excerpts: The kale salad is SO good.
It must be all the cheese that they put on it, making it so unhealthy
but I get it every time.
kale salad.author: Tina Y.
kale salad.review:
Good food, chill vibes. 

Atmosphere attributes to so much here. They have a great selection on tap and such knowledgeable staff. It may not be alcohol, but I really enjoy getting the ginger beer here. It accompanies the meal well. 

There is a great selection of food for any occasion whether you are looking for a snack to accompany your drink or trying to have a full meal. Obviously, I'm trying to have a full meal. The kale salad is SO good. It must be all the cheese that they put on it, making it so unhealthy but I get it every time. Note: it's bigger than the size of my head (definitely shareable). 

The chicken pot pie is my friend's favorite. It has shredded chicken, the vegetable mix (peas, carrots, etc.) and two puff pastries. The sauce is thick and savory. I like to add a lot of pepper onto it. 

I've also gotten the mac and cheese, which is really rich. It's topped with breadcrumbs and put under the broiler. You can't do mac and cheese wrong. 

If I were to recommend another item, I would get one of the flatbreads!

excerpts: The kale salad was fresh and flavorful, the flat bread with arugula and sausage savory, and the chicken pot pie soothing and warm.
kale salad.author: Cici T.
kale salad.review:
It's a relaxed atmosphere at Fat Angels with great service - attentive, friendly, and professional staff. They genuinely want to provide the patrons with a good experience and it really shows.

The wine and beer selection had good breadth (more wine options by the glass, please!) and the menu was "hefty" enough to go with the alcohol. The kale salad was fresh and flavorful, the flat bread with arugula and sausage savory, and the chicken pot pie soothing and warm.

excerpts: I recommend the kale salad--it's pretty good.
And the wine selection is pretty good too!
kale salad.author: Jessica K.
kale salad.review: super cute wine bar with good food. the food portions are pretty big and filling. I recommend the kale salad--it's pretty good. And the wine selection is pretty good too!

excerpts: I recommend the bacon-y kale salad with rotisserie chicken, or trying the spicy sausage flatbread (discounted during happy hour!) if you can't decide what to order.
kale salad.author: Jenni S.
kale salad.review:
I love the staff here -- they're all always so nice, quick, and helpful. Don't know which beer or wine to try? Don't panic! Though the drink list may seem dauntingly long, everyone is great with recommendations. They haven't steered me wrong yet! Good music, even better food... it's no wonder I come here so often!

I recommend the bacon-y kale salad with rotisserie chicken, or trying the spicy sausage flatbread (discounted during happy hour!) if you can't decide what to order.

excerpts: We had the spicy Mac and cheese, chicken pot pie, kale salad, and asparagus olive flatbread.
I'm normally very picky about my Mac and cheese
and it was okay
that didn't have that richness to it.
The flat bread crust was a little too thin almost like a water salt cracker.
However, the kale salad and chicken pot pie were amazing and I couldn't stop eating it.
Overall, great place!
However, the kale salad and chicken pot pie were amazing and I couldn't stop eating it.
Overall, great place!
kale salad.author: Celia B.
kale salad.review: Great beer and wine selection; bartenders are friendly and offer samples in case you're stuck between a few choices. Very intimate setting, great candle lighting, and location is tucked away from the crowds. We had the spicy Mac and cheese, chicken pot pie, kale salad, and asparagus olive flatbread. I'm normally very picky about my Mac and cheese and it was okay that didn't have that richness to it. The flat bread crust was a little too thin almost like a water salt cracker. However, the kale salad and chicken pot pie were amazing and I couldn't stop eating it. Overall, great place!

excerpts: The service was perfect and the food delicious (kale salad and chicken pot pie are the way to go).
We both tried different types of cider, both very well done, cold, and refreshing.
Then we got the creme brûlée - dear lord that was so good.
Ultimately you can't beat a relaxed atmosphere and fresh food.
Easily one of my favorite places now.
kale salad.author: Shadiah G.
kale salad.review: So good! Great atmosphere and amazing food. The service was perfect and the food delicious (kale salad and chicken pot pie are the way to go). We both tried different types of cider, both very well done, cold, and refreshing. Then we got the creme brûlée - dear lord that was so good. Ultimately you can't beat a relaxed atmosphere and fresh food. Easily one of my favorite places now.

excerpts: My friend and I shared a kale salad and the chicken pot pie.
We had chocolate cake for dessert.
The atmosphere and service were real easy and enjoyable.
kale salad.author: Amy D.
kale salad.review: I have to admit I'm not a beer drinker but Fat Angel has converted me. I had A Golden State of Mind on tap with my dinner then a chocolate beer with dessert. Both beers were smooth and perfect with the food. My friend and I shared a kale salad and the chicken pot pie. We had chocolate cake for dessert. The atmosphere and service were real easy and enjoyable.

excerpts: My favorites are the maple bacon butter, kale salad with chicken, all of the flat breads, and the sliders.
These all seem to pair perfectly with the beer.
kale salad.author: Paul W.
kale salad.review:
I figured I should write a more comprehensive review for fat angel considering it's one if my favorite spots. This place is what a gastro pub should be. Great beer and wine selection and delicious consistent food. It is quite small and very popular.  The combination of small and popular is actually the major drawback of the place.  They do not take reservations so wait times can be upwards of 1-2 hours at times if you want a table for dinner.  You can put your name on a list and they will text you when a table becomes available, but this system may not be ideal for some. Also considering that some people order food and then sit at tables for hours drinking after dinner makes it difficult for the staff to accurately predict wait times.  Also since they have outdoor seating, weather becomes a variable in that on nice days their seating capacity almost doubles.  

The staff is always very friendly and do their best to accommodate given the limitations listed above.  They are understandably in a tricky situation and there is no great way to make everyone happy!  

When you walk in there is a chalkboard that lists the beer and wine on tap. This is an ever changing selection which is great. Occasionally they run out of beers and the selection of tap beer can be limited. They make up for this with a huge selection of bottled beers listed by type in their menu. 

Just about everything on the food menu is awesome. My favorites are the maple bacon butter, kale salad with chicken, all of the flat breads, and the sliders. These all seem to pair perfectly with the beer.

excerpts: We ordered really well and enjoyed the kale salad, spicy sausage flatbread, and mac n' cheese...
all were winners and would easily order again.
It is quite a small venue
but it was fairly easy to get a seat and the service was great.
I will be back!
kale salad.author: Derek S.
kale salad.review: Ah sweet Fat Angel you are delicious! We ordered really well and enjoyed the kale salad, spicy sausage flatbread, and mac n' cheese...all were winners and would easily order again. It is quite a small venue but it was fairly easy to get a seat and the service was great. I will be back!

excerpts: The kale salad is also amazing.
kale salad.author: Jaching H.
kale salad.review:
Tons of wonderful wine and beers on draught!

The trout salad with horseradish dressing is like no other. I could eat this every day.  The kale salad is also amazing.

Skip the spicy mac and cheese.  The heat comes from cayenne, but it ends us tasting like tabasco sauce, which just isn't that interesting to me. 

There is wonderful outdoor seating in front with heat lamps and a view of the palm trees across the street.  So very California. 

I love this place and am quickly becoming a regular!

excerpts: The kale salad is unmatched - marcona almonds,  bacon, and the right touch of champagne dressing.
kale salad.author: Cham M.
kale salad.review:
I aim for variety when it comes to food/drink, especially since our fair city lends itself well to culinary discovery. However, when it comes to establishments that do it well (and consistently), I am a creature of habit. 

Fat Angel does not have an extensive menu, but what they do have is a well-balanced selection of basics. The outlined food categories nicely fit one page... and it covers the necessities: Appetizers (Angel's Share), Cheese, Meat, Butter, Greens, Flatbread, Plates. The kale salad is unmatched - marcona almonds,  bacon, and the right touch of champagne dressing. No arguments about the chicken pot pie, as it is exactly how I envision a perfect savory pie to be (probably used a cup full of butter to have reached said perfection, but who's caring?). The spicy mac/cheese is pure bliss on a mini skillet. Still want more, you say? The Grape/Gorgonzola/Prosciutto flatbread is the way to go.

Are you judging my diet yet? Did you miss the part about me crushing on a salad? 

Oh the beers. Amazing beers on tap that rotate frequently based on season and featured microbrews. Some of the best variety offered in SF, but you end up liking one - drink up, as chances are that beer will be gone in 2 days and it may be while until they get another limited batch. They also have an excellent selection of bottled beers that covers a range of palates. Wine on tap more your groove? I've only tried the Sauvignon Blanc (Martella?) and Pinot Noir (Copain), both decent, but in a place like Fat Angel - with all the beer selections and so little time? Go for the brew. 

The staff knows their stuff. Friendly, fun, and - I'll emphasize this - patient. You in need of figuring out what kind to get, given the otherwise intimidating selection? Engage them in conversation, and they'll make several recommendations (armed with samples)... after which you complete your selection and indulge happily. Let this be a lesson to other establishments: It pays to have a crew who is knowledgeable and passionate about the very things the place stands for. Need I spell out why? Because they generate fans who, not only (willingly) shell out $XX regularly for food and drinks, but ones who give gratitude over a public space like Yelp - even at the risk of getting a longer wait for a table on a Friday night.

excerpts: Between 4 people, we shared a the spicy sausage flatbread (huge, like a squared pizza basically & definitely good for 4!), the spicy mac & cheese (best mac & cheese I've had in a while!), 2 big soft pretzels and a huge Kale salad.
The salads are realllllly huge and impossible to eat by yourself even if you tried :-D
kale salad.author: Leslie S.
kale salad.review:
I really enjoyed having drinks & dinner at Fat Angel! I had been wanting to go for a while.

The neighborhood where it's located is lively, the decor cozy, the staff friendly (they make you feel like you're at home!) and the drinks menu is so long! There are so many kinds of beers and wines from different parts of the world. There's definitely a bit of everything of everyone!

I had the Pinot Gris from Oregon and really enjoyed it. My friends had red wines from pitchers and huge German beers they all liked.

Between 4 people, we shared a the spicy sausage flatbread (huge, like a squared pizza basically & definitely good for 4!), the spicy mac & cheese (best mac & cheese I've had in a while!), 2 big soft pretzels and a huge Kale salad. The salads are realllllly huge and impossible to eat by yourself even if you tried :-D I love greens, so I was happy!

I loved the atmosphere, we will be back!

excerpts: We've tried the pretzel, a bunch of their cheeses and meats, the baby kale salad, the mushroom flatbread, and the mac 'n' cheese.
Their portions and large and everything tastes great.
Their pretzel is one of my favorites in the city, and their kale salad rivals Darwin's, which is quite a feat.
kale salad.author: Regina L.
kale salad.review:
My fiance and I have been here twice now, and as a self-proclaimed beer snob, he happens to think that Fat Angel has the best beer selection in San Francisco. I happen to agree. We had great experiences eating and drinking at Fat Angel and will definitely be returning often. Their space is curated perfectly, and even in the small space, they do have adequate seating. The staff is very friendly and they do a good job managing the bar/register/wait list. They have a great mix of indoor and outdoor seating, as well as a waiting area for people who haven't been seated yet. 

Their beer list is rare and extensive. Pages and pages of beer that is rare/hard to find, all at relatively good prices. They have an eclectic mix of beer and wine, and there's always something new and interesting to try on their draft board. 

Their food is spectacular. We've tried the pretzel, a bunch of their cheeses and meats, the baby kale salad, the mushroom flatbread, and the mac 'n' cheese. Their portions and large and everything tastes great. Their pretzel is one of my favorites in the city, and their kale salad rivals Darwin's, which is quite a feat. The only "meh" dish is the mac 'n' cheese; the sauce is kinda watery and the pasta could be more al dente. 

Fat Angel is a great date night spot, or just a place to grab a special beer. We love it here!

excerpts: Kale salad was also delicious, as well as the mac & cheese (could have been spicier).
kale salad.author: Alice Z.
kale salad.review:
This place should be a girl's best friend.  Wine (on draft) and cheese (x6).  Not to mention bread & multiple types of butter.

We pretty much tried everything.  Champagne cocktail for $10 was delicious. Half-bottle of wine for $20 netted 3 full glasses. Also tried truffled cheese, truffled wild boar salami, spicy salami, hard cow cheese, humboldt's fog goat cheese , and duck liver mousse(my fave).  

Maple bacon butter was delicious. they had about 5 other variations of butter to try too. Whipped and light. It almost doesn't feel like you're ingesting a million calories!

Endless bags of bread slices and baguette slices.  We were 80% full based on the charcuterie platter we made ourselves. 

Kale salad was also delicious, as well as the mac & cheese (could have been spicier). Sliders were good too - the bread was a softer, more croissant-like bun with sesame seeds. 

Would come back again but maybe try an additional butter and not do the mac & cheese. It was good but nothing special.

excerpts: Kale salad was great and the portion was huge.
Mac and cheese was spicy and the portion was huge.
Sliders and pate were delicious.
Wish they had fries - then it would be perfect.
kale salad.author: Kate F.
kale salad.review:
The line at State Bird Provisions was unacceptably long, so we wandered around the corner and voila -- beer, snacks, and tables without a wait.

I don't have a lot to add that others haven't said recently. Kale salad was great and the portion was huge. Mac and cheese was spicy and the portion was huge. Sliders and pate were delicious. Wish they had fries - then it would be perfect.

excerpts: We ordered the kale salad and prosciutto flatbread.
The bread was perfectly crunchy.
I would have been appeased by the service if they had comped our order or even a free dessert.
But we barely got an apology.
kale salad.author: Raha G.
kale salad.review: I wish I could give this place more stars, I really do. But the service was lacking tonight. It took almost an hour for us to get our food because they messed up our order. We ordered a bottle of wine but had to ask for a refill every time we were done. The food itself was very good. We ordered the kale salad and prosciutto flatbread. The bread was perfectly crunchy. I would have been appeased by the service if they had comped our order or even a free dessert. But we barely got an apology.

excerpts: It took us 4000 hours to order as there's so many delicious options available that we weren't accustomed to, but we ended up getting three cheese and three meat, the Kale salad with chicken was BEYOND incredible (and a huge serving too!), and the arugula flatbread just sealed the deal.
Love this spot!
Great atmosphere though a little elbow-to-elbow, but that's typical in most of SF.
We'll totally go back!
kale salad.author: Erin W.
kale salad.review: It took us 4000 hours to order as there's so many delicious options available that we weren't accustomed to, but we ended up getting three cheese and three meat, the Kale salad with chicken was BEYOND incredible (and a huge serving too!), and the arugula flatbread just sealed the deal. Love this spot! Great atmosphere though a little elbow-to-elbow, but that's typical in most of SF. We'll totally go back!

excerpts: besides the flavored butters, charcuterie and cheese offerings - the kale salad, sliders and gorgonzola flatbread are absolutely delicious.
you've gotta order those!
kale salad.author: Mandy A.
kale salad.review:
fat angel is like everything i want in a local establishment - lots of cheese, homemade bread, fresh local salads, artisan bar bites (sliders, flatbreads and the like), charcuterie, an extensive beer/cider/wine list and taxidermy on the wall. i absolutely love this place!

yes, it's bordering the sketchiness that is the western addition but its tucked away so you almost forget where you are.

the wait is sometimes a little too long to justify, but if you catch them at a good time you'll be happy you stopped by.

besides the flavored butters, charcuterie and cheese offerings - the kale salad, sliders and gorgonzola flatbread are absolutely delicious. you've gotta order those!

excerpts: The kale salad was killer as was the bread w/ lemon caper butter.
These guys love their capers!
kale salad.author: Erin S.
kale salad.review: The kale salad was killer as was the bread w/ lemon caper butter. These guys love their capers!

excerpts: I have ordered their Chicken/Kale salad via UberEats, and every time it is delicious - the salad is a HUGE portion of fresh kale, the shredded chicken is nice white meat, and the almonds in the salad give it a very nice crunch.
kale salad.author: William P.
kale salad.review:
I have ordered their Chicken/Kale salad via UberEats, and every time it is delicious - the salad is a HUGE portion of fresh kale, the shredded chicken is nice white meat, and the almonds in the salad give it a very nice crunch. I supplement their nice tart dressing with a squeeze of fresh lemon from my kitchen.

Excellent, will order again. Here's an Uber link that will get you free rides and discounts: 

https://www.uber.com/invite/6m9pv

excerpts: My personal favorites being the kale salad and the endive salad.
Also the portions on the salads are HUGE.
They should be shared by two people and shouldn't even be attempted by one person.
They aren't expensive and will fill you up.
The Flat breads are even better.
Every time I look at the menu I want to try something else
but I always, always get the roasted red grape and walnut flat bread.
It is just so savory and a perfect combination of sweet and salty.
I rely on my date to order one of the others
so I can at least try it
kale salad.author: Nick R.
kale salad.review:
Quiet possibly the greatest place to take a date in the city. Edit for hyperbole but you get the idea. This has to be one of my favorite places in the city and had to give them a proper yelp review finally. The combination of atmosphere, cost, quality of food and drinks make it a no brainier five star that anyone venturing in the Fillmore area should try.

The highlight of Fat Angel for me is the food. It is a relatively small menu but everything on it is worth taking a shot at. The areas they excel in are the salads and the flat-breads. I had never encountered this combination of flavors before I came here and was shocked they could get such quality food to come out of that small kitchen. 

Seriously all four salads are delicious. My personal favorites being the kale salad and the endive salad. Also the portions on the salads are HUGE. They should be shared by two people and shouldn't even be attempted by one person. They aren't expensive and will fill you up. The Flat breads are even better. Every time I look at the menu I want to try something else but I always, always get the roasted red grape and walnut flat bread. It is just so savory and a perfect combination of sweet and salty. I rely on my date to order one of the others so I can at least try it but it is a halfhearted attempt at best. 

Another positive is the service time. The turnaround on food is one of the best I have had in the city and the quality is always consistent. Shout out to whoever is back there whipping up the food.

By this time you are completely full and realize you haven't even gotten to the main dishes. I have had the sliders and the mac and cheese which are both great as well. The mac and cheese is very spicy so be forewarned if you aren't used to that. 

This place also holds its own as a bar as well. There is a stuff drink menu with plenty of options for the beer aficionados. The wine is pretty varied as well but may not satisfy the wine heads of SF. 

The customer service is great at Fat Angel as well. With easy pay at the bar and personally calling you when your table is ready are great perks. 

Also full disclosure I am in love with the bartender/waitress.I don't know her name but she has short hair and tattoos and is the woman of my dreams.  I am sure she is married or taken but I am professing my love for her here. 

The negatives that could knock off some stars for others are just how small Fat Angel is. It is a really tiny and intimate place and can get crowded on most nights by around 8 or 9pm. I am talking standing room only at the bar and freezing your butt off by choosing to sit at the outside tables because nothing is available inside. Be prepared for a wait time but its never too long. Also the small place leads to some really really close table set ups. You are in the other couples conversation no matter what so be prepared for people watching as you will be two inches from someone else. 

Fat Angel may have an odd name but as one of my first introductions to social life in SF I couldn't have had a better experience. The service has not dipped in the three years I have been in SF and I would venture to say it won't when you make your way out there as well. 

Fillmore has a gem that serves a perfect wine and candlelight home with food that leaves you coming back for more. Also if you know the waitress tell her she is awesome and has a fan club. This is the place I suggest whenever dinner is up to me so I am sure I will see you there.

excerpts: We ordered the baby kale salad and the prosciutto flatbread which looked very promising.
Th salad was drenched in dressing which made it very salty and heavy.
The next dish - the flatbread was even worse.
The cheese was definitely the main ingredient and it was so much that you can hardly taste the bread or any of the other ingredients.
If you are a relatively healthy eater like me, I wouldn't recommend the place.
The only reason I would return to to the Fat Angel is for a drink - its still a pretty nice place for a glass of wine or beer.
kale salad.author: Mirela S.
kale salad.review:
I have mixed feelings about this place. The atmosphere is great and cozy, the service is good and their menu looks really appetizing. 
However, I have subtracted two stars because of the food. We ordered the baby kale salad and the prosciutto flatbread which looked very promising. Th salad was drenched in dressing which made it very salty and heavy. The next dish - the flatbread was even worse. The cheese was definitely the main ingredient and it was so much that you can hardly taste the bread or any of the other ingredients. If you are a relatively healthy eater like me, I wouldn't recommend the place.
The only reason I would return to to the Fat Angel is for a drink - its still a pretty nice place for a glass of wine or beer.

excerpts: kale salad to the mac'n'cheese plate to the flatbreads.
Because the libations menu is so large, I won't comment much more than saying you're bound to find something you like to drink here: a hearty beer, a sophisticated wine, etc.
Check the chalkboard atop the bar for what's happening, or ask your server about what's on draft.
Finally, this restaurant doesn't take reservations, by the way; snuggle in early, or wait in a line.
Also, only one bathroom for everyone, staff and customers.
kale salad.author: Allison C.
kale salad.review: Cozy? You mean cramped. But overall, I get you and your charm, Fat Angel. I like your vibe and taste generally. Portions are wowzers generous on their menu items, from the massive (and delicious!) kale salad to the mac'n'cheese plate to the flatbreads. Because the libations menu is so large, I won't comment much more than saying you're bound to find something you like to drink here: a hearty beer, a sophisticated wine, etc. Check the chalkboard atop the bar for what's happening, or ask your server about what's on draft. Finally, this restaurant doesn't take reservations, by the way; snuggle in early, or wait in a line. Also, only one bathroom for everyone, staff and customers.

excerpts: A kale salad and chicken pot pie made for a perfect dinner on a cold rainy day or any day.
Thanks Fat Angel.
Until we meet again.
kale salad.author: Mike C.
kale salad.review:
Fat Angle turned our ordinary Thursday into an awesome Thursday. Service was great, beer selection - amazing, food - delicious. We couldn't have asked for more.

They don't take reservations but we only had to wait 10 minutes to sit at the bar. The beer list was a comical mixture of modern day brewing but the bartender was great with recommendations and tastings of ones I was interested in.

My wife and I have eaten here twice now and haven been let down. A kale salad and chicken pot pie made for a perfect dinner on a cold rainy day or any day. Thanks Fat Angel. Until we meet again.

excerpts: Then we got a kale salad, and were presented with a mountain of it.
kale salad.author: Vivian H.
kale salad.review: Glad we found this place! We came by before a movie at the Kabuki, and we started with some wine and a little charcuterie and cheese plate. SO good, and large portions. Then we got a kale salad, and were presented with a mountain of it. We really could have ended our meal there, but I couldn't get my mind off some comfort food like their mac n cheese or chicken pot pie. Unfortunately.. the pot pie just wasn't good. It first came out lukewarm, then when they said they'd remake it, they def just microwaved it bc the "crust" then came out soggy. Sadface. That said, the server/bartenders are wonderful and make amazing recommendations.

excerpts: Had the kale salad which was so good I would order it again.
It is also gigantic and absolutely for sharing, as is everything else on the menu.
The mushroom cheese flatbread was perfection and thin like flatbread should be.
The Mac and cheese was also delicious and had a nice kick to it.
They lose a star bc the bread pudding
was not good and was clearly microwaved before being served to us.
Skip dessert
and you're golden.
kale salad.author: Debbie L.
kale salad.review: This place could easily become a favorite of mine.  Great food, chill atmosphere, and friendly service.  Had the kale salad which was so good I would order it again.  It is also gigantic and absolutely for sharing, as is everything else on the menu.  The mushroom cheese flatbread was perfection and thin like flatbread should be.  The Mac and cheese was also delicious and had a nice kick to it.  They lose a star bc the bread pudding was not good and was clearly microwaved before being served to us.  Skip dessert and you're golden.

excerpts: The soft sheep and the bacon kale salad were nom-a-licious, though, so our mouths were overall happy.
kale salad.author: Sarah C.
kale salad.review:
The food was just ok. The black truffle butter had zero flavor, the bread was burnt, and the duck salami (which was a pâté?) was super gamey. The soft sheep and the bacon kale salad were nom-a-licious, though, so our mouths were overall happy.

But...the beer selection was phenomenal!! 

My bf and I love sour beers and there is only a small handful to choose from, even at the most fancy places, in Dallas, where we're from. This place had at LEAST 30 to choose from! And that doesn't begin to scratch the surface of what they have to offer. Even the stuff on tap looked fascinating.

The waitstaff were super friendly hipster-types and know their stuff, too.

This place is a must for beer aficionados. Go!

excerpts: The baby kale salad and flatbreads were fresh, innovative flavors, wonderful.
Service was friendly if not super attentive.
Would be 5 stars if not for the long wait with no drink service.
kale salad.author: Molly K.
kale salad.review:
I loved the small setting and warm decor, except for how long it took to get seated or to get anyone's attention to order a drink at the bar. I ended  up only being able to get a drink when our party of 4 was finally seated after long wait because I just couldn't get a waiter's attention before that.

That being said, everything else was wonderful. My Duet IPA was delicious and served really cold, as it should be. The baby kale salad and flatbreads were fresh, innovative flavors, wonderful. Service was friendly if not super attentive. Would be 5 stars if not for the long wait with no drink service.

excerpts: (I can't remember the name), a kale salad, and the mac and cheese - with a drink on the tab, we only came out to $50!
If I was going to exclude anything, it would have been the meat - not that it was bad in any way, but the rest of the menu is what I'd suggest trying!
It was simply the least memorable part of the meal.
The salad in particular stood out for both of us - and an order of that is easily good for three people (we couldn't quite finish it with two of us).
kale salad.author: Peter L.
kale salad.review:
Came in on a Saturday night - they don't take reservations, so we just showed up around 8:00PM. About a 20 minute wait (during which time, drinks were involved). It's a small place, and I think we got lucky on the timing - our wait time really wasn't bad at all.

The drinks are priced anywhere from the regular/affordable and up to a 'sky is the limit' deal - pick what you want. The selections were nice, something for everyone - check out their menu for more to choose from, not just the board.

Very casual atmosphere, hip... all that good stuff - it is a small place, so we were almost elbow to elbow with the table next to us, not that it was a problem.

As food goes, we had the polenta fries (loved it), the maple bacon butter, some of the meat (I can't remember the name), a kale salad, and the mac and cheese - with a drink on the tab, we only came out to $50! If I was going to exclude anything, it would have been the meat - not that it was bad in any way, but the rest of the menu is what I'd suggest trying! It was simply the least memorable part of the meal. The salad in particular stood out for both of us - and an order of that is easily good for three people (we couldn't quite finish it with two of us). The mac & cheese was more on the order of 2 people, I think.

As someone mentioned, if it isn't too breezy that evening, consider bringing a jacket and sitting outside if you want to sit and eat quickly; that evening, I think only one group elected to sit outside, the rest of us waited for a spot inside!

excerpts: But they would if they went to Fat Angel and ordered the kale salad with bacon, toasted almonds and vinagrette.
It was a massive bowl of leaves, but because it wasn't drenched in dressing, it was easy to enjoy the lot of it.
Restaurants rarely do vegetables or salads this well or with such a great serving size.
The restaurant was extremely crowded and the service wasn't perfet, but the buzz was delightful and the lighting was perfectly dim.
kale salad.author: Sara S.
kale salad.review: Nobody actually likes kale, right?  But they would if they went to Fat Angel and ordered the kale salad with bacon, toasted almonds and vinagrette.  It was a massive bowl of leaves, but because it wasn't drenched in dressing, it was easy to enjoy the lot of it.  Restaurants rarely do vegetables or salads this well or with such a great serving size.  The restaurant was extremely crowded and the service wasn't perfet, but the buzz was delightful and the lighting was perfectly dim.  My daughter ordered the chicken pot pie and it was also about the tastiest one we've ever tried.  Too bad the hotel didn't have a fridge for the leftovers!  Too rich to eat the whole thing, but would have been great to share.  This place is a gem.

excerpts: My favs are the kale salad, red grape flatbread, and a refreshing sour beer.
kale salad.author: Laura B.
kale salad.review:
This place is my go to beer bar in the city.  It's a bit of a trip for me but it's always worth it.  They have it all-- great beer selection, awesome wine, fantastic food, and knowledgeable staff that will humor all of your stupid questions.  
My favs are the kale salad, red grape flatbread, and a refreshing sour beer.

excerpts: The kale salad is amazing, and you don't need to add chicken (it's a little dry).
It was massive and enough for two people.
I wouldn't mind going here every day and sharing that kale salad with someone.
kale salad.author: Terry K.
kale salad.review: The kale salad is amazing, and you don't need to add chicken (it's a little dry).  It was massive and enough for two people.  I wouldn't mind going here every day and sharing that kale salad with someone.  The chicken pot pie was good, "esp because of the tarragon" (quipped my very picky chicken-pot-pie-eating friend).  My wine was like a Pinot Grigio and excellent, they have "draft wines".  Great little neighborhood restaurant.

excerpts: We had the pretzel, a selection of 3 meats and 3 cheeses, kale salad and the mushroom flatbread.
Everything was great and the kale salad may have been my favorite and it was HUGE!
The also have an amazing beer list.
I had the Mosaic Double IPA
, I had never heard of this brew before but it was phenominal.
Not super hoppy, which I dont mind, but more super smooth.
It paired so well with our food as it was clean and crisp not terribly powerful.
This place is great!
I cant wait to go back.
kale salad.author: Michael B.
kale salad.review: We had a fantastic experience. The service was great, the food came out fast, was super fresh, and the protions were not shy. We had the pretzel, a selection of 3 meats and 3 cheeses, kale salad and the mushroom flatbread. Everything was great and the kale salad may have been my favorite and it was HUGE! The also have an amazing beer list. I had the Mosaic Double IPA, I had never heard of this brew before but it was phenominal. Not super hoppy, which I dont mind, but more super smooth. It paired so well with our food as it was clean and crisp not terribly powerful. This place is great! I cant wait to go back.

excerpts: The baby kale salad is excellent despite its simplicity.
kale salad.author: Simon M.
kale salad.review: This is a great place if you are looking for a large selection of craft beer. The beer menu has beers grouped by type and the wait staff are very helpful with suggestions. The food is also very good and compliments the beer. The baby kale salad is excellent despite its simplicity.

excerpts: We shared the mac and cheese and kale salad.
Mac and cheese was delicious and the kale salad was surprisingly big.
kale salad.author: Brian L.
kale salad.review: This place is great. Went with my girlfriend for a drink and bite to eat. We shared the mac and cheese and kale salad. Mac and cheese was delicious and the kale salad was surprisingly big. Great selection of beers, although not many of tap.

excerpts: The kale salad is massive and delicious!
Definitely recommend it.
Plus a huge selection of beer and wine.
kale salad.author: Lauren D.
kale salad.review: The kale salad is massive and delicious! Definitely recommend it. Plus a huge selection of beer and wine.

excerpts: I recommend the kale salad and mushroom pizza--you won't be disappointed!
kale salad.author: Kelly H.
kale salad.review: Very impressed with the food, service, and beer selection. I recommend the kale salad and mushroom pizza--you won't be disappointed!

excerpts: The best kale salad and bread pudding that I've ever had in my life!!
Going back this weekend to try more on the menu!!
Can't wait!!!
kale salad.author: Julie S.
kale salad.review: The best kale salad and bread pudding that I've ever had in my life!! Going back this weekend to try more on the menu!! Can't wait!!!

excerpts: The wine, the service, the food (pot pie! and mac and cheese! and kale salad!).
We moved to a new neighborhood, but still drive back here just for this place.
kale salad.author: Maddy D.
kale salad.review: Love everything about this place. The wine, the service, the food (pot pie! and mac and cheese! and kale salad!). We moved to a new neighborhood, but still drive back here just for this place.

excerpts: The kale salad (add chicken) is so good (and big enough to split)
, I dream about it.
The mac and cheese is really good, as is the cheese platter.
Really friend servers/bartenders all around.
kale salad.author: Rose T.
kale salad.review: Love this place, such a charming neighborhood joint if you want an unpretentious to place to relax with friends over wine, beer and light food. I love the laid-back, friendly vibe.  They let you samples a little wine or beer if you can't decide.  The kale salad (add chicken) is so good (and big enough to split), I dream about it.  The mac and cheese is really good, as is the cheese platter.  Really friend servers/bartenders all around.

excerpts: Had the pretzel with a side of cheese dip (OMG), and the very delicious kale salad!
kale salad.author: Sophia D.
kale salad.review: Super helpful staff! They helped us pick a beer that we loved! Had the pretzel with a side of cheese dip (OMG), and the very delicious kale salad!

excerpts: We used to come here about once a week for a kale salad, chicken pot pie, and an IPA I had never heard of.
kale salad.author: Michael C.
kale salad.review: If only they weren't so busy. We used to come here about once a week for a kale salad, chicken pot pie, and an IPA I had never heard of.

excerpts: The kale salad was just ok because of the goopy dressing.
Would go back to try out the pot pie.
all together, it was decent.
kale salad.author: pamela A.
kale salad.review: We had an ok bite to eat here before a concert at the Fillmore. Beer recommendation was a bomb--asked for a hoppy beer and got a floral girly beer. Nonetheless the olives were awesome and the sliders were to die for. The kale salad was just ok because of the goopy dressing. Would go back to try out the pot pie. all together, it was decent. Great selection of beers and wines--many selections not seen or found anywhere else. Give it a try.

excerpts: Between 4 people, we shared a the spicy sausage flatbread (huge, like a squared pizza basically & definitely good for 4!), the spicy mac & cheese (best mac & cheese I've had in a while!), 2 big soft pretzels and a huge Kale salad.
The salads are realllllly huge and impossible to eat by yourself even if you tried :-D
pretzels.author: Leslie S.
pretzels.review:
I really enjoyed having drinks & dinner at Fat Angel! I had been wanting to go for a while.

The neighborhood where it's located is lively, the decor cozy, the staff friendly (they make you feel like you're at home!) and the drinks menu is so long! There are so many kinds of beers and wines from different parts of the world. There's definitely a bit of everything of everyone!

I had the Pinot Gris from Oregon and really enjoyed it. My friends had red wines from pitchers and huge German beers they all liked.

Between 4 people, we shared a the spicy sausage flatbread (huge, like a squared pizza basically & definitely good for 4!), the spicy mac & cheese (best mac & cheese I've had in a while!), 2 big soft pretzels and a huge Kale salad. The salads are realllllly huge and impossible to eat by yourself even if you tried :-D I love greens, so I was happy!

I loved the atmosphere, we will be back!

excerpts: Yummy pretzels
pretzels.author: Neal L.
pretzels.review: Awesome staff. Spilled wine on my hand and gave me a free glass she spilled on me. Really cool atmosphere. So many beers and wine and Mead. Yummy pretzels

excerpts: Their cheese plates and pretzels a great value.
I haven't ordered much more but the rest of the food looks good.
I saw a family waiting for food they had ordered once, which is always a surprise at a bar!
pretzels.author: Wendy K.
pretzels.review: GREAT bar if you're looking for something a bit different, during the day or for HH. Right around the corner from some great restaurants. Full bar but even better beer and wine on tap. They have seating outside and wide open windows when it's nice out. Their cheese plates and pretzels a great value. I haven't ordered much more but the rest of the food looks good. I saw a family waiting for food they had ordered once, which is always a surprise at a bar!

excerpts: HUGE selection of artisanal beers from all over the world, great food including soft pretzels, flatbread pizzas, mac and cheese, etc.
pretzels.author: Lina L.
pretzels.review: Delicious little gem hidden in Lower Fillmore! HUGE selection of artisanal beers from all over the world, great food including soft pretzels, flatbread pizzas, mac and cheese, etc.

excerpts: We got their popular FA chicken pot pie ($14).
I'm not sure if I've ever had fancy chicken pot pie (I can only think of the frozen ones from my childhood and that my roommate in college used to microwave).
But FA has created quite a gastropub-worthy version with roasted chicken and assorted veggies, spiked with sherry and tarragon, and topped with a flaky puff pastry.
chicken pot pie.author: Edna C.
chicken pot pie.review:
When my bf suggested going to Fat Angel, I didn't jump on the idea because I probably subconsciously thought it implied something about myself. Fast forward two years, and my friends and I are wandering about Pac Heights and I suggest Fat Angel. We snagged the last table, I received compliments for my recommendation, and my response was that it was actually my bf's rec. Moral of the story: Don't take restaurant names too seriously, and listen to recommendations by your SO. 

The alcoholic menu is extensive and overwhelming, in a good way. They have amazing wine and beer selections from all over the world. It's somewhat pricier, but they also have less expensive options for the rest of us peasants. The cocktail menu is short but intriguing, with a beer or wine base. There is a list of rotating draft beer and wine as well.

(+) We started off with a cheese and charcuterie board ($16 + $18 for 3 meats and 3 cheeses). It was beautifully laid out, with little dabs of spicy nuts, jams, honey, and whole grain mustard to mix it up.
- Brie was quite standard and the piece was small
- Pecorino and machego were good, not too strong but subtle
- Finocchio was like a fatty salami. Tasty, but may not be the best if you're on a diet
- The spicy prosciutto spread was more like a meat jam, and was also a somewhat small quantity. If you are craving something prosciutto-y, I suggest the speck or the bresaola. Tastes deliciously cured
- The bread came in a paper bag on the side. Would have liked it on a board for Instagram purposes, and in fact I think it comes on the same board if you don't order as much stuff for your board

(++) The tomato, spicy sausage, arugula, and Parmesan flatbread ($15) turned out more impressive than your standard flatbread. The bread is so miraculously thin it's almost like eating a cracker with a myriad of toppings with contrasting flavors. I bet this is what pizza tastes like in heaven for fat angels (....get it?)

(+++) We got their popular FA chicken pot pie ($14). I'm not sure if I've ever had fancy chicken pot pie (I can only think of the frozen ones from my childhood and that my roommate in college used to microwave). But FA has created quite a gastropub-worthy version with roasted chicken and assorted veggies, spiked with sherry and tarragon, and topped with a flaky puff pastry. It's savory and herby, with contrasting textures, a tad of creaminess without being too heavy, and a bit of nostalgia.

The server was helpful in her suggestions for the charcuterie board, never rushed us (even though we were taking a long time chatting after dinner and there was a wait on the Friday), and split the check 3 ways for us. It totaled to slightly above $40 each, for a glass of wine and a lot of food.

The ambiance is vintage and cool: marble tables, a chandelier with a statement, and a small patio for better food lighting. FA is a place I would come back to, in order to try the different drinks and noms. Plus, their menu has variation and is printed daily. (at least until SF bans non-reusable menus)

My minor complaints are that my friend noticed a bit of lipstick stain left on her cup, and that there were little fruit flies including one that landed in my wine glass. Good thing I finished it quickly. 

Other tips:
- Happy hour is 4-6pm weekdays, $1 off wine/beer and $2 off flatbreads
- It's a short walk from Jtown and Social Study, so there are great options for more drinks/things to do afterwards
- Not really great for large groups since it's fairly small. I'd say not to come with more than 6ish people
- Other dishes that look amazing are the greens (it a huggggggeee  fluffy salad) and spicy mac n cheese (comes in a skillet, of course)

Fun fact: it's owned by the same group as Trestle, Stone's Throw, and Corridor, and it indeed has the same wow factor.

excerpts: But the chicken pot pie is phenomenal!
chicken pot pie.author: Aaron W.
chicken pot pie.review:
The Mac and cheese is good.

The ceased salad is good.

But the chicken pot pie is phenomenal!  

Great food!

excerpts: My favorite dish to order here is the signature Chicken Pot Pie.
It's more of a deconstructed pot pie but seriously so delicious and filling.
It's perfect for sharing with another person.
chicken pot pie.author: MyTien P.
chicken pot pie.review:
I always love visiting Fat Angel before going to a concert at The Fillmore! They have a great selection of wine, beer, flatbreads, and appetizers!

My favorite dish to order here is the signature Chicken Pot Pie. It's more of a deconstructed pot pie but seriously so delicious and filling. It's perfect for sharing with another person. The Flatbread Pizzas are also delicious and the perfect pairing with any of their beers + wines! 

My only complaint is the limited staff. Usually there are only 2-3 people working and it might take a while for you to place an order. Patience is a virtue!

excerpts: I had the chicken pot pie.
It was delish and a healthy portion (as well as the wine pours!)
The pot pie actually had chicken in it!
Not like the typical SF eatery where you're to fine 2 pieces of chicken in your chicken salad.
There was a lot of chicken, and perfectly cooked veggies.
Not soggy.
The caesar salad was also killer.
We ordered the roasted Chinese nuts with our wine and that was a great duo.
The nuts were not chinese though.
ha!
Sadly, we were too full for dessert.
chicken pot pie.author: Dario L.
chicken pot pie.review:
Let me just say, this place is solid.  I seem to drive by it a lot the last couple of years. I like how secluded it is in one of my favorite neighborhoods in this city. I finally decided to give it a try last night and was blown away!  Not because they are doing anything that is rocket science.  Mainly because the ambience and their simple menu (but very solid!!!) and extensive wine and beer list.  

Ambience: What more could you want? Candle lit, very cozy.  Love the wood furnishings and bar.  There is a big stuffed buck on the wall when you walk in.  Makes one feel like they are going back to the shire after a long days hunt. LOL

Service: Our waitress was very attentive and knowledgeable about the wine offerings when asked.  She recommended one wine and then went as far as coming back with the original recommendation as a sample as well as a revised recommendation she wanted us to try. Now that is service!  

Wine: Great selections. I had the Sauvignon Blanc and it was great! It packed a great punch as almost all CA wines should.

Food: Simple offerings but very flavorful! The food came out fast and that had me worried for a little bit but after we took the first bites those fears were gone.  They really are good at what they do, do a few things and do them well.  I had the chicken pot pie. It was delish and a healthy portion (as well as the wine pours!) The pot pie actually had chicken in it! Not like the typical SF eatery where you're to fine 2 pieces of chicken in your chicken salad. There was a lot of chicken, and perfectly cooked veggies. Not soggy.  The caesar salad was also killer.  We ordered the roasted Chinese nuts with our wine and that was a great duo.  The nuts were not chinese though. ha!  Sadly, we were too full for dessert. next time!

If you're in the weekday slump, and not looking to cook or just want to go out for a simple yet delicious meal, come to fat angel. Bring your friends or family!  Will definitely be revisiting!

excerpts: I also had the chicken pot pie, which was delicious but not quite what I expected.
It is a little bit more like a thick chicken stew topped with a square of puff pastry.
It captures the spirit of pot pie but not really the same taste.
Tasty food, great service, would recommend this as a chill spot for a casual drink or bite.
chicken pot pie.author: Ada C.
chicken pot pie.review: Stopped by for the early happy hour on a weekday and was glad I did! The sausage and arugula flatbread was delicious and a great list of beers that I'm looking forward to trying more of. I also had the chicken pot pie, which was delicious but not quite what I expected. It is a little bit more like a thick chicken stew topped with a square of puff pastry. It captures the spirit of pot pie but not really the same taste. Tasty food, great service, would recommend this as a chill spot for a casual drink or bite.

excerpts: Their chicken pot pie is AMAZING!!
chicken pot pie.author: Janet H.
chicken pot pie.review:
My new favorite spot to hit before seeing a show at the Fillmore! Their chicken pot pie is AMAZING!! It's inspired me to make my own one day...

The ambiance of Fat Angel is relaxed, simple, and classy. I can see this as a great place to grab drinks with friends or even a date. I came here on a Tuesday so it wasn't super crowded; not sure how crowded it would be on a weekend as it is a pretty small establishment. 

I love the details for this bar though... the organ and choir sign to go along with the theme... and the 99 bottles of wine displayed on the wall. 

Fat Angel also has different variety of beer and wine so it is a crowd pleaser!

excerpts: My favorite food item on the menu here was the chicken pot pie; it was hot and juicy inside and nice and flaky on the outside.
chicken pot pie.author: Viet L.
chicken pot pie.review:
Fat Angel is a great place to unwind with a small group of friends or a date. It's a small wine bar with a relaxing ambiance and chill vibes. They only serve beer and wine here, and although the list isn't huge there will probably be something for everyone. You won't have to worry about college kids tossing back Jaeger bombs either.

Our group of 7 easily got a table in the evening on a weekday night and this restaurant is perfect for sharing food with friends and enjoying each other's company. The charcuterie plate along with cheese was perfect for sharing. My favorite food item on the menu here was the chicken pot pie; it was hot and juicy inside and nice and flaky on the outside. I'd probably pass on the pretzel plate next time, but if you want something "bready" then any of the flat breads would satisfy. 

The service was top notch and everyone there really helped make our night wonderful. Overall, Fat Angel might not be the greatest place to go if you're trying to have an actual dinner, but its perfect for hanging out with friends if you're looking for a chill night.

excerpts: The chicken pot pie is my friend's favorite.
It has shredded chicken, the vegetable mix (peas, carrots, etc.) and two puff pastries.
The sauce is thick and savory.
chicken pot pie.author: Tina Y.
chicken pot pie.review:
Good food, chill vibes. 

Atmosphere attributes to so much here. They have a great selection on tap and such knowledgeable staff. It may not be alcohol, but I really enjoy getting the ginger beer here. It accompanies the meal well. 

There is a great selection of food for any occasion whether you are looking for a snack to accompany your drink or trying to have a full meal. Obviously, I'm trying to have a full meal. The kale salad is SO good. It must be all the cheese that they put on it, making it so unhealthy but I get it every time. Note: it's bigger than the size of my head (definitely shareable). 

The chicken pot pie is my friend's favorite. It has shredded chicken, the vegetable mix (peas, carrots, etc.) and two puff pastries. The sauce is thick and savory. I like to add a lot of pepper onto it. 

I've also gotten the mac and cheese, which is really rich. It's topped with breadcrumbs and put under the broiler. You can't do mac and cheese wrong. 

If I were to recommend another item, I would get one of the flatbreads!

excerpts: With absolutely no input we decided to order the chicken pot pie, pretzel with mustard and cheese sauce, the flatbread with roasted grapes and goat cheese.
Chicken Pot Pie -
The first bite I took was from the center and the soup was cold in the center.
The puff pastry they had on top was soggy from the top to the bottom.
In that first bite I got a chicken bone.
chicken pot pie.author: Camera P.
chicken pot pie.review:
We came here on a slow weekday night at around 10PM to get some food and try out some wine. When we arrived they told us that the kitchen closed in about half an hour, so we sat down and looked over the menu. We asked the server what her preferences and what was good and all she did was point at the menu items and told us what was in the dishes. With absolutely no input we decided to order the chicken pot pie, pretzel with mustard and cheese sauce, the flatbread with roasted grapes and goat cheese. The food was alright and I would have to say I have honestly had a lot better elsewhere.

Chicken Pot Pie - The first bite I took was from the center and the soup was cold in the center. The puff pastry they had on top was soggy from the top to the bottom. In that first bite I got a chicken bone. The flavor was decent and the veggies were cooked well.

Flatbread - The flatbread itself was very thin and cracker like. There were areas where it was nice and crispy but then there were other areas where it was really soggy and all of the toppings just fell off. The grapes were probably the best part about the dish. They were seasoned well and had some really great flavors.

Pretzel - The shape and presentation of the pretzel was really bad, but it was probably the best tasting dish we had. It went great with the whole mustard. The cheese sauce was really think and broken and did not have a great texture.

We also ordered a glass of wine and beer. Our wine had some pieces of cork in it. With how service was going that night we decided to just take out the pieces and drink our drinks. Every time the server came by, it always felt like an inconvenience to her and that she had better things to do, even though we were 2 out of 6 people there that night.

To be honest, I would avoid coming here. There are very few places that I feel like I need to get away from, and this was one of them. I would not visit again unless the service gets better.

excerpts: The kale salad was fresh and flavorful, the flat bread with arugula and sausage savory, and the chicken pot pie soothing and warm.
chicken pot pie.author: Cici T.
chicken pot pie.review:
It's a relaxed atmosphere at Fat Angels with great service - attentive, friendly, and professional staff. They genuinely want to provide the patrons with a good experience and it really shows.

The wine and beer selection had good breadth (more wine options by the glass, please!) and the menu was "hefty" enough to go with the alcohol. The kale salad was fresh and flavorful, the flat bread with arugula and sausage savory, and the chicken pot pie soothing and warm.

excerpts:
Loved the chicken pot pie, not a big fan of the butter (3 for $16)

Highly recommend - must try for beer lovers!
chicken pot pie.author: Anju J.
chicken pot pie.review:
Got a 1.5 hour wait on the last attempt to visit and ended up at State provision instead. So glad decided to give this place a try again
Sunday night - plenty of empty tables \m/

Amazing service! There were 2 bartenders both amazing. The beer selection was the best I have seen , and their menu organization was easy to navigate. Loved the chicken pot pie, not a big fan of the butter (3 for $16)

Highly recommend - must try for beer lovers!

excerpts: There are a variety of small bites, some solid cheese and salumi offerings, and dependable, hearty comfort fare like the chicken pot pie, mac n' cheese, or braised beef shortrib stew.
chicken pot pie.author: Vincent L.
chicken pot pie.review:
A non-foodie friend of mine burst out laughing, uncontrollably so, when I uttered the term "gastropub," but maybe if he stopped by Fat Angel he'd understand.

Fat Angel feels like a rustic country saloon, with antique-looking furnishings, chandeliers, and a stuffed moose head, but is really a lively yet casual neighborhood pub just off the Fillmore corridor. The strongest point here is the extensive, well-curated beer menu, with solid offerings from around the world. The wine offerings have also been carefully selected.

As for the "gastropub" theme, the food offerings here are quite solid. There are a variety of small bites, some solid cheese and salumi offerings, and dependable, hearty comfort fare like the chicken pot pie, mac n' cheese, or braised beef shortrib stew. Service is also friendly and patient, especially when it comes to explaining all the choices on their menu.

A very solid place just for a few drinks, or even a date. Definitely worth a visit.

excerpts: My 'go-to' meal here is the Fat Angel Chicken Pot Pie, with roasted carrots, chicken, sherry and tarragon ($14).
Their bread is less like a biscuit, more like a croissant.
I think the light, flakey texture of bread choice is key for this dish.
The contents themselves are thick and creamy, without leaving you stuffed.
When I need to eat emotionally, I crave this chicken pot pie.
chicken pot pie.author: Kimberlee P.
chicken pot pie.review:
Fat Angel's food menu is simple, it's wine and beer menu extensive. If interested in food and drinks that borders on the unfamiliar, look somewhere else. The reason why I love Fat Angel is that it succeeds in what may quaint neighborhood jaunts fail to do: keep things simple and classy. Fat Angel serves up tastes and an ambiance that is comfortable and recognizable. This restaurant doesn't attempt to be something it's not.

Since I discovered this place over a year ago, I visit the establishment about once per month. Of all San Francisco restaurants, this would be my most visited and the place I most often take friends for a light, casual dinner. My friends always leave commenting how much they are "surprised" by the food and ambiance of this hidden gem of a bar/restaurant. 

My 'go-to' meal here is the Fat Angel Chicken Pot Pie, with roasted carrots, chicken, sherry and tarragon ($14). Their bread is less like a biscuit, more like a croissant. I think the light, flakey texture of bread choice is key for this dish. The contents themselves are thick and creamy, without leaving you stuffed. When I need to eat emotionally, I crave this chicken pot pie.

Some other dishes I have tried that I have enjoyed greatly are the Spicy Mac N' Cheese, with gruyère, cheddar and parmiggiano-reggiano ($12), the Baby Kale, minus bacon, marcona almonds and Parmesan ($12). 

As for drinks, I encourage you to be adventurous and try something new every time. I am never disappointed. 

The service here is impeccable. The bar and wait staff is a tightly-knit family. If you show your face here often enough, they'll recognize you, remember your tastes and give you recommendations for navigating their beer and wine lists. The team is also lightning fast at delivering your food, checking up on you, and bringing you the bill whenever ready. 

As has been mentioned in other reviews, this place should be listed as a bar, not a restaurant. Think of it as a bar with bites on par. 

There's limited seating here, with most tables set for two. Perfect for a date night; not ideal for a family dinner.

excerpts: I've heard their chicken pot pie was good but wasn't able to try it.
The cheese and meat plate was really good too.
Can't go wrong with that.
chicken pot pie.author: Jenn L.
chicken pot pie.review:
Great bartenders and the atmosphere is great. It's kinda small but a great date spot too. They have happy hour from M-F 4:30-6PM. I believe for bottle of wine its about $4 dollars off, 1$ off draft, and $2 off flat bread. 

I've heard their chicken pot pie was good but wasn't able to try it. The cheese and meat plate was really good too. Can't go wrong with that.

excerpts: We had the spicy Mac and cheese, chicken pot pie, kale salad, and asparagus olive flatbread.
I'm normally very picky about my Mac and cheese
and it was okay
that didn't have that richness to it.
The flat bread crust was a little too thin almost like a water salt cracker.
However, the kale salad and chicken pot pie were amazing and I couldn't stop eating it.
Overall, great place!
However, the kale salad and chicken pot pie were amazing and I couldn't stop eating it.
Overall, great place!
chicken pot pie.author: Celia B.
chicken pot pie.review: Great beer and wine selection; bartenders are friendly and offer samples in case you're stuck between a few choices. Very intimate setting, great candle lighting, and location is tucked away from the crowds. We had the spicy Mac and cheese, chicken pot pie, kale salad, and asparagus olive flatbread. I'm normally very picky about my Mac and cheese and it was okay that didn't have that richness to it. The flat bread crust was a little too thin almost like a water salt cracker. However, the kale salad and chicken pot pie were amazing and I couldn't stop eating it. Overall, great place!

excerpts: The chicken pot pie here is delicious!!!
The puff pastry was flaky/buttery and the inside was very creamy.
chicken pot pie.author: Jennifer K.
chicken pot pie.review:
The chicken pot pie here is delicious!!! The puff pastry was flaky/buttery and the inside was very creamy. The only thing is that I wished the pot pie was a little hotter, it got cold pretty quickly. 

I also loved their flatbread! The flatbread crust tasted like baked Parmesan chips. There is a large selection of beer. 

The place is a little small, so there might be a wait, but you can put your name on a wait list through Yelp. 

Would definitely come here again for their flat bread and Mac and cheese.

excerpts: The service was perfect and the food delicious (kale salad and chicken pot pie are the way to go).
We both tried different types of cider, both very well done, cold, and refreshing.
Then we got the creme brûlée - dear lord that was so good.
Ultimately you can't beat a relaxed atmosphere and fresh food.
Easily one of my favorite places now.
chicken pot pie.author: Shadiah G.
chicken pot pie.review: So good! Great atmosphere and amazing food. The service was perfect and the food delicious (kale salad and chicken pot pie are the way to go). We both tried different types of cider, both very well done, cold, and refreshing. Then we got the creme brûlée - dear lord that was so good. Ultimately you can't beat a relaxed atmosphere and fresh food. Easily one of my favorite places now.

excerpts:
FA's chicken pot pie - roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon 
- This was good.
My friend loved it.
FYI...
lots and lots of tarragon.
Which I enjoy but some people might not.
chicken pot pie.author: Ness H.
chicken pot pie.review:
The very first time I came here, I ordered 3 meats, 3 cheeses, 1 butter for an amazing charcuterie board. This place made me FALL IN LOVE with charcuterie boards. Now every time I go to a restaurant with one on the menu, I always order it. Always. 

Second time here was more recent. 
I remember the butter being softer and easier to spread last time. Also way more flavorful and delicious. Last time we ordered the maple bacon and this time the chill garlic. High key disappointing this time. Butter was hard. Their menu clearly states "Served w/ warm" but it was definitely cold butter. They gave us little bread (Firebrand levain) The bread wasn't tasty and slightly burnt. 

Salad. Romaine, fried capers, w/ house caesar dressing (raw egg used) add roast chicken
- overall not good. not enough flavor in their dressing. not enough dressing. large portion. chicken was dry and flavorless. 

Flatbread. Roasted red grape, walnut & prosciutto w/ gorgonzola
- I tried some. It was okay. I don't think the roasted red grapes were all that roasted. They were like regular grapes sliced in half. 

Plates. FA's chicken pot pie - roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon 
- This was good. My friend loved it. FYI...lots and lots of tarragon. Which I enjoy but some people might not.

excerpts: I'm a sucker for chicken pot pie, so I knew I had to order it.
chicken pot pie.author: Michelle L.
chicken pot pie.review:
Great place for date night! Large wine and beer selection, and delicious food!
I'm a sucker for chicken pot pie, so I knew I had to order it.

The pot pie filling was probably the best pot pie filling I've ever had. Super savory without being too salty. It was amazing! I wasn't a huge fan of the puff pastry crust, but it was still good.

The sliders were good too. Will be back!

excerpts: The chicken pot pie was a huge disappointment.
Between two layers of crust was a gloppy filling that contained almost no chicken.
chicken pot pie.author: David D.
chicken pot pie.review:
Fat Angel is in the Stones Throw Restaurant group so I was expecting something wonderful from the Fat Angel.  Instead I got something that was a disappointment.   

Their menu would suggest that you are going to get well-prepared comfort food at a comfortable price.  That wasn't the case for me.

The smoke trout salad came in an immense bowl and the trout was good.  However, the greens and especially the horseradish vinaigrette was too much of an OK thing that seemed designed to encourage, even force you to drink copiously.  The salad was also a bit one dimensional as once you got past the trout there was just greens, greens, greens.   Some cherry tomatoes or carrots, something, anything, would have helped.

The chicken pot pie was a huge disappointment.  Between two layers of crust was a gloppy filling that contained almost no chicken.  Just some carrots and whatever they used to thicken the filling.  

Service was extraordinary.  The two young ladies attending the bar and tables were stretched to the limit as the room was quite full, yet they did their job with aplomb.  Bravo to the servers.  Without them this would have been a one star review.

excerpts: The chicken pot pie had a really flaky crust, but I didn't taste anything special about the tarragon cream sauce.
chicken pot pie.author: Janice C.
chicken pot pie.review:
Praise the Lord, hallelujah!

I haven't gone to church in a long time, but I sing praises when it is warranted. Fat Angel makes me sing from the heart.

This sweet, angelic spot exudes upscale lodge with a casual chic feel: marble bar, pew style booth seating and a handsome wall holding some crafted brews and carefully chosen vino. Don't mind the imposing Moosehead hanging above, Rocky and Bullwinkle totally approve.

Fat Angel seamlessly blends fantastic wine bar food with excellent tipples. The menu is 90% alcohol (as it should be!) beers are arranged according to your taste: light, crisp, heavy, dark. Same for the wines and for those who aren't feeling both, they offer several aperitifs as well. 

It felt a little stuffy inside because of the rain, otherwise, I can imagine sitting here for hours on a warm SF night with the bay windows wide open. A crisp and zesty Picpoul was affordably priced at $8/glass.  My gf loves Riesling and this one from Kabinett is a richer style with sweetness in the end.  Of course, you can't go wrong with a Hefeweizen (Ayinger) or a dark stout like Double Chocolate Stout from England or a breakfast stout from Mikeller Bar (the Danes KNOW beer!)

All this imbibing made us hungry: we devoured an excellent meat board with speck, salami and duck terrine. On the board were also FLAVORED BUTTERS like maple bacon and Philz coffee. You wouldn't be able to resist spreading these on toast! The flatbread pizzas are pleasingly light, even with rich toppings such as gorgonzola, prosciutto and grapes on it. The chicken pot pie had a really flaky crust, but I didn't taste anything special about the tarragon cream sauce. 

Hark the herald angels sing and glory to ... the genius who brought Fat Angel to San Francisco. Let's say Amen to that!

excerpts: Finally, the CHICKEN POT PIE (roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon, $13) was creamy and had a sweet hint to it.
chicken pot pie.author: Sebastian F.
chicken pot pie.review:
This place is awesome. 

Extensive beer list (100+ super local beers) - check
Friendly elk greeting from the wall - check
(optional) Christmas tree with Polaroid pictures of the patrons - check

The super friendly gals working at the bar will seat you quickly in this intimite but yet lively place. You might be surprised that the beer/wine selection takes about 90% of the menu but this is a wine bar after all. However, also come here for the food as it's delicious!

The FLATBREAD PIZZA comes in various styles (Firebrand sourdough baguette and whole grain mustard with chorizo, duck salami, genoa, pheasant terrine, speck, or soppressata, $5-$28) and is worth every penny - most delicious topped sourdough I've had in a while, and super crispy.

The SOURDOUGH & BUTTER ($5) satisfies in a special kinda way - have you tried Philz Cofffee butter or Maple Bacon butter? I bet you haven't. Go order.

Finally, the CHICKEN POT PIE (roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon, $13) was creamy and had a sweet hint to it. Marvelous.

Fat Angel - a pleasant surprise in the lower Fillmore area. Stay where you are, angel. I'll be back.

excerpts: Chicken pot pie & fish salad was tasty!
chicken pot pie.author: Tina H.
chicken pot pie.review:
Awesome service. Our server was very kind and on top of it. I don't know her name but I want her to get recognition- tall, short hair, tatted, lefty. Super nice!

Chicken pot pie & fish salad was tasty! 

The female bartender was very nice as well. 

Old school GOOD music! 

Will def be back!!

excerpts: Best chicken pot pie and flatbread
I've ever had.
chicken pot pie.author: Jenny H.
chicken pot pie.review:
Holy smokes, the food here is SO darn delicious. Best chicken pot pie and flatbread I've ever had. Also, be sure to order some sweet wines toward the end of your dinner!

The only reason why I'm giving this place a 4-star is because it can get incredibly loud toward dinner time / after work. I had to literally yell across the table to tell my friend a story. In a way, it's a good thing because EVERYONE is there to chat and you won't have any awkward silences. It gets super busy around the bar as well. I would recommend getting a seat early if you can!

excerpts:
(Kind of build your own type of deal)

Chicken pot pie is comforting and hearty.
chicken pot pie.author: Rachel T.
chicken pot pie.review:
Very cute place. Great for date night. I've been a few times. Weekends are pretty busy, I recommend week nights. 

Cheese and meat boards are super fun. (Kind of build your own type of deal)

Chicken pot pie is comforting and hearty.
Sliders are tasty and satisfying. 

Beer list is never ending, wine on tap a plus.

Check it out!

excerpts: That being recognized, the chicken pot pie was decent
chicken pot pie.author: Ron M.
chicken pot pie.review:
We ordered take out so that definitely had an effect in that the pot pie wasn't as hot, right out of the oven. 

That being recognized, the chicken pot pie was decent but I've had much better in other places (not in SF). 

The salad was Fresh and crisp

excerpts: My friends also really loved the sliders, chicken pot pie, and mac and cheese.
chicken pot pie.author: Jennifer C.
chicken pot pie.review:
We came here on a Saturday night about 6pm and it was still about a half hour wait to seat five of us. It's a much smaller restaurant (seats maybe 30 people) and has an intimate vibe. We saw quite a few dates while we were there. Aside from the restaurant, there is also a bar located at the front if you just want to stop by for a drink or two.

Food (5/5) To be completely honest, the sausage, tomato, and arugula flatbread that I ordered was probably one of the best flatbread that I have ever tasted. It had a thin crust and was topped with delicious spicy sausage. I should also mention that the flatbread is a very generous portion and I was able to take half of it home for tomorrow's breakfast (SCORE!). My friends also really loved the sliders, chicken pot pie, and mac and cheese.

Drinks (4/5) The drink menu is quite large, but I was surprised that it cost me $13 for a 12oz bottled beer...I mean I love me some good beer but that is a hefty price for something I can buy in the store.

Overall I'd say the food was awesome and the beer was great. They've got wine, beer, and something for everyone.

excerpts: We had their signature chicken pot pie..
Have to say even better than my grandma's!!
(I know!!
Ouch!!
Sorry granny!!!)
the puff pastry was buttery and crusty!!
The filling has thick and flavorful.
(Somehow I felt the potatoes were a bit undercooked..hmm..)
And the kale truffle flatbread was phenomenal, maybe I have bias on anything truffle..
Smoked trout salad is another item I enjoyed a lot.
The horseradish vinaigrette was light, but the salad was tossed so well, every single bite will pick up all the flavors.
chicken pot pie.author: Yann M.
chicken pot pie.review:
Okay, this is my 4th meal of that crazy Sunday. I am pretty positive that I wasn't even hungry until I walked into this restaurant..
The lighting was pretty dim. The waitress was very patient regarding all of the questions about beer my friends threw at her. 
We had their signature chicken pot pie.. Have to say even better than my grandma's!! (I know!! Ouch!! Sorry granny!!!) the puff pastry was buttery and crusty!! The filling has thick and flavorful. (Somehow I felt the potatoes were a bit undercooked..hmm..) 
And the kale truffle flatbread was phenomenal, maybe I have bias on anything truffle..@.@.. 
Smoked trout salad is another item I enjoyed a lot. The horseradish vinaigrette was light, but the salad was tossed so well, every single bite will pick up all the flavors. 
And their Mac n Cheese.. Hmmmm... Spicy!! I am not a fan of Mac n cheese.. But couldn't help having couple of scoops here!!

Love this place! Recommend!!

excerpts: Their freshly baked Chicken Pot Pie that is served piping hot from the oven, is surely homely and that crisp and flaky crust, is comfort to the soul!
chicken pot pie.author: Tiffany D.
chicken pot pie.review:
I love to wine and dine with Fat Angel!  

Their flatbread pizza with gorgonzola, walnut, prosciutto and topped with roasted grapes, is deliciously amazing!  Pair it with their grand selections of fine wine, such as their Manto Negro/Callet from Spain, which had hints of cocoa, toffee and cherry blend, then the meal would be splendidly perfect to the palate!  

Their freshly baked Chicken Pot Pie that is served piping hot from the oven, is surely homely and that crisp and flaky crust, is comfort to the soul!

They serve up beer as well, just in case you prefer not to dine over wine! 

I simply can't ask for better company to pair a meal and wine over with, than with Fat Angel!

excerpts: THE CHICKEN POT PIE!
THE BEST CHICKEN POT PIE OF EVERYONES LIFE.
I know they had a really great beer list but nothing matters besides the chicken pot pie!
chicken pot pie.author: Sarah D.
chicken pot pie.review:
OH MY GOD. THE CHICKEN POT PIE! THE BEST CHICKEN POT PIE OF EVERYONES LIFE. 

Get the pot pie. I know they had a really great beer list but nothing matters besides the chicken pot pie!

excerpts: My friend and I shared a kale salad and the chicken pot pie.
We had chocolate cake for dessert.
The atmosphere and service were real easy and enjoyable.
chicken pot pie.author: Amy D.
chicken pot pie.review: I have to admit I'm not a beer drinker but Fat Angel has converted me. I had A Golden State of Mind on tap with my dinner then a chocolate beer with dessert. Both beers were smooth and perfect with the food. My friend and I shared a kale salad and the chicken pot pie. We had chocolate cake for dessert. The atmosphere and service were real easy and enjoyable.

excerpts: It hurts to do this, because I love their chicken pot pie, but I feel as if I must...
I ordered from here last Thursday and found a large bug crawling underneath my pizza.
Damn shame because I really liked this place :(.
chicken pot pie.author: Blake V.
chicken pot pie.review: It hurts to do this, because I love their chicken pot pie, but I feel as if I must... I ordered from here last Thursday and found a large bug crawling underneath my pizza. Damn shame because I really liked this place :(.

excerpts: We splurged on the mac n cheese and chicken pot pie and it was well worth it.
Both dishes were made uniquely with delicious flavors.
Can't go to a wine bar without a meat and cheese plate!
I can't recall exactly which cheeses we chose
but I know I had a delicious blue in there.
chicken pot pie.author: Jen W.
chicken pot pie.review:
Delicious and elegant hole in the wall in the Fillmore area...great place to order a few small plates and kick back with some glasses of wine.  That's exactly what we did.

We splurged on the mac n cheese and chicken pot pie and it was well worth it.  Both dishes were made uniquely with delicious flavors.  Can't go to a wine bar without a meat and cheese plate!  I can't recall exactly which cheeses we chose but I know I had a delicious blue in there.  Yum.  

Pick up a couple of glasses of wine and you're good to go.  Cute little place with great food...4 stars.

excerpts: Once seated, we ordered a few of the items that were recommended by other reviewers - the maple bacon butter, spicy sausage flatbread, and chicken pot pie.
I would say the flatbread was my favorite, it had a good combination of ingredients.
