Unfortunately, the chicken pot pie had some flavor in there that tasted cherry-like which I didn't really appreciate that permeated the whole dish.
And the butter was interesting
but it is served rock hard
and they give it to you with cold bread,
so it's not very easy to spread.
I'm not sure I'd order it again.
chicken pot pie.author: Gloria N.
chicken pot pie.review:
This was a decent place to meet up for drinks.  They have a pretty small space, maybe 8 tables or so and about 10 seats at the bar.  I got there around 7 and the wait was about 20 minutes for dinner.  They had a few tables outside so we grabbed beers and sat down until our table was ready.  You also have the option of exploring the neighboring stores and bars since you get a text letting you know when your table is ready.
Once seated, we ordered a few of the items that were recommended by other reviewers - the maple bacon butter, spicy sausage flatbread, and chicken pot pie.  I would say the flatbread was my favorite, it had a good combination of ingredients.  Unfortunately, the chicken pot pie had some flavor in there that tasted cherry-like which I didn't really appreciate that permeated the whole dish.  And the butter was interesting but it is served rock hard and they give it to you with cold bread, so it's not very easy to spread.  I'm not sure I'd order it again.
Overall, I'd say that if I were to come back, it would probably be just for drinks.

excerpts: 4) Chicken pot pie with roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon - solid, hearty pot pie.

No complaints. 
5)
chicken pot pie.author: Saminda W.
chicken pot pie.review:
Small place with a long wait but generally worth it.  Terrific food, decent beer selection, and friendly service; that's a nice trifecta.

While we waited for our table (about 40 mins), we tried their charcuterie plate with a nice assortment of cheeses.  It staved off our hunger well and paired well with the dark Belgian beers we were trying.

When we finally sat down, we were still ravenous and the four of us ordered almost everything on the menu:

1) Flatbread with roasted red grape, walnut & prosciutto w/ gorgonzola - epic, still can remember the savory flavor
2) Flatbread with tomato, spicy sausage & arugula w/ parmesan - equally epic, the flavors came together so well
3) Mac n' Cheese with gruyère, cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano, cayenne - spicy, creamy goodness. Yum.
4) Chicken pot pie with roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon - solid, hearty pot pie.  No complaints. 
5) Sliders with beef, caramelized onions, bacon, irish cheddar, aioli - only misfire of the whole meal, meat was dry and not really flavorful and the trimmings didn't make up for it.  

Overall, really impressed.  If only they had more tables!

excerpts: CHICKEN POT PIE - $12
Roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon
I was quite impressed with this one mainly because it didn't look like a pie.
It looked like there was a thick flakey buttery thing of pastry on top and beneath the filling.
Otherwise the filling was out in the open
so you see exactly what you're getting.
Just your standard chicken pot pie filling
but what made it unique was the "crust".
chicken pot pie.author: Tu-Anh N.
chicken pot pie.review:
Walking in with my 3 girlfriends we were immediately given exceptional service.  2 people served us and were really friendly.  I regret not getting their names.  But they were so nice and attentive and tried to be as helpful as possible!

Looking at the menu, I was amused that 90% of the items were alcoholic beverages.  I came for the food...which can be found on the last page, hehe.

So here's what my girlfriends and I shared:

FLATBREAD - $13 ($2 off during Happy Hour)
Tomatoes, basil, spicy sausage, & arugula w/ ricotta
Although simple, this was amazing.  I love the subtle spice of the sausage, the thin crispyness of the crust (which was not at all greasy), and the arugula that paried so well along with the ricotta.  All the ingredients was just the right amount and this plate was a great one for sharing.  I loved it!

MAC 'N CHEESE - $11
Gruyère, aged cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano
I came here for this dish right here.  I"m happy that it was so spicey like many people thought.  If anything I tasted no spice which was fine.  I loved how the top layer was crispy...and yes this dish was quite greacy...but hey its why I love mac n cheese!  Be careful though, it comes out SUPER hot!  This ooey-gooey cheesy dish was a fave!


F.A.'S CHICKEN POT PIE - $12
Roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon 
I was quite impressed with this one mainly because it didn't look like a pie.  It looked like there was a thick flakey buttery thing of pastry on top and beneath the filling.  Otherwise the filling was out in the open so you see exactly what you're getting.  Just your standard chicken pot pie filling but what made it unique was the "crust".  Yum!

3 SLIDERS - $10
Beef, caramelized onions, bacon, Irish cheddar, aioli
Oh so tasty!  Simple but I appreciate it not being dry.  I love the little pickled peppers it came with...it compliments it SO well.  I felt the aioli tasted like ranch dressing..but its not a complaint.  I enjoyed it.  

Its unfortunate I didn't try any drinks since I feel its their main thing...but I'm happy to have tried their food because it was amazing.  Parking was fairly easy for me (I came around 5:45pm and stayed until 6pm since its free after that).  The restaurant itself is quite small, intimate, but not jam packed.  It does become a full house and I felt we got lucky finding an empty table immediately.  Great food, great company, and exceptional service...whats there to complain?

excerpts:
not so spicy
Chicken pot pie really good.
Not too salty but perfect blend of creamy and quality ingredients
chicken pot pie.author: Randell J.
chicken pot pie.review:
A quick review of what we ordered:
Fried capers love them
Garlic chili butter
Maple bacon butter not quite sweet enough but ample amounts of bacon
Meat dish with caprese, duck salami, and duck liver pate with mustard
Spicy Mac n cheese not so spicy
Chicken pot pie really good. Not too salty but perfect blend of creamy and quality ingredients
Not heaping but very filling
Large selection of drinks
Old stockale hoppy strong flavor lingers on the palate
Sparkling mead strong oaky flavor not too sweet but compliments the food well

Would return. Good for date night.

excerpts: But on my last visit I discovered the Chicken Pot Pie.
Divine!
It may have been my first time trying it, but it certainly won't be my last.
It is an open bowl of Chicken, carrots, peas, potatoes and the perfect amount of gravy and spices with a nice layer of buttery, flakey crust on the bottom and backed to perfection on the top.
Man, I want to go back today just to try it again.
chicken pot pie.author: Victoria O.
chicken pot pie.review:
I love, love, love Fat Angel. It is a hidden (or not so hidden) gem of San Francisco. It is right off of Fillmore, it is a great spot if you are in the neighborhood. I've been going for about four years, and every time I go I find another great menu item. Mind you the menu is only one page (we aren't talking Cheesecake Factory selections) so hard to believe that I haven't tried it all. But on my last visit I discovered the Chicken Pot Pie. Divine! It may have been my first time trying it, but it certainly won't be my last. It is an open bowl of Chicken, carrots, peas, potatoes and the perfect amount of gravy and spices with a nice layer of buttery, flakey crust on the bottom and backed to perfection on the top. Man, I want to go back today just to try it again. It is almost sweet (in a good way) so I do recommend sprinkling with salt and pepper. 

They always have a kick bootie beer selection. And definitely keep them on the radar during sf beer week. Every evening they have a different delicious offering. I sampled five great Paradox beers and on another night 5 Bruery beers poured from bottles. (They had fifteen hard to find beers to choose from, so I had to narrow it down to one sample of five.)

Our fall back food options have always been the bread with flavored butters. The most recent flavors were Bernaise, Chive, Chili, Maple Bacon and Molasses. You can try one for $5.50, three for $15 or all five for I think $25. That is a lot of butter, but I did feel compelled to try them all once and take home the left overs. This last time the Bernaise butter was my favorite. Delish.

We also love their flatbreads, toppings change seasonally. Most recently we tried the butternut squash and kale. Perfect!

And the mac n cheese, is great. Has a tangy hardier taste with the perfect amount of sauce to crunch ratio.

Sometimes the prices can get a little steep if you don't pay attention when ordering, you think it may be a quick bite of food and a beer from your local gastropub, and next thing you know your tab is $90. But you can't blame them for having too many awesome things to order! 

I would like to have cold ice water, luke warm water is the worst. And a few veggie sides and sweet options. But this place is a great go to spot.

excerpts: We had chicken pot pie and asparagus flatbread with beer and wine.
Both were so fresh and well flavored that I still thought about them for a few days.
Could get crowded in the evening, but worth waiting for a bit and coming back.
chicken pot pie.author: Jaclyn C.
chicken pot pie.review: Great selection of beers and wine, some unique and high end ones, and the food was amazing. We had chicken pot pie and asparagus flatbread with beer and wine. Both were so fresh and well flavored that I still thought about them for a few days. Could get crowded in the evening, but worth waiting for a bit and coming back.

excerpts: Followed by the chicken pot pie and spicy Mac and cheese.
The food was good!
The service was a bit slow from beginning to end.
We had to ask for a box and check after waiting a really long time!!
I was surprised as its a pretty small restaurant and figured they'd want us to scoot out (people were waiting and they don't take reservations).
After  a night of drinking (we're on holiday) it was perfect comfort food.
Would happily recommend.
chicken pot pie.author: Leanne E.
chicken pot pie.review:
We ate here last night, after finding it on Yelp. 
They have an extraordinary menu of beer and wine. We had the pretzel and cheese to start. Followed by the chicken pot pie and spicy Mac and cheese. 
The food was good!
The service was a bit slow from beginning to end. We had to ask for a box and check after waiting a really long time!! I was surprised as its a pretty small restaurant and figured they'd want us to scoot out (people were waiting and they don't take reservations).
After  a night of drinking (we're on holiday) it was perfect comfort food. Would happily recommend.

excerpts: No arguments about the chicken pot pie, as it is exactly how I envision a perfect savory pie to be (probably used a cup full of butter to have reached said perfection, but who's caring?).
The spicy mac/cheese is pure bliss on a mini skillet.
Still want more, you say?
chicken pot pie.author: Cham M.
chicken pot pie.review:
I aim for variety when it comes to food/drink, especially since our fair city lends itself well to culinary discovery. However, when it comes to establishments that do it well (and consistently), I am a creature of habit. 

Fat Angel does not have an extensive menu, but what they do have is a well-balanced selection of basics. The outlined food categories nicely fit one page... and it covers the necessities: Appetizers (Angel's Share), Cheese, Meat, Butter, Greens, Flatbread, Plates. The kale salad is unmatched - marcona almonds,  bacon, and the right touch of champagne dressing. No arguments about the chicken pot pie, as it is exactly how I envision a perfect savory pie to be (probably used a cup full of butter to have reached said perfection, but who's caring?). The spicy mac/cheese is pure bliss on a mini skillet. Still want more, you say? The Grape/Gorgonzola/Prosciutto flatbread is the way to go.

Are you judging my diet yet? Did you miss the part about me crushing on a salad? 

Oh the beers. Amazing beers on tap that rotate frequently based on season and featured microbrews. Some of the best variety offered in SF, but you end up liking one - drink up, as chances are that beer will be gone in 2 days and it may be while until they get another limited batch. They also have an excellent selection of bottled beers that covers a range of palates. Wine on tap more your groove? I've only tried the Sauvignon Blanc (Martella?) and Pinot Noir (Copain), both decent, but in a place like Fat Angel - with all the beer selections and so little time? Go for the brew. 

The staff knows their stuff. Friendly, fun, and - I'll emphasize this - patient. You in need of figuring out what kind to get, given the otherwise intimidating selection? Engage them in conversation, and they'll make several recommendations (armed with samples)... after which you complete your selection and indulge happily. Let this be a lesson to other establishments: It pays to have a crew who is knowledgeable and passionate about the very things the place stands for. Need I spell out why? Because they generate fans who, not only (willingly) shell out $XX regularly for food and drinks, but ones who give gratitude over a public space like Yelp - even at the risk of getting a longer wait for a table on a Friday night.

excerpts: The second time we sampled the spicy mac 'n cheese and chicken pot pie.
Both delicious but heavy and rich.
Perfect for two of us to share- although we didn't quite finish either item.
Will be back again and again!
chicken pot pie.author: Alyssa C.
chicken pot pie.review: Have been here twice now and am a big fan. The first time my group and I enjoyed the cheese plate, Caesar salad and sausage flat bread. The servers are very knowledgeable- ours helped us choose wine and cheese. The second time we sampled the spicy mac 'n cheese and chicken pot pie. Both delicious but heavy and rich. Perfect for two of us to share- although we didn't quite finish either item. Will be back again and again!

excerpts: The chicken pot pie is delicioussssssss!
The crispy cheese layer on top and the creamy chicken on bottom.
chicken pot pie.author: Jennifer C.
chicken pot pie.review:
Besides the long wait and pack of people, definitely a great place to chill and have glorified bar food.

They have tons of beer and drink choices. The drafts are good and I love that they told you a little about it to see if you'd like it. The workers are definitely on it and friendly, which makes the waiting a little better. 

The chicken pot pie is delicioussssssss! The crispy cheese layer on top and the creamy chicken on bottom. So juicy and flavorful.

The truffle flat bread with sausage is definitely yummy but seriously no truffle taste. You guys run out or something??

Would def come back to try more of the menu. 

I left a little more fat. Thanks.

excerpts: We shared the cheese plate, smoked trout salad and chicken pot pie and everything was great.....try the Ptit Cab Sauvignon they have on tap - excellent !
chicken pot pie.author: Wylie T.
chicken pot pie.review: Wife and I stopped by after a day in the city just for a glass of wine but stayed for dinner as this the Fat Angel was so warm and welcoming.  Service was attentive and helpful, bringing several tastes of wines before we committed without attitude or complaint.  We shared the cheese plate, smoked trout salad and chicken pot pie and everything was great.....try the Ptit Cab Sauvignon they have on tap - excellent !

excerpts: We got the Mac and Cheese, Chicken Pot Pie, and some red wine on tap which was a HUGE PLUS!
chicken pot pie.author: Kat M.
chicken pot pie.review:
Came here for my birthday and loved every second of my dining experience! 

Eleanor (I think that's her name), our server, was insightful about the menu and knew what wine paired well with each of their dishes. We got the Mac and Cheese, Chicken Pot Pie, and some red wine on tap which was a HUGE PLUS!

excerpts: My friend and I shared the spicy mac and cheese, their famous chicken pot pie, and a platter of meats, cheese, and butter.
chicken pot pie.author: Dawn T.
chicken pot pie.review:
I came here for my 22nd birthday with 6 other friends. It's a small place but they did our best to accommodate our needs. We had our table in the back and our server really explained all of the cheese and meat selections that we had a question about.

I wanted to save her some trouble by splitting up the bill before she took our orders and she had no issue doing so. 

The FOOD IS INSANE. My friend and I shared the spicy mac and cheese, their famous chicken pot pie, and a platter of meats, cheese, and butter. I was highly impressed and extremely satisfied.

I was also dove into their creamy creme brule with a perfect hard sugar top that wasn't burnt. It was really sweet that I received a free dessert for my birthday.

I'm definitely coming back and taking all of my friends.

excerpts: I got the chicken pot pie, which I thought was pretty good.
chicken pot pie.author: Keith C.
chicken pot pie.review:
Came here for dinner with a friend and was not disappointed.  The beer and wine selection is QUITE extensive and is organized by flavor (with alcohol percentages!) so if you like beer and wine, definitely check this place out.  I got the chicken pot pie, which I thought was pretty good.  I wasn't amazed though.  

I'll definitely come back here for some beers if I'm in the area, and if I'm getting drinks I'll probably grab a small bite to eat too.

excerpts: We ordered a flatbread and the chicken pot pie and all was good.
The meals are full of flavor
so you'll need water and wine
;) to wash it all down!
chicken pot pie.author: Jessica H.
chicken pot pie.review: Good Wine, good food with good portions. Couldn't ask for more.  The restaurant itself is on the smaller end but when I went around 8pm on a weekday we did not have to wait to get seated.  Not sure how crowded it gets at busier times.  Their salads are delicious and come in a great portion size.  We ordered a flatbread and the chicken pot pie and all was good. The meals are full of flavor so you'll need water and wine ;) to wash it all down!

excerpts: Food: flat bread, spicy Mac and cheese, chicken pot pie, sliders.
My favorite were the sliders and flat bread!
chicken pot pie.author: Kristin C.
chicken pot pie.review:
This is a great place for small bites and trying new beers. It's small and quaint and right off of fillmore. My coworker who has lived in SF for so long took me here and he has good taste in food and knows what he likes so I trusted him and wasn't disappointed. He got a sour beer and if was my first time trying one and it was good! They often have new selection of alcohol that come in so its a fun place to sample. We got a cream beer and a porter. 

Limited about of seating but the atmosphere is cozy. Very dim but a fun atmosphere for a date night. 

Food: flat bread, spicy Mac and cheese, chicken pot pie, sliders. My favorite were the sliders and flat bread!

excerpts: The Fa's chicken pot pie - roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon - was also super homey.
chicken pot pie.author: Tiffany D.
chicken pot pie.review:
Had been wanting to try this spot for awhile now. Located in a nice little nook near Fillmore Street, Fat Angel boasts a great beer menu and some delish gastropub eats.

The wait is long, and they don't take resys, so come early and don't be that hungry. Also, with SF weather, bring either a jacket and sit outside (much shorter wait time, and they have heat lamps), or wait longer for the inside tables. It's a tiny space so waits can me 1.5-2 hours long depending on party size.

We started off with fried capers. These were interesting -- deep fried, so the insides were hollow, and the outsides were crunchy. It was delicious, but super salty (capers, duh).

Next, we noshed on the chocolate cinnamon butter. This was served with a great rye bread, and was so delicious. Like cinnamoney-nutella. Spread like butter, and was soft.

Then we had 2 flatbreads: (1) Roasted red grape, walnut, & prosciutto w/ Gorgonzola, which was lovely. The roasted grapes are a favorite thing of mine that not many places do. It adds a hint of sweet to something that feels savory. It's great. (2) Wild mushroom and white truffle oil w/pecorino. This was also delicious, and better than the roasted red grape flatbread. Both flatbreads were super thin -- think nacho chip with pizza-like toppings. Very tasty and not too heavy.

Then we had the Mac n'cheese - gruyere, cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano, cayenne. Was a nice, homey mac and cheese. The Fa's chicken pot pie - roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon - was also super homey. The toasted filo dough on top was a great touch, which you break into pieces and eat with the insides of the pot pie.

Finally we had a great cheese board, which our server picked. Service overall was nice, with servers being very beer and food knowledgeable, and eager to help.

Had a delightful meal with great friends, and would definitely come back.

excerpts: For foods I got the chicken pot pie.
The pie isn't like your traditional chicken pot pie with the chicken stuffing inside of the pie.
This one here all of the filling is out in the bowl, and you've got your piece of pie/bread floatin' on 'modest mouse' style in the middle.
It was good, and while not what I expected I wouldn't hesitate to get it again if/when I dine here again.
chicken pot pie.author: David C.
chicken pot pie.review:
Only been to this place once but I was impressed. They've got a good variety of beer, I was pleasantly surprised by their selection. My buddy got the curieux, it was absolutely delicious; don't you just love it when your beers are delicious? From what I remember the curieux was a bit creamy, and fruity, give it a try if that sounds up your alley, you won't be disappointed. 

For foods I got the chicken pot pie. The pie isn't like your traditional chicken pot pie with the chicken stuffing inside of the pie. This one here all of the filling is out in the bowl, and you've got your piece of pie/bread floatin' on 'modest mouse' style in the middle. It was good, and while not what I expected I wouldn't hesitate to get it again if/when I dine here again.

excerpts: - Chicken pot pie (13) --
More like a deconstructed pot pie.
The portions were huge, and this was delicious.
chicken pot pie.author: Cynthia W.
chicken pot pie.review:
Really like this place:

- Huge beer and wine selection.

- House marinated olives (4) -- SO GOOD. They're Calvestrano olives (those giant, juicy, plump, forest green-colored ones -- my absolute fav) and they taste heavenly.

- Meat + cheese (6 for 28) -- We combined a bunch to make a charcuterie plate. Everything was really good, the duck salami and genoa especially stood out.

- 3 sliders (12) -- These were okay. Nothing special.

- Chicken pot pie (13) -- More like a deconstructed pot pie. The portions were huge, and this was delicious. Probably because it had like a pound of butter and cream in it (not listed in the ingredients), and as a lactard, I did not appreciate the after-effects.

This place is cozy, tasteful, and intimate, but gets crowded really fast. There is outdoor seating with heat lamps, but it still gets a little chilly. They don't seat your party until everyone is there.

Tip: They don't take reservations, but you can download the NoWait app and put your name down when they open (4 PM).

excerpts: I did enjoy the flat bread, the mac and cheese (yum!), and the deconstructed chicken pot pie.
Recommended for a date, especially since it's so dark you can't really see ;) haha ...
chicken pot pie.author: Lorrie M.
chicken pot pie.review:
This is a super cute and cosy restaurant that I had a chance to come w/ my bff and her bf (ha that's a mouthful ...) recently when we got together for dinner. 

By cute and cozy I mean this place is TINY. We were sitting 3 at a table and I was feeling like a giant of sorts. Because the place is small, it usually smells like olive oil and fried things as the kitchen just drifts into the air of the place ... but the bar is cute and their selection of wine and beer is quite extensive.

The thing that surprised me the most, actually, was the fact that they had a large beer list. Who knew, I thought this was a wine bar!

The wait staff are very friendly, and very knowledgable, but seem somewhat rushed since they were sort of looking like they wanted us to get out of there every time we finished a bottle ... but aside from that everything was good. I did enjoy the flat bread, the mac and cheese (yum!), and the deconstructed chicken pot pie. Recommended for a date, especially since it's so dark you can't really see ;) haha ...

excerpts: Chicken Pot Pie - Delicious!
A bowl filled with creamy chicken and veggies (carrots and peas) topped with a crispy crust.
chicken pot pie.author: Richard P.
chicken pot pie.review:
YUM YUM YUM! I just moved to San Francisco this past weekend and Fat Angle is probably one of my favorite places to eat thus far! Located just across the street from my apartment it is very convenient for me to eat there.

They have a great selection of beer! Organized by type, some of these bottles can get quite pricey $30+ so be careful when ordering. But if you like beer they are sure to have something you like!

The food is delicious!  They have a small menu, so in the few times I've been I have been able to try a majority of the items:

Flavored Butters, Cheese, and Meats served with bread -- Almost like a charcuterie platter. It all comes out together on a platter served with bread. I loved the meats and cheeses. Awesome quality and the saltiness goes well when drinking.

Chicken Pot Pie - Delicious! A bowl filled with creamy chicken and veggies (carrots and peas) topped with a crispy crust. Not too doughy since the crust isn't completely surrounding the pie.

Burger Sliders -- My favorite thing here! Juicy meat with some amazing aioli. Also goes great with the pickled jalapenos which are served on the side.

Mac n' Cheese - Cheesy with a kick. The heat seems to linger for awhile, but it is so good.

Flat Breads - Extremely thin crust! Thin and crispy!

Great place to grab some beers and delicious food. My only complaint is that the restaurant is really small, so sometimes the wait can be long.

excerpts: The menu was short but we found what we wanted quickly: sliders for me, and chicken pot pie for my buddy P.
Unfortunately, it took about 15 mins to get someone to take our orders.
(Staff was very thin.)
chicken pot pie.author: Dan B.
chicken pot pie.review:
When looking for a place to grab a bite before a show at the Fillmore, Fat Angel showed up near the top of the list during a Yelp search.  Noticing that they were a gastropub with a fine beer list made the choice easy for me.

After parking nearby with my friend P, we made a beeline here to quench our thirst and grab a bite. Unfortunately, there was a small crowd of people jamming the doorway and we thought we might be out of luck. After all, the place is really tiny. 

Undaunted, we squeezed through to the bar to find several open spaces. I guess everyone really wanted a table.  We didn't.

The draft beer list here (written on chalkboard) was FANTASTIC: all microbrews, including two IPAs, a golden ale, a porter, a weiss beer, a brown ale. a double IPA and even a sour beer.  The bottle list was much longer; The waiter said the total count was over 100!  So many choices that we couldn't decide, and so we left. (yeah right)

The menu was short but we found what we wanted quickly: sliders for me, and chicken pot pie for my buddy P.  Unfortunately, it took about 15 mins to get someone to take our orders. (Staff was very thin.) At least we had tasty beers in front of us and some time to examine the cool decor, including the large glass chandelier (echoes of the nearby Fillmore?) and the back of the bar, which appeared to be made out of an old church organ...pretty Cool actually.

Once we ordered, the food arrived quickly. We both enjoyed our meals and our second, tasty brew.  The night was off to a good start.  By the time we paid up and left, the outside crowd had doubled, and even bar seats were in demand. We were glad we had arrived when we did.

5 stars for the perfect pre-show dinner and excellent beer selection; 1 star off for the spotty service.

excerpts: Huz had chicken pot pie and I had trout salad.
Both were Tady with generous portions.
Great chill vibe and service.
chicken pot pie.author: Cydney B.
chicken pot pie.review: Nice little bistro that we will visit again. Huz had chicken pot pie and I had trout salad. Both were Tady with generous portions. Great chill vibe and service.

excerpts:
Best:
Mac n cheese
Chicken pot pie

Atmosphere: intimate, dim lighting and trendy
chicken pot pie.author: Daniela J.
chicken pot pie.review:
This is a great little place that does a few dishes really well!

Best:
Mac n cheese
Chicken pot pie

Atmosphere: intimate, dim lighting and trendy

I will come here again!

excerpts: Chicken pot pie:
chicken pot pie.author: Nadeen H.
chicken pot pie.review:
Hrm... was it just me? So many people rave about this place and I came with high expectations but I was a little disappointed... I guess I expected everything to taste a lot better but nothing really was to my liking.

Polenta fries: first few bites was good... sorta seemed like I was forcing myself to eat it... the taste was a bit weird to me, kinda tastes like a lot of olive oil, and found myself drowning the fries in ketchup to kind of make it taste better... When the fries became cool... it tasted just awful. Wasn't a fan.

Tomatoes, basil, spicy sausage flat bread: this was pretty good. I really liked the ricotta and sausage!

Mac n cheese: The toppings were delicious and perfect but below the toppings seemed really dry... a bit hard to swallow? Regardless, the toppings made up for it, I guess.

Sliders: no no no! First bite was SOOO GOOD... then it just felt really oily and buttery and eck... made me feel a bit sick after.

Chicken pot pie: I've had better... a bit too thick and creamy for my taste.

I dont know... I really wish I could give this place more stars but I really wasn't impressed. Maybe it was just an off day for the kitchen... I'd like to come back and give it another go though. (:

Really nice ambiance though!

excerpts: The chicken pot pie really blew me away and leftovers
we're just as amazing.
chicken pot pie.author: Shirley N.
chicken pot pie.review:
I would give this place a solid four stars if it wasn't for the rude male host working the front. If the outside seats are "first come, first serve", do not tell me you lost a few customers due to me taking one chair from the other table because you are one who told me to check the outside seating and to take whatever's available -_- He made me feel horrible and I could have been approached in a more friendly manner. 

I came here with a party of three on a busy Friday night and I can't wait to visit this place again minus the rude host. The chicken pot pie really blew me away and leftovers we're just as amazing. They have a endless list of beers, wines and bar food. This is a fun place to grab some drinks with friends and just hang out. I do not recommend large parties here.

excerpts: Now that I've tried their amazing mac & cheese and the chicken pot pie (kind of salty), I'd love to sample their antipasti and organic butter.
chicken pot pie.author: Kate V.
chicken pot pie.review:
Mac & cheese here is sinful
Skipping it is a mistake
That's why the angel is fat
... wine headache.

Wine and scrumptious food to go with it are my weakness. Hence I liked this place so much I came two nights in a row!

The food here is yummy enough to stand alone. Now that I've tried their amazing mac & cheese and the chicken pot pie (kind of salty), I'd love to sample their antipasti and organic butter.

As with any other small wine bar, the extensive wine list is unique and has been put together bottle by bottle by the co-owners. I got to chat with one of them about their business venture and the story behind it (the inspiration for the name "Fat Angel" actually came from China of all places). If Cyrick isn't too busy, you should flag him down, he's awesome!

The décor is like chapel meets speakeasy. Or maybe it just feels that way since you're sitting in a church pew staring at an organ... downing a bottle of tempranillo. The intimate space is mood-lit by candles and chandeliers--super date-appropriate. Just watch out for slow service on a busy night. If time is not a factor for you, however, then feel free to spend all evening in this cozy little spot, which I'm really glad is thriving in its home in the heart of the Fillmore.

excerpts: The chicken pot pie I obsessed bout days after dining here.
Even the caeser salad was amazing.
chicken pot pie.author: Jeanette W.
chicken pot pie.review: I absolutely love this place!  The chicken pot pie I obsessed bout days after dining here.  Even the caeser salad was amazing.  Eclectic beer list too for beers that are from different country's.

excerpts: Must try their Mac n cheese, sausage flatbread, and chicken pot pie.
A huge beer selection (and wine) and friendly staff!
chicken pot pie.author: Joyce C.
chicken pot pie.review: Very cramped in here but the food is so delicious. Must try their Mac n cheese, sausage flatbread, and chicken pot pie. A huge beer selection (and wine) and friendly staff!

excerpts: I ordered the chicken pot pie the last time I was there.
The portion was pleasing, and I initially was really enjoying it, but the more I ate, the more I felt like it tasted like the pot pies I used to make in the ovens.
chicken pot pie.author: Allison S.
chicken pot pie.review:
It's got a whole section on the menu for sour beers. I'm sold. 

The food is pretty damn good. I've had quite a bit off their menu--the highlights are the different butters and the salads, which are seriously gigantic. I ordered the chicken pot pie the last time I was there. The portion was pleasing, and I initially was really enjoying it, but the more I ate, the more I felt like it tasted like the pot pies I used to make in the ovens. So, there's your docked star--the pot pie isn't the best thing on the menu. 

Great bar though, and bartenders are super knowledgable. Also I love wine on tap.

excerpts: My friend and I shared a salad, mac & cheese and the chicken pot pie -
everything was delicious!
We were really looking forward to the mac & cheese, which was good.
but the chicken pot pie totally stole the show.
The chicken is tender and the pot pie crust is thin, crispy and there's a bit of cheese baked on to the crust too..
HmmMmmMMmmMm so good!
chicken pot pie.author: Terry C.
chicken pot pie.review:
I can't believe i waited so long to try the food at Fat Angel.

They had a good list of beer & wine. And an excellent menu of small plates and comfort foods - i love the combination.

My friend and I shared a salad, mac & cheese and the chicken pot pie - everything was delicious! We were really looking forward to the mac & cheese, which was good. but the chicken pot pie totally stole the show. The chicken is tender and the pot pie crust is thin, crispy and there's a bit of cheese baked on to the crust too..HmmMmmMMmmMm so good!

excerpts: Bread Served in Lunch Bag, Plate of Sopressata & Hot Coppa w/ Housemade Jelly & Nuts, Chicken Pot Pie, Sliders, Mac & Cheese
Total:  $53.65
Note:
My Top Pick
chicken pot pie.author: Genevieve Y.
chicken pot pie.review:
Date & Time:  Friday February 5, 2010 @ 6pm
Dining Companion:  The Husband
Scene:  Good Mix of  Unpretentious Neighborhood Peeps Dining Solo & Couples in North Face Vests
Vibe:  Casual & Charming    
Music:  Cool Mix of Alternative & Jazz- Sarah Vaghn & Etta James 
Decor:  Rustic & Cozy.  Candle-Lit,  Wooden Bar, Ornate Chandeliers, Train Station Benches, Leather Club Chairs. 
Service:  The Owners are Nice, Genuine & Earnest.  The Best Ever.
Imbibe:  Extensive Wine List.  We had Beer & Espresso to Top off The Meal
Devour:  Complimentary Homemade Cured Olives, Bread Served in Lunch Bag, Plate of Sopressata & Hot Coppa w/ Housemade Jelly & Nuts, Chicken Pot Pie, Sliders, Mac & Cheese
Total:  $53.65
Note:  My Top Pick

excerpts: Chicken pot pie was yummy.
chicken pot pie.author: Christine M.
chicken pot pie.review:
CUTE PLACE!

I have always wanted to try this place and I'm glad I did for my bday. Definitely small so try not to go with more than 4! We had 6 ppl, which is doable but pushing it, especially if you are going to be ordering lots of things!

A memorable beer for us was the Witch's Wit! Yummy and light.
Chicken pot pie was yummy. Mac n cheese was ok.
Flatbreads were yummy, the one with grapes and walnuts was good.
we had the meat and cheese platter. good nibble food.
maple bacon and philz coffee butter, interesting!

would definitely come again with a group of girls or just the bf!

excerpts: We ordered a chicken pot pie, pizza and wine.
I love their chicken pie, so creamy!!
And the pizza is so crunchy!
If you are a wine drinker,  you have definitely drop by here!
chicken pot pie.author: Joanna H.
chicken pot pie.review:
I was here with my friend exploring new restaurants. We decided to give it a shot since the restaurant is always packed. We ordered a chicken pot pie, pizza and wine.
I love their chicken pie, so creamy!! And the pizza is so crunchy! If you are a wine drinker,  you have definitely drop by here!

excerpts: But the chicken pot pie is what really gets my attention.
So delicious!
And very pretty on the plate, too.
Aside from the pot pie, I also got some slices of bresaola as a starter.
The bread they had to go with the meat was good (not amazing but solid).
One of these days I'm going to go back and try the Mac and cheese...
but it will be hard to turn away from that pot pie.....
chicken pot pie.author: Farah F.
chicken pot pie.review: This place is really close to my apartment, which is already a big plus. But the chicken pot pie is what really gets my attention. So delicious! And very pretty on the plate, too. Aside from the pot pie, I also got some slices of bresaola as a starter. The bread they had to go with the meat was good (not amazing but solid). One of these days I'm going to go back and try the Mac and cheese... but it will be hard to turn away from that pot pie.....

excerpts: A kale salad and chicken pot pie made for a perfect dinner on a cold rainy day or any day.
Thanks Fat Angel.
Until we meet again.
chicken pot pie.author: Mike C.
chicken pot pie.review:
Fat Angle turned our ordinary Thursday into an awesome Thursday. Service was great, beer selection - amazing, food - delicious. We couldn't have asked for more.

They don't take reservations but we only had to wait 10 minutes to sit at the bar. The beer list was a comical mixture of modern day brewing but the bartender was great with recommendations and tastings of ones I was interested in.

My wife and I have eaten here twice now and haven been let down. A kale salad and chicken pot pie made for a perfect dinner on a cold rainy day or any day. Thanks Fat Angel. Until we meet again.

excerpts: We ordered the mac & cheese (yum), chicken pot pie (my choice favorite of the night), endive salad (delightfully huge portions), prosciutto flatbread (meh, kind of small and not filling but it'lll be hard to resist ordering one

so my review probably won't mean anything to someone who's read this far), and a single cheese (this was the first item to come out and it's safe to say everyone in my group was disappointed at the size of the cheese and the bread).
chicken pot pie.author: Melissa T.
chicken pot pie.review:
I'm either too cheap or too poor to give this place a full five stars. Came here on a Saturday around 6:30 with four other friends. The restaurant is pretty small, so it took a while for them to be able to seat our odd numbered group. We had initially come here for outdoor seating, but the outdoor tables are best for groups of two or three so we just went inside, which was fairly loud because of the acoustics of the room. Sort of works for the vibe of the restaurant, just don't plan to have any intimate conversations here as you'll have to talk fairly loudly for your friends/date to hear.

We ordered the mac & cheese (yum), chicken pot pie (my choice favorite of the night), endive salad (delightfully huge portions), prosciutto flatbread (meh, kind of small and not filling but it'lll be hard to resist ordering one so my review probably won't mean anything to someone who's read this far), and a single cheese (this was the first item to come out and it's safe to say everyone in my group was disappointed at the size of the cheese and the bread). Personally, I was thinking that for $5 I could buy a huge block of muenster cheese and be pretty happy with that.

Overall, it was a nice place to try but I wasn't made into a regular. I feel like the food menu is overpriced by $2-3 for each item. But if nothing else, we did come to the conclusion that we should throw our own wine and cheese party at home, so I guess this place is good for getting the social creative juices flowing

excerpts: Really excited to go back to try their Chicken pot pie (which sadly was sold out when we arrived!)
.. as well as their spicy mac & cheese!
Just writing this review makes me want to go back NOW!
:D
chicken pot pie.author: Amber S.
chicken pot pie.review:
Last night on a spontaneous whim, we arrived at Fat Angel for the second time.

Got their Sangiovese by the glass and was recommended by Derek the bartender to pair it with flat bread. This was Heavenly!! 

Loved the combination of roasted red grapes, walnuts, really yummy prosciutto & gorgonzola (which was Not over-powering at all!) Cannot wait to try their other flavors.The flat bread itself was like a thin crust pizza.. perfect with wine or beer because you're not overloaded with carbs after!

Really excited to go back to try their Chicken pot pie (which sadly was sold out when we arrived!) .. as well as their spicy mac & cheese! Just writing this review makes me want to go back NOW! :D

excerpts: The mac n cheese and chicken pot pie are to die for!
Hadn't come here in at least 2 years, so coming back to try my once favorites was a great reminder of how good the food is!
These two dishes were so dense, that the prosciutto flatbread was just an afterthought.
I would do without the flatbread next time.
chicken pot pie.author: Jeanne C.
chicken pot pie.review:
The mac n cheese and chicken pot pie are to die for! Hadn't come here in at least 2 years, so coming back to try my once favorites was a great reminder of how good the food is! These two dishes were so dense, that the prosciutto flatbread was just an afterthought. I would do without the flatbread next time. We all thought the Zinfandel was the best out of the Reds tasting.

Seating is random. We were told a 45 min wait but it ended up being 20-30 min. We sat at the bar. They are very particular about where you sit and stand when waiting for a table, so it's really hard to get a drink when you want it. I love intimate spots but it's a little too small for the demand of the place!

excerpts: Chicken pot pie, chicken pot pie, chicken pot pie!
The best ever!
Along with an outstanding beer list, delightful wine selections, cheese plates and charcuterie boards, this place is far, far better than the State Bird...seriously
chicken pot pie.author: Vince C.
chicken pot pie.review: Chicken pot pie, chicken pot pie, chicken pot pie!  The best ever!  Along with an outstanding beer list, delightful wine selections, cheese plates and charcuterie boards, this place is far, far better than the State Bird...seriously

excerpts: cheeses, charcuterie, flatbreads, mac n cheese, and chicken pot pie.
chicken pot pie.author: Regina C.
chicken pot pie.review:
LOVE this place. small. dark. simple. a ton of beer selections. an easy menu that you can't go wrong with. cheeses, charcuterie, flatbreads, mac n cheese, and chicken pot pie. all things that pair well with beer, of course. 

the bartender wants you to drink something you enjoy and will talk you through their libations as well as offer you something different if what you've got isn't pleasing.

be prepared to wait some. at 815 on a wednesday we waited about 20 minutes. not too bad but i'll bet it gets worse at varying times in the night and on different days.

excerpts: We really could have ended our meal there, but I couldn't get my mind off some comfort food like their mac n cheese or chicken pot pie.
Unfortunately.. the pot pie just wasn't good.
It first came out lukewarm, then when they said they'd remake it, they def just microwaved it bc the "crust" then came out soggy.
Sadface.
That said, the server/bartenders are wonderful and make amazing recommendations.
chicken pot pie.author: Vivian H.
chicken pot pie.review: Glad we found this place! We came by before a movie at the Kabuki, and we started with some wine and a little charcuterie and cheese plate. SO good, and large portions. Then we got a kale salad, and were presented with a mountain of it. We really could have ended our meal there, but I couldn't get my mind off some comfort food like their mac n cheese or chicken pot pie. Unfortunately.. the pot pie just wasn't good. It first came out lukewarm, then when they said they'd remake it, they def just microwaved it bc the "crust" then came out soggy. Sadface. That said, the server/bartenders are wonderful and make amazing recommendations.

excerpts: MUST TRY the CHICKEN POT PIE... DELICIOUS!
A def must go!
chicken pot pie.author: Mary S.
chicken pot pie.review: I am so glad I brought my family to this spot. Everything you can find at Fat Angel that defines  a good date are here: delicious food, wine options, and the ambiance. MUST TRY the CHICKEN POT PIE... DELICIOUS! A def must go!

excerpts: Chicken Pot Pie to kill for.
I'm starting to salivate.
chicken pot pie.author: Chris B.
chicken pot pie.review:
I don't get up to the city often enough, especially around dinner time, but when I do it takes some convincing to NOT go to Fat Angel.

Bajillions of beers (if you like that sort of thing). The best sliders I've ever had. Chicken Pot Pie to kill for. I'm starting to salivate.

excerpts: My husband's chicken pot pie was good (he says) and my sister enjoyed her endive salad.
My brother-in-law had the sliders and he seemed to find them agreeable as well.
chicken pot pie.author: Molly N.
chicken pot pie.review:
Minus one star for being crazy expensive.

That said? Great food, great beer choices, and funny, kind, and helpful staff. I enjoyed the mac n' cheese immensely. My husband's chicken pot pie was good (he says) and my sister enjoyed her endive salad. My brother-in-law had the sliders and he seemed to find them agreeable as well. They had a wonderful selection of beers but it was just way too expensive for me to go for, so I settled on having one cocktail with dinner - the Pimm's cup, which was delicious!

excerpts: We ordered the chicken pot pie as our main entree - and as soon as we got the dish I had to make room for it.
A different take on the traditional dish.
It was served in a bowl - so it had the appearance of soup - with a square shaped crust placed on top.
But with a nice surprise!
As you eat the dish - you will find more crust on the bottom and sides of the bowl!
The crust is my favorite part, so I was happy!
chicken pot pie.author: Megan R.
chicken pot pie.review:
HANDS DOWN best service I've ever had!

The BF and I had just got done biking the golden gate bridge... and we were craving some good food and drinks... put back on those calories we had just pedaled away. 

Of course SF was freeeeezing! But as soon as we got inside - we were warmed up! Not too hot, just perfect! We got lucky! The house was full - but a minute after we arrived a couple had just left so we scored some good seats!

I started off with the Riesling. A nice light fruity crisp wine. Yummy yummy. After 2 glasses I was definitely feeling warmer!

We ordered the Firebrand sourdough baguettes with cheese & meat. The platter came with spicy mustard, some fancy smancy jellies and sauces, and nuts. The server was so nice! I had no idea about the types of meats - I don't normally eat this type of food. But I'll definitely start! He gave us a break down of each type of meat, how it was seasoned and processed! 

We went with:
CHEESE: 
Vella Dry Jack   hard cow
Roaring Forties Blue   semi-soft cow

MEAT:
Salami
Hot Copa

AND on top of that! The server felt bad because our plate was accidentally given to someone else (we didn't even feel the wait was that long). SO he hooked us up with another cheese and meat on the house!

Chorizo
Truffle Tremor  soft goat

The Vella Dry Jack was my favorite! It was dry, but in a good way! The truffle tremor was good too! A bit strong, but very tasty! Especially paired with the yummy sauces  and the spices in the meats! I loved all the meat! It felt like so much food! But we ate pretty much all of it!

I was planning on this being a starter, but I was so full! We ordered the chicken pot pie as our main entree - and as soon as we got the dish I had to make room for it. A different take on the traditional dish. It was served in a bowl - so it had the appearance of soup - with a square shaped crust placed on top. But with a nice surprise! As you eat the dish - you will find more crust on the bottom and sides of the bowl! The crust is my favorite part, so I was happy! Yummy chicken - thick soups full of veggies, carrots, sherry, & tarragon.

Once we were absolutely full we hung out. Finished our drinks. It was really nice. The setting was perfect! I wouldn't have wanted to spend my last night any other way. I wish we had one of these places in Hawaii. Great for intimate settings - or just to hang out and catch up with the friends. Warm, cozy, clean, nicely decorated. Part of the drop ceiling had beautiful copper tiles with chandeliers hanging from it. There were lots of different types of lighting, 
chandeliers, candles, track lighting: the combo of all of them spot on!

I'll admit the drinks were a bit pricey. But not too bad & the experience I had made it all worth it. 

I definitely recommend it!

excerpts: Also try their flat bread n chicken pot pie!
This is a perfect lil place for great food, wine n catching up with friends!
chicken pot pie.author: Stephanie C.
chicken pot pie.review: Really chill spot... Came here or hh at 5:30... O problem getting a table.. By 7:30 this place was packed! Started with their fried polenta fries... So bomb! Their Mac n cheese has a lil kick to it and it was soooooooo good :)  one of the best around! I'd definitely go back for the Mac ... Also try their flat bread n chicken pot pie! This is a perfect lil place for great food, wine n catching up with friends!

excerpts: A prosciutto flatbread to start, pork sliders and the chicken pot pie to share.
We were expecting "fancy place" portions but were pleasantly surprised to find fantastically midwest portions.
We stupidly filled up on the flatbread, leaving only enough room for 2 sliders for him and 1 slider for myself.
We took the chicken pot pie to go and enjoyed it the next day for lunch.
Absolutely delicious.
Best I've ever had.
Wine, beer, appetizer and two entrees?
chicken pot pie.author: Hazel J.
chicken pot pie.review:
Wandered in here on an impromptu date night. Atmosphere is great-- organ pipes, mounted deer head and a chandelier-- I'll take it. We didn't have a reservation and it was a Friday night. The hostess took our phone number and said she'd text in 30 minutes or so, when our table was ready. The "new beers" chalkboard almost scared us off-- $30 for a beer? But they have a lot of more affordable options among their extensive drinks menu. 

The place is small, very small, so if you're waiting for your table on a busy night be prepared to be in everyone's way the entire time. Or, stand outside like we did. Luckily, our table was ready in 20 minutes.

We squeezed into the corner table with our order already ready. A prosciutto flatbread to start, pork sliders and the chicken pot pie to share. We were expecting "fancy place" portions but were pleasantly surprised to find fantastically midwest portions. We stupidly filled up on the flatbread, leaving only enough room for 2 sliders for him and 1 slider for myself. We took the chicken pot pie to go and enjoyed it the next day for lunch. Absolutely delicious. Best I've ever had. Wine, beer, appetizer and two entrees? Less than $50 and enough for lunch the next day. 

We'll definitely be back!

excerpts: Chicken pot pie had a strange taste, which was the only disappointing part.
chicken pot pie.author: Susie S.
chicken pot pie.review:
What a beautiful place! Though it is tiny and you'll most likely end up in a line, this place charms you like none other.

LOVED the flatbread, mac n cheese, and salads. Chicken pot pie had a strange taste, which was the only disappointing part. Beers were good, and their "wine on tap" selection was good, too.

Go early to beat the rush!

excerpts: Next time I'm trying the chicken pot pie or the flatbread--just need to wait a while
so I don't seem too eager.
chicken pot pie.author: Jacob S.
chicken pot pie.review:
Soo good. There's really not much I can add here that hasn't been said. Fat Angel came recommended to me by several different people. My roommate and I were just waiting for the right time to make our visit. We live in the area and were lucky to come in around 10 and get seated immediately at one of the tables in the corner. Contrary to some of the reviews here, I found everyone who worked there to be really laid back and friendly. One of the servers even stopped everyone during dinner to announce that two veterans of the establishment were recently engaged. The place is small enough that it's intimate but without seeming exclusive, which is probably why it manufactures so many regulars.

And of course, the drinks. Definitely the most extensive collection of craft beers I've ever seen: the menu had about 8 pages of beer and wine, one page of food, and then another page of wine. I wanted to try a beer from the Bruery but wasn't willing to splurge quite yet and opted instead for one from Pretty Things. I also tried a cheese plate and the smoked trout salad based on the reviews here and wasn't disappointed. 

Despite the quantity and deliciousness of the food, this is still a bar at heart, so it makes for an interesting inversion of your typical dinner. Simply by the way the menu is set up, you find yourself ordering drinks with a side of food, and butter with a side of bread. Next time I'm trying the chicken pot pie or the flatbread--just need to wait a while so I don't seem too eager.

excerpts:
Again, great flavors, can't go wrong.
-  Chicken pot pie with roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon.
It was decent.
Not the best pot pie I had ever had but certainly satisfying.
-  Sliders with beef, caramelized onions, bacon, irish cheddar, aioli.
They were OK
chicken pot pie.author: Rachel G.
chicken pot pie.review:
Went once and will definitely go back.
What a great selection of beers!  The food was delicious as well.
Our table of five ordered beers off the beers on tap.  We were very happy with our selections.  My only feedback is, the menu location isn't the most central. From where we were sitting, it wasn't viewable and it wasn't made known that there was a beer on tap option.  Needles to say we were a little concerned at the price of the bottles since not everyone in our group enjoys the same style of beers to warrant sharing a bottle or two.

We also ordered the following food to share:
-  Mac n' Cheese with gruyère, cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano, cayenne.  The spice was perfect and the texture was awesome.  
-  Flatbread with roasted red grape, walnut & prosciutto w/ gorgonzola.   Great combination of flavors!
-  Flatbread with tomato, spicy sausage & arugula w/ parmesan.  Again, great flavors, can't go wrong.
-  Chicken pot pie with roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon.  It was decent.  Not the best pot pie I had ever had but certainly satisfying.
-  Sliders with beef, caramelized onions, bacon, irish cheddar, aioli.  They were OK but I'd defiantly try other menu items for some truly delicious food. 

Overall, I really was happy with my experience.  I would come back for the ambience, the outdoor seating option, the selection of pretty amazing beers and some delicious food.

excerpts:
Chicken pot pie was good comfort food though I prefer the Liberty Cafe version

Enjoyed an Iduna Cru with the meal and look forward to sampling more of the beers.
chicken pot pie.author: Brad B.
chicken pot pie.review:
Cozy pub with amazing selection of beers. Don't let the pub theme scare you away; the food is great! There is limited indoor seating, some bar stools, and a few sidewalk tables. Service was pleasant and efficient.

We had the pesto flatbread. Cracker-thin crust is crisp and chewy - exceptional. Toppings were all excellent.

Chicken pot pie was good comfort food though I prefer the Liberty Cafe version

Enjoyed an Iduna Cru with the meal and look forward to sampling more of the beers.

excerpts:
:--very good
Chicken Pot pie  :---
we were stuffed at this point, but it was excellent.
chicken pot pie.author: Steve B.
chicken pot pie.review:
Nice spot for fun/different beers, I assume the wine selection is good.

Food is great, we tried all sorts of things and split them.  Food is pretty reasonably priced (~10 bucks for 3 sliders), some of the beers are crazy expensive.

Three of us had:

several great beers, including:
Ale Industries Rye'd Piper
Ale Industries Dualing Rye I believe it was called, cask aged
Arrogant Bastard Casked

Tried two appetizers:
Pretzel
Polenta fries  :--very good

Tried three "plates":
Sliders  :-- very tasty, light on the meat but very good.
Pesto Flat bread pizze   :--very good
Chicken Pot pie  :---  we were stuffed at this point, but it was excellent.  Probably second to The Townshead across town for chicken pot pies, but very good.  

Highly recommend the place.  it is small and crowded, takes about 30 minutes to get a seat inside.  has heaters on the outside for sitting or waiting.  We sat outside and started on beers and pretzel and were inside before we finished the pretzel.

Great starter for a night at the Fillmore.

excerpts: The chicken pot pie was massive and pretty good.
All of the food tasted like it had just been prepared, which is a plus.
chicken pot pie.author: Ruchi M.
chicken pot pie.review:
Open late which is great, and they have very friendly and knowledgeable service. We ordered a lot of food. Here's a roundup: The polenta fries are super delicious, definitely get these. We also got the sliders and the mac and cheese. The mac and cheese was good but pretty heavy. The chicken pot pie was massive and pretty good. All of the food tasted like it had just been prepared, which is a plus. Cautionary word - the food is super hot (temperature wise), so be careful otherwise you'll end up with a burned tongue. 

The creme brulee was a bit too eggy for my liking. 3.5 stars, but more of a 3 than a 4.

excerpts: Chicken pot pie is a MUST.
Their apple bread pudding was pretty great too.
Despite the craziness, staff was super accomodating, patient, and knowledgeable.
chicken pot pie.author: Vivian D.
chicken pot pie.review:
Loved (almost) everything about Fat Angel besides the crazy wait. People tend to lounge around due to their awesome selection of wines, beers, cheese & meat platters. I was tempted to, but the long line piling up at the door made me feel bad. 

Chicken pot pie is a MUST. Their apple bread pudding was pretty great too. Despite the craziness, staff was super accomodating, patient, and knowledgeable.

excerpts: Chicken Pot Pie - soul warming.
chicken pot pie.author: Ami Y.
chicken pot pie.review:
Really stoked about this fairly new joint.

Their flat bread is delicious - think of them as very very thin pizza!
Mac & Cheese - always good.
Chicken Pot Pie - soul warming.

So many types of interesting beer on tap? Sold!

excerpts:
Greatly enjoyed the food:
[[ Chicken Pot Pie ]]- a bowl of delicious filling, generous on the shredded chicken; topped with a thick piece of buttery, flakey, crust.
chicken pot pie.author: Jeanne L.
chicken pot pie.review:
The most quaint little gastropub!!  

Drinks:
-- Wines on tap!!!
-- Big selection of beers. Their selection of beers on tap change frequently.  
-- I ordered a Japanese expresso stout on tap!  Who would have thought that Japan would produce stouts?  And that it would be good?  And that a bar here would have it on tap?!
-- LOTS of other stouts available.  (Hey.... I'm really into stouts...)

Greatly enjoyed the food:
[[ Chicken Pot Pie ]]- a bowl of delicious filling, generous on the shredded chicken; topped with a thick piece of buttery, flakey, crust. The ratio of filling and crust was perfect for me
[[ Flatbread with mushroom & white truffle oil ]] - thin and crispy crust - fresh and light, not greasy
[[ Mac n' Cheese ]] - 3 different types of cheese, nice little crusty bits throughout.  

My only complaint would be that it gets way too crowded here, even early on a weekday.  Anybody want to join me for early mid-afternoon drinking?

excerpts: The chicken pot pie... best one I have ever had... EVER.
chicken pot pie.author: Shannon H.
chicken pot pie.review:
I LOVE Fat Angel. 

The flatbreads are amazing ... try the Basil pesto, black olives, roasted tomatoes w/ ricotta & sausage. Yummmm

Even better? The chicken pot pie... best one I have ever had... EVER. 

Huge and delicious salad portions.... great to share. 

A great LITTLE spot... come early or you wil for sure have a wait. But service is always nice and they also have a few seats outside under heat lamps :)

excerpts: The chicken pot pie was uniquely presented.
chicken pot pie.author: Big Baby Jesus C.
chicken pot pie.review: BBJ like.  Huge selection of wines by the glass and bottled beers.  Supposed to have draft beer as well, but I didn't see it nor was it mentioned.  Food was good, prices fair, and good portions.  Friendly service as well.  The chicken pot pie was uniquely presented.

excerpts: My daughter ordered the chicken pot pie and it was also about the tastiest one we've ever tried.
Too bad the hotel didn't have a fridge for the leftovers!
Too rich to eat the whole thing, but would have been great to share.
This place is a gem.
chicken pot pie.author: Sara S.
chicken pot pie.review: Nobody actually likes kale, right?  But they would if they went to Fat Angel and ordered the kale salad with bacon, toasted almonds and vinagrette.  It was a massive bowl of leaves, but because it wasn't drenched in dressing, it was easy to enjoy the lot of it.  Restaurants rarely do vegetables or salads this well or with such a great serving size.  The restaurant was extremely crowded and the service wasn't perfet, but the buzz was delightful and the lighting was perfectly dim.  My daughter ordered the chicken pot pie and it was also about the tastiest one we've ever tried.  Too bad the hotel didn't have a fridge for the leftovers!  Too rich to eat the whole thing, but would have been great to share.  This place is a gem.

excerpts: However, I found the chicken pot pie to be too tarragon-y and would not get that again.
chicken pot pie.author: Lisa K.
chicken pot pie.review: Things started out a little rough on a chilly Friday night when we had to hang out outside for a while, waiting for a table. At first it seemed like a lost cause, as the waitstaff only came by to bus other tables and comment how refreshing it was outside compared to the stuffiness inside. It didn't feel so nice as we were waiting! Another employee came out, took our name, and we were seated without a terribly lengthy wait. However, given how small the place is, I would be reluctant to come back when it's busy. The beer selection is pretty great, and the snacks (which the menu focuses on) are better than the main courses. The fried capers were fantastic and the good-sized dish of them really went a long way, and the serving of the smoked trout salad was quite large and good for sharing. However, I found the chicken pot pie to be too tarragon-y and would not get that again.

excerpts: We mentioned this was our first time at Fat Angel, and he thoughtfully walked us though the menus (Drink Menu - they have 38 bottles of wine available and some Belgian beers and non-alcoholic; Food Menu - includes various meats, cheeses, butters, a few comfort entrees - i.e. mac-n-cheese, chicken pot pie, and
flatbreads -
we had the asparagus + toasted pine nuts - excellent!).
chicken pot pie.author: Cathy K.
chicken pot pie.review:
I've been on a 5-star roll. Thank you Yelpers for guiding me!

I was very impressed with this place. Our server was incredibly patient, knowledgeable and basically went above and beyond. We mentioned this was our first time at Fat Angel, and he thoughtfully walked us though the menus (Drink Menu - they have 38 bottles of wine available and some Belgian beers and non-alcoholic; Food Menu - includes various meats, cheeses, butters, a few comfort entrees - i.e. mac-n-cheese, chicken pot pie, and flatbreads - we had the asparagus + toasted pine nuts - excellent!). Our guy asked us questions on what type of wine we like and made great recommendations on pairing the wine + food. 

This place is cozy, so seating can be tight. Nice candlelit ambiance at night. They have bar seating + table seating. It's a great place to stop in and relax over quality beverage + food + service. Heaven indeed.

excerpts: We then ordered the mac-n-cheese, chicken pot pie and sliders.
The sliders had a good cook on them and were tasty.
The chicken pot pie was yummy, but there wasn't enough crust and therefore, too much filling.
The filling, however, did have a good amount of shredded chicken which I was glad they didn't skimp on.
The mac-n-cheese was okay.
It was served in a hot skillet which made scooping and serving the dish a bit difficult (there was no pan holder or hot glove to help in handling it).
The Mister didn't take to the mac-n-cheese and said he could have made it himself.
Although a fair assessment as far as difficulty of the dish, the Mister rarely cooks...
yeah, go figure!
chicken pot pie.author: Sean A.
chicken pot pie.review:
Word of the Meal: CRAMPED

So the Mister and I, being from Los Angeles, are becoming more conscious about our caloric intake, health and fitness. In addition to regular exercise and healthy eating, we recently cut out processed carbs and unnecessary sugars after 6pm. One day, I just couldn't take it anymore. So, we went to Fat Angel since it was two blocks away. It was packed on a cold, dreary night. Nobody appeared to be hosting or seating people, so I made my way to an empty table and sat down. Not knowing if this was acceptable behavior at Fat Angel, I kind of went with it and went to town with the carbs. LOL.

We had the Pimm's cup and the Champagne cocktail for drinks. Neither of which were to die for. We then ordered the mac-n-cheese, chicken pot pie and sliders. The sliders had a good cook on them and were tasty. The chicken pot pie was yummy, but there wasn't enough crust and therefore, too much filling. The filling, however, did have a good amount of shredded chicken which I was glad they didn't skimp on. The mac-n-cheese was okay. It was served in a hot skillet which made scooping and serving the dish a bit difficult (there was no pan holder or hot glove to help in handling it). The Mister didn't take to the mac-n-cheese and said he could have made it himself. Although a fair assessment as far as difficulty of the dish, the Mister rarely cooks...yeah, go figure! Kettle meet pot. 

The service at Fat Angel was good, but the envirnoment was too cramped for our style. Other table's conversations were bleeding into ours, coercing silence. I did get what I was in search of - a few mouth fulls of starchy carbs, but I do not think I would go back again. A gastropub probably isn't my cup of tea, but I am sure others had a wonderful time at this neighborhood joint.

excerpts: FA's chicken pot pie, $12: one of my least favorite pot pies, sadly.
Sherry, tarragon, carrots & roasted chicken had the consistency of goopey mush.
There was a spice that totally turned me off (cumin?
coriander?
curry?)

The pastry top had many flakey layers. 
-- mac & cheese, $11: loved the corkscrew pasta & the generous crunchy topping.
chicken pot pie.author: Fancypants X.
chicken pot pie.review:
I bet it's every guy's dream to open up a restaurant so he could feed his nuts to dozens of beautiful, drunk women nightly. I'm not ashamed to say...I had Cy's Salty Sweet Chinese Nuts ($4) & loved them. You know I've been sitting on that intro for a few days! *wink* 

Other edibles:
-- fried capers, $3: not what I expected. Crispy, salty but needed a lil' sumfin, sumfin to be eaten with. 
-- charcuterie platter, $23 for 5: not sure what meats he chose but I tried a salami w/ black pepper which had an understated taste, nothing wild or spicy about it
-- maple bacon butter & bread, $4.5: I should have gone for the garlic chili...
-- FA's chicken pot pie, $12: one of my least favorite pot pies, sadly. Sherry, tarragon, carrots & roasted chicken had the consistency of goopey mush. There was a spice that totally turned me off (cumin? coriander? curry?) The pastry top had many flakey layers. 
-- mac & cheese, $11: loved the corkscrew pasta & the generous crunchy topping. Cheese wasn't as sharp as I would've liked & too runny. 

More misses than hits, so three stars for our dinner is more than generous. Service was impeccable; Jason & Cy are amazing hosts & their establishment is beautiful & archetypal San Francisco. I just don't think their food style matches what I'm looking for. Give their extensive alkie list a gander; you're guaranteed to find a very sipable libation.

excerpts: Chicken pot pie:
chicken pot pie.author: Hanui C.
chicken pot pie.review:
I LOVE GASTROPUBS! There's something about darkened and packed restaurants with cozy yet humbling food that really strikes a chord with me... I think Fat Angel might have been my first SF gastropub foray. I wasn't disappointed!

I came here for pre-show dining before seeing Shabazz Palaces at Yoshi's SF. If you're going to Yoshi's for music, I highly recommend you come here instead of dining at Yoshi's; Yoshi's is overpriced and doesn't taste very good. Fat Angel was only a couple blocks away from the venue.

The wait is a little long, and since the establishment is pretty small, I had to wait outside. There is some bar seating, but I opted for the tables instead. The atmosphere was sexy yet understated, and the noise level was at a comfortable middle between awkward low and overbearing high.

What we had:

Maple bacon butter: As a self-proclaimed butter aficionado, I approve this dish! It reminded me of a buttery reincarnation of Frances' Bacon Beignets. When I ran out of bread, I started eating the butter on its own; NO REGRETS.

Mac n' cheese: I'm not a huge fan of mac n cheese, but since my boyfriend seems to be stuck in fourth grade, we gave it a try. It was AMAZING! They used conchiglie rigate (or what I always refer to affectionately as the "shell pasta", and the dish was served on a cast iron mini-casserole. Yum!

Chicken pot pie: Not as great as the mac n cheese, I'm afraid, but memorable in its own right. If you have never broke the shell on a steaming hot pie with the back of your spoon, you are missing out.

I'll be back for you, Fat Angel.

excerpts: Chicken pot pie: 3 stars.
Pretty flavorful and rich.
Bread pudding: 3 stars.
The whipped cream was amazing but the bread pudding itself was not very good.
I couldn't get any sense of bread in the pudding.

Ambience: sophisticated but also laid back
Service: 4 stars.
Very attentive but not too attentive that it's overwhelming!
I will absolutely come back for the Mac & cheese..
chicken pot pie.author: Monica A.
chicken pot pie.review:
Mac & cheese: 4 stars. I've had a lot of Mac & cheese and this by far was in the top 5.
Basil marinara & arugula w/ ricotta flatbread: 2 stars. Eh, not much flavor and wasn't impressed with the flatbread.
Chicken pot pie: 3 stars. Pretty flavorful and rich.
Bread pudding: 3 stars.  The whipped cream was amazing but the bread pudding itself was not very good. I couldn't get any sense of bread in the pudding.
Ambience: sophisticated but also laid back
Service: 4 stars. Very attentive but not too attentive that it's overwhelming!
I will absolutely come back for the Mac & cheese..

excerpts: The chicken pot pie was quite good, but the salad was overly dressed and soggy since it probably had been sitting on the counter for a long time.
The creme brulee was average.
After this experience, the poor management and avg.
food, it is safe to say we will not be recommending this restaurant to anyone or coming anymore.
chicken pot pie.author: Vanessa C.
chicken pot pie.review:
I usually don't write reviews, however our experience at this restaurant was quite horrible to the point where I felt there was a need to share.

This was our second visit to Fat Angel. We came here on around 10:30 and were seated after a couple of mins since we were also getting dinner. The place looked quite unorganized, the bartender was also the server and there were only another female server for a crowded place. 

We sat down and ordered our drinks. The drinks came momentarily, after we told them we were ready to order. He got our order in, there were a couple of other tables behind us who ordered later. We waited for almost 20mins for our cold cut plate. I don't know how long it takes to slice meat. But as I looked up, the tables who ordered way later already received their cold cut plates and salads! When my bf tried to speak to the waiters, they ignored him. I managed to catch the attention of the female waitress and explained to her that everyone else who ordered after us had received their food, even the hot plates yet we only had drinks. 

After 5-10 mins, our food began to come. The male server who was also the bartender made no attempt to explain or apologize for the significant delay, and acted as if nothing had happened. When we ordered dessert, they made no attempt to clear our table full of plates, instead piled the dessert plate on our stacked table. We had to essentially gather our own plates to have them being taken away. 

As for the food, the cold cut platter was standard. The chicken pot pie was quite good, but the salad was overly dressed and soggy since it probably had been sitting on the counter for a long time. The creme brulee was average. After this experience, the poor management and avg. food, it is safe to say we will not be recommending this restaurant to anyone or coming anymore.

excerpts: We both had flat breads (I had duck sausage, Luann had a lemon butter) and though I ordered a mac' n cheese they delivered a chicken pot pie my wife ordered the sliders.
The food was all comp'd because they got the order wrong, but admittedly it was delicious.
If not for the service, I'd probably give them 4 stars.
They have a good idea, they just need to figure out execution part.
chicken pot pie.author: Ed H.
chicken pot pie.review:
Let me start by saying that Fat Angel has great food, beer, and a very friendly staff--if you ever have a chance to meet them.  They seem to be overwhelmed by the popularity of their place and are understaffed to deal with the scads of people trying to patronize the place.  Good luck trying to find a seat and getting served.

Oh yeah, the beer selection is exceptional, though we could only get served one drink in the time given.  We both had flat breads (I had duck sausage, Luann had a lemon butter) and though I ordered a mac' n cheese they delivered a chicken pot pie my wife ordered the sliders.  The food was all comp'd because they got the order wrong, but admittedly it was delicious.  If not for the service, I'd probably give them 4 stars.  They have a good idea, they just need to figure out execution part.

excerpts: I had the chicken pot pie with tarragon and a glass of pinot grigio (full size!), and my friend had the mac and cheese with a glass of cab, and throughout dinner the two of us could not decide whose food was more amazing, it was that freaking delicious!
Best of all, the wine and the food were not the normal crazy expensive San Francisco prices.
Looks like I found my new favorite place to eat in San Fran.
Can't wait to try the cheese plates next time.
chicken pot pie.author: Sarah W.
chicken pot pie.review:
Is it possible to be in love with a restaurant? I don't even know where to begin, my experience was so good. The ambiance of the place, small, and inviting with candles on each table, reminded me of a tavern I would go to in New England. Our server was friendly without being over bearing, and gave us plenty of time to decide what to order.
I had the chicken pot pie with tarragon and a glass of pinot grigio (full size!), and my friend had the mac and cheese with a glass of cab, and throughout dinner the two of us could not decide whose food was more amazing, it was that freaking delicious! 
Best of all, the wine and the food were not the normal crazy expensive San Francisco prices. 
Looks like I found my new favorite place to eat in San Fran. Can't wait to try the cheese plates next time.

excerpts: I also got to try the homemade chicken pot pie and the mushroom flat bread.
Needless to say, my tastebuds were pleased!
I'm not a big fan of wine so the owner helped me pair my meal with a glass.
They are down-to-earth, friendly and patient people.
Did I mention very knowledgeable about their food and wines?

Here is my rating broken down:
1st star- excellent customer service
2nd

star- place is kept clean and very nicely decorated
3rd star- seated promptly & wait time for food was fast
4th star-
GREAT FOOD!!
5th
star- unique.
easy parking.
definitely coming back!
chicken pot pie.author: Teresa C.
chicken pot pie.review:
I have heard about this place from friends so I decided to check it out. I had the slider mini burgers. Hands down the best sliders I've ever tasted. I suggest if you go, this is a must-try item. I also got to try the homemade chicken pot pie and the mushroom flat bread. Needless to say, my tastebuds were pleased!
I'm not a big fan of wine so the owner helped me pair my meal with a glass. They are down-to-earth, friendly and patient people. Did I mention very knowledgeable about their food and wines?
Here is my rating broken down:
1st star- excellent customer service
2nd star- place is kept clean and very nicely decorated
3rd star- seated promptly & wait time for food was fast
4th star- GREAT FOOD!!
5th star- unique. easy parking. definitely coming back!

excerpts: My BF ordered the chicken pot pie which was SO COMFORTING AND DELICIOUS.
even to a vegetarian.
I had the apple walnut gorgonzola endive salad.
chicken pot pie.author: Tiffany W.
chicken pot pie.review:
Share all the food!

Gastropub.  What does that actually mean?  Who came up with that term? I'll have to do some research because... they are awesome.  Cheap pub fare with a gourmet spin.  Extra special brews and wines.

Fat Angel is such a gem in this Alamo-Western Addition neighborhood.  It's a pretty small space, not good for large parties.  There's a bar area and a heated outdoor patio.
