homemade BUTTERS. small plates to share-- cheeses, meats, olives and nuts. these are clearly of the highest quality-- ask for extra bread if you get the butters!  They also have 3 or 4 salads (which could easily serve 3, not exaggerating) and a few mains.  My BF ordered the chicken pot pie which was SO COMFORTING AND DELICIOUS. even to a vegetarian.  I had the apple walnut gorgonzola endive salad. Fresh. 

Wines on tap. Good wines on tap.  A beer list 5 pages long.  For the beer enthusiast.

Came here to do some celebrating late monday night and they were full.  This place gets packed on the weekends.  Friendly staff, pitchers of water on the table.

excerpts: The chicken pot pie is delicious and the way they do it is unique and different in a refreshing way.
The mac and cheese is really cheesy, but would be better if it were a lot less peppery.
Service felt a little slow, but all in all, this place is satisfactory.
chicken pot pie.author: Christine W.
chicken pot pie.review: So this place is really crowded and the tables are teeeeeeny, so getting a table for more than two people is a pain.  The salami and spread with bread are delicious and just melts in your mouth.  The chicken pot pie is delicious and the way they do it is unique and different in a refreshing way.  The mac and cheese is really cheesy, but would be better if it were a lot less peppery.  Service felt a little slow, but all in all, this place is satisfactory.

excerpts: The chicken pot pie was good, "esp because of the tarragon
" (quipped my very picky chicken-pot-pie-eating friend).
My wine was like a Pinot Grigio and excellent, they have "draft wines".
Great little neighborhood restaurant.
chicken pot pie.author: Terry K.
chicken pot pie.review: The kale salad is amazing, and you don't need to add chicken (it's a little dry).  It was massive and enough for two people.  I wouldn't mind going here every day and sharing that kale salad with someone.  The chicken pot pie was good, "esp because of the tarragon" (quipped my very picky chicken-pot-pie-eating friend).  My wine was like a Pinot Grigio and excellent, they have "draft wines".  Great little neighborhood restaurant.

excerpts: I felt so lucky to have ordered chicken pot pie, it was incredible delicious!!!
The crispy pie was filled with tender chicken, and creamy potato soup, tasted really good!
chicken pot pie.author: Tina Z.
chicken pot pie.review:
The food I had in Fat Angel was pretty good! I felt so lucky to have ordered chicken pot pie, it was incredible delicious!!! The crispy pie was filled with tender chicken, and creamy potato soup, tasted really good! The price came out reasonable too. 

The ambiance was good to people hanging at the bar as a group, but maybe a little bit loud to sit at the tables. But generally for the service we got, I'd give Fat Angel 5 stars!

excerpts: We had the chicken pot pie, mac and cheese, and the mushroom flatbread.
Each were wonderful in their own way, but the chicken pot pie is in a category of greatness by itself.
Throughout the meal I just kept exclaiming "this is the best chicken pot pie I've ever had".
chicken pot pie.author: Jenny L.
chicken pot pie.review:
06.04.11

Cyrick = friendly, animated, and overall awesome.  Thanks for serving me the sauv blanc on tap even though I had my "fake" ID ;)

We had the chicken pot pie, mac and cheese, and the mushroom flatbread.  Each were wonderful in their own way, but the chicken pot pie is in a category of greatness by itself.  Throughout the meal I just kept exclaiming "this is the best chicken pot pie I've ever had".  No joke.

And wine on tap...what a concept.

I'm SO coming back.

Total damage for three: $63

excerpts:
- Mac and Cheese
- Chicken Pot Pie
- Happy boyfriend because there are so many good beers, which means that I get to go here more often and drink wine!
(Seriously, I'm not sure why more places in the city don't cater to couples like us, where one is a beer enthusiast and the other a wine-o)
chicken pot pie.author: Erin B.
chicken pot pie.review:
This place has become my favorite spot in the city for wine and hanging out.  We come here a lot before shows at the Fillmore or seeing a movie at Kabuki.  The staff is incredibly nice, and even though the place is always packed they sure do hustle to try and make things quick.  I don't know if I want to tell anyone the trick to getting a table, but just... go early.  Around 6:30, the place fills up and people stay for hours so you probably won't get a table unless you're willing to stand around for a long time.  

My favorites:
- Sauv. Blanc on draft - yummy and comes in at a mere $5.50 during happy hour!
- Mac and Cheese
- Chicken Pot Pie
- Happy boyfriend because there are so many good beers, which means that I get to go here more often and drink wine! (Seriously, I'm not sure why more places in the city don't cater to couples like us, where one is a beer enthusiast and the other a wine-o)

excerpts: Flatbread and chicken pot pie were both awesome, as was the service.
chicken pot pie.author: Lauren K.
chicken pot pie.review: This was a little taste of Brooklyn in San Francisco, which is just what we were looking for! Awesome beer list, great bar snacks, and a fun atmosphere. Tight quarters, but again it felt like New York so we were totally comfortable. Will definitely go back! Flatbread and chicken pot pie were both awesome, as was the service.

excerpts: Chicken Pot pie was very close to being a hit
but there was too much salt on the top puff pastry and WAY TOO MUCH Taragon!!
Woah heavy hand there.
There was a good amount of chicken in the pie, a good thing.
We shared 4 dishes between 3 of us and we all came out hungry.
chicken pot pie.author: Karen T.
chicken pot pie.review: Ok I listened to you Yelp users and was a bit dissapointed. This place was just ok, it's hit or miss. This is my sober month so I ordered a fresh squeeze lemonade which was very yummy. Let me start with all the yummys: Sliders, Meat Platter. I'll pass food- Mushroom and Truffle Flatbread, tasted like store bought cracker not flatbread. Chicken Pot pie was very close to being a hit but there was too much salt on the top puff pastry and WAY TOO MUCH Taragon!! Woah heavy hand there. There was a good amount of chicken in the pie, a good thing. We shared 4 dishes between 3 of us and we all came out hungry.

excerpts: Food was AWESOME, get the chicken pot pie.
It'll fill you up and tastes amazing!
Aside from that, all their little meat and cheese dishes are fabulously paired with jams and mustard to provide an incredible tasting meal.
Ask the waiter for his/her opinion, and just trust them if you can't figure out what you want.
Staff is super friendly, one of those small businesses where every customer is precious to them, and it shows.
chicken pot pie.author: Edmond H.
chicken pot pie.review:
Awesome little hole in the wall, just off the main roads of San Francisco. Came here with a friend to try it out, was amazing, decided to come back with the girlfriend. Ended up coming here on a Friday night around 7:30 and pleasantly surprised that I didn't have to wait more than 15 minutes to get seated. Would've expected some insane wait time,  but the staff was super friendly and we got a drink while we waited.

Positives: Food was AWESOME, get the chicken pot pie. It'll fill you up and tastes amazing! Aside from that, all their little meat and cheese dishes are fabulously paired with jams and mustard to provide an incredible tasting meal. Ask the waiter for his/her opinion, and just trust them if you can't figure out what you want. Staff is super friendly, one of those small businesses where every customer is precious to them, and it shows. Atmosphere is romantic, great for a date.

Con: It's a bit small. There's something like space for 20-25 people, and the place can get a little cramped. But really... being a small cozy romantic restaurant can be a nice change of pace. Not going to take away a star just because their business is so good that it's a little hard to move around. Just know that it's going to be a little cramped if you go on a busy night.

excerpts: We also ordered the grape, walnut and gorgonzola flatbread, the sliders, the chicken pot pie, and drinks.
I'd have to say, I was most impressed with the flatbread (I usually like lots of meat on my pizza, I mean, flatbread).
It was excellent.
The pot pie and the sliders were pretty darn good, too.
As for drinks, I got a nice MIkkeller stout, which was, as my server informed me, fruitier than stouts tend to be.
chicken pot pie.author: B Y.
chicken pot pie.review:
So I've been here twice (three attempts). It was delicious. I was in a party of four, got a table after a 15-20 minute wait at 7 on a cloudy Saturday night. We ordered one meat, one cheese, and one butter (I kind of wish they had a set of one meat\cheese\butter plate, since we wanted to try one in each category). However, our server made some excellent recommendations for what to order. We also ordered the grape, walnut and gorgonzola flatbread, the sliders, the chicken pot pie, and drinks. I'd have to say, I was most impressed with the flatbread (I usually like lots of meat on my pizza, I mean, flatbread). It was excellent. The pot pie and the sliders were pretty darn good, too. It may sound weird, but I really liked the buns on the sliders. 

As for drinks, I got a nice MIkkeller stout, which was, as my server informed me, fruitier than stouts tend to be. Delicious, nonetheless.

I don't know if I came in on a good night, or if some of the reviewers came in on a bad night, but I thought the service was good. My party was pretty clueless as to order, and the server walked us through a lot\most of the menu. When they got busier, he couldn't stand around and wait for us to make up our minds, but that's understandable.

excerpts: The Chicken Pot Pie and the Apple Bread Pudding is to die for.
chicken pot pie.author: Chris C.
chicken pot pie.review:
I am going to really hate myself to give away my local hang out but I have to review it because they are so AWESOME.   I been only bringing my close friends here because I am afraid that this place will soon be running over with people not from the neighborhood.  But I want this place to last so I am reviewing it. 

They have an excellent list of great wines, many of them are wines that you will probably never heard of and giving your taste buds a good tingle.  The food there albeit very limited is solid and accommodate with the wines that you might order.  The Chicken Pot Pie and the Apple Bread Pudding is to die for.

The owners of Fat Angel (the one I know better is Cyrick)  will take good care of you and understand what you will like to drink and they will remember you.  I didn't go there for two weeks and the owner who I order from only once remember me,  I was thoroughly impressed.  Now this place has now become my hangout place for wine.  

So if you are in the Fillmore area for date or a quick drink. This is the place to go!

excerpts: love the chicken pot pie and the mac n cheese.
Will be back very very soon to eat it all AGAIN!
chicken pot pie.author: Mary M.
chicken pot pie.review:
After walking 1.5 miles we made it!! 

love the chicken pot pie and the mac n cheese. Will be back very very soon to eat it all AGAIN!

excerpts: I had a bite of the chicken pot pie and I think it's one of these best I've ever had (granted, I don't eat much chicken pot pie).
I'm usually not a big fan of bread pudding but the apple bread pudding here was really good- hot, fresh out of the oven,
served with a side of whipped cream.
chicken pot pie.author: Lisa C.
chicken pot pie.review:
The intimidate place was quite packed when we dropped in after visiting the Fillmore. The few tables were occupied but we were able to snag spots at the bar. 

Beers and wines on tap, and nibbles weren't too bad.  The cheese and meat platter held us over. I had a bite of the chicken pot pie and I think it's one of these best I've ever had (granted, I don't eat much chicken pot pie).  I'm usually not a big fan of bread pudding but the apple bread pudding here was really good- hot, fresh out of the oven, served with a side of whipped cream.  Only complaint is I wish they served it with a scoop of vanilla ice cream instead of the whipped cream.  

Something like they reuse their wine bottles and they are made with a different material in order to be more 'green'. I'm a fan of the low-pressure atmosphere here so I definitely can see myself coming back.

excerpts: Chicken pot pie is a must - taste very homemade and hearty.
Sliders are a little light on the meat but great aioli.
The flatbreads are nicely done as well.
Prices are not cheap but you do get pretty decent quality bar food.
They seem to have a good collection of wine and beer.
Ambience is great - it is both casual yet moderately intimate.
chicken pot pie.author: Ed L.
chicken pot pie.review: For a drinking establishment, this place serves up some killer food. Chicken pot pie is a must - taste very homemade and hearty. Sliders are a little light on the meat but great aioli. The flatbreads are nicely done as well. Prices are not cheap but you do get pretty decent quality bar food. They seem to have a good collection of wine and beer. Ambience is great - it is both casual yet moderately intimate.

excerpts: The chicken pot pie and mac
'n' cheese are consistently good.
chicken pot pie.author: Liz C.
chicken pot pie.review:
Ah...Fat Angel. My "Cheers". Where do I start about this wonderfully inviting, romantic, charming bistro/pub in the Fillmore District? 

Let's start off with the proprietors. Jason and Cyrick are super heroes who somehow remain jolly and attentive (with a super-human knowledge of good food and wine) late into the evening (and dealing with tipsy Asian chicks like me). Cyrick is one of the happiest people around -- and is really knowledgeable about good food/drink pairings on the menu.  Plus - he  really knows cured meats. 

The food -- the smoked trout salad with fennel and fried capers will turn any raging carnivore into a whipped vegetarian. It is THAT good. The sliders with the garlic aioli and spicy pickles are perfect bits of heaven. The chicken pot pie and mac 'n' cheese are consistently good. The tartufo salami is really tasty.

The wine -- Jason is like Pandora, but for wine. You tell him which wines you like, and he introduces you to new wines that he thinks you might like. He is usually right. 

The ambiance -- Fat Angel is soft, romantic and brooding. Girls - the lighting will make you look your most beautiful.  The music is never too intrusive, and it is easy to have a conversation here. 

It's a small place -- so don't go too often. You might take one of my tables.

excerpts: Had the Chicken pot pie, Sliders, and some charcuterie washed down with glasses of Chenin Blanc (Vouvray) and Grenache.
The owners are always walking around and checking in with you and for such a small space it's pretty lively.
In fact it was downright loud on a Thurs night with drinkers conversing all over the bar and dining area.
Dig all the old artifacts they dug out of a Napa church to decorate the space.
Obviously one must regard the cherub, aka Fat Angel that adorns the area above the entrance.
chicken pot pie.author: Kim N.
chicken pot pie.review: As the Fillmore area keeps going in flux, it's nice to see nice new establishments run by people who really love what they're doing. Came in here for a quick dinner before catching a show down the street. Had the Chicken pot pie, Sliders, and some charcuterie washed down with glasses of Chenin Blanc (Vouvray) and Grenache. The owners are always walking around and checking in with you and for such a small space it's pretty lively. In fact it was downright loud on a Thurs night with drinkers conversing all over the bar and dining area. Dig all the old artifacts they dug out of a Napa church to decorate the space. Obviously one must regard the cherub, aka Fat Angel that adorns the area above the entrance.

excerpts: The best chicken pot pie ever - grandma's recipe won me over !
chicken pot pie.author: Kathy N.
chicken pot pie.review:
The best chicken pot pie ever - grandma's recipe won me over !

Terrific service, thanks - you are doing a great job with this place, keep up the hard work - looks like it is winning people over 1

excerpts: We got the Cesar Salad, Mac and Cheese, chicken pot pie and drinks.
I tried the draft white, BF had the Casey Jones draft beer.
The drinks were marvelous the food UH-mazing.
chicken pot pie.author: M B.
chicken pot pie.review:
To be honest I was pretty sure these reviews were padded because the owners are so sweet. One of them looks like Wesley from "The Princess Bride" (isn't that worth an extra star by itself?). The place is also oozing with heart. You can tell this place is someones dream come reality.   

My boyfriend and I have been keeping our eye on the place for a couple of months, since we live close to it and frequently walk by. Last night (Thursday) we decided to give it a go. 

I am proud to say I am a total food and wine snob and was very impressed. We got the Cesar Salad, Mac and Cheese, chicken pot pie and drinks. I tried the draft white, BF had the Casey Jones draft beer. The drinks were marvelous the food UH-mazing. 

So much so, in fact, that at 5:30 (AM!!) this morning my boyfriend and I were once again discussing the merits of Fat Angel! In particular, the Pot Pie; me, being an borderline alchie, was thinking about the draft wine, while nodding that the pot pie was most excellent. 

Fat Angel congratulations you deserve your 5 stars!

excerpts: FA's Chicken Pot Pie, oh snap.
Mac-Daddy's Mac & Cheese, sinful!
The Apple bread pudding w/ Chantilly cream, so fantastic that I'm salivating just thinking about it.
chicken pot pie.author: Melody M.
chicken pot pie.review:
I love Fat Angel. I cannot say enough kind things about this place. Such a charming & inviting place. I loved that the owner remembered us from our visit a year prior. A cool guy. You can tell he has a passion for wine, beer & good eats.

The wine & beer menu is attractive and everything on the food menu that we have tried has been a winner. This includes: The 5 butter platter (Who wants to eat butter by the spoonful? Not me, that is not until I sampled the Mmm, Butter! platter. Holy crap the cinnamon chocolate butter was insanely delicious. I have since internet stalked Mmm, Butter! so I can buy her butter by the tubs). The 5 cheese platter, awesome. The Sliders, simple yet really flavorful. Endive salad, decent & yummy. FA's Chicken Pot Pie, oh snap. Mac-Daddy's Mac & Cheese, sinful! The Apple bread pudding w/ Chantilly cream, so fantastic that I'm salivating just thinking about it. And lastly, the Blueberry Cobbler, YUUUM! 

It's a good thing I live 40 miles away from this place. Otherwise I would be a frequent visitor and I'd put on a bunch of weight.

excerpts: My friend and I had the Mac and cheese and chicken pot pie.
Both to die for.
Also, I usually don't like beer, but I loved the beer with pear flavors (forgot its name)- very light and refreshing!
chicken pot pie.author: Felicia F.
chicken pot pie.review: Can't wait to go back! I loved the atmosphere and loved the food. My friend and I had the Mac and cheese and chicken pot pie. Both to die for. Also, I usually don't like beer, but I loved the beer with pear flavors (forgot its name)- very light and refreshing!

excerpts: Beyond delicious chicken pot pie, huge amazing salad perfectly dressed, incredible wine selection and unique atmosphere.
All relatively affordable!
The service was ok, a little slow...but my friend and I were in no rush
so it didn't matter.
Somehow we snagged a table as soon as we walked in the door on a Friday night around 7pm.
Good stuff, I will be back.
chicken pot pie.author: D P.
chicken pot pie.review: Beyond delicious chicken pot pie, huge amazing salad perfectly dressed, incredible wine selection and unique atmosphere. All relatively affordable! The service was ok, a little slow...but my friend and I were in no rush so it didn't matter. Somehow we snagged a table as soon as we walked in the door on a Friday night around 7pm. Good stuff, I will be back.

excerpts: Also great is the chicken pot pie.
chicken pot pie.author: Brittany S.
chicken pot pie.review:
The boyfriend and I started coming here because it's within walking distance from his apartment and he had heard great things about it...and luckily he heard right. And now we just keep going back!

Its pretty small but the atmosphere is cozy not uncomfortable. The servers aren't over the top friendly but they get the job done and are always cordial. We've tried the butter and several different cheeses, all delicious. My go to meal is the smoked trout salad - it's fantastic. Also great is the chicken pot pie. We didn't love the flatbread we tried, but it wasn't bad by any means.

They also have wine on tap - we only drink the various red mixes but they are always great and reasonably priced. They have a very extensive and unique beer list, as well. However, it annoys me they serve beer in Delirium Tremens glasses but don't actually serve Delerium Tremens.

excerpts: We used to come here about once a week for a kale salad, chicken pot pie, and an IPA I had never heard of.
chicken pot pie.author: Michael C.
chicken pot pie.review: If only they weren't so busy. We used to come here about once a week for a kale salad, chicken pot pie, and an IPA I had never heard of.

excerpts:
My favorites on the food menu:
Chicken pot pie
Chicken caesar salad (comes with fried capers which are delicious and shredded roasted chicken)
Sliders (best you'll ever have, trust me)
chicken pot pie.author: Dave Y.
chicken pot pie.review:
The only reason why I would give this place anything less than 5 stars is because I selfishly want to keep this place to myself. It's an incredible addition to the city, and particularly the Fillmore. They have an impressive selection of wine and even more impressive selection of craft beers from around the world. I always ask either Cy or Jen for a recommendation and it's always spot on. Btw, Cy and Jen are awesome. Good people and great service. The food menu is short but you won't be disappointed with any dish you order. That's guaransheed for all my Rasheed Wallace fans out there. The atmosphere is beautiful. The owners purchased architectural components that previously belonged to a church - notice the organ above the bar, wooden benches along the walls, and golden "fat angel" hanging outside the front. If you're looking for a venue for a date, or low key dinner before going out, or a drink after work, look no further. Rumor has it the owners are looking to open a larger restaurant a half block around the corner on Fillmore. Hope it comes through, they're turning the Fillmore into one of the most desired neighborhoods to live in SF

My favorites on the food menu:
Chicken pot pie
Chicken caesar salad (comes with fried capers which are delicious and shredded roasted chicken)
Sliders (best you'll ever have, trust me)

excerpts: + Chicken pot pie.
This dish...is...
so...good...
It's so good...
Sooo goooood.

*drool* 
+ Cheese plate was a little pricey, but really wonderful and worth it.
+ GREAT service.
The bartenders are patient, funny, and genuinely sweet.
The waiters talked us through the menu, answered our questions, and helped us decide without trying to upsell us.
Totally unpretentious and no one rolled their eyes or acted like it was our privilege to be there
chicken pot pie.author: Katie M.
chicken pot pie.review:
Wow, this place was great! I've been there twice; once for dinner and another time just for drinks. 

+ wine on draft? count me in
+ GREAT beer selection. One of the best I've found in the city.
+ Smoked trout salad was incredible.
+ Chicken pot pie. This dish...is...so...good...It's so good...Sooo goooood. *drool* 
+ Cheese plate was a little pricey, but really wonderful and worth it.
+ GREAT service. The bartenders are patient, funny, and genuinely sweet. The waiters talked us through the menu, answered our questions, and helped us decide without trying to upsell us. Totally unpretentious and no one rolled their eyes or acted like it was our privilege to be there (you know what I mean, San Francisco)

- Fills up fast, so get there early. We arrived right as it opened so we had great service, but it was packed within 30 minutes.
-The flatbread we ordered was okay. It wasn't bad, but I had to think of a second thing to go on the "negatives" list...sorry flatbread, you really weren't bad at all. 


Yay, Fat Angel!!!

excerpts: So i'm definitely coming back to try the chicken pot pie!!!
chicken pot pie.author: Emily T.
chicken pot pie.review:
spent so much money  here!!! but well worth it :)

wine list is extensive and DELICIOUS!

food is even more amazing... 
Trout salad was so flavorful and refreshing at the same time, definitely a must. 
Macraroni and cheese was a bit rich for my taste but damn good still...
Rabbit pate was served with gourmet mustard and super delicious. 
The truffle oil with mushroom flat bread was really to die for. It reminded me of the nopa flatbread :)

Service was excellent. The bartender hates iphone so i loved him a lot :) So i'm definitely coming back to try the chicken pot pie!!!

excerpts: Do try the Mac & Cheese, and Chicken Pot Pie (not your typical pot pie)!
I did not like the duck salami, my friends did
, it tasted too greasy and "ducky" for me.
chicken pot pie.author: Juliee D.
chicken pot pie.review: Very decent food, cozy atmosphere, small & quaint place! Do try the Mac & Cheese, and Chicken Pot Pie (not your typical pot pie)! I did not like the duck salami, my friends did, it tasted too greasy and "ducky" for me.

excerpts: 3 of us shared a wild mushroom and white truffle oil flatbread, the sliders, the macncheese and the chicken pot pie.
Everything was really solid, although a bit on the heavy side - but hey - it's really good comfort food.
in order, i liked the chicken pot pie the most, then
flatbread next

, then the macncheese and then the sliders
would definitely go back!
chicken pot pie.author: Eleanor C.
chicken pot pie.review:
my friend suggested to have dinner here after reading the great reviews on yelp and i'm so glad that we chose to come here!
found a parking spot in front of yoshis, a block away - score!
a group just left and we got a small table for 3 right away score! (the place is small and we came on a monday evening around 7pm and it was pretty packed so i would imagine on other nights there would be a wait!)
we sat down at 6:56pm and they let us take advantage of the happy hour (till 7pm, $2 off flatbreads and $1 off beers and wines on tap) - score!
i got a pinot noir on tap - really good
my friend got an Inception Triple Voodoo - really good Belgian ale.
3 of us shared a wild mushroom and white truffle oil flatbread, the sliders, the macncheese and the chicken pot pie. Everything was really solid, although a bit on the heavy side - but hey - it's really good comfort food.
in order, i liked the chicken pot pie the most, then flatbread next, then the macncheese and then the sliders
would definitely go back!

excerpts: you will die for the sauce), and chicken pot pie.
They also offer items for dessert but the 2 times I dined
I was way to stuffed to get to that part of the meal.
I will definitely have to leave room next time.
Great place for a dinner date or small party.
Definitely a place I will have to come and visit when in town.
Totally in love with you golden chubby lil winged angel.
Till we meet again.
chicken pot pie.author: Arlene C.
chicken pot pie.review: I have found a new love here in SF. I loved it so much that I returned to dine here 2 nights in a row. You must be patient to come here. The wait can be long, approximately 1 hour each time I came, but definitely worth it. Grab a drink at the bar while you wait and make sure to bring people that will make good conversation or you can always stand at a table giving dirty looks to hurry up and get going. Anyway back to Fat Angel, great selection of beers and amazing bites. You would definitely have to come here a few times to try all the items on the menu. The menu itself is quite small but you definitely want to try it ALL. For appetizers they offer their flavored butters (yum), cheese and meats (yum yum). They offer salads, flat breads, mac n cheese, sliders ( a must try!!! you will die for the sauce), and chicken pot pie. They also offer items for dessert but the 2 times I dined I was way to stuffed to get to that part of the meal. I will definitely have to leave room next time. Great place for a dinner date or small party. Definitely a place I will have to come and visit when in town. Totally in love with you golden chubby lil winged angel. Till we meet again.

excerpts: I make better chicken pot pie & adult mac&cheese.
chicken pot pie.author: Karen P.
chicken pot pie.review: service was awesome; however, the food is OVERhyped!  I make better chicken pot pie & adult mac&cheese.

excerpts: Must try:  the sliders (pickles are homemade), bread pudding, chicken pot pie.
chicken pot pie.author: Sandra P.
chicken pot pie.review: Love this place and I'm so glad it's here! A neighborhood gem. Must try:  the sliders (pickles are homemade), bread pudding, chicken pot pie.

excerpts: Be sure to try the chicken pot pie and the mac and cheese.
The best I ever had!
chicken pot pie.author: Lon T.
chicken pot pie.review: Excellent food and awesome service.  My friends and I stopped by Fat Angel after seeing a movie at Kabuki Cinemas.  We will definitely be back for more delicious food and wine.  Be sure to try the chicken pot pie and the mac and cheese.  The best I ever had!

excerpts: On a return visit with a friend, we sat at the bar had very good wine from the tap and shared FA's chicken pot pie and a frisée salad.
The salad could easily have fed 4.
The pot pie portion was huge, too, but both of us agreed that it was too heavy.
It's more in the style of a shepherd's pie--too thick and potatoey.
I much prefer a creamier pie that one can spike with a shot of sherry.
chicken pot pie.author: Alex M.
chicken pot pie.review:
This heavenly boîte tucked away in the Fillmore Center is a recent discovery, having been recommended by a foodie friend of mine who loves FA's mac & cheese.  Yummy!  For me, what stands out about FA's mac & cheese is that it's made with Gruyère, topped with toasted bread crumbs and comes out sizzling in a cast iron casserole.  The portion is large enough for two, so one can try other things on their limited menu.  I was in a group of 4 in my first visit and along with the mac & cheese, we had their sliders, flat bread and a nice bottle of reasonably priced red wine.  All of us had a wonderful time!  On a return visit with a friend, we sat at the bar had very good wine from the tap and shared FA's chicken pot pie and a frisée salad.  The salad could easily have fed 4.  The pot pie portion was huge, too, but both of us agreed that it was too heavy.  It's more in the style of a shepherd's pie--too thick and potatoey.  I much prefer a creamier pie that one can spike with a shot of sherry.  The Big Four still ranks as my personal favorite for pot pie.

The Fat Angel, having just celebrated their first anniversary, attracts an attractive, young, hip crowd probably more into FA's very good beer list than their wines.  I find the decor very attactive--done up with the fixtures of an old church.  Organ pipes line the wall behind the bar and pews serve as banquettes.  Sit long enough at the bar with a few glasses of wine and one can easily think of Christine Daaé being serenaded by the Phantom!

excerpts: He had chicken pot pie and sliders, he loved the chicken pot pie.
I had the mac and cheese which was extremely SPICY!
When telling the waitress she simply said that the kitchen staff is from Mexico and that's why it's spicy.... ???????
Never heard such a thing B4.
Wines were good but service was non-existent.
After seating at a table for 15 minutes we had to get up to order at the bar.
When they brought us the food there was no napkins, silverware or water until we got a glimpse of the busboy and asked him for those items.
Even to ask for another wine and the bill we had to go to the bar, but a group of girls next to us had a waiter coming to them all the time...
Would not recommend.
chicken pot pie.author: Amanda T.
chicken pot pie.review: A 3 star is the average between my husband's and my review. He had chicken pot pie and sliders, he loved the chicken pot pie. I had the mac and cheese which was extremely SPICY! When telling the waitress she simply said that the kitchen staff is from Mexico and that's why it's spicy.... ??????? Never heard such a thing B4. Wines were good but service was non-existent. After seating at a table for 15 minutes we had to get up to order at the bar. When they brought us the food there was no napkins, silverware or water until we got a glimpse of the busboy and asked him for those items. Even to ask for another wine and the bill we had to go to the bar, but a group of girls next to us had a waiter coming to them all the time... Would not recommend.

excerpts: Strangers were recommending the chicken pot pie, but I'm a vegetarian, so I'm forwarding the recommendation on to you.
chicken pot pie.author: Jenny K.
chicken pot pie.review: Friendly staff. Bartender explained the beers on tap..good beer but a bit expensive for me. Strangers were recommending the chicken pot pie, but I'm a vegetarian, so I'm forwarding the recommendation on to you.

excerpts: We ordered the boar salami, truffle oil mushroom flatbread, a bleu cheese, maple bacon butter, lemon caper butter, bacon macaroni and cheese, sliders and chicken pot pie.
This was more than enough food for four very hungry people!
All of the food was very good with the only disappointment being the chicken pot pie.
The pot pie was only luke warm and very bland.
Next time I would opt for a salad because they were huge and looked amazing.
It seemed like the kitchen was a bit disorganized if they were busy but I am sure that will be worked out in time, they are fairly new.
chicken pot pie.author: Deseray T.
chicken pot pie.review: So, I was given the task of finding a place to go for dinner/drinks before going to see MGMT last night at the Fillmore. I searched around on Yelp for places in the area so we could just park one time and walk over to the show afterwards. I found this place on here and saw the good reviews so we decided to try it out. We got here around 6 p.m. and sat up at the bar. The bartender was very attentive and nice! The place became very crowded as the evening went on, probably because of the show at the Fillmore. It was fun, classy and overall a stellar time! It was a place to go for food, wine, good beers and you can laugh in there without the whole place noticing even though it is a smaller place. We ordered the boar salami, truffle oil mushroom flatbread, a bleu cheese, maple bacon butter, lemon caper butter, bacon macaroni and cheese, sliders and chicken pot pie. This was more than enough food for four very hungry people!  All of the food was very good with the only disappointment being the chicken pot pie. The pot pie was only luke warm and very bland. Next time I would opt for a salad because they were huge and looked amazing. It seemed like the kitchen was a bit disorganized if they were busy but I am sure that will be worked out in time, they are fairly new. As for the drinks we ordered the Pinot Nior on tap, Pranqster beer, a specialty bottle beer and a glass of each of the two Pinots. The 2006 Carneros Pinot was out of this world, highly recommend it. The highlights definitely were that Pinot, maple bacon butter, macaroni and cheese and the truffle oil flatbread. I definitely enjoyed the atmosphere and experience and will go back soon, even when I am not going to see a show at the Fillmore.

excerpts: fluffy salad) and spicy mac n cheese (comes in a skillet, of course)
mac n cheese.author: Edna C.
mac n cheese.review:
When my bf suggested going to Fat Angel, I didn't jump on the idea because I probably subconsciously thought it implied something about myself. Fast forward two years, and my friends and I are wandering about Pac Heights and I suggest Fat Angel. We snagged the last table, I received compliments for my recommendation, and my response was that it was actually my bf's rec. Moral of the story: Don't take restaurant names too seriously, and listen to recommendations by your SO. 

The alcoholic menu is extensive and overwhelming, in a good way. They have amazing wine and beer selections from all over the world. It's somewhat pricier, but they also have less expensive options for the rest of us peasants. The cocktail menu is short but intriguing, with a beer or wine base. There is a list of rotating draft beer and wine as well.

(+) We started off with a cheese and charcuterie board ($16 + $18 for 3 meats and 3 cheeses). It was beautifully laid out, with little dabs of spicy nuts, jams, honey, and whole grain mustard to mix it up.
- Brie was quite standard and the piece was small
- Pecorino and machego were good, not too strong but subtle
- Finocchio was like a fatty salami. Tasty, but may not be the best if you're on a diet
- The spicy prosciutto spread was more like a meat jam, and was also a somewhat small quantity. If you are craving something prosciutto-y, I suggest the speck or the bresaola. Tastes deliciously cured
- The bread came in a paper bag on the side. Would have liked it on a board for Instagram purposes, and in fact I think it comes on the same board if you don't order as much stuff for your board

(++) The tomato, spicy sausage, arugula, and Parmesan flatbread ($15) turned out more impressive than your standard flatbread. The bread is so miraculously thin it's almost like eating a cracker with a myriad of toppings with contrasting flavors. I bet this is what pizza tastes like in heaven for fat angels (....get it?)

(+++) We got their popular FA chicken pot pie ($14). I'm not sure if I've ever had fancy chicken pot pie (I can only think of the frozen ones from my childhood and that my roommate in college used to microwave). But FA has created quite a gastropub-worthy version with roasted chicken and assorted veggies, spiked with sherry and tarragon, and topped with a flaky puff pastry. It's savory and herby, with contrasting textures, a tad of creaminess without being too heavy, and a bit of nostalgia.

The server was helpful in her suggestions for the charcuterie board, never rushed us (even though we were taking a long time chatting after dinner and there was a wait on the Friday), and split the check 3 ways for us. It totaled to slightly above $40 each, for a glass of wine and a lot of food.

The ambiance is vintage and cool: marble tables, a chandelier with a statement, and a small patio for better food lighting. FA is a place I would come back to, in order to try the different drinks and noms. Plus, their menu has variation and is printed daily. (at least until SF bans non-reusable menus)

My minor complaints are that my friend noticed a bit of lipstick stain left on her cup, and that there were little fruit flies including one that landed in my wine glass. Good thing I finished it quickly. 

Other tips:
- Happy hour is 4-6pm weekdays, $1 off wine/beer and $2 off flatbreads
- It's a short walk from Jtown and Social Study, so there are great options for more drinks/things to do afterwards
- Not really great for large groups since it's fairly small. I'd say not to come with more than 6ish people
- Other dishes that look amazing are the greens (it a huggggggeee  fluffy salad) and spicy mac n cheese (comes in a skillet, of course)

Fun fact: it's owned by the same group as Trestle, Stone's Throw, and Corridor, and it indeed has the same wow factor.

excerpts: I ordered the spicy mac n cheese, which was pretty good!
Went well with my IPA.
I would be down to give Fat Angel another try
but I really did not enjoy my first time here.
mac n cheese.author: Stefanie C.
mac n cheese.review:
How could I resist going somewhere called Fat Angel? Cool vibe. Love the decor. Right when I walked in, I learned that my whole party must be present to be seated. The seats at the bar were taken, so I just stood awkwardly by the entrance. The waitress handed me a menu but then I was ignored by the bartender. Eventually I ordered an IPA from their small beer list.

Once my friends had arrived and we were finally seated, it took a REALLY long time for us to be able to order, get our food, then ultimately pay for everything. This place was severely understaffed when we went. Poor waitress was the only one working the floor and occasionally the bartender would help out. It was an annoying experience.

I ordered the spicy mac n cheese, which was pretty good! Went well with my IPA. I would be down to give Fat Angel another try but I really did not enjoy my first time here.

excerpts: And their Mac n Cheese.. Hmmmm...
Spicy!!
I am not a fan of Mac n cheese..
mac n cheese.author: Yann M.
mac n cheese.review:
Okay, this is my 4th meal of that crazy Sunday. I am pretty positive that I wasn't even hungry until I walked into this restaurant..
The lighting was pretty dim. The waitress was very patient regarding all of the questions about beer my friends threw at her. 
We had their signature chicken pot pie.. Have to say even better than my grandma's!! (I know!! Ouch!! Sorry granny!!!) the puff pastry was buttery and crusty!! The filling has thick and flavorful. (Somehow I felt the potatoes were a bit undercooked..hmm..) 
And the kale truffle flatbread was phenomenal, maybe I have bias on anything truffle..@.@.. 
Smoked trout salad is another item I enjoyed a lot. The horseradish vinaigrette was light, but the salad was tossed so well, every single bite will pick up all the flavors. 
And their Mac n Cheese.. Hmmmm... Spicy!! I am not a fan of Mac n cheese.. But couldn't help having couple of scoops here!!

Love this place! Recommend!!

excerpts: For the main courses, we got the asparagus flatbread and the spicy mac n cheese.
Both were pretty good!
The asparagus was very fresh and the kalamata olives added a nice tangy touch to the flatbread.
The mac n cheese was a little spicy so beware!
But it was still very creamy and delicious
mac n cheese.author: Malika R.
mac n cheese.review:
So excited that I got to make an excuse to go out to the Filmore to explore! We ended up at Fat Angel because of the great reviews and their interesting menu.

This place is pretty small and I don't know what the crowds are like on the weekends, but on a Monday night there was still a wait around 8PM.  

I started out with the local cider from San Bruno. It was a typical, crisp cider but for some reason it was really really good! Definitely recommend it if you like ciders! 

For food, we got the pretzel to start. The cheese and mustard dipping sauces that came out with the pretzel were amazing; I wish I could get some to take home! The pretzel was served warm and it was a great starter to pair with our drinks. For the main courses, we got the asparagus flatbread and the spicy mac n cheese. Both were pretty good! The asparagus was very fresh and the kalamata olives added a nice tangy touch to the flatbread. The mac n cheese was a little spicy so beware! But it was still very creamy and delicious :) 

I want to come back again for happy hour to explore their tremendous drinks menu and maybe try some of their cheese plates!

excerpts: We splurged on the mac n cheese and chicken pot pie and it was well worth it.
Both dishes were made uniquely with delicious flavors.
Can't go to a wine bar without a meat and cheese plate!
I can't recall exactly which cheeses we chose
but I know I had a delicious blue in there.
mac n cheese.author: Jen W.
mac n cheese.review:
Delicious and elegant hole in the wall in the Fillmore area...great place to order a few small plates and kick back with some glasses of wine.  That's exactly what we did.

We splurged on the mac n cheese and chicken pot pie and it was well worth it.  Both dishes were made uniquely with delicious flavors.  Can't go to a wine bar without a meat and cheese plate!  I can't recall exactly which cheeses we chose but I know I had a delicious blue in there.  Yum.  

Pick up a couple of glasses of wine and you're good to go.  Cute little place with great food...4 stars.

excerpts: why I love mac n cheese!
Be careful though, it comes out SUPER hot!
mac n cheese.author: Tu-Anh N.
mac n cheese.review:
Walking in with my 3 girlfriends we were immediately given exceptional service.  2 people served us and were really friendly.  I regret not getting their names.  But they were so nice and attentive and tried to be as helpful as possible!

Looking at the menu, I was amused that 90% of the items were alcoholic beverages.  I came for the food...which can be found on the last page, hehe.

So here's what my girlfriends and I shared:

FLATBREAD - $13 ($2 off during Happy Hour)
Tomatoes, basil, spicy sausage, & arugula w/ ricotta
Although simple, this was amazing.  I love the subtle spice of the sausage, the thin crispyness of the crust (which was not at all greasy), and the arugula that paried so well along with the ricotta.  All the ingredients was just the right amount and this plate was a great one for sharing.  I loved it!

MAC 'N CHEESE - $11
Gruyère, aged cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano
I came here for this dish right here.  I"m happy that it was so spicey like many people thought.  If anything I tasted no spice which was fine.  I loved how the top layer was crispy...and yes this dish was quite greacy...but hey its why I love mac n cheese!  Be careful though, it comes out SUPER hot!  This ooey-gooey cheesy dish was a fave!


F.A.'S CHICKEN POT PIE - $12
Roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon 
I was quite impressed with this one mainly because it didn't look like a pie.  It looked like there was a thick flakey buttery thing of pastry on top and beneath the filling.  Otherwise the filling was out in the open so you see exactly what you're getting.  Just your standard chicken pot pie filling but what made it unique was the "crust".  Yum!

3 SLIDERS - $10
Beef, caramelized onions, bacon, Irish cheddar, aioli
Oh so tasty!  Simple but I appreciate it not being dry.  I love the little pickled peppers it came with...it compliments it SO well.  I felt the aioli tasted like ranch dressing..but its not a complaint.  I enjoyed it.  

Its unfortunate I didn't try any drinks since I feel its their main thing...but I'm happy to have tried their food because it was amazing.  Parking was fairly easy for me (I came around 5:45pm and stayed until 6pm since its free after that).  The restaurant itself is quite small, intimate, but not jam packed.  It does become a full house and I felt we got lucky finding an empty table immediately.  Great food, great company, and exceptional service...whats there to complain?

excerpts:
mustard
Spicy Mac n cheese
mac n cheese.author: Randell J.
mac n cheese.review:
A quick review of what we ordered:
Fried capers love them
Garlic chili butter
Maple bacon butter not quite sweet enough but ample amounts of bacon
Meat dish with caprese, duck salami, and duck liver pate with mustard
Spicy Mac n cheese not so spicy
Chicken pot pie really good. Not too salty but perfect blend of creamy and quality ingredients
Not heaping but very filling
Large selection of drinks
Old stockale hoppy strong flavor lingers on the palate
Sparkling mead strong oaky flavor not too sweet but compliments the food well

Would return. Good for date night.

excerpts: And the mac n cheese, is great.
mac n cheese.author: Victoria O.
mac n cheese.review:
I love, love, love Fat Angel. It is a hidden (or not so hidden) gem of San Francisco. It is right off of Fillmore, it is a great spot if you are in the neighborhood. I've been going for about four years, and every time I go I find another great menu item. Mind you the menu is only one page (we aren't talking Cheesecake Factory selections) so hard to believe that I haven't tried it all. But on my last visit I discovered the Chicken Pot Pie. Divine! It may have been my first time trying it, but it certainly won't be my last. It is an open bowl of Chicken, carrots, peas, potatoes and the perfect amount of gravy and spices with a nice layer of buttery, flakey crust on the bottom and backed to perfection on the top. Man, I want to go back today just to try it again. It is almost sweet (in a good way) so I do recommend sprinkling with salt and pepper. 

They always have a kick bootie beer selection. And definitely keep them on the radar during sf beer week. Every evening they have a different delicious offering. I sampled five great Paradox beers and on another night 5 Bruery beers poured from bottles. (They had fifteen hard to find beers to choose from, so I had to narrow it down to one sample of five.)

Our fall back food options have always been the bread with flavored butters. The most recent flavors were Bernaise, Chive, Chili, Maple Bacon and Molasses. You can try one for $5.50, three for $15 or all five for I think $25. That is a lot of butter, but I did feel compelled to try them all once and take home the left overs. This last time the Bernaise butter was my favorite. Delish.

We also love their flatbreads, toppings change seasonally. Most recently we tried the butternut squash and kale. Perfect!

And the mac n cheese, is great. Has a tangy hardier taste with the perfect amount of sauce to crunch ratio.

Sometimes the prices can get a little steep if you don't pay attention when ordering, you think it may be a quick bite of food and a beer from your local gastropub, and next thing you know your tab is $90. But you can't blame them for having too many awesome things to order! 

I would like to have cold ice water, luke warm water is the worst. And a few veggie sides and sweet options. But this place is a great go to spot.

excerpts: I thoroughly enjoyed their mac n cheese (we ordered 2).
Why only 3 stars?
Slow slow slow service.
It took us forever to get a table and forever to get the check settled.
I say go for a drink but leave it at that.
(State Bird Provisions is right around the corner!)
mac n cheese.author: Angela D.
mac n cheese.review:
This place is cute with a good selection of wine on tap.
I thoroughly enjoyed their mac n cheese (we ordered 2).
Why only 3 stars? Slow slow slow service. It took us forever to get a table and forever to get the check settled. 
I say go for a drink but leave it at that. (State Bird Provisions is right around the corner!)

excerpts: Creamy, delicious spicy mac n cheese?
I really shouldn't,
but hey, I can start my diet tomorrow...
Sliders?
mac n cheese.author: Riz W.
mac n cheese.review:
Molasses brown sugar butter?  Yes, please.  Creamy, delicious spicy mac n cheese?  I really shouldn't, but hey, I can start my diet tomorrow... Sliders?  Well, only if they're good (and yes, they are!).  

In summary: truly satisfying comfort food!  Lengthy selection of beer (there's gotta be something for everyone in this drink menu). Friendly staff. Outdoor tables. Good times.

excerpts: The flatbreads are light and indulgent yet not as much as the mac n cheese with gruyere and cheddar.
Absolutely share and wash it down with more wine.
I've been back several times since for girls night and date night.
Fat Angel is a great place for both.
It's just hard to get a seat if you're not there early in the evening.
Best if your party is small.
mac n cheese.author: Samantha L.
mac n cheese.review: After drinking lots of red wine, eating charcuterie and rich cheese i could have just taken a nap right at the table. Loved the variety of butter to choose from to eat with the sourdough bread and mustard. The flatbreads are light and indulgent yet not as much as the mac n cheese with gruyere and cheddar. Absolutely share and wash it down with more wine. I've been back several times since for girls night and date night. Fat Angel is a great place for both. It's just hard to get a seat if you're not there early in the evening.  Best if your party is small.

excerpts: , I think they substituted the horseradish for it - good call), the spicy Mac n cheese, and the arugula sausage flatbread.
All were so tasty.
My favorite was the Mac and cheese which was just right in spice.
Service was polite, quick, and fantastic - creme brûlée on the house topped off our meal.
mac n cheese.author: Patricia S.
mac n cheese.review:
Impressive selection of alcohol - first half of the menu lists the options and it is extensive!
As I care about food more - we ordered the trout salad which had beets in it (yum, I think they substituted the horseradish for it - good call), the spicy Mac n cheese, and the arugula sausage flatbread. All were so tasty. My favorite was the Mac and cheese which was just right in spice. Service was polite, quick, and fantastic - creme brûlée on the house topped off our meal.

excerpts: I particularly delighted in their spicy mac n cheese.
mac n cheese.author: Isabele B.
mac n cheese.review:
Fat Angel Food & Libation

The name itself is already enough to make you want to go to this restaurant. I particularly delighted in their spicy mac n cheese.

I don't know what else to say, just that Fat Angel is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in SF!

excerpts:
Best:
Mac n cheese
Chicken pot pie

Atmosphere: intimate, dim lighting and trendy
mac n cheese.author: Daniela J.
mac n cheese.review:
This is a great little place that does a few dishes really well!

Best:
Mac n cheese
Chicken pot pie

Atmosphere: intimate, dim lighting and trendy

I will come here again!

excerpts: Mac n cheese
: The toppings were delicious and perfect but below the toppings seemed really dry... a bit hard to swallow?
mac n cheese.author: Nadeen H.
mac n cheese.review:
Hrm... was it just me? So many people rave about this place and I came with high expectations but I was a little disappointed... I guess I expected everything to taste a lot better but nothing really was to my liking.

Polenta fries: first few bites was good... sorta seemed like I was forcing myself to eat it... the taste was a bit weird to me, kinda tastes like a lot of olive oil, and found myself drowning the fries in ketchup to kind of make it taste better... When the fries became cool... it tasted just awful. Wasn't a fan.

Tomatoes, basil, spicy sausage flat bread: this was pretty good. I really liked the ricotta and sausage!

Mac n cheese: The toppings were delicious and perfect but below the toppings seemed really dry... a bit hard to swallow? Regardless, the toppings made up for it, I guess.

Sliders: no no no! First bite was SOOO GOOD... then it just felt really oily and buttery and eck... made me feel a bit sick after.

Chicken pot pie: I've had better... a bit too thick and creamy for my taste.

I dont know... I really wish I could give this place more stars but I really wasn't impressed. Maybe it was just an off day for the kitchen... I'd like to come back and give it another go though. (:

Really nice ambiance though!

excerpts: Mac n cheese:
Creamy and good portion, given the other things we also ordered.
mac n cheese.author: Natasha P.
mac n cheese.review:
I'm so glad my bf found this place on Yelp! We had some last minute changes during our SF getaway and wanted some delicious food in our bellies :)

We got lucky with parking and quickly found our way to the quaint little pub. About a 10 minute wait and had a look at the menu even though we already knew what we were going to have. Unfortunately, we were seated on a two-top with 3 people, but moved after a few dishes came out when the table next to us left. 

Polenta fries with garlic aioli and spicy ketchup: So bomb! Fried to perfection. The garlic aioli was nice and creamy and the ketchup had just the right kick. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?select=v9nx_p9ngsUFMTeRQL3_2Q

Salame nostrano and hot copa (??): Originally ordered just the salame but because the "order took so long" (I didn't think it was too long of a wait o_O) one of the owners gave us the other meat on the house! Don't remember if it was the hot copa or not, but it was delicioso~ The meats come with whole grain mustard and bread. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?select=u_QTAXoXAyNA2PmWqzwApw

Red grape, gorgonzola, walnut, proscuitto flatbread: The right size for the three of us. Generous amount of all ingredients and a classic combo done right. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?select=WmeropcwqBspDObJjgk-8A

Mac n cheese: Creamy and good portion, given the other things we also ordered. We were stuffed and I had to beast it out for the last few bites.http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?select=v6j6QhxBbF2D93-rv_IRyQ

All the Yelp reviews are testament to the owners' passion and dedication to Fat Angel. They really enjoy doing what they do and are happy to help you make your food/beverage selection. My only regret is not getting anything to drink because they have a wide selection of beers and wines.

excerpts: I would come back, not for the Mac n cheese though.
mac n cheese.author: Mauricio C.
mac n cheese.review: Cozy, cute, little place. Kitchen closed at 1030pm on Thursday. Salami was good with tasty dijon mustard. Bread wasn't crispy. Mac'ncheese was ok, I've had better, add some lobster to it. The mother puncher IPA was also ok. I would come back, not for the Mac n cheese though.

excerpts: Must try their Mac n cheese, sausage flatbread, and chicken pot pie.
A huge beer selection (and wine) and friendly staff!
mac n cheese.author: Joyce C.
mac n cheese.review: Very cramped in here but the food is so delicious. Must try their Mac n cheese, sausage flatbread, and chicken pot pie. A huge beer selection (and wine) and friendly staff!

excerpts: Must try: flatbread, Mac n cheese, charcuterie platter.
mac n cheese.author: Natasha F.
mac n cheese.review: Delicious comfort food and extensive beer list in a cozy setting. Wait staff is really friendly too. Great for date night or a small group, but it is a very small venue. Must try: flatbread, Mac n cheese, charcuterie platter.

excerpts:
Mac n cheese was ok.
Flatbreads were yummy, the one with grapes and walnuts was good.
we had the meat and cheese platter. 
good nibble food.
mac n cheese.author: Christine M.
mac n cheese.review:
CUTE PLACE!

I have always wanted to try this place and I'm glad I did for my bday. Definitely small so try not to go with more than 4! We had 6 ppl, which is doable but pushing it, especially if you are going to be ordering lots of things!

A memorable beer for us was the Witch's Wit! Yummy and light.
Chicken pot pie was yummy. Mac n cheese was ok.
Flatbreads were yummy, the one with grapes and walnuts was good.
we had the meat and cheese platter. good nibble food.
maple bacon and philz coffee butter, interesting!

would definitely come again with a group of girls or just the bf!

excerpts: I especially liked the Mac n Cheese, it was wonderfully creamy and rich.
My friend had the trout and he said it was the best trout he ever had -
well, to be honest
I think it was the first time he had trout.
mac n cheese.author: Jillian P.
mac n cheese.review: This place has an appealing ambiance and countless varieties of wines, beers and bar-food. The cherry on the cake is the service. Our waiter was great, I can't remember our waiter's name, but he was attentive, a little hard to understand, English was definitely a second language for him, but he was very pleasant. I especially liked the Mac n Cheese, it was wonderfully creamy and rich. My friend had the trout and he said it was the best trout he ever had - well, to be honest I think it was the first time he had trout. If you are into trying different beers I suggest that you visit this place. The service is spectacular and the atmosphere is nice. We enjoyed our visit a lot. We hope to be able to go back soon.

excerpts: We tried two beers, bread with garlic chili / honey butter, and the mac n cheese.
Everything tasted amazing and the portions were more than enough.
Fortunately we got here ~15-20 minutes before the crowd started coming in; there's outdoor seating
but I loved sitting inside enjoying the woodsy and candlelit ambiance.
I promised myself I wouldn't try the same restaurant twice while I live in the city
but I might just need to come back!
mac n cheese.author: Jamie B.
mac n cheese.review: Love it! Our waitress was super helpful and gave us some great recommendations. We tried two beers, bread with garlic chili / honey butter, and the mac n cheese. Everything tasted amazing and the portions were more than enough. Fortunately we got here ~15-20 minutes before the crowd started coming in; there's outdoor seating but I loved sitting inside enjoying the woodsy and candlelit ambiance. I promised myself I wouldn't try the same restaurant twice while I live in the city but I might just need to come back!

excerpts: The mac n cheese and chicken pot pie are to die for!
Hadn't come here in at least 2 years, so coming back to try my once favorites was a great reminder of how good the food is!
These two dishes were so dense, that the prosciutto flatbread was just an afterthought.
I would do without the flatbread next time.
mac n cheese.author: Jeanne C.
mac n cheese.review:
The mac n cheese and chicken pot pie are to die for! Hadn't come here in at least 2 years, so coming back to try my once favorites was a great reminder of how good the food is! These two dishes were so dense, that the prosciutto flatbread was just an afterthought. I would do without the flatbread next time. We all thought the Zinfandel was the best out of the Reds tasting.

Seating is random. We were told a 45 min wait but it ended up being 20-30 min. We sat at the bar. They are very particular about where you sit and stand when waiting for a table, so it's really hard to get a drink when you want it. I love intimate spots but it's a little too small for the demand of the place!

excerpts: The Mac N Cheese was very good, not overly cheesy and very peppery which I like.
The mousse was ok, bread pudding was more like a cinnamon roll or thick french toast and good.
The fact that they have a large beer selection, dessert wines, and a large wine menu for a bar is a definite plus.
The decor is hip, love the diverse crowd, it was getting busy when we left at 6pm on a Sunday.
Can't wait to return.
mac n cheese.author: Elizabeth T.
mac n cheese.review:
For bar food, this spot is great. Try the butters, very yummy, I had the lemon and capers and it was delicious. My friends tried the bacon butter which looked liked foie, and they claimed was finger licken. I'd pass on the flat bread next time or try a different style, we had the mushroom and it was super oily. The Mac N Cheese was very good, not overly cheesy and very peppery which I like. The mousse was ok, bread pudding was more like a cinnamon roll or thick french toast and good. The fact that they have a large beer selection, dessert wines, and a large wine menu for a bar is a definite plus. The decor is hip, love the diverse crowd, it was getting busy when we left at 6pm on a Sunday. Can't wait to return. Hope to see more spots like this in the Fillmore.

Two drinks, a bunch of food, and tip ...3 people, we each paid $40. Could easily have a drink and share a salad and keep it under $30 for the total.

excerpts: cheeses, charcuterie, flatbreads, mac n cheese, and chicken pot pie.
mac n cheese.author: Regina C.
mac n cheese.review:
LOVE this place. small. dark. simple. a ton of beer selections. an easy menu that you can't go wrong with. cheeses, charcuterie, flatbreads, mac n cheese, and chicken pot pie. all things that pair well with beer, of course. 

the bartender wants you to drink something you enjoy and will talk you through their libations as well as offer you something different if what you've got isn't pleasing.

be prepared to wait some. at 815 on a wednesday we waited about 20 minutes. not too bad but i'll bet it gets worse at varying times in the night and on different days.

excerpts: We really could have ended our meal there, but I couldn't get my mind off some comfort food like their mac n cheese or chicken pot pie.
Unfortunately.. the pot pie just wasn't good.
It first came out lukewarm, then when they said they'd remake it, they def just microwaved it bc the "crust" then came out soggy.
Sadface.
That said, the server/bartenders are wonderful and make amazing recommendations.
mac n cheese.author: Vivian H.
mac n cheese.review: Glad we found this place! We came by before a movie at the Kabuki, and we started with some wine and a little charcuterie and cheese plate. SO good, and large portions. Then we got a kale salad, and were presented with a mountain of it. We really could have ended our meal there, but I couldn't get my mind off some comfort food like their mac n cheese or chicken pot pie. Unfortunately.. the pot pie just wasn't good. It first came out lukewarm, then when they said they'd remake it, they def just microwaved it bc the "crust" then came out soggy. Sadface. That said, the server/bartenders are wonderful and make amazing recommendations.

excerpts: Their Mac n cheese has a lil kick to it
and it was soooooooo good
one of the best around!
I'd definitely go back for the Mac ...
mac n cheese.author: Stephanie C.
mac n cheese.review: Really chill spot... Came here or hh at 5:30... O problem getting a table.. By 7:30 this place was packed! Started with their fried polenta fries... So bomb! Their Mac n cheese has a lil kick to it and it was soooooooo good :)  one of the best around! I'd definitely go back for the Mac ... Also try their flat bread n chicken pot pie! This is a perfect lil place for great food, wine n catching up with friends!

excerpts: LOVED the flatbread, mac n cheese, and salads.
mac n cheese.author: Susie S.
mac n cheese.review:
What a beautiful place! Though it is tiny and you'll most likely end up in a line, this place charms you like none other.

LOVED the flatbread, mac n cheese, and salads. Chicken pot pie had a strange taste, which was the only disappointing part. Beers were good, and their "wine on tap" selection was good, too.

Go early to beat the rush!

excerpts: The Mac N cheese was so unreal that my date on the paleo diet ate half of it.
And def ask for sausage in the Mac N cheese.
The beer and wine selection is really extensive, too.
Will be coming back.
mac n cheese.author: Eric T.
mac n cheese.review: The Mac N cheese was so unreal that my date on the paleo diet ate half of it. And def ask for sausage in the Mac N cheese. The beer and wine selection is really extensive, too. Will be coming back.

excerpts: Mac n' cheese: I'm not a huge fan of mac n cheese, but since my boyfriend seems to be stuck in fourth grade, we gave it a try.
It was AMAZING!
They used conchiglie rigate (or what I always refer to affectionately as the "shell pasta", and the dish was served on a cast iron mini-casserole.
Not as great as the mac n cheese, I'm afraid, but memorable in its own right.
mac n cheese.author: Hanui C.
mac n cheese.review:
I LOVE GASTROPUBS! There's something about darkened and packed restaurants with cozy yet humbling food that really strikes a chord with me... I think Fat Angel might have been my first SF gastropub foray. I wasn't disappointed!

I came here for pre-show dining before seeing Shabazz Palaces at Yoshi's SF. If you're going to Yoshi's for music, I highly recommend you come here instead of dining at Yoshi's; Yoshi's is overpriced and doesn't taste very good. Fat Angel was only a couple blocks away from the venue.

The wait is a little long, and since the establishment is pretty small, I had to wait outside. There is some bar seating, but I opted for the tables instead. The atmosphere was sexy yet understated, and the noise level was at a comfortable middle between awkward low and overbearing high.

What we had:

Maple bacon butter: As a self-proclaimed butter aficionado, I approve this dish! It reminded me of a buttery reincarnation of Frances' Bacon Beignets. When I ran out of bread, I started eating the butter on its own; NO REGRETS.

Mac n' cheese: I'm not a huge fan of mac n cheese, but since my boyfriend seems to be stuck in fourth grade, we gave it a try. It was AMAZING! They used conchiglie rigate (or what I always refer to affectionately as the "shell pasta", and the dish was served on a cast iron mini-casserole. Yum!

Chicken pot pie: Not as great as the mac n cheese, I'm afraid, but memorable in its own right. If you have never broke the shell on a steaming hot pie with the back of your spoon, you are missing out.

I'll be back for you, Fat Angel.

excerpts: We also had the mac n cheese, sliders, and the pretzel.
mac n cheese.author: Aleyna S.
mac n cheese.review:
I have to say I love this spot.

I checked it out for the first time a couple weeks ago with a friend. They have an excellent selection of different beers and wines. Kudos on the nice selection of sours. I am definitely on a sour beer kick. The bartender was very helpful as we selected four different beers to split. Love the sweet and sour beer, but stay away from the wild berries under sours. It tastes like cough syrup. Bleh.

Food: Can't complain here either. Food was solid and tasty. The caesar salad is huge! Comes in a giant wooden bowl. Enough for three or four people. We also had the mac n cheese, sliders, and the pretzel. 

Lastly, my favorite part. The ambience. It's a quaint neighborhood spot. Not pretentious. Great place to have a beer and a snack with a date or an old friend.

excerpts: Love the food - try the flatbreads, fancy mac n cheese, and the olives - all varying levels of bad for you
mac n cheese.author: Rosers M.
mac n cheese.review:
One word: Awesome.  In a city chock full of divey after work bars, this is my favorite happy hour place in the city.  

Love the vibe - unpretentious, interesting but not distracting decor, and always lively after work but not over-the-top rowdy.  Love the drinks - the ever-changing draft beer selection is always interesting (maybe 10 beers total - just tried the Hop Wallop, very nice), the beer and wine bottle list is pretty long, and prices are reasonable across the board. Love the food - try the flatbreads, fancy mac n cheese, and the olives - all varying levels of bad for you but oh-so-addictive.  

Only a couple gripes with this place - the location is a bit sketchy and the food menu, although pretty tasty, is short and never changes.

excerpts: love the chicken pot pie and the mac n cheese.
Will be back very very soon to eat it all AGAIN!
mac n cheese.author: Mary M.
mac n cheese.review:
After walking 1.5 miles we made it!! 

love the chicken pot pie and the mac n cheese. Will be back very very soon to eat it all AGAIN!

excerpts: Great chicken potpie, great mac n cheese, and great apple bread pudding.
Such an extensive beer list!
Very impressive.
mac n cheese.author: Kellsie F.
mac n cheese.review: Great chicken potpie, great mac n cheese, and great apple bread pudding. Such an extensive beer list! Very impressive.

excerpts: I've had the sliders before and they make some of the best in the city, I'ts my fave in the city as well as there mac n cheese.
mac n cheese.author: Chris D.
mac n cheese.review: If you're a beer fan this is your spot,  and also nice wine list. Flatbread was amazing and kept us from not starving waiting for our table @ the bird. I've had the sliders before and they make some of the best in the city, I'ts my fave in the city as well as there mac n cheese.

excerpts: Their sliders and  their Mac n Cheese were both delicious.
While the Mac n Cheese was par, their sliders were some of the best sliders I have ever had in my life!
mac n cheese.author: Diana R.
mac n cheese.review:
I know once I finish writing this review I am going to regret it. Reasoning is that this place is so amazing and once this place blows up like it should, I will never get a seat when I come here. But it is my obligation (as my friends reminded me last night) to tell you of this wonderful place.

This place is just what The Fillmore needs, and I am so pissed that I moved away from this neighborhood because 1. It was walking distance to my house, and 2. It's a wine/beer bar that is reasonably priced, has amazing food, and friendly service. Whoever thought of making a bacon butter or a chocolate cinnamon butter needs to patent that shit because those two butters were two of the most amazing parties I have ever had in my mouth. Adding it with their country bread was genius! Looking for a little more substance? Their sliders and  their Mac n Cheese were both delicious. While the Mac n Cheese was par, their sliders were some of the best sliders I have ever had in my life!

Their wine and beer selection is amazing. While I stuck with the wine side this time, I was extremely impressed with the variety, as well as them being able to cover a lot of regions throughout the world. The owner, who was serving us, was extremely knowledgeable and for my last glass, I made him pick something for me. He ended up picking a beautiful Portuguese wine that was big and bold and fabulous! 

The atmosphere is awesome. Small, quaint, perfect for that girls evening where you want to sit at a table and catch up, or for the predate drink where you are sitting at the bar. The owners also have an amazing taste in music, all his own collection. We made him promise that he would never change the music. The whole bar is made from a church organ he was able to snag from napa, and beautifully restored.

I am so glad my friend stumbled upon this and wanted to share it with myself and our girlfriends. We all had nothing but excellent comments about this place and decided this is probably going to be our go to spot when we want to get together for a drink and hang out. I cannot wait to come back here to hang out, have a glass of wine, and relax. 

Like I said, I'm already regretting sharing this place with my fellow yelpers.

excerpts: We ordered the sliders and the Mac n Cheese.
Both were yummy.
We'll definitely be back and if they expand their food menu a bit, we'll be back more often!
mac n cheese.author: S B.
mac n cheese.review: Went here for the first time before catching a movie at Kabuki Sundance Cinemas. Our hostess, Jessica, was awesome! She recommended some really neat beers and we loved it. Beers were a bit on the expensive side but they have a great list to choose from. Food menu was limited, but the food was great. We ordered the sliders and the Mac n Cheese. Both were yummy. We'll definitely be back and if they expand their food menu a bit, we'll be back more often!

excerpts: Also, they have a good mac n cheese
and I normally don't even like
mac n cheese
but next time I will have to come back to order their giant salad!
mac n cheese.author: Allison T.
mac n cheese.review: Came here twice with some girlfriends.  A good quiet place to hang out if you want to talk and have some wine and food and they do have indoor and outdoor seating.  They have a pretty good wine selection here.  My favorite though is the meat and cheese plates....especially with their mustard...so good. Also, they have a good mac n cheese and I normally don't even like mac n cheese but next time I will have to come back to order their giant salad!

excerpts: I have tried the flatbreads, mac n cheese,sliders, and the caeser salad, all of which were very tasty!
The salads come family style, sharable 3-4 people.
And delicious!!
The vibe in here is cool and casual, with a beautifully lit ambiance from the candles and smooth reclaimed bar,equipped with brass pipes from an old church organ.
On a warm night, drink/dine at one of the outdoor tables overlooking the Fillmore Center Plaza.
From my long-winded review, I guess you could say I heart Fat Angel:)
mac n cheese.author: Shelley M.
mac n cheese.review: I've been coming here since opening day, I can't believe this is my first review of the place. I have loved it from the start, not too many places this close to home with such an incredible beer selection. They also have an awesome list of wines, my favorites being on tap. I have tried the flatbreads, mac n cheese,sliders, and the caeser salad, all of which were very tasty! The salads come family style, sharable 3-4 people. And delicious!! The vibe in here is cool and casual, with a beautifully lit ambiance from the candles and smooth reclaimed bar,equipped with brass pipes from an old church organ. On a warm night, drink/dine at one of the outdoor tables overlooking the Fillmore Center Plaza. From my long-winded review, I guess you could say I heart Fat Angel:)

excerpts: The mac n cheese needed more better, stickier cheese and wasn't warm enough.
mac n cheese.author: Nate P.
mac n cheese.review:
Cute place.  Great wine - got the 'draft' pinot which was cheap and fantastic.  The downside?  The food.  Sliders: overdone and the buns were burned.  Badly.  The mac n cheese needed more better, stickier cheese and wasn't warm enough.

So go for the wine and atmosphere.  And go down the street to eat.

P.S. the flat bread did look really good but I did not get it.

excerpts: I never liked Mac n Cheese, but I loved theirs.
It gets really crowded and we had to wait for a hour and half to be seated
but it was totally worth the wait.
mac n cheese.author: Coco L.
mac n cheese.review: Food is so delicious! I never liked Mac n Cheese, but I loved theirs. It gets really crowded and we had to wait for a hour and half to be seated but it was totally worth the wait.

excerpts: Try the sliders and mac n cheese!
They are freaking delicious.
mac n cheese.author: Dan H.
mac n cheese.review:
Went there for the first time a couple of weeks ago.  Server was very knowledgeable and nice.

Beer selection is tops.  Wine is good as well.

Try the sliders and mac n cheese! They are freaking delicious.

excerpts: They offer salads, flat breads, mac n cheese, sliders ( a must try!!!
mac n cheese.author: Arlene C.
mac n cheese.review: I have found a new love here in SF. I loved it so much that I returned to dine here 2 nights in a row. You must be patient to come here. The wait can be long, approximately 1 hour each time I came, but definitely worth it. Grab a drink at the bar while you wait and make sure to bring people that will make good conversation or you can always stand at a table giving dirty looks to hurry up and get going. Anyway back to Fat Angel, great selection of beers and amazing bites. You would definitely have to come here a few times to try all the items on the menu. The menu itself is quite small but you definitely want to try it ALL. For appetizers they offer their flavored butters (yum), cheese and meats (yum yum). They offer salads, flat breads, mac n cheese, sliders ( a must try!!! you will die for the sauce), and chicken pot pie. They also offer items for dessert but the 2 times I dined I was way to stuffed to get to that part of the meal. I will definitely have to leave room next time. Great place for a dinner date or small party. Definitely a place I will have to come and visit when in town. Totally in love with you golden chubby lil winged angel. Till we meet again.

excerpts: maple bacon butter was to quite delicious along with the mac n cheese.
DEFINITELY get bacon with it.
and the sliders... dude...
we got two orders of it and i finished 4 of them all to myself.
haha.
had the proscuitto and that was yummy too.
