i will definitely drag my friend back here again after a long day at school.
mac n cheese.author: Anne H.
mac n cheese.review:
so this is my first yelp review and i just HAD to write a review for this place. :) 

so i went here thursday with a friend n her friend n this place is completely awesome!!!!!

loved the cheqered past and the pale ale cy suggested. :)

maple bacon butter was to quite delicious along with the mac n cheese. DEFINITELY get bacon with it. :) and the sliders... dude... we got two orders of it and i finished 4 of them all to myself. haha. had the proscuitto and that was yummy too. i will definitely drag my friend back here again after a long day at school. :)

excerpts: the mac n cheese was delish,  the mushroom flatbread was scrumptious and the flavored butter out of this world.
I just wish my pimms cup was larger!
mac n cheese.author: sarah s.
mac n cheese.review: it was yummy and absolutely adorable and cozy inside. great for a cold evening. the mac n cheese was delish,  the mushroom flatbread was scrumptious and the flavored butter out of this world. I just wish my pimms cup was larger!

excerpts: Didn't even get drinks...

I will next time!
get the pot pie.
OMG.
drinks.author: shauna o.
drinks.review:
Stumbled upon this place and the food was amazing. Super cute and cozy, zero wait, and our server, Logan, was amazing. Attentive, friendly and upbeat. 
Didn't even get drinks... I will next time!
get the pot pie. OMG.

excerpts: FA is a place I would come back to, in order to try the different drinks and noms.
Plus, their menu has variation and is printed daily.

It's a short walk from Jtown and Social Study, so there are great options for more drinks/things to do afterwards
- Not really great for large groups since it's fairly small.
I'd say not to come with more than 6ish people
- Other dishes that look amazing are the greens (it a huggggggeee
drinks.author: Edna C.
drinks.review:
When my bf suggested going to Fat Angel, I didn't jump on the idea because I probably subconsciously thought it implied something about myself. Fast forward two years, and my friends and I are wandering about Pac Heights and I suggest Fat Angel. We snagged the last table, I received compliments for my recommendation, and my response was that it was actually my bf's rec. Moral of the story: Don't take restaurant names too seriously, and listen to recommendations by your SO. 

The alcoholic menu is extensive and overwhelming, in a good way. They have amazing wine and beer selections from all over the world. It's somewhat pricier, but they also have less expensive options for the rest of us peasants. The cocktail menu is short but intriguing, with a beer or wine base. There is a list of rotating draft beer and wine as well.

(+) We started off with a cheese and charcuterie board ($16 + $18 for 3 meats and 3 cheeses). It was beautifully laid out, with little dabs of spicy nuts, jams, honey, and whole grain mustard to mix it up.
- Brie was quite standard and the piece was small
- Pecorino and machego were good, not too strong but subtle
- Finocchio was like a fatty salami. Tasty, but may not be the best if you're on a diet
- The spicy prosciutto spread was more like a meat jam, and was also a somewhat small quantity. If you are craving something prosciutto-y, I suggest the speck or the bresaola. Tastes deliciously cured
- The bread came in a paper bag on the side. Would have liked it on a board for Instagram purposes, and in fact I think it comes on the same board if you don't order as much stuff for your board

(++) The tomato, spicy sausage, arugula, and Parmesan flatbread ($15) turned out more impressive than your standard flatbread. The bread is so miraculously thin it's almost like eating a cracker with a myriad of toppings with contrasting flavors. I bet this is what pizza tastes like in heaven for fat angels (....get it?)

(+++) We got their popular FA chicken pot pie ($14). I'm not sure if I've ever had fancy chicken pot pie (I can only think of the frozen ones from my childhood and that my roommate in college used to microwave). But FA has created quite a gastropub-worthy version with roasted chicken and assorted veggies, spiked with sherry and tarragon, and topped with a flaky puff pastry. It's savory and herby, with contrasting textures, a tad of creaminess without being too heavy, and a bit of nostalgia.

The server was helpful in her suggestions for the charcuterie board, never rushed us (even though we were taking a long time chatting after dinner and there was a wait on the Friday), and split the check 3 ways for us. It totaled to slightly above $40 each, for a glass of wine and a lot of food.

The ambiance is vintage and cool: marble tables, a chandelier with a statement, and a small patio for better food lighting. FA is a place I would come back to, in order to try the different drinks and noms. Plus, their menu has variation and is printed daily. (at least until SF bans non-reusable menus)

My minor complaints are that my friend noticed a bit of lipstick stain left on her cup, and that there were little fruit flies including one that landed in my wine glass. Good thing I finished it quickly. 

Other tips:
- Happy hour is 4-6pm weekdays, $1 off wine/beer and $2 off flatbreads
- It's a short walk from Jtown and Social Study, so there are great options for more drinks/things to do afterwards
- Not really great for large groups since it's fairly small. I'd say not to come with more than 6ish people
- Other dishes that look amazing are the greens (it a huggggggeee  fluffy salad) and spicy mac n cheese (comes in a skillet, of course)

Fun fact: it's owned by the same group as Trestle, Stone's Throw, and Corridor, and it indeed has the same wow factor.

excerpts: I can see this as a great place to grab drinks with friends or even a date.
I came here on a Tuesday
drinks.author: Janet H.
drinks.review:
My new favorite spot to hit before seeing a show at the Fillmore! Their chicken pot pie is AMAZING!! It's inspired me to make my own one day...

The ambiance of Fat Angel is relaxed, simple, and classy. I can see this as a great place to grab drinks with friends or even a date. I came here on a Tuesday so it wasn't super crowded; not sure how crowded it would be on a weekend as it is a pretty small establishment. 

I love the details for this bar though... the organ and choir sign to go along with the theme... and the 99 bottles of wine displayed on the wall. 

Fat Angel also has different variety of beer and wine so it is a crowd pleaser!

excerpts: Came here for a quick bite/drinks before heading off to the Fillmore for a concert.
Fat Angel is small but pretty busy establishment.
The staff really great though, and even offered to let us order food at a side bar space and eat it there (despite no seats).
We ended up ordering some drinks + food and took a seat in their small outdoor space while waiting for food.
They turned on the outdoor heater and lights for us
drinks.author: Deanna S.
drinks.review:
Came here for a quick bite/drinks before heading off to the Fillmore for a concert. Fat Angel is small but pretty busy establishment. The staff really great though, and even offered to let us order food at a side bar space and eat it there (despite no seats). We ended up ordering some drinks + food and took a seat in their small outdoor space while waiting for food. They turned on the outdoor heater and lights for us and it was so comfortable we just ended up hanging out there and just ordering any other items at the bar inside and bringing it out.  

They have a good variety of wines and beers to choose from. The Navarro Edelzwicker (white) was soooo goood for me (light and sweet). I think I could have sat there with friends having conversation all night with that glasses of that Navarro all night. It was so easy to sip on! The food came with lightening speed, which was great because we did have a hangry friend with us! The mac and cheese seemed to be a staple and there was also butter w/ bread, but from what I heard, it was a bit on the obscure side with hints of lemon (and capers?). It was interesting, but probably not to my friends palate! 

Overall, service was great, food was fast and decent and the space was just right for all our pre-concert needs! I would definitely be back if ever in the area!

excerpts: Went for some drinks and appetizers.
Overall, very basic stuff and very expensive.
Not planning on going back anytime soon
drinks.author: Evan M.
drinks.review: Went for some drinks and appetizers. Overall, very basic stuff and very expensive. Not planning on going back anytime soon

excerpts: With how service was going that night we decided to just take out the pieces and drink our drinks.
drinks.author: Camera P.
drinks.review:
We came here on a slow weekday night at around 10PM to get some food and try out some wine. When we arrived they told us that the kitchen closed in about half an hour, so we sat down and looked over the menu. We asked the server what her preferences and what was good and all she did was point at the menu items and told us what was in the dishes. With absolutely no input we decided to order the chicken pot pie, pretzel with mustard and cheese sauce, the flatbread with roasted grapes and goat cheese. The food was alright and I would have to say I have honestly had a lot better elsewhere.

Chicken Pot Pie - The first bite I took was from the center and the soup was cold in the center. The puff pastry they had on top was soggy from the top to the bottom. In that first bite I got a chicken bone. The flavor was decent and the veggies were cooked well.

Flatbread - The flatbread itself was very thin and cracker like. There were areas where it was nice and crispy but then there were other areas where it was really soggy and all of the toppings just fell off. The grapes were probably the best part about the dish. They were seasoned well and had some really great flavors.

Pretzel - The shape and presentation of the pretzel was really bad, but it was probably the best tasting dish we had. It went great with the whole mustard. The cheese sauce was really think and broken and did not have a great texture.

We also ordered a glass of wine and beer. Our wine had some pieces of cork in it. With how service was going that night we decided to just take out the pieces and drink our drinks. Every time the server came by, it always felt like an inconvenience to her and that she had better things to do, even though we were 2 out of 6 people there that night.

To be honest, I would avoid coming here. There are very few places that I feel like I need to get away from, and this was one of them. I would not visit again unless the service gets better.

excerpts: Drinks were good, but I wish they had a more extensive wine list.
We had the flatbread pizza with Gorgonzola, grapes, walnuts and prosciutto...
it was delicious!!!
drinks.author: Elizabeth S.
drinks.review: What a fun little wine bar!  I met friends here on a Friday night and it was the perfect place for a girls catch up. Drinks were good, but I wish they had a more extensive wine list. We had the flatbread pizza with Gorgonzola, grapes, walnuts and prosciutto...it was delicious!!!

excerpts: A very solid place just for a few drinks, or even a date.
Definitely worth a visit.
drinks.author: Vincent L.
drinks.review:
A non-foodie friend of mine burst out laughing, uncontrollably so, when I uttered the term "gastropub," but maybe if he stopped by Fat Angel he'd understand.

Fat Angel feels like a rustic country saloon, with antique-looking furnishings, chandeliers, and a stuffed moose head, but is really a lively yet casual neighborhood pub just off the Fillmore corridor. The strongest point here is the extensive, well-curated beer menu, with solid offerings from around the world. The wine offerings have also been carefully selected.

As for the "gastropub" theme, the food offerings here are quite solid. There are a variety of small bites, some solid cheese and salumi offerings, and dependable, hearty comfort fare like the chicken pot pie, mac n' cheese, or braised beef shortrib stew. Service is also friendly and patient, especially when it comes to explaining all the choices on their menu.

A very solid place just for a few drinks, or even a date. Definitely worth a visit.

excerpts: I decided to stop by Fat Angel to have some drinks and food with a friend, and I was pleasantly surprised by the experience.
I walked in expecting to sit at the bar, but as soon as I stepped in, I noticed that the bar is on the smaller side of things.
drinks.author: Keith H.
drinks.review:
I decided to stop by Fat Angel to have some drinks and food with a friend, and I was pleasantly surprised by the experience.  I walked in expecting to sit at the bar, but as soon as I stepped in, I noticed that the bar is on the smaller side of things.  However, it did not take too long to get seated at a table, and I thought the service was friendly right from the start.

We ended up sharing several items including the spicy mac n' cheese, the smoked trout salad, and the pretzel.  I've never been the biggest macaroni and cheese fan, but I though Fat Angel's version was solid with a creamy mixture of cheeses (though not very spicy).  The pretzel was excellent, with a chewy yet firm texture (and given that it was from Firebrand, I am not surprised that it was amazing).  I liked that the trout salad was not overdressed, but you were still able to adequately sample the horseradish vinaigrette.  They offer a limited specialty cocktail menu, so I'd recommend sticking with the wine and beer selection.

excerpts: If interested in food and drinks that borders on the unfamiliar, look somewhere else.
The reason why I love Fat Angel is that it succeeds in what may quaint neighborhood jaunts fail to do: keep things simple and classy.
Fat Angel serves up tastes and an ambiance that is comfortable and recognizable.
As for drinks, I encourage you to be adventurous and try something new every time.
drinks.author: Kimberlee P.
drinks.review:
Fat Angel's food menu is simple, it's wine and beer menu extensive. If interested in food and drinks that borders on the unfamiliar, look somewhere else. The reason why I love Fat Angel is that it succeeds in what may quaint neighborhood jaunts fail to do: keep things simple and classy. Fat Angel serves up tastes and an ambiance that is comfortable and recognizable. This restaurant doesn't attempt to be something it's not.

Since I discovered this place over a year ago, I visit the establishment about once per month. Of all San Francisco restaurants, this would be my most visited and the place I most often take friends for a light, casual dinner. My friends always leave commenting how much they are "surprised" by the food and ambiance of this hidden gem of a bar/restaurant. 

My 'go-to' meal here is the Fat Angel Chicken Pot Pie, with roasted carrots, chicken, sherry and tarragon ($14). Their bread is less like a biscuit, more like a croissant. I think the light, flakey texture of bread choice is key for this dish. The contents themselves are thick and creamy, without leaving you stuffed. When I need to eat emotionally, I crave this chicken pot pie.

Some other dishes I have tried that I have enjoyed greatly are the Spicy Mac N' Cheese, with gruyère, cheddar and parmiggiano-reggiano ($12), the Baby Kale, minus bacon, marcona almonds and Parmesan ($12). 

As for drinks, I encourage you to be adventurous and try something new every time. I am never disappointed. 

The service here is impeccable. The bar and wait staff is a tightly-knit family. If you show your face here often enough, they'll recognize you, remember your tastes and give you recommendations for navigating their beer and wine lists. The team is also lightning fast at delivering your food, checking up on you, and bringing you the bill whenever ready. 

As has been mentioned in other reviews, this place should be listed as a bar, not a restaurant. Think of it as a bar with bites on par. 

There's limited seating here, with most tables set for two. Perfect for a date night; not ideal for a family dinner.

excerpts: This place is the perfect preshow drinks and light food spot.
Very respectable beer list with nightly specials and some great cheese board, salad and skillet entrees.
Very small and not a lot of tables so arrive early to enjoy the libations!
drinks.author: May O.
drinks.review: This place is the perfect preshow drinks and light food spot. Very respectable beer list with nightly specials and some great cheese board, salad and skillet entrees. Very small and not a lot of tables so arrive early to enjoy the libations!

excerpts: But, none of my friends got drinks because they weren't as capable at flagging down the one employee here.
I'm grateful to that poor overworked waitress, but I also feel bad for her!
drinks.author: Chris S.
drinks.review:
Never had such bad service at an SF bar (/restaurant) before. Granted, it was Friday night, but we honestly only ever saw one person working the entire restaurant AND behind the bar. She looked stressed and overworked, but she was at least pleasant and helpful. Though, when I finally got to her, she suggested I push my way past an entire group of people to squeeze up to the bar......it would have been super rude. But, she was nice enough to let me get service at the other end of the bar where things were much clearer.

When I finally got service, she was very helpful, and the beer selection was solid. But, none of my friends got drinks because they weren't as capable at flagging down the one employee here. I'm grateful to that poor overworked waitress, but I also feel bad for her!

excerpts: They were out of the first two drinks I tried to order.
Their homemade potpie was decent.
They have fantastic beer options.
I really liked the 13.5% alc
drinks.author: Andrew G.
drinks.review:
Amazing waitress, she easily made my dining experience pleasant. The atmosphere was nice. I sat outside on a beautiful night. 

They were out of the first two drinks I tried to order. Their homemade potpie was decent. They have fantastic beer options. I really liked the 13.5% alc "What about them apples" honey cider, it was strong and smooth, and unlike any cider I've ever had.

The strongly recommended maple-bacon butter kinda grossed me out and made me queasy. They kindly swapped it out for their garlic chili butter with fresh bread for me (as they did not have regular butter available believe it or not). I again thought it was kinda gross, but nibbled a bit at it out of politeness, and of course paid for it. These cubes of flavored butter reminded me a bit of bouillon cubes with a pasty texture. Maybe it's just me. But all-in-all, I'd come back again.

excerpts:
A few observations to make note of: 
* watch the prices on the drinks.
* if you're careful on the drink costs, it's actually really decently priced overall (came to about $60 for the two of us and that was with two drinks apiece).
We'd definitely be happy to return for more samplings of food and drinks.
drinks.author: Cassandra J.
drinks.review:
We came here directly after a matinee showing at the Kabuki in Japantown, right as the pub was opening so we had our pick of seats and it wasn't crowded at all (so a good time to show up is right at 4pm). With a wide range of beer, cider and cocktails to choose from, plus small plates of all sorts, we were quite overwhelmed with what to choose from. We settled on a range of beers and cocktails and splurged on the sausage flatbread, the pretzel with cheese sauce, and the spicy mac & cheese.

Suffice to say, the food was absolutely delicious and we came out pretty full and tipsy. 

A few observations to make note of: 
* watch the prices on the drinks. There's a wide range of beers and ciders that go from an easy $9 to well over $20 due to sizes and alcohol percent and it's easy to not notice.
* spicy mac&cheese isn't really spicy. I'm super sensitive to heat and yeah... this was not spicy at all. 
* if you're careful on the drink costs, it's actually really decently priced overall (came to about $60 for the two of us and that was with two drinks apiece).

We'd definitely be happy to return for more samplings of food and drinks.

excerpts: Drinks (4/5)
The drink menu is quite large, but I was surprised that it cost me $13 for a 12oz bottled beer...
drinks.author: Jennifer C.
drinks.review:
We came here on a Saturday night about 6pm and it was still about a half hour wait to seat five of us. It's a much smaller restaurant (seats maybe 30 people) and has an intimate vibe. We saw quite a few dates while we were there. Aside from the restaurant, there is also a bar located at the front if you just want to stop by for a drink or two.

Food (5/5) To be completely honest, the sausage, tomato, and arugula flatbread that I ordered was probably one of the best flatbread that I have ever tasted. It had a thin crust and was topped with delicious spicy sausage. I should also mention that the flatbread is a very generous portion and I was able to take half of it home for tomorrow's breakfast (SCORE!). My friends also really loved the sliders, chicken pot pie, and mac and cheese.

Drinks (4/5) The drink menu is quite large, but I was surprised that it cost me $13 for a 12oz bottled beer...I mean I love me some good beer but that is a hefty price for something I can buy in the store.

Overall I'd say the food was awesome and the beer was great. They've got wine, beer, and something for everyone.

excerpts: The pretzel was served warm and it was a great starter to pair with our drinks.
I want to come back again for happy hour to explore their tremendous drinks menu and maybe try some of their cheese plates!
drinks.author: Malika R.
drinks.review:
So excited that I got to make an excuse to go out to the Filmore to explore! We ended up at Fat Angel because of the great reviews and their interesting menu.

This place is pretty small and I don't know what the crowds are like on the weekends, but on a Monday night there was still a wait around 8PM.  

I started out with the local cider from San Bruno. It was a typical, crisp cider but for some reason it was really really good! Definitely recommend it if you like ciders! 

For food, we got the pretzel to start. The cheese and mustard dipping sauces that came out with the pretzel were amazing; I wish I could get some to take home! The pretzel was served warm and it was a great starter to pair with our drinks. For the main courses, we got the asparagus flatbread and the spicy mac n cheese. Both were pretty good! The asparagus was very fresh and the kalamata olives added a nice tangy touch to the flatbread. The mac n cheese was a little spicy so beware! But it was still very creamy and delicious :) 

I want to come back again for happy hour to explore their tremendous drinks menu and maybe try some of their cheese plates!

excerpts: For drinks, I can only speak for myself.
I got the Sauvignon blanc (2013) and it tasted like crap.
drinks.author: Emily C.
drinks.review:
This place is located right across the street from a friends apartment, so he recommended us to go here! It was a Saturday night around 10ish when we got there. Inside was still relatively crowded but we were still able to get seating after a short wait.

We ordered the spicy Mac & cheese ($13) which was just as good as all the other Yelpers claimed! (Yay I'm joining the bandwagon) I do think it's a bit pricey, the plate is rather small but it is pretty dense so it will fill you up especially if you're not sharing. The sliders ($13) were also really good!! Definitely recommend that. We also got a cheese plate..it's served with bread and jelly. 

For drinks, I can only speak for myself. I got the Sauvignon blanc (2013) and it tasted like crap. I couldn't finish it :( and I hate wasting alcohol.

The ambience of this place is casual! Kinda dark inside. The decorations are cool. The bathroom is nice and clean too!! There's even decorations inside. This is a plus for me, somebody who has a small bladder and spends much of their time running to the bathroom. :)

Overall great experience, just pricey. $80+ for 3 people.

excerpts: This was a decent place to meet up for drinks.
They have a pretty small space, maybe 8 tables or so and about 10 seats at the bar.
I got there around 7 and the wait was about 20 minutes for dinner.
They had a few tables outside
Overall, I'd say that if I were to come back, it would probably be just for drinks.
drinks.author: Gloria N.
drinks.review:
This was a decent place to meet up for drinks.  They have a pretty small space, maybe 8 tables or so and about 10 seats at the bar.  I got there around 7 and the wait was about 20 minutes for dinner.  They had a few tables outside so we grabbed beers and sat down until our table was ready.  You also have the option of exploring the neighboring stores and bars since you get a text letting you know when your table is ready.
Once seated, we ordered a few of the items that were recommended by other reviewers - the maple bacon butter, spicy sausage flatbread, and chicken pot pie.  I would say the flatbread was my favorite, it had a good combination of ingredients.  Unfortunately, the chicken pot pie had some flavor in there that tasted cherry-like which I didn't really appreciate that permeated the whole dish.  And the butter was interesting but it is served rock hard and they give it to you with cold bread, so it's not very easy to spread.  I'm not sure I'd order it again.
Overall, I'd say that if I were to come back, it would probably be just for drinks.

excerpts: Its unfortunate I didn't try any drinks since I feel its their main thing...
but I'm happy to have tried their food because it was amazing.
Parking was fairly easy for me
(I came around 5:45pm and stayed until 6pm since its free after that).
The restaurant itself is quite small, intimate, but not jam packed.
It does become a full house and I felt we got lucky finding an empty table immediately.
Great food, great company, and exceptional service...whats there to complain?
drinks.author: Tu-Anh N.
drinks.review:
Walking in with my 3 girlfriends we were immediately given exceptional service.  2 people served us and were really friendly.  I regret not getting their names.  But they were so nice and attentive and tried to be as helpful as possible!

Looking at the menu, I was amused that 90% of the items were alcoholic beverages.  I came for the food...which can be found on the last page, hehe.

So here's what my girlfriends and I shared:

FLATBREAD - $13 ($2 off during Happy Hour)
Tomatoes, basil, spicy sausage, & arugula w/ ricotta
Although simple, this was amazing.  I love the subtle spice of the sausage, the thin crispyness of the crust (which was not at all greasy), and the arugula that paried so well along with the ricotta.  All the ingredients was just the right amount and this plate was a great one for sharing.  I loved it!

MAC 'N CHEESE - $11
Gruyère, aged cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano
I came here for this dish right here.  I"m happy that it was so spicey like many people thought.  If anything I tasted no spice which was fine.  I loved how the top layer was crispy...and yes this dish was quite greacy...but hey its why I love mac n cheese!  Be careful though, it comes out SUPER hot!  This ooey-gooey cheesy dish was a fave!


F.A.'S CHICKEN POT PIE - $12
Roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon 
I was quite impressed with this one mainly because it didn't look like a pie.  It looked like there was a thick flakey buttery thing of pastry on top and beneath the filling.  Otherwise the filling was out in the open so you see exactly what you're getting.  Just your standard chicken pot pie filling but what made it unique was the "crust".  Yum!

3 SLIDERS - $10
Beef, caramelized onions, bacon, Irish cheddar, aioli
Oh so tasty!  Simple but I appreciate it not being dry.  I love the little pickled peppers it came with...it compliments it SO well.  I felt the aioli tasted like ranch dressing..but its not a complaint.  I enjoyed it.  

Its unfortunate I didn't try any drinks since I feel its their main thing...but I'm happy to have tried their food because it was amazing.  Parking was fairly easy for me (I came around 5:45pm and stayed until 6pm since its free after that).  The restaurant itself is quite small, intimate, but not jam packed.  It does become a full house and I felt we got lucky finding an empty table immediately.  Great food, great company, and exceptional service...whats there to complain?

excerpts:
Not heaping but very filling
Large selection of drinks
Old stockale hoppy strong flavor lingers on the palate
Sparkling mead
drinks.author: Randell J.
drinks.review:
A quick review of what we ordered:
Fried capers love them
Garlic chili butter
Maple bacon butter not quite sweet enough but ample amounts of bacon
Meat dish with caprese, duck salami, and duck liver pate with mustard
Spicy Mac n cheese not so spicy
Chicken pot pie really good. Not too salty but perfect blend of creamy and quality ingredients
Not heaping but very filling
Large selection of drinks
Old stockale hoppy strong flavor lingers on the palate
Sparkling mead strong oaky flavor not too sweet but compliments the food well

Would return. Good for date night.

excerpts: Stopped by here for some quick drinks before a concert at the Fillmore.
drinks.author: Jodi H.
drinks.review:
Stopped by here for some quick drinks before a concert at the Fillmore.

Didn't eat anything here, but loved the organic and fairytale-feel of the atmosphere! Ambiance was magical with their candlelight lighting and delicious aromas from the kitchen.

The spot is quite small with a narrow bar section and closely-arranged tables for diners. This would be a perfect spot for date night or a toned-down girls night with friends. 

I do want to give a HUGE 5 stars to the bartender and (seemingly) host who's name is Derek. He's an absolute top-notch bartender here focused on providing high-quality service to ALL customers. He really helped me find the beer that I wanted by letting me taste beer after beer on their tap list--props to you good sir! I also work in the hospitality industry, so I KNOW A GREAT BARTENDER/SERVER when I interact with one.

I'd love to come here for the food next time, and considering the incredible service my friends and I had with Derek, there will be a round 2.

excerpts: They also sell "digestive" drinks, which are pretty neat.
It's small, so be warned: If you are looking to eat, you may wait.
drinks.author: Nick K.
drinks.review:
Cozy spot with a great draft beer list and wine on tap. They also sell "digestive" drinks, which are pretty neat. It's small, so be warned: If you are looking to eat, you may wait. If you are looking to drink, you may be cramped.

I haven't had the food, but this is certainly a good place to sip a beverage or two on your way out or your way back home.

excerpts: Because they generate fans who, not only (willingly) shell out $XX regularly for food and drinks, but ones who give gratitude over a public space like Yelp - even at the risk of getting a longer wait for a table on a Friday night.
drinks.author: Cham M.
drinks.review:
I aim for variety when it comes to food/drink, especially since our fair city lends itself well to culinary discovery. However, when it comes to establishments that do it well (and consistently), I am a creature of habit. 

Fat Angel does not have an extensive menu, but what they do have is a well-balanced selection of basics. The outlined food categories nicely fit one page... and it covers the necessities: Appetizers (Angel's Share), Cheese, Meat, Butter, Greens, Flatbread, Plates. The kale salad is unmatched - marcona almonds,  bacon, and the right touch of champagne dressing. No arguments about the chicken pot pie, as it is exactly how I envision a perfect savory pie to be (probably used a cup full of butter to have reached said perfection, but who's caring?). The spicy mac/cheese is pure bliss on a mini skillet. Still want more, you say? The Grape/Gorgonzola/Prosciutto flatbread is the way to go.

Are you judging my diet yet? Did you miss the part about me crushing on a salad? 

Oh the beers. Amazing beers on tap that rotate frequently based on season and featured microbrews. Some of the best variety offered in SF, but you end up liking one - drink up, as chances are that beer will be gone in 2 days and it may be while until they get another limited batch. They also have an excellent selection of bottled beers that covers a range of palates. Wine on tap more your groove? I've only tried the Sauvignon Blanc (Martella?) and Pinot Noir (Copain), both decent, but in a place like Fat Angel - with all the beer selections and so little time? Go for the brew. 

The staff knows their stuff. Friendly, fun, and - I'll emphasize this - patient. You in need of figuring out what kind to get, given the otherwise intimidating selection? Engage them in conversation, and they'll make several recommendations (armed with samples)... after which you complete your selection and indulge happily. Let this be a lesson to other establishments: It pays to have a crew who is knowledgeable and passionate about the very things the place stands for. Need I spell out why? Because they generate fans who, not only (willingly) shell out $XX regularly for food and drinks, but ones who give gratitude over a public space like Yelp - even at the risk of getting a longer wait for a table on a Friday night.

excerpts: We didn't order any drinks (aside from the coffee), so I can't comment on that except for the fact that 75% of the menu encompassed libations which was interesting.
It also can be a bit difficult to flag down your server once it gets busy; my mom needed another coffee and she had to go up to the bar to let them know.
drinks.author: Sam F.
drinks.review:
Had my last meal here before I headed off to Taiwan!

My boyfriend, my mom and I arrived around 5 PM and we were the only ones there, which was nice because we had the undivided attention of the servers. We ordered the sausage flatbread, the endive salad and the smoked trout with greens. My mom also ordered a coffee which was freshly made, one cup at a time. It was delicious!

The food didn't take long to come out but at first we thought they had forgotten to give us the additional chicken we ordered for the endive salad. They didn't forget, they just brought it out later so no problem there. I really enjoyed the sausage flatbread because the bread was really thin and the arugula went really well with the sausage and tomato. I think I ate about half of it by myself lol. The endive salad was pretty good but I wouldn't recommend ordering the chicken as a side, because it was pretty dry. The trout on the other hand was very tasty, and the greens were delicious.

We didn't order any drinks (aside from the coffee), so I can't comment on that except for the fact that 75% of the menu encompassed libations which was interesting. It also can be a bit difficult to flag down your server once it gets busy; my mom needed another coffee and she had to go up to the bar to let them know.

excerpts: I really enjoyed having drinks & dinner at Fat Angel!
and the drinks menu is so long!
drinks.author: Leslie S.
drinks.review:
I really enjoyed having drinks & dinner at Fat Angel! I had been wanting to go for a while.

The neighborhood where it's located is lively, the decor cozy, the staff friendly (they make you feel like you're at home!) and the drinks menu is so long! There are so many kinds of beers and wines from different parts of the world. There's definitely a bit of everything of everyone!

I had the Pinot Gris from Oregon and really enjoyed it. My friends had red wines from pitchers and huge German beers they all liked.

Between 4 people, we shared a the spicy sausage flatbread (huge, like a squared pizza basically & definitely good for 4!), the spicy mac & cheese (best mac & cheese I've had in a while!), 2 big soft pretzels and a huge Kale salad. The salads are realllllly huge and impossible to eat by yourself even if you tried :-D I love greens, so I was happy!

I loved the atmosphere, we will be back!

excerpts: Didn't have any drinks but the menu looked great.
Def wear your stretchy pants / muumuu.
drinks.author: Leila L.
drinks.review: Fatty heaven. Bread and cheese and bread and cheese. Had a cheese board, mac and cheese (omg so good), romaine salad and 3 of the flavored butters. The mac and cheese is to DIE for. Didn't have any drinks but the menu looked great. Def wear your stretchy pants / muumuu.

excerpts: I was only here for the drinks, and they were pretty full when we got there around 7pm on a Saturday.

There was some standing room available at the bar, but that's a small area (the place itself isn't that big and gives off more of a "cozy" vibe), so luckily we were able to grab one of the last remaining tables outside.
I will hopefully be back at some point for drinks, and get to try their food.
Parking in this area is usually tough, but street parking spots are available.
drinks.author: Amy D.
drinks.review: Cute spot to stop by and grab a drink and/or some bites to eat. I was only here for the drinks, and they were pretty full when we got there around 7pm on a Saturday. There was some standing room available at the bar, but that's a small area (the place itself isn't that big and gives off more of a "cozy" vibe), so luckily we were able to grab one of the last remaining tables outside. They have an extensive list of bottled beers to choose from, and also a good variety of beers on tap, wines, and cocktails to choose from. I opted to try the Ottekolong (13 oz, $8.75) on draft, which was a good beer. My friends got cocktails (around $9/each) which they enjoyed. Our server was friendly and service was fast, so no complaints there. I will hopefully be back at some point for drinks, and get to try their food. Parking in this area is usually tough, but street parking spots are available.

excerpts: Even though it is pricey, it's worth it to get a couple of the small plates (especially the meats and cheeses) since it pairs really well with the drinks.
Also, keep in mind, the menu changes every now and then,
so it's kind of a different experience (at least from the two times
drinks.author: Denise C.
drinks.review:
Second time here and it's still great. Definitely a small place for a small group of people. The focus here is mostly on the libations part... Obviously from the name :) The food is pretty good though (just a bit on the expensive side for what you get). Even though it is pricey, it's worth it to get a couple of the small plates (especially the meats and cheeses) since it pairs really well with the drinks. Also, keep in mind, the menu changes every now and then, so it's kind of a different experience (at least from the two times I've been there).

They have a bunch of beers on tap and a vast selection of wine and bottled beer. They have everything from cheap to like... almost $72 for a bottle of beer (didn't really pay attention to the wines because we weren't really there for wine). The second time I've went here, we had just gotten out of a very beery brunch at 21st Amendment, so we didn't really order much alcohol; only Drake's 2013 Jolly Rodger Imperial American Black Ale (how awesome is that name). It was the last bottle though... but damn that was good. Highly recommend it... if you can find it somewhere else XD

We ordered the lemon caper sage butter (maple bacon is better), sliders (meh), mac and cheese (yum!), and a meat plate with salchichon, two slices of duck liver pâté ('cause we're so fancy), speck, duck salami, and truffled wild boar. The meat plate was definitely better this time around (don't remember the last one we had), and you get a brown bag filled to the brim with bread (which is crazy yummy). The meat plate also comes with a great mustard which brings it all together. Would definitely avoid the sliders though... came out a little soggy... and honestly not very unique/flavorful. The mac and cheese comes in a tiny little cast iron with these awesome breadcrumbs on top.

I like this place for the random selection and the chill atmosphere. Luckily the second time we went, it was waaaaaaaaaaay quieter (we were the only ones in the resturant, minus some of the tables outside) and it was great to hang out with a couple friends. It did start to fill up a little bit by 6 pm (halfish full) but by then we were pretty sated and happy.

Would come back, would recommend, but really the attraction here is the drink! The staff is super friendly too. Definitely has hipster written all over it :D

excerpts: I'll definitely come back here for some beers if I'm in the area, and if I'm getting drinks I'll probably grab a small bite to eat too.
drinks.author: Keith C.
drinks.review:
Came here for dinner with a friend and was not disappointed.  The beer and wine selection is QUITE extensive and is organized by flavor (with alcohol percentages!) so if you like beer and wine, definitely check this place out.  I got the chicken pot pie, which I thought was pretty good.  I wasn't amazed though.  

I'll definitely come back here for some beers if I'm in the area, and if I'm getting drinks I'll probably grab a small bite to eat too.

excerpts: This place was great, snacks were good and drinks were good.
We got the pretzel with the whole grain mustard and cheese sauce which was delish.
They also have a butter section!
a butter section!
which I think every place should have.
For whatever reason I thought the butter was going to be melted for dipping
but it came out like normal butter that they usually provide with bread
and it was very cold and hard to cut through.
I would have liked it to have been softer
but if you are patient and give it a minute or two it should be fine.
We have no patience and inhale our food so that is more of an "us" problem.
It is also very small
so I wouldn't recommend it for large parties
but the ambiance is really nice and casual.
drinks.author: Samantha J.
drinks.review: This place was great, snacks were good and drinks were good. We got the pretzel with the whole grain mustard and cheese sauce which was delish. They also have a butter section! a butter section! which I think every place should have. For whatever reason I thought the butter was going to be melted for dipping but it came out like normal butter that they usually provide with bread and it was very cold and hard to cut through. I would have liked it to have been softer but if you are patient and give it a minute or two it should be fine. We have no patience and inhale our food so that is more of an "us" problem.  It is also very small so I wouldn't recommend it for large parties but the ambiance is really nice and casual.

excerpts: The drinks are expensive so don't binge here (a beer might cost you $10).
I ordered this one sour bourbon beer and it clearly said it was $8 on the chalkboard but the bartender charged me $10.
He fixed it for me
drinks.author: Marlon T.
drinks.review:
Fat Angel has one of those names where you sort of want to go just because it's called Fat Angel. Like, what type of product does a place called Fat Angel serve?
Since I've recently become a developing bourbon connoisseur, now whenever I think of angels and a gastropub, I think of "angel's share" which is a term that describes the evaporated liquid of processing bourbon in a barrel (before it's ultimately bottled after however long it stays in a barrel). Because of this knowledge, I thought this might be a bourbon joint. It's actually a wine bar.

This is a small joint that doesn't get crowded right away, but usually does about an hour and a half into the restaurants opening. So, if you can't get a table at State Bird Provisions around the corner, this is an alternative for some people who want to eat ASAP.

The macaroni and cheese is amazing. The crumbs on top make the dish 3 times better. This is the only dish of food I tried. The other dishes on the menu sounded amazing though.

The drinks are expensive so don't binge here (a beer might cost you $10). I ordered this one sour bourbon beer and it clearly said it was $8 on the chalkboard but the bartender charged me $10. He fixed it for me but it's always annoying when that happens.

Overall, nice place to grab a drink before heading off to do something else on Fillmore.

excerpts: the food seemed divine, the drinks were great, and the service was splendid.
If they take reservations I suggest you make one, we were here on Thanksgiving's Eve and it was at about 80% capacity.
drinks.author: Sara N.
drinks.review:
I wish I had room to try the food, it smelled divine!
We came here after eating in the city center and before a show at the Fillmore, it was perfect!  A patron who was holding a few seats let us take them (we asked a few times to make sure it was okay), the stools are made of old tractor wheels!  
The ambiance/decor was great, a rustic, vintage, watering hole that would seem to be popular in the days of Billy the Kid but with a modern flare and elegant features.  Not only were the stools made of old wheels but the bar was an old organ, the bathroom had a very nice style to it and it smelled pretty darn good (especially for the area around the Fillmore), and there is a gorgeous chandelier casting a dim light over the room.
We each had a few wines on tap and each of the bartenders were pretty friendly.  The wine was quite delicious and I got a Sav Blac, it was surprising to me that I didn't change to a red since I'm not a white wine lover.  They also had bottled beer and cider (Crispin the Saint was an option), plus tap.
Overall, I would come back here in a heartbeat, especially if I am headed to the Fillmore- the food seemed divine, the drinks were great, and the service was splendid.  If they take reservations I suggest you make one, we were here on Thanksgiving's Eve and it was at about 80% capacity.

excerpts: Their drinks are great, too!
I'll definitely be back.
drinks.author: John F.
drinks.review:
I love Fat Angel! The place is adorable and their food is really good. My partner and I ordered some butters to start (their menu features five flavored butters), which are served with bread and are absolutely amazing. We ordered three, which is way too much for two people, but we really enjoyed trying them! We chose the bernaise, the chile garlic, and the lemon caper sage butters -- all were delicious, and it was difficult to decide which was the best.

For our entrees, I had the kalamata and asparagus flatbread. My partner had the chicken potpie. Both were delicious and very well-priced. Looking back, I suppose they weren't totally remarkable, but we were both very happy with the food.

Their drinks are great, too! I'll definitely be back.

excerpts: Drinks are top notch!
Small place, so find your seating or wait..
Mac and cheese is prob the best around!!
Really love this place and have been back a few times, I even craved the Mac so badly when in town once I got it to go for the drive home
drinks.author: Patrick B.
drinks.review: Drinks are top notch! Small place, so find your seating or wait.. Mac and cheese is prob the best around!! Really love this place and have been back a few times, I even craved the Mac so badly when in town once I got it to go for the drive home ;)

excerpts: This is a fun place to grab some drinks with friends and just hang out.
I do not recommend large parties here.
drinks.author: Shirley N.
drinks.review:
I would give this place a solid four stars if it wasn't for the rude male host working the front. If the outside seats are "first come, first serve", do not tell me you lost a few customers due to me taking one chair from the other table because you are one who told me to check the outside seating and to take whatever's available -_- He made me feel horrible and I could have been approached in a more friendly manner. 

I came here with a party of three on a busy Friday night and I can't wait to visit this place again minus the rude host. The chicken pot pie really blew me away and leftovers we're just as amazing. They have a endless list of beers, wines and bar food. This is a fun place to grab some drinks with friends and just hang out. I do not recommend large parties here.

excerpts: Came here late for some drinks.
Feels like a French cafe.
Very much like it.
No cocktails, however, so I drank alone since my wife was on a roll with cocktails that night.
drinks.author: Marco H.
drinks.review: Came here late for some drinks. Feels like a French cafe.  Very much like it. No cocktails, however, so I drank alone since my wife was on a roll with cocktails that night.

excerpts: I've been here a few times just for drinks with friends, but last night went here for food as well.
We shared some truffle flavored goat's cheese and some duck liver pate to start.
Then we shared a mushroom flatbread and the sliders.
The sliders were particularly tasty, but all the food was good.
drinks.author: Jordan C.
drinks.review:
I've been here a few times just for drinks with friends, but last night went here for food as well. We shared some truffle flavored goat's cheese and some duck liver pate to start. Then we shared a mushroom flatbread and the sliders. The sliders were particularly tasty, but all the food was good. We also shared a half bottle of their on-top sauv blanc wine.

The service was friendly and prompt, and the place has a very cool mellow crowd.

excerpts: Their drinks are awesome.
The only reason why I didn't give Fat Angel 5 stars is because I didn't have the opportunity to try their food (I came here AFTER dinner elsewhere),
drinks.author: Helen W.
drinks.review:
Their drinks are awesome. The only reason why I didn't give Fat Angel 5 stars is because I didn't have the opportunity to try their food (I came here AFTER dinner elsewhere), though looking at pictures, I know I'll have to come back to try their mac & cheese. 

Tip: Come here if you're a beer connoisseur. Their menu of brewskis is OUT OF THIS WORLD!!! Whether you like them light, dark, hoppy, etc., you name it, there's a brew for you. Not to mention, our server (I believe his name was Derek) was SUPER helpful in describing all the special notes of each beer on the menu; it certainly makes their long list of beers less intimidating. :)

excerpts: The combination of atmosphere, cost, quality of food and drinks make it a no brainier five star that anyone venturing in the Fillmore area should try.
drinks.author: Nick R.
drinks.review:
Quiet possibly the greatest place to take a date in the city. Edit for hyperbole but you get the idea. This has to be one of my favorite places in the city and had to give them a proper yelp review finally. The combination of atmosphere, cost, quality of food and drinks make it a no brainier five star that anyone venturing in the Fillmore area should try.

The highlight of Fat Angel for me is the food. It is a relatively small menu but everything on it is worth taking a shot at. The areas they excel in are the salads and the flat-breads. I had never encountered this combination of flavors before I came here and was shocked they could get such quality food to come out of that small kitchen. 

Seriously all four salads are delicious. My personal favorites being the kale salad and the endive salad. Also the portions on the salads are HUGE. They should be shared by two people and shouldn't even be attempted by one person. They aren't expensive and will fill you up. The Flat breads are even better. Every time I look at the menu I want to try something else but I always, always get the roasted red grape and walnut flat bread. It is just so savory and a perfect combination of sweet and salty. I rely on my date to order one of the others so I can at least try it but it is a halfhearted attempt at best. 

Another positive is the service time. The turnaround on food is one of the best I have had in the city and the quality is always consistent. Shout out to whoever is back there whipping up the food.

By this time you are completely full and realize you haven't even gotten to the main dishes. I have had the sliders and the mac and cheese which are both great as well. The mac and cheese is very spicy so be forewarned if you aren't used to that. 

This place also holds its own as a bar as well. There is a stuff drink menu with plenty of options for the beer aficionados. The wine is pretty varied as well but may not satisfy the wine heads of SF. 

The customer service is great at Fat Angel as well. With easy pay at the bar and personally calling you when your table is ready are great perks. 

Also full disclosure I am in love with the bartender/waitress.I don't know her name but she has short hair and tattoos and is the woman of my dreams.  I am sure she is married or taken but I am professing my love for her here. 

The negatives that could knock off some stars for others are just how small Fat Angel is. It is a really tiny and intimate place and can get crowded on most nights by around 8 or 9pm. I am talking standing room only at the bar and freezing your butt off by choosing to sit at the outside tables because nothing is available inside. Be prepared for a wait time but its never too long. Also the small place leads to some really really close table set ups. You are in the other couples conversation no matter what so be prepared for people watching as you will be two inches from someone else. 

Fat Angel may have an odd name but as one of my first introductions to social life in SF I couldn't have had a better experience. The service has not dipped in the three years I have been in SF and I would venture to say it won't when you make your way out there as well. 

Fillmore has a gem that serves a perfect wine and candlelight home with food that leaves you coming back for more. Also if you know the waitress tell her she is awesome and has a fan club. This is the place I suggest whenever dinner is up to me so I am sure I will see you there.

excerpts: Would recommend this place for some drinks to anyone in the area.
drinks.author: Jess Z.
drinks.review: Cute little spot we stumbled on after being chased out of 1300 Fillmore by a rude hostess and a terrible prix fixe valentines menu.  Great selection of beers and wine, all reasonably priced. Food was great. Waiter made a mistake with the timing of the food so one came out way too early, but was kind enough to take one meal off the bill which was hugely unnecessary but greatly appreciated and noted. Would recommend this place for some drinks to anyone in the area.

excerpts: It's just a comfortable spot to grab a seat at a bare wooden table and enjoy a few drinks.
drinks.author: Eve K.
drinks.review:
Hidden, low-key, small wine bar I really enjoyed. 

Cost to worth it rating: 3.5 (~10/glass)
Return worthiness: yes

Highlights:
- Atmosphere: more like a coffee shop or a pub than a wine bar cause there wasn't a hint of pretentiousness. It's just a comfortable spot to grab a seat at a bare wooden table and enjoy a few drinks. 
- Selection: good for both wines by the glass as well as beers
- Descriptions: conversational personality infused in the text using words anyone can understand. Categories like "Chubby and Satisfying" and "Bright and Juicy" were fun to see. 
- Pretzel: warm, soft, and salt

Lowlights: 
- Hidden: unassuming on a side street of Filmore. I wouldn't imagine it was such a cool place, but I did my standard yelp check before I walked in and gave it a try.

I'd love to come back and spend more time drinking here as well as getting to try their food. Mac and cheese was calling my name.

excerpts: Just about everything here was fab; the decor was fun, the bar staff friendly, the servers attentive, the food yummy, the drinks flowing.
I just would have liked to not have had such a long wait.
Especially on a weekday (we didn't leave until almost 11:30).
But you can't knock a place for being popular, especially when it's this good.
drinks.author: Allison B.
drinks.review:
This place is fantastic. Came here randomly a few weeks ago. A friend and I had been searching for another wine bar, but when we couldn't find it, we stumbled upon this one instead. The selection of beers was very impressive, but what caught my eye - and captured my heart - was the fact they have WINE ON TAP. Let me repeat that again.. Fat Angel has WINE ON TAP. I thought draft wine only existed in my version of heaven.

Anyway, we had to wait quite a long time to be seated, which is perhaps the only downside. It was a Wednesday night. It was around 8. And it was packed. Just elbowing our way to the bar to put our names on the waiting list was tricky. We must have been lucky to arrive at exactly the same time as everyone else, because by the time we were seated (well over an hour later) it was no longer so crowded. But they have WINE ON TAP, so I was content. As for the food, we ordered the 3 cheese plate, the chorizo meat plate, the asparagus flatbread and the sliders. Being generally gluten free, I passed on the breads that arrived with our cheeses and meat, and the kitchen was (kindly) able to serve my sliders with lettuce instead of buns. Everything I ate was super tasty, and my friend enjoyed his flatbread too.

Just about everything here was fab; the decor was fun, the bar staff friendly, the servers attentive, the food yummy, the drinks flowing. I just would have liked to not have had such a long wait. Especially on a weekday (we didn't leave until almost 11:30). But you can't knock a place for being popular, especially when it's this good.

excerpts: I split with my friend, she drinks more than I do, so
the service called to her bidding, with thier Huge list of Drinks!
drinks.author: Michael R.
drinks.review:
"Fat angel" Yeah, stop thinking about cupid, and start thinking low-fi date nights,
That's what I think of it, this place is a great place to "wet your whistle"
which incredible 

Around happy-hour right before the sunsets it's kinda romantic in a smokey,
antique type of way with it's various wooden seats and cramped decor
which reminds me of the 1960's revisted, and place like this looks like
it deserves Whiskey, or some single-malt scotch in your glass.

I enjoyed the prosciutto flat-bread and the Macaroni and cheese
I split with my friend, she drinks more than I do, so the service called to her bidding, with thier Huge list of Drinks!

I personally, Had the Pinot Noir 
2011 Lupe-Cholet 'Comte de Lupe'  Bourgogne, France...
I can taste the lovely rasberries it has some bite to it and It was amazing with the Mac and Cheese!
 
Also there was this delicious "Pumpkin Like Porter" called
the "Imperial Chocolate Pumpkin Porter   Anchorage, Alaska  (651ml)"
In which tasted like "Pumpkin Pie".

I was astounded by the selection.
The service was pretty decent, but didn't really stand out,
(I guess they don't expect punk kids like Myself to have money?)

We made it in time for happy hour so our curiosity got the better of us...
I'd go back here when I'm craved an awesome list of Libation,
as far as service...I'll let you pass this time!

Just Because I think you title is a reference to A Jefferson Airplane Song!
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9A7jM-7bNYs

excerpts: The decor and ambiance is great for a romantic date (after dinner or even before for light snacks and drinks), and it's great for a few friends just to hang out.
drinks.author: Vanessa K.
drinks.review:
I absolutely love it here. This is such a cute gem in the neighborhood that it is. It's small, so be prepared to wait on a busy night.  The decor and ambiance is great for a romantic date (after dinner or even before for light snacks and drinks), and it's great for a few friends just to hang out.  Completely low key but uber chic and cute.

The drink list is super intense, and quite extensive. It takes some time to navigate it.  i saw other people eating salads and they were huge. We got the mushroom flat bread which was completely divine. The mushrooms were fresh and so fragrant. There was the right amount of cheese just to give the salty and nutty taste.  We also got the sliders which I am still dreaming and drooling over.  They were the best sliders I've ever had. They were juicy and fresh. Love it!

excerpts:
Drink menu is pretty robust, and our drinks were good, though not fast.

Nope, we just paid for the drinks and left.
drinks.author: Mike H.
drinks.review:
Overrated and overcrowded. No plans to go back. My gf and I just wanted a drink to figure out where to eat - maybe here, maybe elsewhere - due to getting shut out nearby. Drink menu is pretty robust, and our drinks were good, though not fast.

We checked out the menu, given to us by the bartender, but then...we couldn't order for 10-15 minutes. He'd literally talk to other people and not look at us. Should we have yelled, or made a scene? Nope, we just paid for the drinks and left. 

Pro move: arrive early if you want a table, especially if a show's playing later that night at the Fillmore. No reservations available and table management is suboptimal.

excerpts: Two drinks, a bunch of food, and tip ...
3 people, we each paid $40.
Could easily have a drink and share a salad and keep it under $30 for the total.
drinks.author: Elizabeth T.
drinks.review:
For bar food, this spot is great. Try the butters, very yummy, I had the lemon and capers and it was delicious. My friends tried the bacon butter which looked liked foie, and they claimed was finger licken. I'd pass on the flat bread next time or try a different style, we had the mushroom and it was super oily. The Mac N Cheese was very good, not overly cheesy and very peppery which I like. The mousse was ok, bread pudding was more like a cinnamon roll or thick french toast and good. The fact that they have a large beer selection, dessert wines, and a large wine menu for a bar is a definite plus. The decor is hip, love the diverse crowd, it was getting busy when we left at 6pm on a Sunday. Can't wait to return. Hope to see more spots like this in the Fillmore.

Two drinks, a bunch of food, and tip ...3 people, we each paid $40. Could easily have a drink and share a salad and keep it under $30 for the total.

excerpts: 2 of us (only 3 of us in my group) still had full drinks we were enjoying
& we had only finished 1/3 of the 5 share plates we ordered.
We only spent a total of 45 min at our table.
I hate being rushed like that.
If I go back it will only be for beer and some delicious butter.
Will keep you posted (if I return) on the service.
Hopefully this was not the standard for their service.
drinks.author: Ginger G.
drinks.review: Great beer selection & delicious butters. However not a fan of the other food they have to offer. Also felt a little rushed. As soon as my group stopped eating the waitress brought us over boxes and asked if we wanted anything else. 2 of us (only 3 of us in my group) still had full drinks we were enjoying & we had only finished 1/3 of the 5 share plates we ordered. We only spent a total of 45 min at our table. I hate being rushed like that. If I go back it will only be for beer and some delicious butter. Will keep you posted (if I return) on the service. Hopefully this was not the standard for their service.

excerpts: still, i'd definitely go back, and have a feeling this place will be one of our go-to's for pre-concert drinks!
drinks.author: Kimberlee G.
drinks.review:
Went with girlfriends before seeing a show at the Fillmore. Loved the location, super easy to grab some bites and walk over to the show!

Loved the decor/ambiance. When we arrived, the tables were full, but the bartender told us to grab a seat outside and the next table would be ours. A waiter took our drink orders, and had them waiting at the table for us as soon as it was ready.

I had the sparkling chardonnay blend (REALLY good)
and chardonnay on tap (okay)

We split a few things family style - prosciutto flatbread (super delish), maple bacon butter (so-so), sliders (good!), and the waiter encouraged us to split one of the salads - we chose the pear/endive - and it was my favorite item of the night! (REALLY, REALLY tasty). 

be sure to double check your bill, after a couple of glasses of wine each, we nearly missed that we had 2x$19/glass of wine on our bill that were not ours. they quickly fixed our bill, but we nearly missed those pricey add-ons. 

the service had ups and downs, bartender was great, female waitress was great, expeditor/busser was great, but the male waiter seemed aloof and annoyed. 

still, i'd definitely go back, and have a feeling this place will be one of our go-to's for pre-concert drinks!

also, for some reason, looking at the restaurant on the map in the yelp app showed it around the corner from the Fillmore, however when I clicked in the app to have it give me directions via the iphone maps app, it took me a few blocks away. we knew where we were going so rerouted ourselves. but something was a bit wacky with that.

excerpts: I could easily see myself hanging with my friends or hubby at a table and grabbing drinks.
Makes me wish I had a place like this in my own 'hood!
drinks.author: Patty M.
drinks.review:
We were looking for a place to eat before we caught a show at the Boom Boom Room.  After yelping it out, we settled on Fat Angel.

Got here around 9:30ish and panicked because we were super hungry and didn't see anyone with food!  However, we were assured we could order food and promptly ordered some flatbread and sliders.  Everything was excellent, including the wine on tap we just had to try.

Ambiance was great - just like the little corner restaurants that are nice but a casual hangout all the same that I love so dearly.  I could easily see myself hanging with my friends or hubby at a table and grabbing drinks.  Makes me wish I had a place like this in my own 'hood!

excerpts: 5 stars for the food, the drinks, and the fun

I've had here 
3 stars for the organization/seating
drinks.author: Iska B.
drinks.review:
Hands down my favorite bar in San Francisco. It helps to be friends with regulars, not going to lie, but even if we didn't have the inside scoop, I'd still like it here. 

They've  got it all, unique beers, wine, and delicious food. Speaking of food, I feel that at this point that I've tried most of the menu and it's all delicious, but the real stand-out is the smoked trout salad. Jesus tap dancing Christ, that smoked trout is the most delicious fish ever. I want to buy a case of that smoked trout and eat it everyday. My fiend described that salad as "an orgasm you don't have to work for". It's that good and it's SALAD.

Moving on....

Beer selection is top notch and changes regularly as does the wine but I think they have certain bottles that are always on hand. The decor is pretty cool too, they have a lot of pews from an old church, which adds a naughty element as you indulge in booze and rich food. 

My only criticism is that it gets really crowded and it can be hard to get a table as it's not a very large place. They do have some outdoor tables (with heat lamps) but it's nicer inside. They seem a little disorganized when it comes to seating as well, so if you don't want to wait around, I'd suggest coming early. Whatever though, I'd probably wait an hour for that trout salad. 

5 stars for the food, the drinks, and the fun I've had here 
3 stars for the organization/seating

excerpts: Will be back, but just for drinks and maybe some greens.
drinks.author: Kate A.
drinks.review:
So really FA gets a 3.5, but I rounded it up because the servers were very nice, and the inside decor is cozy cool (if you don't mind that there's a giant animal head, attention PETA/vegetarian folk - next to the lovely chandelier). 

Selection of beverages was wide and quirky, with various kinds of wine, beer and mead.Pours are small -- $12-15 for a 1/3 filled wine glass of mead... Note that spirits aren't served here. 

Menu is very ecclectic bar food. Food is pricey for what you get for the most part. Only salads are large, tasty and reasonably priced. Trout salad excellent. But spent $13 for 3 small sliders with maybe 1/16 pound of meat on each, with the thin patties charred to toughness -- also came out bone cold.  $5 pretzel was overbaked and bland. They don't serve chips, fries or beans or rice, etc. 

Outside is best on a warm day as the tiny heaters outside aren't strong enough to actually warm anything up, and there is no awning/side panel to hold in what heat there is. Will be back, but just for drinks and maybe some greens.

excerpts: Great gastropub/small plates and drinks eatery off Fillmore.
The venue is not large so come early if you can.
Great charcuterie and cheese platters, small plates, nuts, olives and nibbles.
Many choices of good quality beverages - wine, beer, cocktails and coffee.
Most of the food is high end comfort food.
Definitely a new choice for us for small nibbles and a quiet drink with visitors.
Limited choices in large plates/entree
so maybe not the best for a date night scenario, better with a group of friends sharing.
Service was pleasant and attentive.
drinks.author: Amaya B.
drinks.review: Great gastropub/small plates and drinks eatery off Fillmore. The venue is not large so come early if you can. Great charcuterie and cheese platters, small plates, nuts, olives and nibbles. Many choices of good quality beverages - wine, beer, cocktails and coffee. Most of the food is high end comfort food. Definitely a new choice for us for small nibbles and a quiet drink with visitors. Limited choices in large plates/entree so maybe not the best for a date night scenario, better with a group of friends sharing. Service was pleasant and attentive.

excerpts: Can only speak for the drinks here.
Great beer selection and great place to kill time while waiting for your table at State Bird.
drinks.author: Tiffany C.
drinks.review: Can only speak for the drinks here.  Great beer selection and great place to kill time while waiting for your table at State Bird.

excerpts: and we were craving some good food and drinks... put back on those calories we had just pedaled away.
Finished our drinks.
It was really nice.
The setting was perfect!
I wouldn't have wanted to spend my last night any other way.
I wish we had one of these places in Hawaii.
Great for intimate settings - or just to hang out and catch up with the friends.
Warm, cozy, clean, nicely decorated.
Part of the drop ceiling had beautiful copper tiles with chandeliers hanging from it.

There were lots of different types of lighting, 
chandeliers, candles, track lighting:
I'll admit the drinks were a bit pricey.
drinks.author: Megan R.
drinks.review:
HANDS DOWN best service I've ever had!

The BF and I had just got done biking the golden gate bridge... and we were craving some good food and drinks... put back on those calories we had just pedaled away. 

Of course SF was freeeeezing! But as soon as we got inside - we were warmed up! Not too hot, just perfect! We got lucky! The house was full - but a minute after we arrived a couple had just left so we scored some good seats!

I started off with the Riesling. A nice light fruity crisp wine. Yummy yummy. After 2 glasses I was definitely feeling warmer!

We ordered the Firebrand sourdough baguettes with cheese & meat. The platter came with spicy mustard, some fancy smancy jellies and sauces, and nuts. The server was so nice! I had no idea about the types of meats - I don't normally eat this type of food. But I'll definitely start! He gave us a break down of each type of meat, how it was seasoned and processed! 

We went with:
CHEESE: 
Vella Dry Jack   hard cow
Roaring Forties Blue   semi-soft cow

MEAT:
Salami
Hot Copa

AND on top of that! The server felt bad because our plate was accidentally given to someone else (we didn't even feel the wait was that long). SO he hooked us up with another cheese and meat on the house!

Chorizo
Truffle Tremor  soft goat

The Vella Dry Jack was my favorite! It was dry, but in a good way! The truffle tremor was good too! A bit strong, but very tasty! Especially paired with the yummy sauces  and the spices in the meats! I loved all the meat! It felt like so much food! But we ate pretty much all of it!

I was planning on this being a starter, but I was so full! We ordered the chicken pot pie as our main entree - and as soon as we got the dish I had to make room for it. A different take on the traditional dish. It was served in a bowl - so it had the appearance of soup - with a square shaped crust placed on top. But with a nice surprise! As you eat the dish - you will find more crust on the bottom and sides of the bowl! The crust is my favorite part, so I was happy! Yummy chicken - thick soups full of veggies, carrots, sherry, & tarragon.

Once we were absolutely full we hung out. Finished our drinks. It was really nice. The setting was perfect! I wouldn't have wanted to spend my last night any other way. I wish we had one of these places in Hawaii. Great for intimate settings - or just to hang out and catch up with the friends. Warm, cozy, clean, nicely decorated. Part of the drop ceiling had beautiful copper tiles with chandeliers hanging from it. There were lots of different types of lighting, 
chandeliers, candles, track lighting: the combo of all of them spot on!

I'll admit the drinks were a bit pricey. But not too bad & the experience I had made it all worth it. 

I definitely recommend it!

excerpts: But they have a lot of more affordable options among their extensive drinks menu.
drinks.author: Hazel J.
drinks.review:
Wandered in here on an impromptu date night. Atmosphere is great-- organ pipes, mounted deer head and a chandelier-- I'll take it. We didn't have a reservation and it was a Friday night. The hostess took our phone number and said she'd text in 30 minutes or so, when our table was ready. The "new beers" chalkboard almost scared us off-- $30 for a beer? But they have a lot of more affordable options among their extensive drinks menu. 

The place is small, very small, so if you're waiting for your table on a busy night be prepared to be in everyone's way the entire time. Or, stand outside like we did. Luckily, our table was ready in 20 minutes.

We squeezed into the corner table with our order already ready. A prosciutto flatbread to start, pork sliders and the chicken pot pie to share. We were expecting "fancy place" portions but were pleasantly surprised to find fantastically midwest portions. We stupidly filled up on the flatbread, leaving only enough room for 2 sliders for him and 1 slider for myself. We took the chicken pot pie to go and enjoyed it the next day for lunch. Absolutely delicious. Best I've ever had. Wine, beer, appetizer and two entrees? Less than $50 and enough for lunch the next day. 

We'll definitely be back!

excerpts: Didn't check to see how we liked the drinks he had recommended, didn't check in once we got our food, didn't notice our empty glasses, didn't notice our swiveled heads looking for someone to help us.
and she happily got us another round of drinks.
drinks.author: Jennifer M.
drinks.review:
I was so excited to try a new place but sadly I will not be going back.  The service was deplorable.  After my friend and I ordered food and one drink each, we never saw our server again.  Actually we did see him taking other tables' orders, he just never bothered to check in on us.  Didn't check to see how we liked the drinks he had recommended, didn't check in once we got our food, didn't notice our empty glasses, didn't notice our swiveled heads looking for someone to help us.  It was like our table had ceased to exist.

We managed to flag down a woman that i believe was the bartender and she happily got us another round of drinks.  As we were waiting for those to arrive, we wondered aloud why we bothered to stay for a second drink

The food was almost as unimpressive as the service...
We ordered the cheese plate and the sliders.  When it was delivered to our table (by someone other than our server) there was no explanation of the three cheeses on the plate.  They were yummy tho! The sliders were fine, but the meat was teeny tiny... lift the bun for a good laugh!

excerpts: Great for drinks they have amazing wine on tap and small plates.
Great place to wait for state bird.
drinks.author: Ribec F.
drinks.review: Great for drinks they have amazing wine on tap and small plates.  Great place to wait for state bird.

excerpts: I recommend checking this place out for drinks if you're in the area.
drinks.author: Nikitha R.
drinks.review: Fat Angel is always REALLY crowded during happy hour. It is a really small place that cannot accommodate a lot of people and we had to wait over an hour for a table. They have a great selection of wine and beer and a unique food menu. I enjoyed the flatbread with tomato, spicy sausage, arugula and parmesan but was not a huge fan of the spicy mac n' cheese. I recommend checking this place out for drinks if you're in the area.

excerpts: And of course, the drinks.
Simply by the way the menu is set up, you find yourself ordering drinks with a side of food, and butter with a side of bread.
drinks.author: Jacob S.
drinks.review:
Soo good. There's really not much I can add here that hasn't been said. Fat Angel came recommended to me by several different people. My roommate and I were just waiting for the right time to make our visit. We live in the area and were lucky to come in around 10 and get seated immediately at one of the tables in the corner. Contrary to some of the reviews here, I found everyone who worked there to be really laid back and friendly. One of the servers even stopped everyone during dinner to announce that two veterans of the establishment were recently engaged. The place is small enough that it's intimate but without seeming exclusive, which is probably why it manufactures so many regulars.

And of course, the drinks. Definitely the most extensive collection of craft beers I've ever seen: the menu had about 8 pages of beer and wine, one page of food, and then another page of wine. I wanted to try a beer from the Bruery but wasn't willing to splurge quite yet and opted instead for one from Pretty Things. I also tried a cheese plate and the smoked trout salad based on the reviews here and wasn't disappointed. 

Despite the quantity and deliciousness of the food, this is still a bar at heart, so it makes for an interesting inversion of your typical dinner. Simply by the way the menu is set up, you find yourself ordering drinks with a side of food, and butter with a side of bread. Next time I'm trying the chicken pot pie or the flatbread--just need to wait a while so I don't seem too eager.

excerpts: Just stopped by for drinks, but we'll have to come back and check out their food.
From the menu and seeing other people's meals it looks and smells delicious.
drinks.author: Joseph K.
drinks.review: Great atmosphere. Excellent selection of wine,  beer and cocktails. Just stopped by for drinks, but we'll have to come back and check out their food. From the menu and seeing other people's meals it looks and smells delicious.

excerpts: Great place for a date or small get together where you want to actually be able to hear the people you are with, and share some good quality food and drinks.
Mostly evening hours.
Get there early to avoid a long wait.
drinks.author: Mel D.
drinks.review: Attn beer lovers.. Expansive beer selection! Nice intimate place in the neighborhood.  Modest selection of food. A little above average in pricing.
