Great place for a date or small get together where you want to actually be able to hear the people you are with, and share some good quality food and drinks.  Mostly evening hours. Get there early to avoid a long wait.

excerpts:
Drinks:
-- Wines on tap!!!
-- Big selection of beers.
Their selection of beers on tap change frequently.
-- I ordered a Japanese expresso stout on tap!
Who would have thought that Japan would produce stouts?
And that it would be good?
And that a bar here would have it on tap?!
-- LOTS of other stouts available.
drinks.author: Jeanne L.
drinks.review:
The most quaint little gastropub!!  

Drinks:
-- Wines on tap!!!
-- Big selection of beers. Their selection of beers on tap change frequently.  
-- I ordered a Japanese expresso stout on tap!  Who would have thought that Japan would produce stouts?  And that it would be good?  And that a bar here would have it on tap?!
-- LOTS of other stouts available.  (Hey.... I'm really into stouts...)

Greatly enjoyed the food:
[[ Chicken Pot Pie ]]- a bowl of delicious filling, generous on the shredded chicken; topped with a thick piece of buttery, flakey, crust. The ratio of filling and crust was perfect for me
[[ Flatbread with mushroom & white truffle oil ]] - thin and crispy crust - fresh and light, not greasy
[[ Mac n' Cheese ]] - 3 different types of cheese, nice little crusty bits throughout.  

My only complaint would be that it gets way too crowded here, even early on a weekday.  Anybody want to join me for early mid-afternoon drinking?

excerpts: About a 20 minute wait (during which time, drinks were involved).
The drinks are priced anywhere from the regular/affordable and up to a 'sky is the limit' deal - pick what you want.
drinks.author: Peter L.
drinks.review:
Came in on a Saturday night - they don't take reservations, so we just showed up around 8:00PM. About a 20 minute wait (during which time, drinks were involved). It's a small place, and I think we got lucky on the timing - our wait time really wasn't bad at all.

The drinks are priced anywhere from the regular/affordable and up to a 'sky is the limit' deal - pick what you want. The selections were nice, something for everyone - check out their menu for more to choose from, not just the board.

Very casual atmosphere, hip... all that good stuff - it is a small place, so we were almost elbow to elbow with the table next to us, not that it was a problem.

As food goes, we had the polenta fries (loved it), the maple bacon butter, some of the meat (I can't remember the name), a kale salad, and the mac and cheese - with a drink on the tab, we only came out to $50! If I was going to exclude anything, it would have been the meat - not that it was bad in any way, but the rest of the menu is what I'd suggest trying! It was simply the least memorable part of the meal. The salad in particular stood out for both of us - and an order of that is easily good for three people (we couldn't quite finish it with two of us). The mac & cheese was more on the order of 2 people, I think.

As someone mentioned, if it isn't too breezy that evening, consider bringing a jacket and sitting outside if you want to sit and eat quickly; that evening, I think only one group elected to sit outside, the rest of us waited for a spot inside!

excerpts: I half hope that less people know about it since the crowds can be a bit much to handle, but the food is wicked good, the drinks are just right and the atmosphere, when not too crowded, is very welcoming.
drinks.author: Tyler B.
drinks.review: This place totally rocks! I half hope that less people know about it since the crowds can be a bit much to handle, but the food is wicked good, the drinks are just right and the atmosphere, when not too crowded, is very welcoming.

excerpts:
Wonderful ambience too

- Very generous with their drinks

- Skip the Apple Bread
drinks.author: Jocelyn L.
drinks.review:
What a Fun neighborhood gastropub!

- Great service: everyone running the bar was friendly and fun despite the Craaaaazy Saturday crowd. Wonderful ambience too

- Very generous with their drinks

- Skip the Apple Bread Pudding- i'm sorry, but it was really disgusting; the worst dessert i'd eaten in a while. Texturally gummy and hard, flavor-wise- absolutely flavorless. It was like chewing a gummy flour ball swimming in a plate of whipped cream (or was it melted ice cream? i don't even know)

- My friend seemed to enjoy the mushroom flatbread, so i guess the food is not entirely bad. Just the bread pudding

HIghly recommend except for dessert (please do something about it! I really want to get a good dessert there!)

excerpts: The food and drinks here are a little pricey, however, but I would say it's reasonable given the nice atmosphere.
drinks.author: Don L.
drinks.review:
Fat Angel is a good place to just lay back, relax, and drink some wine. The place has a rather romantic atmosphere, and would be a good place to bring a date. 

They have an amazing selection of beer and wine there, and the one I picked (Riesling) was nothing short of terrific. I had a good evening overall, and would come back to this place if I'm ever in the area.

The service was decent. The food and drinks here are a little pricey, however, but I would say it's reasonable given the nice atmosphere.

excerpts: We had the Pimm's cup and the Champagne cocktail for drinks.
Neither of which were to die for.
drinks.author: Sean A.
drinks.review:
Word of the Meal: CRAMPED

So the Mister and I, being from Los Angeles, are becoming more conscious about our caloric intake, health and fitness. In addition to regular exercise and healthy eating, we recently cut out processed carbs and unnecessary sugars after 6pm. One day, I just couldn't take it anymore. So, we went to Fat Angel since it was two blocks away. It was packed on a cold, dreary night. Nobody appeared to be hosting or seating people, so I made my way to an empty table and sat down. Not knowing if this was acceptable behavior at Fat Angel, I kind of went with it and went to town with the carbs. LOL.

We had the Pimm's cup and the Champagne cocktail for drinks. Neither of which were to die for. We then ordered the mac-n-cheese, chicken pot pie and sliders. The sliders had a good cook on them and were tasty. The chicken pot pie was yummy, but there wasn't enough crust and therefore, too much filling. The filling, however, did have a good amount of shredded chicken which I was glad they didn't skimp on. The mac-n-cheese was okay. It was served in a hot skillet which made scooping and serving the dish a bit difficult (there was no pan holder or hot glove to help in handling it). The Mister didn't take to the mac-n-cheese and said he could have made it himself. Although a fair assessment as far as difficulty of the dish, the Mister rarely cooks...yeah, go figure! Kettle meet pot. 

The service at Fat Angel was good, but the envirnoment was too cramped for our style. Other table's conversations were bleeding into ours, coercing silence. I did get what I was in search of - a few mouth fulls of starchy carbs, but I do not think I would go back again. A gastropub probably isn't my cup of tea, but I am sure others had a wonderful time at this neighborhood joint.

excerpts: It was obvious that the 25 people standing around were part of a group that came for drinks and did not want to sit down.
So instead of making my way to the front I sat down at one of the 10 free tables.
This place is so small with only 12 tables.
drinks.author: Chris S.
drinks.review:
Mixed feelings. When I arrived I was told to wait in the front for my friends to be seated which is not surprising. However most tables were empty but the standing area was so packed that it was difficult to cross the room on my way back to the front. It was obvious that the 25 people standing around were part of a group that came for drinks and did not want to sit down. So instead of making my way to the front I sat down at one of the 10 free tables. This place is so small with only 12 tables. The waitres which were not paying that much attention through the whole evening came over immediately to remind me to wait in the front.

Service: food came at different times, wine arrived after the food although ordered a long time before. Waited for the check quite long too. Waiters forgot orders.

Food: the small smoked trout salad had way less trout compared to our neighbor's plate. The 3 cheese selection was quite expensive for what it was. Portion was good but $$. The taste of everything was good.

excerpts: The eclectic mix of various new and old world wines is certainly more than adequate for a night of drinks and food.
It probably wouldn't get noticed by WineSpectator, but the selection should be satisfactory to all but the most snobbish wine drinkers.
The beer list is several pages long and quite a few are on tap as well.
I'm more of a wine drinker than a beer drinker myself.
Only two bartenders were holding down the fort all night and I must say that they did an excellent job of making sure everything was ok and getting all the drinks out.
drinks.author: Glen L.
drinks.review:
This nice and cozy gastropub located just a stone throw away from Japantown offers great wines, beers and eats.

The eclectic mix of various new and old world wines is certainly more than adequate for a night of drinks and food. It probably wouldn't get noticed by WineSpectator, but the selection should be satisfactory to all but the most snobbish wine drinkers. The beer list is several pages long and quite a few are on tap as well. I'm more of a wine drinker than a beer drinker myself. But since this place is clearly known for the beers they serve, I just told the bartender that I liked hefeweizens and just give me whatever they have on tap that was closest to it. I don't remember the name of the beer I got, but I was happy with it.

From the kitchen I ordered the Basil pesto, black olives, roasted tomatoes & sausage w/ ricotta flat-bread. The bread itself was paper thin and crunchy yet still strong enough to support the tasty toppings. My only complaint is that I think sausage is a bit overpowering flavorwise. It still went well with my beer.

The waitress suggested I try the mac n' cheese which I ordered as well. She warned me that it was very hot. I dismissed her warning thinking she probably has to say that to everyone because she has to deal with a lot of people who are not used to eating spicy food. When the mac n' cheese arrived, I was a bit surprised because it was hot! Not so spicy that it was inedible, but spicy enough that you really wanted that beer to take the burn away.

Only two bartenders were holding down the fort all night and I must say that they did an excellent job of making sure everything was ok and getting all the drinks out.

This place is super popular with the locals. Either get here early or expect to wait.

excerpts: The food and drinks menu is very good.
drinks.author: Vibhor C.
drinks.review:
Always very busy. The food and drinks menu is very good. Although I do think this place is slightly overhyped.

Food Quality - Excellent.
Food Taste - Good.
Food Originality - Excellent.
Price - Good.
Customer Service - Good.
Ambiance - Good.

excerpts: We sat down and ordered our drinks.
The drinks came momentarily, after we told them we were ready to order.
He got our order in
, there were a couple of other tables behind us who ordered later.
We waited for almost 20mins for our cold cut plate.
I don't know how long it takes to slice meat.
But as I looked up, the tables who ordered way later already received their cold cut plates and salads!
When my bf tried to speak to the waiters, they ignored him.
I managed to catch the attention of the female waitress and explained to her that everyone else who ordered after us had received their food, even the hot plates yet
we only had drinks.
drinks.author: Vanessa C.
drinks.review:
I usually don't write reviews, however our experience at this restaurant was quite horrible to the point where I felt there was a need to share.

This was our second visit to Fat Angel. We came here on around 10:30 and were seated after a couple of mins since we were also getting dinner. The place looked quite unorganized, the bartender was also the server and there were only another female server for a crowded place. 

We sat down and ordered our drinks. The drinks came momentarily, after we told them we were ready to order. He got our order in, there were a couple of other tables behind us who ordered later. We waited for almost 20mins for our cold cut plate. I don't know how long it takes to slice meat. But as I looked up, the tables who ordered way later already received their cold cut plates and salads! When my bf tried to speak to the waiters, they ignored him. I managed to catch the attention of the female waitress and explained to her that everyone else who ordered after us had received their food, even the hot plates yet we only had drinks. 

After 5-10 mins, our food began to come. The male server who was also the bartender made no attempt to explain or apologize for the significant delay, and acted as if nothing had happened. When we ordered dessert, they made no attempt to clear our table full of plates, instead piled the dessert plate on our stacked table. We had to essentially gather our own plates to have them being taken away. 

As for the food, the cold cut platter was standard. The chicken pot pie was quite good, but the salad was overly dressed and soggy since it probably had been sitting on the counter for a long time. The creme brulee was average. After this experience, the poor management and avg. food, it is safe to say we will not be recommending this restaurant to anyone or coming anymore.

excerpts: We were promptly seated, drink ordered taken and before we knew it, drinks were served -:)
drinks.author: Wesley S.
drinks.review:
Four of us stopped by Sunday evening for a few adult libations and some snacks. We were promptly seated, drink ordered taken and before we knew it, drinks were served -:) 

We ordered the cheese tray, sliders and some of the garlic  jalapeño butter. I felt is was a bit odd to get butter but it turned out to be really really good.  

Everyone had a great time and we look forward to our next visit.

excerpts: (we had flat breads & bread pudding), amazing choices of drinks ( if you're into sour beer this is heaven) (or wine), friendly bartender/waiter, good decoration, lighting, music (different music in the restroom, it was playing nirvana when i pee
:) maybe a little too cozy with tables too close to each other...
Hard to move between tables.
Overall it's definitely a great spot to grab a drink after work & a casual dinner!
Highly recommended!
drinks.author: melissa n.
drinks.review:
Cozy neighborhood feeling, delicious food (we had flat breads & bread pudding), amazing choices of drinks ( if you're into sour beer this is heaven) (or wine), friendly bartender/waiter, good decoration, lighting, music (different music in the restroom, it was playing nirvana when i pee :) maybe a little too cozy with tables too close to each other... Hard to move between tables. 
Overall it's definitely a great spot to grab a drink after work & a casual dinner! Highly recommended!

excerpts: Inattentive server who gave us attitude when we asked to order drinks while we waited for a table.
The restaurant was small and cramped.
They put too many seats at the bar so there was very little arm space.
There was no ambiance because it was too loud to have a conversation without yelling.
I ordered the some salami, hot coppa, and speck.
They tasted like grocery store salami.
If you want good charcuterie, I recommend adesso in Oakland and boccalone at the ferry building.
my bf ordered the chicken potpie.
drinks.author: Le T.
drinks.review:
My bf and I often pass by this place on our way to quickly's but we never went in because it looked pricey. Tonight we were looking to splurge! 

Pros:
1) good portions for the price. 
2) Really tasty and refreshing lemonade. 

Cons:
1) Inattentive server who gave us attitude when we asked to order drinks while we waited for a table. 
2) The restaurant was small and cramped. They put too many seats at the bar so there was very little arm space. 
3) There was no ambiance because it was too loud to have a conversation without yelling.
4) I ordered the some salami, hot coppa, and speck. They tasted like grocery store salami. If you want good charcuterie, I recommend adesso in Oakland and boccalone at the ferry building.
5) my bf ordered the chicken potpie. He said that it was bland and that Marie calendars frozen potpie tastes better. 

Nothing really stood out here so I wasn't impressed.

excerpts: Met friends for before dinner drinks on Saturday night :-)
drinks.author: Neelam M.
drinks.review:
Met friends for before dinner drinks on Saturday night :-) 

Pros -Lovely place, nice decor, indoor, outdoor seating, great ambiance ! 
          -The bartenders were friendly! 
          -Lots of beer and wine selection. 

I was sick and not drinking, but guess what? They had tea options......I was very happy with the Oolong (Goat's milk) tea recommended by the bartender. There wasn't goat's milk in it. It was Oolong...Not sure why it was called Goat's Milk! It was great! 


Cons - It was a little hard to find. 
           - It can get really loud!

excerpts: The choice of wine and other drinks were top notch, however the food was awful.

So yea for the place and drinks
nay for the food
drinks.author: Jonathan S.
drinks.review:
I'm really torn. The choice of wine and other drinks were top notch, however the food was awful. 

I had one of the flatbreads, my wife had the mac'n'cheese and both were completely over peppered to being inedible. Even a couple of bites managed to ruin the wine. 

So yea for the place and drinks
nay for the food

excerpts: I end up stopping by this place more often than not when going out for drinks around my area.
They have excellent bites (even dinner if you want a meal there) and a great beer and wine list.
I had a sour beer last time that was really delicious:
Echte Kriekenbier Brouwerij Verhaeghel  6.8%
drinks.author: Raina B.
drinks.review:
The proximity of this gastropub to my house definitely ups the ratings a bit, but they could hold their own even if it was farther away.

I end up stopping by this place more often than not when going out for drinks around my area. They have excellent bites (even dinner if you want a meal there) and a great beer and wine list. I had a sour beer last time that was really delicious:
Echte Kriekenbier Brouwerij Verhaeghel  6.8%  
Flemish Red Ale (Cherry),  BEL (330ml)

I looked up the name so all of you can try it and enjoy the deliciousness.

excerpts: Love the drinks -
drinks.author: Rosers M.
drinks.review:
One word: Awesome.  In a city chock full of divey after work bars, this is my favorite happy hour place in the city.  

Love the vibe - unpretentious, interesting but not distracting decor, and always lively after work but not over-the-top rowdy.  Love the drinks - the ever-changing draft beer selection is always interesting (maybe 10 beers total - just tried the Hop Wallop, very nice), the beer and wine bottle list is pretty long, and prices are reasonable across the board. Love the food - try the flatbreads, fancy mac n cheese, and the olives - all varying levels of bad for you but oh-so-addictive.  

Only a couple gripes with this place - the location is a bit sketchy and the food menu, although pretty tasty, is short and never changes.

excerpts: Great menu, superb presentation on all dishes and even down to the wine bottles they serve your drinks in.
drinks.author: William C.
drinks.review:
Super small, but cute wine bar. 

Great menu, superb presentation on all dishes and even down to the wine bottles they serve your drinks in.

Excellent service and an overall cool vibe.

excerpts: I was meeting a friend for some drinks and food and we planned to hit a few spots in her neighborhood.
We ended up at Fat Angel first for a glass of wine and a flat bread mushroom pizza.
Service was eh...something about the server girl slapping down our two menus on our table to start of our first impressions of the place.
drinks.author: Rosalind S.
drinks.review:
I was meeting a friend for some drinks and food and we planned to hit a few spots in her neighborhood.  We ended up at Fat Angel first for a glass of wine and a flat bread mushroom pizza.  Service was eh...something about the server girl slapping down our two menus on our table to start of our first impressions of the place.  I'm sure she didn't mean anything negative because she did slap them down with a smile.  

Our wine came off their tap, and the pizza came out quick and efficiently.  I can't complain about their food; it was delicious and a good start to our food/drink happy hour crawl.

excerpts: and I like that they included 'hetchy hetch' priced as free on the drinks side.
drinks.author: Seema M.
drinks.review:
Stumbled across this gem on Friday after dinner at Dosa on the Fillmore. 

The name threw me off when looking for a spot on Yelp but once we looked into the bar, we need we would love it. The intimate space has a small bar, dim lighting and seating along the far wall and lined across the front windows. There was outdoor seating as well but being San Francisco, it was too cold to sit out there. We scored a random cozy table in the middle of the restaurant. It ended up being a little traffic-y as waiters and customers would have to walk past us to get in and out.

The menu is simple and conducive to sharing. Selections of cured meats, cheeses and breads are the primary items. I was cursing that we had a lackluster meal at Dosa just 30 minutes prior as I wanted to try some of the great cheese choices they had.

My brit husband was in heaven with their beer selection. When the barman brought over the book of beers, his eyes lit up. He ended up getting a craft draft beer which was offered as a 16 or a 22 oz. The wine menu looked good but I wasn't in a vino or beer mood. Upon the waiter's recommendation, I ordered the pimms cup and it was so refreshingly good. There are cute quotes on the menu and I like that they included 'hetchy hetch' priced as free on the drinks side. 

The crowd was a mix between girlfriends, first dates and married couples. I like communal/family style meals so the idea of ordering a couple of plates and sharing over some bottles of wine is ideal.

Perfect spot for date night, intimate snack/drink with small group of friends.

excerpts: Not the best choice if your intention is to have an organized dinner, but it's great for drinks & snacks.
drinks.author: Briana F.
drinks.review:
The food was delicious, fresh, flavorful, and unique. We got a couple of cured meats (hot copa & dry chorizo) & a cheese (Pantaleo Italian goat), the roasted red grape, walnut, & prosciutto with gorgonzola flat-bread (!!), Mac n' Cheese (gruyère, aged cheddar, parmigiano reggiano -- a little spicy!), & sliders (beef, caramelized onions, bacon, cheddar, aioli). And, of course, a bottle of red wine--draft style. Quality surpassed my expectations, trendy (& loud) atmosphere, plus loads of drink options.

My only peeve: Got here at 6:45 p.m., left at 9:45 p.m., and not necessarily by choice. We didn't exactly have one server (more like 4) and honestly, we felt a little forgotten. Despite the lack of consistency and communication in terms of service, I will be back. Not the best choice if your intention is to have an organized dinner, but it's great for drinks & snacks.

excerpts: you'll want to stay and appreciate the drinks, food and atmosphere for as long as possible.
drinks.author: Jennifer C.
drinks.review:
Came here before a show at the Fillmore. Advice: don't come here if you have anywhere to be, because 1. the wait takes forever and 2. you'll want to stay and appreciate the drinks, food and atmosphere for as long as possible.

We put our name on the list and a seat at the end of the bar opened up, so I sat and my boyfriend stood next to me at the corner end of the bar to wait it out. The bartenders are super friendly and helpful. They knew everything about every beer they had. It was kind of overwhelming just how many there are. Sounds like the rotate them out regularly. Also, the menu is printed daily, which leads me to believe the menu is also rotated, but based on previous reviews, it looks like they have some signatures. 

So, we decided to order at the bar. TRY THE SLIDERS. Literally best mini burger I've ever had. If there's even a chance you might not want to share, just add the extras for $3. Also tried the bacon butter (it was ok, my date loved it) and the capers (perfect alternative to mixed nuts on the bar). I MUST come back to try some of the charcuterie and every single one of the salads. We just didn't have time this time around!

Right as we were paying the bill, they called out name to be seated. They had said 25 minutes or less, which was obviously an optimistic guess, but it was ok because I was glad we got to eat there and weren't late for the show!

excerpts: The staff is very good at recommending drinks.
There can be quite the wait for a table.
But if you just want a drink there is usually a table outside you can camp out at, with great heaters.
drinks.author: Katie L.
drinks.review: Love this place! Great beers (I'm not a beer drinker, but some of these have almost converted me) and wonderful wines. The menu isn't terribly vegetarian friendly, but they are happy to accommodate. The staff is very good at recommending drinks. There can be quite the wait for a table. But if you just want a drink there is usually a table outside you can camp out at, with great heaters.

excerpts: Only came for a couple of drinks.
The atmosphere is great.
Server was great.
And selection Wes perfect.
drinks.author: Lis M.
drinks.review: Only came for a couple of drinks.  The atmosphere is great. Server was great.  And selection Wes perfect.

excerpts: Friendly service, fabulous music, incredible drinks list, terrific food, wonderful ambiance.
We were there
Wed March 28 at about 6 pm with our two kids (ages 7 and 5)
-- obviously this is not a spot designed with small people in mind, but our server was super friendly and patient with the girls.

We had only a couple of days in SF (on spring break from Chicago) so wanted to make sure we got in some real "we're on vacation" experiences, hence bringing our children to a gastropub -- but you know, it worked.

They enjoyed the atmosphere, the kitchen whipped up some noodles with parmesan just for them, we enjoyed the flatbread and HUGE caesar salad, and the drinks list was huge, beautifully organized, and irresistible.
A great and memorable evening.
Thank you, Jenny.
drinks.author: Karen K.
drinks.review:
Friendly service, fabulous music, incredible drinks list, terrific food, wonderful ambiance.
We were there Wed March 28 at about 6 pm with our two kids (ages 7 and 5) -- obviously this is not a spot designed with small people in mind, but our server was super friendly and patient with the girls.  We had only a couple of days in SF (on spring break from Chicago) so wanted to make sure we got in some real "we're on vacation" experiences, hence bringing our children to a gastropub -- but you know, it worked.  They enjoyed the atmosphere, the kitchen whipped up some noodles with parmesan just for them, we enjoyed the flatbread and HUGE caesar salad, and the drinks list was huge, beautifully organized, and irresistible.  A great and memorable evening.  Thank you, Jenny.

excerpts:
Waitress blaming the 'Mexican staff' on Mac and Cheese that was too spicy for one of the diners (a supertaster who thought she was just ordering Mac and Cheese), but doing nothing to remedy the situation of inedible mac and cheese (i.e. taking it off the bill, offering an alternative)

Overall rating, 2.5 because I will probably come back but only for drinks and not primarily for food.
drinks.author: Liaty Z.
drinks.review:
+1 Charcuterie and warm bread
-1 Honey, cinnamon butter?  Weird, bland...I don't like it.
-1 Service taking forever, waitress ignoring us until the place cleared out, which probably led to an unnecessary half hour wait for the table and some other food issues (see below). 
+1 Delicious beer
-1 Cider out of a bottle costing $12.
+1 Salad, especially the trout salad
-1 Limited menu, but no pot pie available.  Also, sliders were tasty (steamed even) but a little bit pathetic looking and thin like half-sized McDonald's cheeseburgers
-1 Waitress blaming the 'Mexican staff' on Mac and Cheese that was too spicy for one of the diners (a supertaster who thought she was just ordering Mac and Cheese), but doing nothing to remedy the situation of inedible mac and cheese (i.e. taking it off the bill, offering an alternative)

Overall rating, 2.5 because I will probably come back but only for drinks and not primarily for food.  This place does not deserve a gastropub description if it only has limited bites and the limited bites are pretty darned expensive.  A more consistent and robust menu would probably improve my rating.

excerpts: He was behind the bar mostly making drinks.
But he was also somehow waiting all those tables, cleaning up after tables (right away, too), and doing his job with such quickness that lacked the appearance of chaos.
He didn't even lose his cool or raise his voice, NOT ONCE.
The place isn't too big - maybe seats 25 people, max.
But the place was PACKED.
drinks.author: Y K.
drinks.review:
Classical Revolution was invited to play chamber music in this wine bar and I was performing a round of concerts with CR on the day we broke ground here. While I don't know if that will be a lasting relationship, I have to say I was still impressed with this establishment as a business of its kind.

I had not known of Fat Angel despite the fact that I live 4 blocks away. I hang out quite a bit on Fillmore street - more around J-town/Pac Heights area, but still, Fillmore street has everything my Webster street lacks. I was pleasantly surprised to be invited here one night and discovered that not only is this a "bar", it's a wine bar - WITH FOOD. Great food.

On a busy Sunday night there was one man running the show. He was behind the bar mostly making drinks. But he was also somehow waiting all those tables, cleaning up after tables (right away, too), and doing his job with such quickness that lacked the appearance of chaos. He didn't even lose his cool or raise his voice, NOT ONCE. The place isn't too big - maybe seats 25 people, max. But the place was PACKED. And it's easy to know why.

They not only have great wine and beer selections (I had some FANTASTIC IPA and more pinot noir, on the house) they also have wonderful fare. I had some of the best Mac&cheese of my life, a tasty and crispy flatbread, and the absolute best apple bread pudding of my life, served with a huge dollop of real whipped cream and vanilla bean ice cream. It was a large serving of desert for only 6 bucks, a portion large enough to go around between probably three people. I don't know what they put into the bread pudding - nutmeg? But it was killer, not like any other bread pudding I'd eaten before. It was perfectly creamy and eggy but there was something else about it I haven't found in other bread puddings. It was creamy, crispy , rich, warm, gooey, not too sweet, and subtly spicy in a way I can't describe, really. 

What an awesome place to hang out in the neighborhood. Furnished with a curved bench, individual marble tables and matching antique chairs, antique sconces, matching mirrors, and beautiful, dark mahogany wood and cherry blossoms, this was a great spot for me to enjoy a low-key night with good musicians and better friends. Since my roommate and I are on almost exact opposite schedules except about once a week, once she turns 21 I have a feeling date nights are going to happen here often.

excerpts: We also ordered the grape, walnut and gorgonzola flatbread, the sliders, the chicken pot pie, and drinks.
I'd have to say, I was most impressed with the flatbread (I usually like lots of meat on my pizza, I mean, flatbread).
It was excellent.
The pot pie and the sliders were pretty darn good, too.
As for drinks, I got a nice MIkkeller stout, which was, as my server informed me, fruitier than stouts tend to be.
drinks.author: B Y.
drinks.review:
So I've been here twice (three attempts). It was delicious. I was in a party of four, got a table after a 15-20 minute wait at 7 on a cloudy Saturday night. We ordered one meat, one cheese, and one butter (I kind of wish they had a set of one meat\cheese\butter plate, since we wanted to try one in each category). However, our server made some excellent recommendations for what to order. We also ordered the grape, walnut and gorgonzola flatbread, the sliders, the chicken pot pie, and drinks. I'd have to say, I was most impressed with the flatbread (I usually like lots of meat on my pizza, I mean, flatbread). It was excellent. The pot pie and the sliders were pretty darn good, too. It may sound weird, but I really liked the buns on the sliders. 

As for drinks, I got a nice MIkkeller stout, which was, as my server informed me, fruitier than stouts tend to be. Delicious, nonetheless.

I don't know if I came in on a good night, or if some of the reviewers came in on a bad night, but I thought the service was good. My party was pretty clueless as to order, and the server walked us through a lot\most of the menu. When they got busier, he couldn't stand around and wait for us to make up our minds, but that's understandable.

excerpts: Excellent food and drinks, extremely attentive/friendly service & classy decor.
Lots of neighborhood regulars.
drinks.author: insipidphishie P.
drinks.review:
Excellent food and drinks, extremely attentive/friendly service & classy decor. Lots of neighborhood regulars. I'm trying really hard to become one. 

Update: Mission accomplished...

1.) They know me by name
2.) I got some free food
3.) They tested a new dish on me

Woohoo!

excerpts: i can't wait to come back and have more drinks/food.
drinks.author: Helen T.
drinks.review:
i had wanted to come here on fri night but ended up at maven instead.  when i was parking before dinner at state bird provisions, i ended up parking right in front of fat angel, and since we had to wait a while for dinner anyway, we came here to get a drink first.

their snack meal is interesting w/ a whole section on flavored butter to be eaten w/ bread.  my friend got the maple bacon one and loved it.  since we were slated to have dinner already, i refrained from eating anything.  instead, i had a glass of cava, and it was a generous pour. 

the space is super cute.  i can't wait to come back and have more drinks/food.

excerpts: It's nice to find that handful of bars and restaurants you know you can always go to and just enjoy the company of friends, talking and enjoying a few drinks.
Five stars all the way.
drinks.author: Eric P.
drinks.review:
I love this place.  A nice quiet bar to come and have a few good beers or wine on a Saturday night, and we finally got to try some of the dishes.  We came for dinner Friday evening, and though it was more crowded than we were used to, we were seated immediately and service was friendly and quick.  Jason and Cy are enthusiastic, friendly and quick to clarify the interesting and humorous descriptions listed for the alcohol selection.  Draft beer selection changes from month to month I believe, but you'll always find something you'll thoroughly enjoy.

To the food.  Up until last night we've only ever ordered the meat plate.  A large plate of assorted charcuterie with bread and mustard for 22 dollars makes a great accompaniment to a few beers or wine, as well as a tasty appetizer.  My girlfriend had the pot pie, which I was blown away by its size, and I had the baked macaroni and cheese, made with various cheeses, and sized just perfectly even for a big boy like myself.  Rich but not sickeningly so, cheesy and filling, I'd happily order it again, but not make the same mistake of having pizza for lunch.  And the pot pie, well I helped her finish it.  Flaky crust, hearty filling, makes me wonder why the heck I ever buy the frozen variety.  Prices are reasonable for FIllmore.  

It's nice to find that handful of bars and restaurants you know you can always go to and just enjoy the company of friends, talking and enjoying a few drinks.  Five stars all the way.

excerpts: I've brought my mother here post movie (Sundance Kabuki), my boyfriend for a romantic evening, and friends for after work drinks.
It worked out perfectly for us each time.
This is because the 2 owners (also the only servers) are knowledgeable and dedicated.
drinks.author: Annette M.
drinks.review:
We moved into the Fillmore Center 3 years ago and witnessed the transformation of this empty space into Fat Angel.  I've brought my mother here post movie (Sundance Kabuki), my boyfriend for a romantic evening, and friends for after work drinks. It worked out perfectly for us each time. This is because the 2 owners (also the only servers) are knowledgeable and dedicated. I feel at home here, truly.

Yes, it is very, very dimly lit.  This suits the cozy atmosphere if you ask me. It reminds me of the many small wine bars I visited in Madrid and the South of France. 

The tables are a bit uneven, true.  Doesn't bother me enough to deduct a star though.

I really appreciate the thought they put into their menu. The section names and wine descriptions are clever. 

Love that they bring you a full carafe of water right away. The water glasses are pretty small so this is helpful as the small bar tends to get pretty warm when full. 

~Favorites~
FOOD
-Wild Mushroom Flatbread (love the sea salt), and love the wooden palate it's served on. Even asked the owner where it is from and purchased some for my home!
-Trout Salad
-Cheese Plate
-Any of the flavored butters

excerpts: What an amazing find (yelp comes through again) for pre-Fillmore drinks & eats!
drinks.author: Callie K.
drinks.review:
WOWZERS! What an amazing find (yelp comes through again) for pre-Fillmore drinks & eats! And what a serious bargain for city dining! 

Everything was in our favor last Thursday evening.. one of those odd nights where hubster and I must have had karma and/or the gods on our side.. rock star parking on Geary directly in front of the Fillmore? Check. The last available (corner) table for two at FA when we walked in? Check. Being seated, ordering, & eating within about 40 minutes and getting to the show just as the lights came down? Check!

Contrary to reviews, service was FAST. And our waiter was super friendly and sincere. Instead of trying to upsell us, he discouraged us from each ordering a salad as they are GIGANTIC and also said if we weren't super hungry, we could probably share the mac n' cheese vs. each getting our own. We opted to each get our own anyway as we weren't ordering any other apps., but he was totally right, we ended up both leaving with a to-go box of mac (which then became our next day lunches!).  

As far as the food goes, everything was ridiculously tasty. The horseradish dressing on our arugula salad was super yummy, but the fried capers put it over the top! And the mac n' cheese was some serious comfort food- perfectly cheesy with an amazing bread crumb toasty top, baked in its own mini casserole dish.. yum. We had to use some crazy will power to stop ourselves from leaving in a carb coma.

Finally, the beer and wine is I think what people first & foremost come for; as they should. They have a terrific list not to mention some incredible and reasonable stuff on tap. Once again, our waiter actually suggested to me one of the least expensive wines on the menu, the $6 sauvignon blanc on tap (!) and had we had more time, I would have  loved to have shared a bottle. Super juicy and refreshing, easily one of the best wine deals in town. 

As a side note, to be honest, the name Fat Angel was a bit of a turn-off. I thought it sounded a little cheesy, especially after ogling the gold chubby angel that greeted us, hanging prominently above the doorway. BUT, don't be fooled, inside the decor is actually quite nice. I especially dug the gaudy in a good way giant crystal chandeliers and what appeared to be extremely large golden organ pipes behind the bar. The soundtrack was a decent mix of indie rock that was just loud enough to help mask the super loud and slightly rowdy conversations going on around our table. 

All in all, Fat Angel is definitely thee place to hang before a show at the Fillmore and if you happen to live nearby, this is sure to become a new favorite. You could easily split one of their $9 giant salads (which are presented at your table in a large wooden salad bowl) four ways with a group of friends. $2 for a quality salad? You heard right. 
Yummy beers, wines, eats and treats too, we were especially tempted by the bread pudding a la mode we saw being brought to a couple next to us.. next time I'm hitting that up for sure!

excerpts: some places have great drinks.
some places have generous portions.
some places have affordable options.
Fat Angel has it all.
drinks.author: Ruben K.
drinks.review: some places have delicious food. some places have inventive fares. some places have a great atmosphere. some places have great drinks. some places have generous portions. some places have affordable options. Fat Angel has it all.

excerpts: The food/normal drinks are reasonably priced.
drinks.author: Remi X.
drinks.review:
Very cool casual-elegant lounge in the Fillmore. Wide and interesting selection of unique beers and wines on tap for decent prices with a selection of snacks like cheeses, salami, mac and cheese, sliders, etc. Not really a dinner place, more of an after-dinner/late-night spot. The wine list is written in a fun, accessible way.

Perfect for hanging with any amount of friends, whether it's catching up with one pal or filling one of the bigger tables and getting stuff to share. In my experience it's been crowded/full but we never had to wait... it's relatively noisy but that's to be expected where people are drinking, eating, and making merry :) In its way it kind of reminds me of an old fashioned tavern, though the decor is classy.

Servers are efficient and friendly enough, but not overly so.

This is more of a 4.5 review. The only thing I really had a problem with... and this is just my preference, at the time I went they had a lack of any quality "lighter" beers. For their entire list/selection, even after I asked the bartender, there was only 1 lager that was very cheap compared to the others. I really enjoy Belgian beers, wheat beers, etc, and from a place that aims to have an extensive beer list I wanted more of my favorite beer "genre" to choose from! Although... checking their menu now I see a Belgian listed called "Beer of the Future".... I MUST RETURN FOR THAT. Further scrutiny shows that more such beers have appeared on their list, so I guess I can give them a whole-hearted 5 stars next time!

Oh yes, and did I mention they have MAPLE. BACON. BUTTER.??

EDIT: They serve brunch now on Saturday (during the Farmer's Market in the Fillmore area) and have an unusual/different selection, although you could get "normal" items too (eggs, sausage, bacon, etc). I had a really tasty breakfast sandwich. My roomie got a pink mimosa (pricey but good) and the breakfast potatoes, which were seriously good and a pretty big portion for $4! My other friend got the "Ploughman's Lunch" which is a nice little salami/cheese/fruit plate that comes with a small beer (though he traded it out for OJ, ha). Overall it was enjoyable but getting any "adult" beverages hikes up the tab quickly. The food/normal drinks are reasonably priced.

excerpts: And lots of drinks and snacks for four people was well under the usual price tag for SF.
drinks.author: Sarcastic T.
drinks.review:
On the one hand, I want this to remain a hidden gem and not be flooded by hipsters who don't live in this neighborhood. On the other hand, the owners were awesome and I want this place to succeed so I can continue to indulge myself. So, I fight down my bad angel and write a five star review for Fat Angel. 

Wine by draft (who knew?) was good, beer selection was totally awesome and the food was GREAT. The owners were working the place and I just adored them. And lots of drinks and snacks for four people was well under the usual price tag for SF.

The owners are gonna know me and hubby by sight in no-time.

excerpts: We sat at the bar and loved watching the bartender mix drinks.
drinks.author: Yevgenia F.
drinks.review: Excellent service and the food was amazing.  We had trout salad, mushroom flat bread and the sliders.  It was a wonderful way to start the evening.  The beer selection is wonderful and the place has a great vibe.  We sat at the bar and loved watching the bartender mix drinks.

excerpts: We went last night for dinner and drinks before a show at the Fillmore.
We each had a glass of draft wine (cab for him, zin for me) and they were delish.
drinks.author: Meagan C.
drinks.review:
I have really wanted to love this place, but after a few visits I have only fallen in like. 

We went last night for dinner and drinks before a show at the Fillmore. We each had a glass of draft wine (cab for him, zin for me) and they were delish. Being draft doesn't seem to make it any cheaper than other glasses, except that it is a dollar off at happy hour. 

We also shared the red grape and prosciutto pizza, a cheese plate, and the sliders. The sliders were the fave but none of it was "i can't wait to go back and have it again" good. Our total bill was about $40 which i thought was very reasonable. 

I love the low-lit ambiance (I by no means needed a candle to read the menu... ). When we got there at around 6:30 there were only one or two other people seated at the bar. I was disappointed because the last time we stopped by, we were also the only ones.  It kind of kills the mood when it is silent and empty. It started filling up though by the time we got our food. The chandelier is awesome and I love the big old wooden bar and the corks lining the top. 

If I lived closer, I would love this place to grab a glass of wine and relax. I just don't know that it is worth the trek from North Beach.

excerpts: Hung out here after a couple of drinks at Social Study.
Love this place!
Great food, and great service - low key but nice/helpful service.
I will definitely be coming back here for light bites and good wine!
drinks.author: Jenny L.
drinks.review: Hung out here after a couple of drinks at Social Study. Love this place! Great food, and great service - low key but nice/helpful service. I will definitely be coming back here for light bites and good wine!

excerpts: The flatbreads are delicious, the drinks creative, and the service more enthusiastic than any I've experienced in months.
Why?
drinks.author: Molly P.
drinks.review:
GREAT new addition to the Fillmore/Yoshi's area.  The flatbreads are delicious, the drinks creative, and the service more enthusiastic than any I've experienced in months.  Why?  Because the owners - a couple of young guys who used to live nearby - are serious and sincere about creating a spot where "you can just hang out," as one of them said to me.  

The vibe is casual and comfortable.  There is table and bar seating and a nice dim, candlelit ambiance.  The menu offers choices whether you want just a snack, dessert, or a full dinner.  

Thumbs UP!

excerpts: We ordered some drinks and the cheese and meat plates.
When the cheese plate arrived, it was sort of just plopped down in front of us, with no identification of which cheese was which.

When we were done with our first glass of wine, it proved to be almost impossible to get anyone's attention for a second (or third) glass, which was pretty unacceptable given that we were sitting at the bar in front of all of the employees.
drinks.author: Jenny R.
drinks.review: The reviews for Fat Angel really deceived me because I thought the service here was relatively terrible.  We ordered some drinks and the cheese and meat plates.  When the cheese plate arrived, it was sort of just plopped down in front of us, with no identification of which cheese was which.  When we were done with our first glass of wine, it proved to be almost impossible to get anyone's attention for a second (or third) glass, which was pretty unacceptable given that we were sitting at the bar in front of all of the employees.

excerpts: stopped by here the other night for a couple drinks and some bar food.

the place was packed and LUCKILY 2 people were standing up as from the bar as we walked in...

after grabbing the bar stools, we sat down and ordered drinks from their extensive beer list...and i mean UBER extensive...their beer list, although probably not as crazy as the beer "encyclopedia" at monks kettle, was very well organized...especially if you arent familiar with all the different flavor notes of different beers...

as we perused thru the food menu, i was a bit disappointed because there wasnt any "food, food" as i was hoping for, other than some mac and cheese...
drinks.author: Kyu L.
drinks.review:
"people who like to drink light beer dont like the taste of beer; they just like to pee alot"

this is the first thing written on the chalkboard menu.

stopped by here the other night for a couple drinks and some bar food.

the venue itself is tiny. the place was packed and LUCKILY 2 people were standing up as from the bar as we walked in...

after grabbing the bar stools, we sat down and ordered drinks from their extensive beer list...and i mean UBER extensive...their beer list, although probably not as crazy as the beer "encyclopedia" at monks kettle, was very well organized...especially if you arent familiar with all the different flavor notes of different beers...

as we perused thru the food menu, i was a bit disappointed because there wasnt any "food, food" as i was hoping for, other than some mac and cheese...we opted for a charcuterie plate, a pretzel, and some of their overpriced butter (4.50 for a spoonful of house special butter in an array of flavors)

the pretzel was good. the meats (although nothing really stood out) was good as well.  my favorite part of the food was the dollop of mustard that they thew on every dish...great flavor and it really tied the saltiness of the cured meats with the different breads on the plate...

all in all, service was cool because we were sitting smack dab in the middle of the bar...bartender was nice and helpful...nothing great here but definitely nothing bad...very very chill wine/beer bar indeed.

excerpts: We got the Cesar Salad, Mac and Cheese, chicken pot pie and drinks.
I tried the draft white, BF had the Casey Jones draft beer.
The drinks were marvelous the food UH-mazing.
drinks.author: M B.
drinks.review:
To be honest I was pretty sure these reviews were padded because the owners are so sweet. One of them looks like Wesley from "The Princess Bride" (isn't that worth an extra star by itself?). The place is also oozing with heart. You can tell this place is someones dream come reality.   

My boyfriend and I have been keeping our eye on the place for a couple of months, since we live close to it and frequently walk by. Last night (Thursday) we decided to give it a go. 

I am proud to say I am a total food and wine snob and was very impressed. We got the Cesar Salad, Mac and Cheese, chicken pot pie and drinks. I tried the draft white, BF had the Casey Jones draft beer. The drinks were marvelous the food UH-mazing. 

So much so, in fact, that at 5:30 (AM!!) this morning my boyfriend and I were once again discussing the merits of Fat Angel! In particular, the Pot Pie; me, being an borderline alchie, was thinking about the draft wine, while nodding that the pot pie was most excellent. 

Fat Angel congratulations you deserve your 5 stars!

excerpts: but I love to have drinks here with someone I love.
drinks.author: Kitty O.
drinks.review:
This place is so pleasant.  :)  I can't think of another word to describe it.  Mind you I get my eatin' done before I go out drinkin' so I haven't tried their food yet... but I love to have drinks here with someone I love.  :)

Their champagne with house bitters is delicious!  And I love to try out their exotic beers, pricey as they may be... it's interesting, and not a lot of bars have "interesting" beer  menus...

It's right down the street and around the corner from my other favorite place, Festa, so that's a star right there too.

Maybe I'm seeing this place through rose-colored glasses because I've only ever been here on dates... but I was dying to try it and when I finally did, I insisted date night includes a stop here... because we always end up at aforementioned Festa anyway.

Just a little side note; those bar stools have this weird lump in the croch area... so just watch out the first few times you sit in them.  Hahaha..!

excerpts: While entertaining some friends from out of town, we were having trouble deciding where to go for drinks.
Eventually some one came up with the brilliant idea of going to the first bar that we saw.
drinks.author: Wayne F.
drinks.review:
While entertaining some friends from out of town, we were having trouble deciding where to go for drinks. Eventually some one came up with the brilliant idea of going to the first bar that we saw. Since I live quite literally across the street from Fat Angel, this ended up being our spot.

It was really cute and cozy inside and the wine list was extensive without being completely overwhelming. We shared a bottle of red wine that is made in somebody's garage or something and it was well received by all! The best part, however, would be the service. It's a small place, which I suppose helps with the attentiveness of the staff, but it seemed our server was always one step ahead of us. All in all, a great evening and will gladly return again soon.

excerpts: Food was tasty and drinks were good too.
definitely recommend for a casual date or
pre/post Kabuki snack stop.
drinks.author: Geoffrey H.
drinks.review: I went here last week with my wife on a spur-of-the-moment date. It was a beautiful night with mild weather. We had to wait only a few moments before we were seated outside. Service was excellent and friendly. Food was tasty and drinks were good too. definitely recommend for a casual date or pre/post Kabuki snack stop.

excerpts: Great place for a few drinks and a casual meal.
I definitely plan on hitting it up before a show next time I have tickets to the Fillmore.
drinks.author: Adam C.
drinks.review:
Like most others in this review thread, I was delighted and surprised when I found Fat Angel tucked away in it's quirky little corner in the Fillmore.

The wine and beer menus were some of the best I've seen in the city. With its   healthy bias toward local producers, this joint quickly jumped into a high position in my "take out of town friends here to show off the SF goods" list.  

We had a sampling of food from the meats and cheese and very tasty salad.  As soon as we walked in, we knew we were going for a salad; those being served to the other guests looked too good to pass on.  The flatbreads didn't exude the same pull.

Great place for a few drinks and a casual meal.  I definitely plan on hitting it up before a show next time I have tickets to the Fillmore.

excerpts: It seems to me that several of the drinks on the paper menu are fancy and pricier.
This is a great spot for a date, happy hour, or stop on your way to see a show at the Fillmore.
So glad it exists!!!
drinks.author: Amy B.
drinks.review: Fat Angel is a dimly lit, cozy bar with fun decor.  It has mouth-watering eats (Chinese nuts, various flatbreads, salads, MACARONI AND CHEESE!) and an extensive beer and wine list.  In my experience, the price point is more reasonable if you order a drink off of the chalkboard (i.e., on draft).  It seems to me that several of the drinks on the paper menu are fancy and pricier.  This is a great spot for a date, happy hour, or stop on your way to see a show at the Fillmore.  So glad it exists!!!

excerpts: Perfect for pre-concert drinks and snacks.
drinks.author: km k.
drinks.review:
My girlfriend and I checked this place out before a show at the Fillmore this weekend.  Perfect for pre-concert drinks and snacks.

We split a few dishes:

- Wild Boar meat dish (3 stars) - sliced very fine, and served with hot mustard and fresh bread.

- Smoked trout on greens with a horseradish vinaigrette (5 stars) - Great portion size, amazing flavor!!

- Sliders (5 stars) - these were sooo delicious!  Their home made garlic aioli sauce is extremely tasty!

- Mac & Cheese (4 stars)  - Very cheesy.  Definitely add the bacon & onion to the dish, it adds much more flavor!

The also have a great wine selection and a cool atmosphere.  This is a great new addition to the Fillmore district.  We will most definitely be back!

excerpts: I went there last night with my co-workers to have a few drinks and get some dinner.
We had 6 folks and 4 different checks, which they said was fine.
I got my bill and was charged 20% gratuity for having 6 people even though my bill was for 2 people.
No one else was charged for having 6 people.
Not only that but the waitress just set it down and did not even mention it.
I almost tipped her twice for service that was adequate at best.
I feel that you should warn your dinners that the check has tip included and
they
they are the only ones at the table being charged the gratuity, even though people had there own bill.
Its just poor business practices.
drinks.author: kari j.
drinks.review: DISAPPOINTED!!! I went there last night with my co-workers to have a few drinks and get some dinner. We had 6 folks and 4 different checks, which they said was fine. I got my bill and was charged 20% gratuity for having 6 people even though my bill was for 2 people. No one else was charged for having 6 people. Not only that but the waitress just set it down and did not even mention it. I almost tipped her twice for service that was adequate at best. I feel that you should warn your dinners that the check has tip included and they they are the only ones at the table being charged the gratuity, even though people had there own bill. Its just poor business practices.

excerpts: I've been there twice; once for dinner and another time just for drinks.
drinks.author: Katie M.
drinks.review:
Wow, this place was great! I've been there twice; once for dinner and another time just for drinks. 

+ wine on draft? count me in
+ GREAT beer selection. One of the best I've found in the city.
+ Smoked trout salad was incredible.
+ Chicken pot pie. This dish...is...so...good...It's so good...Sooo goooood. *drool* 
+ Cheese plate was a little pricey, but really wonderful and worth it.
+ GREAT service. The bartenders are patient, funny, and genuinely sweet. The waiters talked us through the menu, answered our questions, and helped us decide without trying to upsell us. Totally unpretentious and no one rolled their eyes or acted like it was our privilege to be there (you know what I mean, San Francisco)

- Fills up fast, so get there early. We arrived right as it opened so we had great service, but it was packed within 30 minutes.
-The flatbread we ordered was okay. It wasn't bad, but I had to think of a second thing to go on the "negatives" list...sorry flatbread, you really weren't bad at all. 


Yay, Fat Angel!!!

excerpts: Food/drinks are always tasty, the staff is always helpful.
I will admit that the first time there i wasn't a big fan (was mostly due to the draft wine then) however after being there a handful of times, i really enjoy the place.
drinks.author: Dilly M.
drinks.review: What a great little spot.  Food/drinks are always tasty, the staff is always helpful.  I will admit that the first time there i wasn't a big fan (was mostly due to the draft wine then) however after being there a handful of times, i really enjoy the place.

excerpts: so it's a good place to grab drinks after work and then transition into dinner.
The decor is cozy and warm, but it is pretty small, so does get crowded.
I'd call ahead if you're going on a Friday/Saturday.
drinks.author: Tiffany C.
drinks.review: This place is generally great in addition to being a great date spot.  My favorite items on the menu are the smoke trout salad and the meat/cheese plate.  The staff are really  friendly and willing to give suggestions if you don't know what you're in the mood for.  They had a delicious triple creme bleu cheese the last time I was there, but their cheese/meat options seem to change fairly frequently.  They have a good beer/wine list so it's a good place to grab drinks after work and then transition into dinner.  The decor is cozy and warm, but it is pretty small, so does get crowded.  I'd call ahead if you're going on a Friday/Saturday.

excerpts: Sai I believe) apologized and offered to buy us a round of drinks out of his own pocket.

Now, in retrospect he probably wouldn't have paid for the drinks out of his pocket the restaurant probably would (or at least should) have an allowance of food and / or drinks that can be comped when there is some sort of mistake on the part of the staff, but since he was saying it would be coming out of his pocket and since he was neither the very rude waitress I had just dealt with or the incompetent waiter who "put our names on the list" I refused the free drinks and just asked that we be seated at a table as soon as possible.
A while later we were seated at this little window - bar thing.
I thought it  was odd we were being seated there since we refused seating at the bar and this was ostensibly the same or worse than seating at the bar, but at this point I was quite hungry
so I just sat down.
We ordered cheeses, meat, a salad, the mac & cheese, and a couple glasses of wine.
The cheeses, meat, and wine were delivered quickly and were fine.
The salad came out after we were finished with the cheeses and meat.
The food was fine, not mind-blowing, but not bad.
We were about two-thirds of the way through the salad when the check arrived.
Both of us were sufficiently satiated so we didn't ask about the mac & cheese, but it was at this point that I decided I had to write a review addressing the subpar service at Fat Angel.
The waiter who had offered to buy us a round came with a check that had taken the first round off the bill, which was nice but didn't really make up for all the issues with the meal.

To me it seems like most of the waitstaff would fit better at a crappy dive bar, where you don't need to write things down because it really is much easier to remember a few drink orders than the names and order of people on a wait list or several tables food orders and you can be more surly with guests.
In short although the beer and wine list seems extensive & interesting the service will keep me away.
drinks.author: Kelsey M.
drinks.review:
After seeing great reviews on Yelp my boyfriend and I decided to try out Fat Angel last Saturday. We arrived at the restaurant around 7:30 and we're told there was one party in front of us as we put our name on the list. Note, we didn't actually write our name down or watch a host write our name down, we just gave our name to a waiter who was supposed to be responsible for the wait list. I never actually saw our name or any other guests name recorded in any way.
Anyway, after putting our names on the "list" we grabbed a drink and stood near the entryway with a couple of beers. A few minutes later a couple came in and put their name on the list. Two seats opened up at the seat yourself bar so we sat down. Food menus were placed in front of us immediately, I told the waiter I would rather wait for an actual table, which he said was fine. A few minutes later I see the couple that came in after us being seated. I grabbed the waitress working that night and told her that we had come in first and asked why we weren't being seated. First the waitress tried to argue with me and insist that I must have just imagined to have stood next to them while they put their name on the list and that they probably came in earlier. When I insisted that no, we came in first, we were there when they put their names on the list the waitress rolled her eyes and told us that most people were fine sitting at the bar so the waiter handling the list had probably just taken us off. She then just walked away. I was shocked. She was just so rude. Instead of trying to rectify their mistake she acted like it was so ridiculous to expect the wait / host staff to do their job. I didn't catch her name, but the waitress working 5/19/2012 was probably the rudest waitstaff I have dealt with. I couldn't believe she just walked away, so I grabbed another waiter to try and get the situation resolved. The second waiter (named Sai I believe) apologized and offered to buy us a round of drinks out of his own pocket. Now, in retrospect he probably wouldn't have paid for the drinks out of his pocket the restaurant probably would (or at least should) have an allowance of food and / or drinks that can be comped when there is some sort of mistake on the part of the staff, but since he was saying it would be coming out of his pocket and since he was neither the very rude waitress I had just dealt with or the incompetent waiter who "put our names on the list" I refused the free drinks and just asked that we be seated at a table as soon as possible.
A while later we were seated at this little window - bar thing. I thought it  was odd we were being seated there since we refused seating at the bar and this was ostensibly the same or worse than seating at the bar, but at this point I was quite hungry so I just sat down. We ordered cheeses, meat, a salad, the mac & cheese, and a couple glasses of wine. The cheeses, meat, and wine were delivered quickly and were fine. The salad came out after we were finished with the cheeses and meat. The food was fine, not mind-blowing, but not bad. We were about two-thirds of the way through the salad when the check arrived. Both of us were sufficiently satiated so we didn't ask about the mac & cheese, but it was at this point that I decided I had to write a review addressing the subpar service at Fat Angel. The waiter who had offered to buy us a round came with a check that had taken the first round off the bill, which was nice but didn't really make up for all the issues with the meal. To me it seems like most of the waitstaff would fit better at a crappy dive bar, where you don't need to write things down because it really is much easier to remember a few drink orders than the names and order of people on a wait list or several tables food orders and you can be more surly with guests. 
In short although the beer and wine list seems extensive & interesting the service will keep me away.

excerpts: Sat at the bar and had olives, the smoked trout salad and some drinks while we waited.
If I was local I would definitely make a habit of it.
The guys behind the bar were super nice and the crowd was agreeable, we almost wanted to stay, even when State Bird called to tell us our "table" was ready.
drinks.author: Stelio C.
drinks.review: 4.5 stars, but I round up or down accordingly. We were waiting for a walk-in wait list phone call from SBP around the block so we had an hour and a half to kill. We found Fat Angel on Yelp. Sat at the bar and had olives, the smoked trout salad and some drinks while we waited. If I was local I would definitely make a habit of it. The guys behind the bar were super nice and the crowd was agreeable, we almost wanted to stay, even when State Bird called to tell us our "table" was ready.

excerpts: The service was friendly and attentive, and the food and drinks were to die for.
I highly recommend finishing your meal off with some of their great coffee.
drinks.author: Victoria R.
drinks.review: I have been here twice, and both times my experience was fantastic.  Although the place was packed, my boyfriend and I got seated within 20 minutes.  The service was friendly and attentive, and the food and drinks were to die for.  I highly recommend finishing your meal off with some of their great coffee.

excerpts: Drinks, food, quaint and adorable space...not good for groups.
drinks.author: Liz W.
drinks.review:
I am really bummed to write this review.  I've been to Fat Angel twice.  First time was to scope out the place, try the wine, and a few of the appetizers and see what I would need to do if I was bringing a semi-large, free flowing group through on a Friday.  The first experience was divine!  Great wine and champagne plus a delicious cheese with honeycomb (my favorite)!  i was sold and hooked.  After devouring my experience, I touched base with the house manager/wait staff/jack of all trades about possibly making a reservation.  He stated this wasnt possible.  They dont take reservations.  But if I got there early I could take over a couple tables and he'd make it work.

The invites were sent, I was talking up the place and people were excited.  I arrived before 5:30 on a Friday to snag my two tables.  When I arrived I spoke with the same guy who informed they had two reservations totaling 35 guests.  I am expecting an additional 20.  We tried to make it work at Fat Angel.  Then it became increasingly more difficult, so I took my party elsewhere.  Saddened and dismayed this decreased my 2nd experience at Fat Angel.  

Be up front with your customers about what you can and what you cant do.  Either you DO take RESERVATIONS or YOU DONT!  Drinks, food, quaint and adorable space...not good for groups.

excerpts: So, I was given the task of finding a place to go for dinner/drinks before going to see MGMT last night at the Fillmore.
I searched around on Yelp for places in the area so we could just park one time and walk over to the show afterwards.
I found this place on here and saw the good reviews so we decided to try it out.
We got here around 6 p.m. and sat up at the bar.
The bartender was very attentive and nice!
The place became very crowded as the evening went on, probably because of the show at the Fillmore.
It was fun, classy and overall a stellar time!
As for the drinks we ordered the Pinot Nior on tap, Pranqster beer, a specialty bottle beer and a glass of each of the two Pinots.
The 2006 Carneros Pinot was out of this world, highly recommend it.
The highlights definitely were that Pinot, maple bacon butter, macaroni and cheese and the truffle oil flatbread.
I definitely enjoyed the atmosphere and experience and will go back soon, even when I am not going to see a show at the Fillmore.
drinks.author: Deseray T.
drinks.review: So, I was given the task of finding a place to go for dinner/drinks before going to see MGMT last night at the Fillmore. I searched around on Yelp for places in the area so we could just park one time and walk over to the show afterwards. I found this place on here and saw the good reviews so we decided to try it out. We got here around 6 p.m. and sat up at the bar. The bartender was very attentive and nice! The place became very crowded as the evening went on, probably because of the show at the Fillmore. It was fun, classy and overall a stellar time! It was a place to go for food, wine, good beers and you can laugh in there without the whole place noticing even though it is a smaller place. We ordered the boar salami, truffle oil mushroom flatbread, a bleu cheese, maple bacon butter, lemon caper butter, bacon macaroni and cheese, sliders and chicken pot pie. This was more than enough food for four very hungry people!  All of the food was very good with the only disappointment being the chicken pot pie. The pot pie was only luke warm and very bland. Next time I would opt for a salad because they were huge and looked amazing. It seemed like the kitchen was a bit disorganized if they were busy but I am sure that will be worked out in time, they are fairly new. As for the drinks we ordered the Pinot Nior on tap, Pranqster beer, a specialty bottle beer and a glass of each of the two Pinots. The 2006 Carneros Pinot was out of this world, highly recommend it. The highlights definitely were that Pinot, maple bacon butter, macaroni and cheese and the truffle oil flatbread. I definitely enjoyed the atmosphere and experience and will go back soon, even when I am not going to see a show at the Fillmore.

excerpts: The Flatbread Pizzas are also delicious and the perfect pairing with any of their beers + wines!
beers.author: MyTien P.
beers.review:
I always love visiting Fat Angel before going to a concert at The Fillmore! They have a great selection of wine, beer, flatbreads, and appetizers!

My favorite dish to order here is the signature Chicken Pot Pie. It's more of a deconstructed pot pie but seriously so delicious and filling. It's perfect for sharing with another person. The Flatbread Pizzas are also delicious and the perfect pairing with any of their beers + wines! 

My only complaint is the limited staff. Usually there are only 2-3 people working and it might take a while for you to place an order. Patience is a virtue!

excerpts: Lots of choices for all types of beers and a good selection of wines.
There is some food that can be ordered to have while drinking also.
A good place to just relax and enjoy your spirits and the wait staff there don't hover over you.
beers.author: V. P.
beers.review:
Great staff! Lots of choices for all types of beers and a good selection of wines. There is some food that can be ordered to have while drinking also. 
 A good place to just relax and enjoy your spirits and the wait staff there don't hover over you.

excerpts: The sausage and arugula flatbread was delicious and a great list of beers that I'm looking forward to trying more of.
beers.author: Ada C.
beers.review: Stopped by for the early happy hour on a weekday and was glad I did! The sausage and arugula flatbread was delicious and a great list of beers that I'm looking forward to trying more of. I also had the chicken pot pie, which was delicious but not quite what I expected. It is a little bit more like a thick chicken stew topped with a square of puff pastry. It captures the spirit of pot pie but not really the same taste. Tasty food, great service, would recommend this as a chill spot for a casual drink or bite.

excerpts: They have a good variety of wines and beers to choose from.
The Navarro Edelzwicker (white) was soooo goood for me (light and sweet).
I think I could have sat there with friends having conversation all night with that glasses of that Navarro all night.
It was so easy to sip on!
The food came with lightening speed, which was great because we did have a hangry friend with us!
The mac and cheese seemed to be a staple and there was also butter w/ bread, but from what I heard, it was a bit on the obscure side with hints of lemon (and capers?).
beers.author: Deanna S.
beers.review:
Came here for a quick bite/drinks before heading off to the Fillmore for a concert. Fat Angel is small but pretty busy establishment. The staff really great though, and even offered to let us order food at a side bar space and eat it there (despite no seats). We ended up ordering some drinks + food and took a seat in their small outdoor space while waiting for food. They turned on the outdoor heater and lights for us and it was so comfortable we just ended up hanging out there and just ordering any other items at the bar inside and bringing it out.  

They have a good variety of wines and beers to choose from. The Navarro Edelzwicker (white) was soooo goood for me (light and sweet). I think I could have sat there with friends having conversation all night with that glasses of that Navarro all night. It was so easy to sip on! The food came with lightening speed, which was great because we did have a hangry friend with us! The mac and cheese seemed to be a staple and there was also butter w/ bread, but from what I heard, it was a bit on the obscure side with hints of lemon (and capers?). It was interesting, but probably not to my friends palate! 

Overall, service was great, food was fast and decent and the space was just right for all our pre-concert needs! I would definitely be back if ever in the area!

excerpts: They bartender was very friendly and knowledgeable of the beers - very large variety.
beers.author: Diane W.
beers.review: We were in the neighborhood for a dinner reservation and had some time to kill so we stopped at the Fat Angel for a drink.    It was surprisingly busy for 4:30 on a Saturday afternoon.    They bartender was very friendly and knowledgeable of the beers - very large variety.

excerpts: Coming from Ohio, I'm used to 400 craft beers on tap, something hard to find in San Francisco.
On this particular night, I was craving a pumpkin beer, and I was able to find something to satisfy my thirst.
Great atmosphere inside
, I will have to come back and try the food, it looked delicious.
beers.author: Bryan M.
beers.review: Great beer selection! Coming from Ohio, I'm used to 400 craft beers on tap, something hard to find in San Francisco. On this particular night, I was craving a pumpkin beer, and I was able to find something to satisfy my thirst. Great atmosphere inside, I will have to come back and try the food, it looked delicious.

excerpts: They have an extensive list of beers and wines on their menu, and I absolutely love their beers on tap.
They always have new sours, which are my favorite.
Can't go wrong with any of the flatbreads, the flatbread with the spicy sausage is as it claims...spicy!
But still really good (I'm also a wimp when it comes to spicy
, so take that with a grain of salt).
Really recommend for a first date, or for happy hour.
beers.author: Gina B.
beers.review: GREAT beer selection! They have an extensive list of beers and wines on their menu, and I absolutely love their beers on tap. They always have new sours, which are my favorite. Can't go wrong with any of the flatbreads, the flatbread with the spicy sausage is as it claims...spicy! But still really good (I'm also a wimp when it comes to spicy, so take that with a grain of salt). Really recommend for a first date, or for happy hour.

excerpts:
Outrageously awesome selection of local beers and wines
+
beers.author: Claire S.
beers.review:
Fat Angel is a relaxed-yet-cool wine bar/gastropub, perfect for a quick drink or a few solid bites. The boy and I dropped by before a nearby dinner last weekend, and had a really great time.

THE HIGHLIGHTS.
+ Friendly, helpful staff
+ Quality, hand-mixed cocktails (seriously)
+ Outrageously awesome selection of local beers and wines
+ Very cool, trendy interiors (loved sitting at the marble bar!)

I can't speak for the food, but there were many happy customers noshing away behind us.

One note (unrelated to Fat Angel) - if you're a dog owner, don't just tie up your overly dependent black Labrador Retriever in front of the place, and leave it there while it's RAINING. Just because it has a water bowl doesn't make you a good pet owner. Either sit outside with your pet or leave it at home, don't be negligent because you want to get a drink.

excerpts: I was really impressed with the selection of beers.
we were short on time
so we just got a couple glasses of the pinot noir on draft but are already planning on coming back to sample the brews
beers.author: Melissa R.
