beers.review: stopped in since we were early for a reservation near by. I was really impressed with the selection of beers. we were short on time so we just got a couple glasses of the pinot noir on draft but are already planning on coming back to sample the brews

excerpts: beers are arranged according to your taste: light, crisp, heavy, dark.
beers.author: Janice C.
beers.review:
Praise the Lord, hallelujah!

I haven't gone to church in a long time, but I sing praises when it is warranted. Fat Angel makes me sing from the heart.

This sweet, angelic spot exudes upscale lodge with a casual chic feel: marble bar, pew style booth seating and a handsome wall holding some crafted brews and carefully chosen vino. Don't mind the imposing Moosehead hanging above, Rocky and Bullwinkle totally approve.

Fat Angel seamlessly blends fantastic wine bar food with excellent tipples. The menu is 90% alcohol (as it should be!) beers are arranged according to your taste: light, crisp, heavy, dark. Same for the wines and for those who aren't feeling both, they offer several aperitifs as well. 

It felt a little stuffy inside because of the rain, otherwise, I can imagine sitting here for hours on a warm SF night with the bay windows wide open. A crisp and zesty Picpoul was affordably priced at $8/glass.  My gf loves Riesling and this one from Kabinett is a richer style with sweetness in the end.  Of course, you can't go wrong with a Hefeweizen (Ayinger) or a dark stout like Double Chocolate Stout from England or a breakfast stout from Mikeller Bar (the Danes KNOW beer!)

All this imbibing made us hungry: we devoured an excellent meat board with speck, salami and duck terrine. On the board were also FLAVORED BUTTERS like maple bacon and Philz coffee. You wouldn't be able to resist spreading these on toast! The flatbread pizzas are pleasingly light, even with rich toppings such as gorgonzola, prosciutto and grapes on it. The chicken pot pie had a really flaky crust, but I didn't taste anything special about the tarragon cream sauce. 

Hark the herald angels sing and glory to ... the genius who brought Fat Angel to San Francisco. Let's say Amen to that!

excerpts:
Extensive beer list (100+ super local beers) - check
Friendly elk greeting from the wall - check
(optional) Christmas tree with Polaroid pictures of the patrons - check
beers.author: Sebastian F.
beers.review:
This place is awesome. 

Extensive beer list (100+ super local beers) - check
Friendly elk greeting from the wall - check
(optional) Christmas tree with Polaroid pictures of the patrons - check

The super friendly gals working at the bar will seat you quickly in this intimite but yet lively place. You might be surprised that the beer/wine selection takes about 90% of the menu but this is a wine bar after all. However, also come here for the food as it's delicious!

The FLATBREAD PIZZA comes in various styles (Firebrand sourdough baguette and whole grain mustard with chorizo, duck salami, genoa, pheasant terrine, speck, or soppressata, $5-$28) and is worth every penny - most delicious topped sourdough I've had in a while, and super crispy.

The SOURDOUGH & BUTTER ($5) satisfies in a special kinda way - have you tried Philz Cofffee butter or Maple Bacon butter? I bet you haven't. Go order.

Finally, the CHICKEN POT PIE (roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon, $13) was creamy and had a sweet hint to it. Marvelous.

Fat Angel - a pleasant surprise in the lower Fillmore area. Stay where you are, angel. I'll be back.

excerpts: We settled on a range of beers and cocktails and splurged on the sausage flatbread, the pretzel with cheese sauce, and the spicy mac & cheese.
There's a wide range of beers and ciders that go from an easy $9 to well over $20 due to sizes and alcohol percent
and it's easy to not notice.
* spicy mac&cheese isn't really spicy.
I'm super sensitive to heat
and
yeah...
this was not spicy at all.
beers.author: Cassandra J.
beers.review:
We came here directly after a matinee showing at the Kabuki in Japantown, right as the pub was opening so we had our pick of seats and it wasn't crowded at all (so a good time to show up is right at 4pm). With a wide range of beer, cider and cocktails to choose from, plus small plates of all sorts, we were quite overwhelmed with what to choose from. We settled on a range of beers and cocktails and splurged on the sausage flatbread, the pretzel with cheese sauce, and the spicy mac & cheese.

Suffice to say, the food was absolutely delicious and we came out pretty full and tipsy. 

A few observations to make note of: 
* watch the prices on the drinks. There's a wide range of beers and ciders that go from an easy $9 to well over $20 due to sizes and alcohol percent and it's easy to not notice.
* spicy mac&cheese isn't really spicy. I'm super sensitive to heat and yeah... this was not spicy at all. 
* if you're careful on the drink costs, it's actually really decently priced overall (came to about $60 for the two of us and that was with two drinks apiece).

We'd definitely be happy to return for more samplings of food and drinks.

excerpts: Both beers were smooth and perfect with the food.
beers.author: Amy D.
beers.review: I have to admit I'm not a beer drinker but Fat Angel has converted me. I had A Golden State of Mind on tap with my dinner then a chocolate beer with dessert. Both beers were smooth and perfect with the food. My friend and I shared a kale salad and the chicken pot pie. We had chocolate cake for dessert. The atmosphere and service were real easy and enjoyable.

excerpts: Occasionally they run out of beers and the selection of tap beer can be limited.
They make up for this with a huge selection of bottled beers listed by type in their menu.
beers.author: Paul W.
beers.review:
I figured I should write a more comprehensive review for fat angel considering it's one if my favorite spots. This place is what a gastro pub should be. Great beer and wine selection and delicious consistent food. It is quite small and very popular.  The combination of small and popular is actually the major drawback of the place.  They do not take reservations so wait times can be upwards of 1-2 hours at times if you want a table for dinner.  You can put your name on a list and they will text you when a table becomes available, but this system may not be ideal for some. Also considering that some people order food and then sit at tables for hours drinking after dinner makes it difficult for the staff to accurately predict wait times.  Also since they have outdoor seating, weather becomes a variable in that on nice days their seating capacity almost doubles.  

The staff is always very friendly and do their best to accommodate given the limitations listed above.  They are understandably in a tricky situation and there is no great way to make everyone happy!  

When you walk in there is a chalkboard that lists the beer and wine on tap. This is an ever changing selection which is great. Occasionally they run out of beers and the selection of tap beer can be limited. They make up for this with a huge selection of bottled beers listed by type in their menu. 

Just about everything on the food menu is awesome. My favorites are the maple bacon butter, kale salad with chicken, all of the flat breads, and the sliders. These all seem to pair perfectly with the beer.

excerpts: so we grabbed beers and sat down until our table was ready.
You also have the option of exploring the neighboring stores and bars since you get a text letting you know when your table is ready.
beers.author: Gloria N.
beers.review:
This was a decent place to meet up for drinks.  They have a pretty small space, maybe 8 tables or so and about 10 seats at the bar.  I got there around 7 and the wait was about 20 minutes for dinner.  They had a few tables outside so we grabbed beers and sat down until our table was ready.  You also have the option of exploring the neighboring stores and bars since you get a text letting you know when your table is ready.
Once seated, we ordered a few of the items that were recommended by other reviewers - the maple bacon butter, spicy sausage flatbread, and chicken pot pie.  I would say the flatbread was my favorite, it had a good combination of ingredients.  Unfortunately, the chicken pot pie had some flavor in there that tasted cherry-like which I didn't really appreciate that permeated the whole dish.  And the butter was interesting but it is served rock hard and they give it to you with cold bread, so it's not very easy to spread.  I'm not sure I'd order it again.
Overall, I'd say that if I were to come back, it would probably be just for drinks.

excerpts: It staved off our hunger well and paired well with the dark Belgian beers we were trying.
beers.author: Saminda W.
beers.review:
Small place with a long wait but generally worth it.  Terrific food, decent beer selection, and friendly service; that's a nice trifecta.

While we waited for our table (about 40 mins), we tried their charcuterie plate with a nice assortment of cheeses.  It staved off our hunger well and paired well with the dark Belgian beers we were trying.

When we finally sat down, we were still ravenous and the four of us ordered almost everything on the menu:

1) Flatbread with roasted red grape, walnut & prosciutto w/ gorgonzola - epic, still can remember the savory flavor
2) Flatbread with tomato, spicy sausage & arugula w/ parmesan - equally epic, the flavors came together so well
3) Mac n' Cheese with gruyère, cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano, cayenne - spicy, creamy goodness. Yum.
4) Chicken pot pie with roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon - solid, hearty pot pie.  No complaints. 
5) Sliders with beef, caramelized onions, bacon, irish cheddar, aioli - only misfire of the whole meal, meat was dry and not really flavorful and the trimmings didn't make up for it.  

Overall, really impressed.  If only they had more tables!

excerpts: There are beers for people who speak of Trappist monks and hidden abbeys-special brews from round the world of which I know nothing, but whose stories are told by the lips of those who know.
The food is warm, and stands alone from the libations.
When a patron ordered a bread pudding, the whole place smelled wonderful.
I like places that are small enough that you are attune to what others are enjoying.
Fat Angel passes that test.
Everyone was piqued by this warm and fragrant dessert, which evoked as many memories as that damn Proustian madeline.
beers.author: Joanna M.
beers.review:
I used to have a recurring dream that I owned a restaurant in Moscow that was interior decorated like a hunting lodge. Every night I was shaken down by mafia-governement workers, threatening to revoke my health permit unless I give them a cut of my profits. It was a beautiful place, very dark with a brown and mahogany color scheme. This was before the whole lodge thing was en vogue. I'd like to think that my dreamscape is ahead of the times.

Fat Angel kind of looks like the place in my dreams, but it's lighter, better decorated, and just cooler, without being too cool. There are animals overhead, a pipe organ, a beautiful bar, and, in contrast to my dingy and dreary nightmare, it's light filled and sunny-even if the streets are shrouded in fog. 

I could see myself here on the regular. Wine on tap-in particular a robust Pinot. There are beers for people who speak of Trappist monks and hidden abbeys-special brews from round the world of which I know nothing, but whose stories are told by the lips of those who know. The food is warm, and stands alone from the libations. When a patron ordered a bread pudding, the whole place smelled wonderful. I like places that are small enough that you are attune to what others are enjoying. Fat Angel passes that test. Everyone was piqued by this warm and fragrant dessert, which evoked as many memories as that damn Proustian madeline. Warm and spiced apples can always tap into your past.

There will be no shake downs at Fat Angel. The people here are truly lovely.

excerpts: The variety of beers is also impressive, but what I loved about Fat Angel and what elevated it to 5 stars for me, was that they also offered a $3 can of Hamm's.
beers.author: Andres B.
beers.review:
Our group stumbled in hungry and wanting more drink. Fat Angel delivered on both fronts. 

We ate the spicy mac n' cheese, tried the maple bacon & lemon sage butters, and ate a prosciutto fig flatbread. Everything was unique, mind-blowingly good, and something I couldn't make in my own kitchen in a million years. The variety of beers is also impressive, but what I loved about Fat Angel and what elevated it to 5 stars for me, was that they also offered a $3 can of Hamm's. Because sometimes you just want some Hamm's with your boojie flatbreads. 

A gem in Japantown for sure, check this place out right away.

excerpts: I sampled five great Paradox beers and on another night 5 Bruery beers poured from bottles.
(They had fifteen hard to find beers to choose from, so I had to narrow it down to one sample of five.)
beers.author: Victoria O.
beers.review:
I love, love, love Fat Angel. It is a hidden (or not so hidden) gem of San Francisco. It is right off of Fillmore, it is a great spot if you are in the neighborhood. I've been going for about four years, and every time I go I find another great menu item. Mind you the menu is only one page (we aren't talking Cheesecake Factory selections) so hard to believe that I haven't tried it all. But on my last visit I discovered the Chicken Pot Pie. Divine! It may have been my first time trying it, but it certainly won't be my last. It is an open bowl of Chicken, carrots, peas, potatoes and the perfect amount of gravy and spices with a nice layer of buttery, flakey crust on the bottom and backed to perfection on the top. Man, I want to go back today just to try it again. It is almost sweet (in a good way) so I do recommend sprinkling with salt and pepper. 

They always have a kick bootie beer selection. And definitely keep them on the radar during sf beer week. Every evening they have a different delicious offering. I sampled five great Paradox beers and on another night 5 Bruery beers poured from bottles. (They had fifteen hard to find beers to choose from, so I had to narrow it down to one sample of five.)

Our fall back food options have always been the bread with flavored butters. The most recent flavors were Bernaise, Chive, Chili, Maple Bacon and Molasses. You can try one for $5.50, three for $15 or all five for I think $25. That is a lot of butter, but I did feel compelled to try them all once and take home the left overs. This last time the Bernaise butter was my favorite. Delish.

We also love their flatbreads, toppings change seasonally. Most recently we tried the butternut squash and kale. Perfect!

And the mac n cheese, is great. Has a tangy hardier taste with the perfect amount of sauce to crunch ratio.

Sometimes the prices can get a little steep if you don't pay attention when ordering, you think it may be a quick bite of food and a beer from your local gastropub, and next thing you know your tab is $90. But you can't blame them for having too many awesome things to order! 

I would like to have cold ice water, luke warm water is the worst. And a few veggie sides and sweet options. But this place is a great go to spot.

excerpts: Great selection of beers and wine, some unique and high end ones, and the food was amazing.
beers.author: Jaclyn C.
beers.review: Great selection of beers and wine, some unique and high end ones, and the food was amazing. We had chicken pot pie and asparagus flatbread with beer and wine. Both were so fresh and well flavored that I still thought about them for a few days. Could get crowded in the evening, but worth waiting for a bit and coming back.

excerpts: Tons and tons of beers on tap and their food, though the menu wasn't any thing out of the ordinary, was fantastic.
beers.author: Peter T.
beers.review:
Sure, their website leaves much to be desired but this place was such a treat! Tons and tons of beers on tap and their food, though the menu wasn't any thing out of the ordinary, was fantastic.

Fat Angel is quite a small venue so I wouldn't plan on bringing more than 1 or 2 other people if you want to be comfortable. Though its small, there are generally only 2-3 people working during dining service. The servers are super friendly, but it can take a moment to get things done. I would definitely order everything at once.

The sliders were really good. The meat is flattened so it comes off as a white castle slider but of San Francisco caliber, of course.

That tomato spicy sausage flatbread put a huge smile on my face.

And that maple bacon butter put a smile in my heart.

Would recommend, would return!

excerpts:
August 4, 2014

Wonderful little place with an exciting menu to go along with a really good selection of craft beers and wine on tap.
beers.author: Dave W.
beers.review:
August 4, 2014

Wonderful little place with an exciting menu to go along with a really good selection of craft beers and wine on tap. We were looking for a light meal and started with an order of the Sweet and Spicy Chinese Nuts. Then we ordered 3 sides of BUTTER! That's right, Fat Angel has flavored butters with endless bread. We had the Maple Bacon, Honey and Lemon Caper Sage butters. Amazingly good! We then proceeded to order their Mac & Cheese and Sliders. Everything was quite good.

excerpts: Tons of wonderful wine and beers on draught!
beers.author: Jaching H.
beers.review:
Tons of wonderful wine and beers on draught!

The trout salad with horseradish dressing is like no other. I could eat this every day.  The kale salad is also amazing.

Skip the spicy mac and cheese.  The heat comes from cayenne, but it ends us tasting like tabasco sauce, which just isn't that interesting to me. 

There is wonderful outdoor seating in front with heat lamps and a view of the palm trees across the street.  So very California. 

I love this place and am quickly becoming a regular!

excerpts: Oh the beers.
Amazing beers on tap that rotate frequently based on season and featured microbrews.
Some of the best variety offered in SF, but you end up liking one - drink up, as chances are that beer will be gone in 2 days and it may be while until they get another limited batch.
They also have an excellent selection of bottled beers that covers a range of palates.
Wine on tap more your groove?
I've only tried the Sauvignon Blanc (Martella?) and Pinot Noir (Copain), both decent, but in a place like Fat Angel - with all the beer selections and so little time?
beers.author: Cham M.
beers.review:
I aim for variety when it comes to food/drink, especially since our fair city lends itself well to culinary discovery. However, when it comes to establishments that do it well (and consistently), I am a creature of habit. 

Fat Angel does not have an extensive menu, but what they do have is a well-balanced selection of basics. The outlined food categories nicely fit one page... and it covers the necessities: Appetizers (Angel's Share), Cheese, Meat, Butter, Greens, Flatbread, Plates. The kale salad is unmatched - marcona almonds,  bacon, and the right touch of champagne dressing. No arguments about the chicken pot pie, as it is exactly how I envision a perfect savory pie to be (probably used a cup full of butter to have reached said perfection, but who's caring?). The spicy mac/cheese is pure bliss on a mini skillet. Still want more, you say? The Grape/Gorgonzola/Prosciutto flatbread is the way to go.

Are you judging my diet yet? Did you miss the part about me crushing on a salad? 

Oh the beers. Amazing beers on tap that rotate frequently based on season and featured microbrews. Some of the best variety offered in SF, but you end up liking one - drink up, as chances are that beer will be gone in 2 days and it may be while until they get another limited batch. They also have an excellent selection of bottled beers that covers a range of palates. Wine on tap more your groove? I've only tried the Sauvignon Blanc (Martella?) and Pinot Noir (Copain), both decent, but in a place like Fat Angel - with all the beer selections and so little time? Go for the brew. 

The staff knows their stuff. Friendly, fun, and - I'll emphasize this - patient. You in need of figuring out what kind to get, given the otherwise intimidating selection? Engage them in conversation, and they'll make several recommendations (armed with samples)... after which you complete your selection and indulge happily. Let this be a lesson to other establishments: It pays to have a crew who is knowledgeable and passionate about the very things the place stands for. Need I spell out why? Because they generate fans who, not only (willingly) shell out $XX regularly for food and drinks, but ones who give gratitude over a public space like Yelp - even at the risk of getting a longer wait for a table on a Friday night.

excerpts: There are so many kinds of beers and wines from different parts of the world.
My friends had red wines from pitchers and huge German beers they all liked.
beers.author: Leslie S.
beers.review:
I really enjoyed having drinks & dinner at Fat Angel! I had been wanting to go for a while.

The neighborhood where it's located is lively, the decor cozy, the staff friendly (they make you feel like you're at home!) and the drinks menu is so long! There are so many kinds of beers and wines from different parts of the world. There's definitely a bit of everything of everyone!

I had the Pinot Gris from Oregon and really enjoyed it. My friends had red wines from pitchers and huge German beers they all liked.

Between 4 people, we shared a the spicy sausage flatbread (huge, like a squared pizza basically & definitely good for 4!), the spicy mac & cheese (best mac & cheese I've had in a while!), 2 big soft pretzels and a huge Kale salad. The salads are realllllly huge and impossible to eat by yourself even if you tried :-D I love greens, so I was happy!

I loved the atmosphere, we will be back!

excerpts: Next time I'd look forward to tasting the flatbread, butters, and another couple of the great number of beers in their selection.
beers.author: Angelica D.
beers.review:
Tuesday night, lookin' for a place to grab a bite to eat before our 7:30 show at Yoshi's. 

Enter: Fat Angel

They advertise on their signboards that they serve "comfort food," and based on what we ate that night, we can attest to it.

-The trout salad ($13, with fried capers and horseradish vinaigrette!) came in a ginormous bowl of greens--it had a smoky flavor, but not too overpowering.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?select=XZ_CcFthXlHWNsBuHMDA-A#XZ_CcFthXlHWNsBuHMDA-A
-And the spicy mac and cheese ($12)? Score. It had a kick to it, and made a nice addition to the salad
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?select=_8Kn54WNyVzDO16hkUhldQ#_8Kn54WNyVzDO16hkUhldQ

-Beers ($1 off for happy hour at 7p is a great plus!): http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/jr7SvnjeveE-xnq66ztvTA/l.jpg
the Rugbrod from the Brewery ($8.50) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?userid=CxWcGXtQSRJn6_C241xC9A#11IDrbb8j88xBG_L7Z6RRQ
the Moscow rye Russian imperial stout by Midnight Sun ($8): http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?userid=CxWcGXtQSRJn6_C241xC9A#7hm0cVcqEhgBeRWl4J57CQ

The ambiance seemed like standard gastropub fare. The lights were turned down low (great for dates), but the tables felt too close to one another. I could've probably reached over to the folks next to us and copped some of their bread. 

Next time I'd look forward to tasting the flatbread, butters, and another couple of the great number of beers in their selection.

excerpts: They have an extensive list of bottled beers to choose from, and also a good variety of beers on tap, wines, and cocktails to choose from.
I opted to try the Ottekolong (13 oz, $8.75) on draft, which was a good beer.
My friends got cocktails (around $9/each) which they enjoyed.
Our server was friendly and service was fast, so no complaints there.
beers.author: Amy D.
beers.review: Cute spot to stop by and grab a drink and/or some bites to eat. I was only here for the drinks, and they were pretty full when we got there around 7pm on a Saturday. There was some standing room available at the bar, but that's a small area (the place itself isn't that big and gives off more of a "cozy" vibe), so luckily we were able to grab one of the last remaining tables outside. They have an extensive list of bottled beers to choose from, and also a good variety of beers on tap, wines, and cocktails to choose from. I opted to try the Ottekolong (13 oz, $8.75) on draft, which was a good beer. My friends got cocktails (around $9/each) which they enjoyed. Our server was friendly and service was fast, so no complaints there. I will hopefully be back at some point for drinks, and get to try their food. Parking in this area is usually tough, but street parking spots are available.

excerpts: I truly enjoy unpretentious eateries that serve solid food and have a good variety of unique beers and great wines.
beers.author: Adena B.
beers.review:
I truly enjoy unpretentious eateries that serve solid food and have a good variety of unique beers and great wines. Fat Angel is exactly that.

The place is fairly small, so when we showed up around 7:30pm on a weekday, we were made to wait about 20 minutes. Not a problem as we ordered a drink at the bar, and stood outside, away from the crowds and in the fresh air.

When we were seated, we were thanked for our patience, and ordered:
+Mac 'n' cheese ($11): with gruyère, aged cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano, it was incredibly good. My date raised his eyebrows at me as I scooped out every last bit of it. No shame in my game.
+Meat and cheese plate: we opted for three of the cow cheeses ($5 each, 3 for $14, 6 for $27) and three of the meats: salametto, hot coppa, and Calabrese ($5.25 each, 3 for $15, or 6 for $28). It was served with a sourdough baguette, some fig, grain mustard, and various chutneys. Delicious! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?select=eIDeQK14cP_qW7fHxFnvzw#UayBZRG-y-54WkbI71tgSg)
+Beer and wine ONLY, but take advantage of the specials on the board, or simply ask for recommendations. They were more than happy to let me sample a few (much appreciated). I chose a tasty pinot and the date opted for a hoppy IPA.

Super pleased with the service. A satisfactory meal for about $50? Works for me.

excerpts: They have an extensive menu of beers on tap and by the bottle and wines also.
beers.author: Wendy L.
beers.review:
What a great spot - I wish I had a neighborhood bar like this. It's a small little place where seating is reserved for people who are dining, so bar patrons are limited to about a half-dozen bar stools. 

They have an extensive menu of beers on tap and by the bottle and wines also. The bartenders gave good, honest recommendations (one of them steered my friend away from a beer that he wouldn't recommend) and were really friendly and responsive. 

It's the perfect place to pop in for a drink (or two) while you're waiting for your table at State Bird Provisions.

excerpts: They have a bunch of beers on tap and a vast selection of wine and bottled beer.
They have everything from cheap to like... almost $72 for a bottle of beer (didn't really pay attention to the wines because we weren't really there for wine).

The second time I've went here, we had just gotten out of a very beery brunch at 21st Amendment, so we didn't really order much alcohol; only Drake's 2013 Jolly Rodger Imperial American Black Ale (how awesome is that name).
It was the last bottle though...
but damn that was good.
beers.author: Denise C.
beers.review:
Second time here and it's still great. Definitely a small place for a small group of people. The focus here is mostly on the libations part... Obviously from the name :) The food is pretty good though (just a bit on the expensive side for what you get). Even though it is pricey, it's worth it to get a couple of the small plates (especially the meats and cheeses) since it pairs really well with the drinks. Also, keep in mind, the menu changes every now and then, so it's kind of a different experience (at least from the two times I've been there).

They have a bunch of beers on tap and a vast selection of wine and bottled beer. They have everything from cheap to like... almost $72 for a bottle of beer (didn't really pay attention to the wines because we weren't really there for wine). The second time I've went here, we had just gotten out of a very beery brunch at 21st Amendment, so we didn't really order much alcohol; only Drake's 2013 Jolly Rodger Imperial American Black Ale (how awesome is that name). It was the last bottle though... but damn that was good. Highly recommend it... if you can find it somewhere else XD

We ordered the lemon caper sage butter (maple bacon is better), sliders (meh), mac and cheese (yum!), and a meat plate with salchichon, two slices of duck liver pâté ('cause we're so fancy), speck, duck salami, and truffled wild boar. The meat plate was definitely better this time around (don't remember the last one we had), and you get a brown bag filled to the brim with bread (which is crazy yummy). The meat plate also comes with a great mustard which brings it all together. Would definitely avoid the sliders though... came out a little soggy... and honestly not very unique/flavorful. The mac and cheese comes in a tiny little cast iron with these awesome breadcrumbs on top.

I like this place for the random selection and the chill atmosphere. Luckily the second time we went, it was waaaaaaaaaaay quieter (we were the only ones in the resturant, minus some of the tables outside) and it was great to hang out with a couple friends. It did start to fill up a little bit by 6 pm (halfish full) but by then we were pretty sated and happy.

Would come back, would recommend, but really the attraction here is the drink! The staff is super friendly too. Definitely has hipster written all over it :D

excerpts: I'll definitely come back here for some beers if I'm in the area, and if I'm getting drinks I'll probably grab a small bite to eat too.
beers.author: Keith C.
beers.review:
Came here for dinner with a friend and was not disappointed.  The beer and wine selection is QUITE extensive and is organized by flavor (with alcohol percentages!) so if you like beer and wine, definitely check this place out.  I got the chicken pot pie, which I thought was pretty good.  I wasn't amazed though.  

I'll definitely come back here for some beers if I'm in the area, and if I'm getting drinks I'll probably grab a small bite to eat too.

excerpts: So many beers and wine on tap, I'm overwhelmed!
But thankfully the bartender is knowledgeable and nice, which goes a long way in sf.
Food is delicious too.
My new favorite spot!
beers.author: Kristin S.
beers.review: This place is so awesome. Nice people, bright sun light. Normal seats. So many beers and wine on tap, I'm overwhelmed! But thankfully the bartender is knowledgeable and nice, which goes a long way in sf. Food is delicious too. My new favorite spot!

excerpts: This is a great place for small bites and trying new beers.
It's small and quaint and right off of fillmore.
My coworker who has lived in SF for so long took me here and he has good taste in food and knows what he likes
so I trusted him and wasn't disappointed.
He got a sour beer and if was my first time trying one
and it was good!
They often have new selection of alcohol that come in so its a fun place to sample.
beers.author: Kristin C.
beers.review:
This is a great place for small bites and trying new beers. It's small and quaint and right off of fillmore. My coworker who has lived in SF for so long took me here and he has good taste in food and knows what he likes so I trusted him and wasn't disappointed. He got a sour beer and if was my first time trying one and it was good! They often have new selection of alcohol that come in so its a fun place to sample. We got a cream beer and a porter. 

Limited about of seating but the atmosphere is cozy. Very dim but a fun atmosphere for a date night. 

Food: flat bread, spicy Mac and cheese, chicken pot pie, sliders. My favorite were the sliders and flat bread!

excerpts: It was excellent, love good Belgian beers.
beers.author: Rebekah T.
beers.review:
Wow, I was impressed by Fat Angel. I've only been there once, but I know what I like. Fat Angel is simple and comfortable, yet classy and gourmet.

I was in the mood for a good beer, I ordered a La Moneuse Saison on draft for my first. It was excellent, love good Belgian beers.

I ordered the House Marinated Olives which are Castelvetrano Olives,  my all-time favorite!! They are large, light green olives that are hearty and light. A must if you are a sucker for olives.

Next up, we shared the Cheese Platter. This is an easy appetizer for groups. Pick the 5 Cheese platter - it comes with jams and accents to mix and match on your toasted bread. Yummm... 

I ordered another beer for the dinner portion of our meal and went with the Christoffel Blond. A nice refreshing German Pilsner. 

For dinner, my friend and I split the wild mushroom & white truffle oil w/ pecorino flat bread and the Endive, apple, candied walnuts, gorgonzola w/ cider vinaigrette salad.

I highly recommend Fat Angel for the beer enthusiast. Here is a copy of the libations - http://www.fatangelsf.com/libations/

Everything was perfect. I love dinners like this. A little of this and that, all quality and very tasty. I can't wait to bring other friends here. There is so much to try and that's a tasty thing.

excerpts: My buddy got the curieux, it was absolutely delicious; don't you just love it when your beers are delicious?
beers.author: David C.
beers.review:
Only been to this place once but I was impressed. They've got a good variety of beer, I was pleasantly surprised by their selection. My buddy got the curieux, it was absolutely delicious; don't you just love it when your beers are delicious? From what I remember the curieux was a bit creamy, and fruity, give it a try if that sounds up your alley, you won't be disappointed. 

For foods I got the chicken pot pie. The pie isn't like your traditional chicken pot pie with the chicken stuffing inside of the pie. This one here all of the filling is out in the bowl, and you've got your piece of pie/bread floatin' on 'modest mouse' style in the middle. It was good, and while not what I expected I wouldn't hesitate to get it again if/when I dine here again.

excerpts:
Great place to go for a late night dinner and beers.
I say this because I am certain it gets really busy at peak hours.
Great food and great beers!!!
beers.author: Peter B.
beers.review:
Great place to go for a late night dinner and beers.
I say this because I am certain it gets really busy at peak hours.
We arrived at 8:30pm and were quickly seated.

Great food and great beers!!!

excerpts: Great place to grab some beers and delicious food.
My only complaint is that the restaurant is really small, so sometimes the wait can be long.
beers.author: Richard P.
beers.review:
YUM YUM YUM! I just moved to San Francisco this past weekend and Fat Angle is probably one of my favorite places to eat thus far! Located just across the street from my apartment it is very convenient for me to eat there.

They have a great selection of beer! Organized by type, some of these bottles can get quite pricey $30+ so be careful when ordering. But if you like beer they are sure to have something you like!

The food is delicious!  They have a small menu, so in the few times I've been I have been able to try a majority of the items:

Flavored Butters, Cheese, and Meats served with bread -- Almost like a charcuterie platter. It all comes out together on a platter served with bread. I loved the meats and cheeses. Awesome quality and the saltiness goes well when drinking.

Chicken Pot Pie - Delicious! A bowl filled with creamy chicken and veggies (carrots and peas) topped with a crispy crust. Not too doughy since the crust isn't completely surrounding the pie.

Burger Sliders -- My favorite thing here! Juicy meat with some amazing aioli. Also goes great with the pickled jalapenos which are served on the side.

Mac n' Cheese - Cheesy with a kick. The heat seems to linger for awhile, but it is so good.

Flat Breads - Extremely thin crust! Thin and crispy!

Great place to grab some beers and delicious food. My only complaint is that the restaurant is really small, so sometimes the wait can be long.

excerpts: At least we had tasty beers in front of us and some time to examine the cool decor, including the large glass chandelier (echoes of the nearby Fillmore?) and the back of the bar, which appeared to be made out of an old church organ...pretty Cool actually.
beers.author: Dan B.
beers.review:
When looking for a place to grab a bite before a show at the Fillmore, Fat Angel showed up near the top of the list during a Yelp search.  Noticing that they were a gastropub with a fine beer list made the choice easy for me.

After parking nearby with my friend P, we made a beeline here to quench our thirst and grab a bite. Unfortunately, there was a small crowd of people jamming the doorway and we thought we might be out of luck. After all, the place is really tiny. 

Undaunted, we squeezed through to the bar to find several open spaces. I guess everyone really wanted a table.  We didn't.

The draft beer list here (written on chalkboard) was FANTASTIC: all microbrews, including two IPAs, a golden ale, a porter, a weiss beer, a brown ale. a double IPA and even a sour beer.  The bottle list was much longer; The waiter said the total count was over 100!  So many choices that we couldn't decide, and so we left. (yeah right)

The menu was short but we found what we wanted quickly: sliders for me, and chicken pot pie for my buddy P.  Unfortunately, it took about 15 mins to get someone to take our orders. (Staff was very thin.) At least we had tasty beers in front of us and some time to examine the cool decor, including the large glass chandelier (echoes of the nearby Fillmore?) and the back of the bar, which appeared to be made out of an old church organ...pretty Cool actually.

Once we ordered, the food arrived quickly. We both enjoyed our meals and our second, tasty brew.  The night was off to a good start.  By the time we paid up and left, the outside crowd had doubled, and even bar seats were in demand. We were glad we had arrived when we did.

5 stars for the perfect pre-show dinner and excellent beer selection; 1 star off for the spotty service.

excerpts: It's a small cozy place which serves a good collection of beers and wines.
It wasn't crowded during the time we came here--we thought it would be considering it was happy hour.
beers.author: Junaline G.
beers.review:
Came here on a Tuesday night after my boyfriends work.  It's a small cozy place which serves a good collection of beers and wines.  It wasn't crowded during the time we came here--we thought it would be considering it was happy hour.  We were greeted and seated right away by their friendly staff.  

Bf had red wine and I had white wine--prices where reasonable.  We ordered cheese plates: truffle tremor--MmmmMmmm --delicious! Nuvola di Pecora, and Vella dry Jack.--they were all good.  

For the meat platter we tried:  loukanika, Finicchiona and Piccante Salami.  Our server was very helpful with suggesting which meat to try.  They were all very tasty.  

We also ordered their roasted red grapes, walnut & prosciutto w/ gorgonzola flatbread.--it was different.  I didn't cAre for the roasted grapes at all.  The prosciutto didn't taste any close to a prosciutto :( bf and I were somewhat disappointed.  We didn't finished our flat bread and asked for it to go--our server took to the back so he can box it up and to come out few minutes later to tell us that he dropped our left over flatbread in the trash--at least he was honest about it.  He gave us 1/2 off the price and offered to fire up another one if we were still hungry..I said no and thank you.

We'd come back again and try their other food on their menu soon.

excerpts: They have a endless list of beers, wines and bar food.
beers.author: Shirley N.
beers.review:
I would give this place a solid four stars if it wasn't for the rude male host working the front. If the outside seats are "first come, first serve", do not tell me you lost a few customers due to me taking one chair from the other table because you are one who told me to check the outside seating and to take whatever's available -_- He made me feel horrible and I could have been approached in a more friendly manner. 

I came here with a party of three on a busy Friday night and I can't wait to visit this place again minus the rude host. The chicken pot pie really blew me away and leftovers we're just as amazing. They have a endless list of beers, wines and bar food. This is a fun place to grab some drinks with friends and just hang out. I do not recommend large parties here.

excerpts: My only regret is not getting anything to drink because they have a wide selection of beers and wines.
beers.author: Natasha P.
beers.review:
I'm so glad my bf found this place on Yelp! We had some last minute changes during our SF getaway and wanted some delicious food in our bellies :)

We got lucky with parking and quickly found our way to the quaint little pub. About a 10 minute wait and had a look at the menu even though we already knew what we were going to have. Unfortunately, we were seated on a two-top with 3 people, but moved after a few dishes came out when the table next to us left. 

Polenta fries with garlic aioli and spicy ketchup: So bomb! Fried to perfection. The garlic aioli was nice and creamy and the ketchup had just the right kick. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?select=v9nx_p9ngsUFMTeRQL3_2Q

Salame nostrano and hot copa (??): Originally ordered just the salame but because the "order took so long" (I didn't think it was too long of a wait o_O) one of the owners gave us the other meat on the house! Don't remember if it was the hot copa or not, but it was delicioso~ The meats come with whole grain mustard and bread. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?select=u_QTAXoXAyNA2PmWqzwApw

Red grape, gorgonzola, walnut, proscuitto flatbread: The right size for the three of us. Generous amount of all ingredients and a classic combo done right. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?select=WmeropcwqBspDObJjgk-8A

Mac n cheese: Creamy and good portion, given the other things we also ordered. We were stuffed and I had to beast it out for the last few bites.http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?select=v6j6QhxBbF2D93-rv_IRyQ

All the Yelp reviews are testament to the owners' passion and dedication to Fat Angel. They really enjoy doing what they do and are happy to help you make your food/beverage selection. My only regret is not getting anything to drink because they have a wide selection of beers and wines.

excerpts: If you are seeking delicious flatbread, super decadent selections of charcuterie and cheeses, a good list of wines and beers that are priced very well, than it's definitely worth the wait!
beers.author: Sue L.
beers.review:
Cozy and consistent, Fat Angel is my go-to spot for wine and comfort food. Their carafes of wine and simple yet delicious food is best served with good friends over reflective conversations. 

Although the restaurant itself is not "fat" by any means as there always seems to be a wait for a table in the cramped quarters, the hostess is super friendly and will offer to text you when a table is available. If you are seeking delicious flatbread, super decadent selections of charcuterie and cheeses, a good list of wines and beers that are priced very well, than it's definitely worth the wait!

excerpts: With an extensive, long list of beers and wines, and a unique menu of finger foods and bar snacks, I was lost in the experience and forgot about my date for a second.
beers.author: J J.
beers.review:
Well-informed and helpful staff in a sophisticated, classy, yet warm and intimate little place. With an extensive, long list of beers and wines, and a unique menu of finger foods and bar snacks, I was lost in the experience and forgot about my date for a second. The possibilities are endless!

What was so delicious: cheese platters with jelly, flat-bread pizza w/ prosciutto, grape, walnut, and Gorgonzola, double IPA (thanks for recommending a great side), and the vibe. I loved all the uncommon ingredients.

Definitely showing some friends this place. Oh, it's nice.

excerpts: Eclectic beer list too for beers that are from different country's.
beers.author: Jeanette W.
beers.review: I absolutely love this place!  The chicken pot pie I obsessed bout days after dining here.  Even the caeser salad was amazing.  Eclectic beer list too for beers that are from different country's.

excerpts: It's got a whole section on the menu for sour beers.
beers.author: Allison S.
beers.review:
It's got a whole section on the menu for sour beers. I'm sold. 

The food is pretty damn good. I've had quite a bit off their menu--the highlights are the different butters and the salads, which are seriously gigantic. I ordered the chicken pot pie the last time I was there. The portion was pleasing, and I initially was really enjoying it, but the more I ate, the more I felt like it tasted like the pot pies I used to make in the ovens. So, there's your docked star--the pot pie isn't the best thing on the menu. 

Great bar though, and bartenders are super knowledgable. Also I love wine on tap.

excerpts: Not to mention, our server (I believe his name was Derek) was SUPER helpful in describing all the special notes of each beer on the menu; it certainly makes their long list of beers less intimidating.
beers.author: Helen W.
beers.review:
Their drinks are awesome. The only reason why I didn't give Fat Angel 5 stars is because I didn't have the opportunity to try their food (I came here AFTER dinner elsewhere), though looking at pictures, I know I'll have to come back to try their mac & cheese. 

Tip: Come here if you're a beer connoisseur. Their menu of brewskis is OUT OF THIS WORLD!!! Whether you like them light, dark, hoppy, etc., you name it, there's a brew for you. Not to mention, our server (I believe his name was Derek) was SUPER helpful in describing all the special notes of each beer on the menu; it certainly makes their long list of beers less intimidating. :)

excerpts: Next time I come back, which will be very soon, i'm going to order the sliders, 3 meats and a few beers.
beers.author: Randy N.
beers.review:
Had this place bookmarked for a while, finally had a chance to try it Thursday 5/3/12. Walked right in with a friend of mine around 7pm.  Nice dark and intimate atmosphere; perfect for a date, or catching up with an old friend.  

I'll cut right to the chase. Here's what we ordered...

-House Olives $4
Simple marinade of olive oil and maybe garlic. No variety, only the green olives not pitted. Where my Kalamata's at?! Got very redundant, needed more herbs. 

-Maple bacon butter w/ bread $4.50
Some wheat bread and maple bacon butter. Maple Bacon butter was interesting. Overall meh. I was sold with the maple bacon butter. 

http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/5Y4U38GnSAnCCilmu1FYMA/l.jpg

-Wipeout Lager 23oz $8.50
Nice full bodied dark beer. 

-Peter Brown Ale 23oz $8.50

-Sliders $10 for 3, we added $3 for 1 more. 
Delicious!! Bun was soft, bacon, caramelized onions, aioli. Came together so nicely, best slider I have ever had, hands down.    

-3 cured meats ( duck salami, speck, chorizo)  $15. 
Duck salami was melt in your mouth, chorizo was a bit oily, but the mustard and bread countered it nicely. Had to ask for more mustard, they only give you a small half dollar sized dollop. Tons of those little baguettes.  This was perfect. 

http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Ki2pbk7yjAcndoxGFaDo0Q/l.jpg

Conclusion: We ordered a lot, since it was our first time, we wanted to get a taste of everything.  Next time I come back, which will be very soon, i'm going to order the sliders, 3 meats and a few beers.  Skip the apps, olives, bread, go straight for the good stuff! 

Total was $58.05 for two, before tax.  Quite reasonable, given how much we ordered. I definitely recommend this spot.    

http://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/pQB3F47NBrCFblW-qKVJJg/l.jpg

-1 star for the waitress explaining to me that butter is churned milk.  I won't go into that, but thank you; I now know what butter is.

excerpts: We got some great beers--i got a sour something--
i know this is awful
but i don't remember what it was--my bf ordered it for me.

Beers were good but nothing compared to the food--we split everything:

3 cheese for $14
-Truffle Tremor (My favorite--so good!)
beers.author: An-Nhien L.
beers.review:
OH MY DEAR.

Went here last night around 6:30 before a show at the Fillmore. Completely impressed and completely DEPRESSED at the fact that I never knew this palce existed!

We got some great beers--i got a sour something--i know this is awful but i don't remember what it was--my bf ordered it for me. Beers were good but nothing compared to the food--we split everything:

3 cheese for $14
-Truffle Tremor (My favorite--so good!)
-Vella Dry Jack  NorCal hard cow--like a sharper Jack cheese, also very good
-Some kind of Gouda--also delicious
It came with a nice jam pairing and organic crustinis

GREAT DEAL AND SO DELICIOUS

Mac n' Cheese - gruyère, aged cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano  $11
This was delicious and the breaded topping was great as well! The pasta was a perfect texture too

3 Sliders - beef, caramelized onions, bacon, irish cheddar, aioli  10
Holy Cow these were tender, juicy, and that aoili sauce has crack in it i swear. Was a little sad that it came with 3 sliders and i was with 2 others so I could only eat one....

All in all, a great experience but I would definitely recommend getting there before 630/7 because it got PACKED while we were sitting there.

excerpts: Really nice draft and bottled beer list with local favorites and some other rarer craft beers as well.
The place is very small
so I was relegated to standing room at the bar.
Met some folks who were also out of town (like I was) visiting their son.
Food looked scrumptious
but I did not have any.
Staff was very friendly and attentive.
Would love to return for dinner someday.
beers.author: Steven J.
beers.review: Stopped in for an after dinner drink. Really nice draft and bottled beer list with local favorites and some other rarer craft beers as well. The place is very small so I was relegated to standing room at the bar. Met some folks who were also out of town (like I was) visiting their son. Food looked scrumptious but I did not have any. Staff was very friendly and attentive. Would love to return for dinner someday.

excerpts: Beers and other appealing cocktails were also on the menu.
beers.author: Betty N.
beers.review:
**GOOD COMFORT FOODS AND GOOD WINES**

Perfect place to grab a few bites and quench your wine thirst before hitting an 8PM performance at Yoshi's.

Small, comfortable, and chill.

Flat breads, sliders, and mac cheese were ordered. 

I liked the flat breads the best. Thin, flavored well with the gourmet cheese and mushrooms.

I had a refreshing Reisling which went well with the small plates.

The staff was friendly and efficient. 

Food came out quickly.

It was not a wine bar. 

Beers and other appealing cocktails were also on the menu.

Check out the overhead chalkboard for ideas and specials, too.

RECOMMEND for FILLMORE.

excerpts: The server gave us samples and talked about the types of beers as we were trying to figure out what we were wanting.
beers.author: Kelli N.
beers.review:
This place has great rustic food: e.g. mushroom flatbread, spicy mac and cheese, and beer selection is beyond. My friends said the wine selection was also great. The server gave us samples and talked about the types of beers as we were trying to figure out what we were wanting. It's a mellow, hip and smart crowd.

There is an attention to detail here that makes Fat Angel worth regular visits to explore the menu.

excerpts: Great selection of beers and wine, all reasonably priced.
Food was great.
Waiter made a mistake with the timing of the food so one came out way too early, but was kind enough to take one meal off the bill which was hugely unnecessary but greatly appreciated and noted.
beers.author: Jess Z.
beers.review: Cute little spot we stumbled on after being chased out of 1300 Fillmore by a rude hostess and a terrible prix fixe valentines menu.  Great selection of beers and wine, all reasonably priced. Food was great. Waiter made a mistake with the timing of the food so one came out way too early, but was kind enough to take one meal off the bill which was hugely unnecessary but greatly appreciated and noted. Would recommend this place for some drinks to anyone in the area.

excerpts: Very nice selection of wines and beers.
If you're in the area and need a quick sip or a few hours of quench thirsting to accomplish, Fat Angel is worth the visit.
beers.author: Binh D.
beers.review:
I can't comment on the food because we just came to grab a glass of wine before our dinner at State Bird Provisions. 

Very nice selection of wines and beers. If you're in the area and need a quick sip or a few hours of quench thirsting to accomplish, Fat Angel is worth the visit.

excerpts:
- Selection: good for both wines by the glass as well as beers
- Descriptions: conversational personality infused in the text using words anyone can understand. 
Categories like "Chubby and Satisfying" and "Bright and Juicy" were fun to see.
beers.author: Eve K.
beers.review:
Hidden, low-key, small wine bar I really enjoyed. 

Cost to worth it rating: 3.5 (~10/glass)
Return worthiness: yes

Highlights:
- Atmosphere: more like a coffee shop or a pub than a wine bar cause there wasn't a hint of pretentiousness. It's just a comfortable spot to grab a seat at a bare wooden table and enjoy a few drinks. 
- Selection: good for both wines by the glass as well as beers
- Descriptions: conversational personality infused in the text using words anyone can understand. Categories like "Chubby and Satisfying" and "Bright and Juicy" were fun to see. 
- Pretzel: warm, soft, and salt

Lowlights: 
- Hidden: unassuming on a side street of Filmore. I wouldn't imagine it was such a cool place, but I did my standard yelp check before I walked in and gave it a try.

I'd love to come back and spend more time drinking here as well as getting to try their food. Mac and cheese was calling my name.

excerpts: The selection of beers was very impressive, but what caught my eye - and captured my heart - was the fact they have WINE ON TAP.
Let me repeat that again..
Fat Angel has WINE ON TAP.
beers.author: Allison B.
beers.review:
This place is fantastic. Came here randomly a few weeks ago. A friend and I had been searching for another wine bar, but when we couldn't find it, we stumbled upon this one instead. The selection of beers was very impressive, but what caught my eye - and captured my heart - was the fact they have WINE ON TAP. Let me repeat that again.. Fat Angel has WINE ON TAP. I thought draft wine only existed in my version of heaven.

Anyway, we had to wait quite a long time to be seated, which is perhaps the only downside. It was a Wednesday night. It was around 8. And it was packed. Just elbowing our way to the bar to put our names on the waiting list was tricky. We must have been lucky to arrive at exactly the same time as everyone else, because by the time we were seated (well over an hour later) it was no longer so crowded. But they have WINE ON TAP, so I was content. As for the food, we ordered the 3 cheese plate, the chorizo meat plate, the asparagus flatbread and the sliders. Being generally gluten free, I passed on the breads that arrived with our cheeses and meat, and the kitchen was (kindly) able to serve my sliders with lettuce instead of buns. Everything I ate was super tasty, and my friend enjoyed his flatbread too.

Just about everything here was fab; the decor was fun, the bar staff friendly, the servers attentive, the food yummy, the drinks flowing. I just would have liked to not have had such a long wait. Especially on a weekday (we didn't leave until almost 11:30). But you can't knock a place for being popular, especially when it's this good.

excerpts: This place has an appealing ambiance and countless varieties of wines, beers and bar-food.
The cherry on the cake is the service.
Our waiter was great, I can't remember our waiter's name, but he was attentive, a little hard to understand, English was definitely a second language for him, but he was very pleasant.
If you are into trying different beers I suggest that you visit this place.
The service is spectacular and the atmosphere is nice.
We enjoyed our visit a lot.
We hope to be able to go back soon.
beers.author: Jillian P.
beers.review: This place has an appealing ambiance and countless varieties of wines, beers and bar-food. The cherry on the cake is the service. Our waiter was great, I can't remember our waiter's name, but he was attentive, a little hard to understand, English was definitely a second language for him, but he was very pleasant. I especially liked the Mac n Cheese, it was wonderfully creamy and rich. My friend had the trout and he said it was the best trout he ever had - well, to be honest I think it was the first time he had trout. If you are into trying different beers I suggest that you visit this place. The service is spectacular and the atmosphere is nice. We enjoyed our visit a lot. We hope to be able to go back soon.

excerpts: We tried two beers, bread with garlic chili / honey butter, and the mac n cheese.
Everything tasted amazing and the portions were more than enough.
Fortunately we got here ~15-20 minutes before the crowd started coming in; there's outdoor seating
but I loved sitting inside enjoying the woodsy and candlelit ambiance.
I promised myself I wouldn't try the same restaurant twice while I live in the city
but I might just need to come back!
beers.author: Jamie B.
beers.review: Love it! Our waitress was super helpful and gave us some great recommendations. We tried two beers, bread with garlic chili / honey butter, and the mac n cheese. Everything tasted amazing and the portions were more than enough. Fortunately we got here ~15-20 minutes before the crowd started coming in; there's outdoor seating but I loved sitting inside enjoying the woodsy and candlelit ambiance. I promised myself I wouldn't try the same restaurant twice while I live in the city but I might just need to come back!

excerpts: Bajillions of beers (if you like that sort of thing).
The best sliders I've ever had.
beers.author: Chris B.
beers.review:
I don't get up to the city often enough, especially around dinner time, but when I do it takes some convincing to NOT go to Fat Angel.

Bajillions of beers (if you like that sort of thing). The best sliders I've ever had. Chicken Pot Pie to kill for. I'm starting to salivate.

excerpts: My bf and I love sour beers and there is only a small handful to choose from, even at the most fancy places, in Dallas, where we're from.
This place had at LEAST 30 to choose from!
And that doesn't begin to scratch the surface of what they have to offer.
beers.author: Sarah C.
beers.review:
The food was just ok. The black truffle butter had zero flavor, the bread was burnt, and the duck salami (which was a pâté?) was super gamey. The soft sheep and the bacon kale salad were nom-a-licious, though, so our mouths were overall happy.

But...the beer selection was phenomenal!! 

My bf and I love sour beers and there is only a small handful to choose from, even at the most fancy places, in Dallas, where we're from. This place had at LEAST 30 to choose from! And that doesn't begin to scratch the surface of what they have to offer. Even the stuff on tap looked fascinating.

The waitstaff were super friendly hipster-types and know their stuff, too.

This place is a must for beer aficionados. Go!

excerpts: They've  got it all, unique beers, wine, and delicious food.
Speaking of food, I feel that at this point that I've tried most of the menu and it's all delicious, but the real stand-out is the smoked trout salad.
Jesus tap dancing Christ
, that smoked trout is the most delicious fish ever.
I want to buy a case of that smoked trout and eat it everyday.
My fiend described that salad as "an orgasm you don't have to work for".
It's that good
beers.author: Iska B.
beers.review:
Hands down my favorite bar in San Francisco. It helps to be friends with regulars, not going to lie, but even if we didn't have the inside scoop, I'd still like it here. 

They've  got it all, unique beers, wine, and delicious food. Speaking of food, I feel that at this point that I've tried most of the menu and it's all delicious, but the real stand-out is the smoked trout salad. Jesus tap dancing Christ, that smoked trout is the most delicious fish ever. I want to buy a case of that smoked trout and eat it everyday. My fiend described that salad as "an orgasm you don't have to work for". It's that good and it's SALAD.

Moving on....

Beer selection is top notch and changes regularly as does the wine but I think they have certain bottles that are always on hand. The decor is pretty cool too, they have a lot of pews from an old church, which adds a naughty element as you indulge in booze and rich food. 

My only criticism is that it gets really crowded and it can be hard to get a table as it's not a very large place. They do have some outdoor tables (with heat lamps) but it's nicer inside. They seem a little disorganized when it comes to seating as well, so if you don't want to wait around, I'd suggest coming early. Whatever though, I'd probably wait an hour for that trout salad. 

5 stars for the food, the drinks, and the fun I've had here 
3 stars for the organization/seating

excerpts: So many beers and wine and Mead.
beers.author: Neal L.
beers.review: Awesome staff. Spilled wine on my hand and gave me a free glass she spilled on me. Really cool atmosphere. So many beers and wine and Mead. Yummy pretzels

excerpts: They had a wonderful selection of beers but it was just way too expensive for me to go for, so
I settled on having one cocktail with dinner - the Pimm's cup, which was delicious!
beers.author: Molly N.
beers.review:
Minus one star for being crazy expensive.

That said? Great food, great beer choices, and funny, kind, and helpful staff. I enjoyed the mac n' cheese immensely. My husband's chicken pot pie was good (he says) and my sister enjoyed her endive salad. My brother-in-law had the sliders and he seemed to find them agreeable as well. They had a wonderful selection of beers but it was just way too expensive for me to go for, so I settled on having one cocktail with dinner - the Pimm's cup, which was delicious!

excerpts: The "new beers" chalkboard almost scared us off-- $30 for a beer?
beers.author: Hazel J.
beers.review:
Wandered in here on an impromptu date night. Atmosphere is great-- organ pipes, mounted deer head and a chandelier-- I'll take it. We didn't have a reservation and it was a Friday night. The hostess took our phone number and said she'd text in 30 minutes or so, when our table was ready. The "new beers" chalkboard almost scared us off-- $30 for a beer? But they have a lot of more affordable options among their extensive drinks menu. 

The place is small, very small, so if you're waiting for your table on a busy night be prepared to be in everyone's way the entire time. Or, stand outside like we did. Luckily, our table was ready in 20 minutes.

We squeezed into the corner table with our order already ready. A prosciutto flatbread to start, pork sliders and the chicken pot pie to share. We were expecting "fancy place" portions but were pleasantly surprised to find fantastically midwest portions. We stupidly filled up on the flatbread, leaving only enough room for 2 sliders for him and 1 slider for myself. We took the chicken pot pie to go and enjoyed it the next day for lunch. Absolutely delicious. Best I've ever had. Wine, beer, appetizer and two entrees? Less than $50 and enough for lunch the next day. 

We'll definitely be back!

excerpts: Plus, the beers were awesome, the mac and cheese was amazing
and we just had an all around good time.
beers.author: Jill C.
beers.review:
I'm writing this review simply because I was blown away by the service. Derrick managed to find the PERFECT wine for me, even when I had a very specific request. Plus he was funny, so extra bonus for him. 

Plus, the beers were awesome, the mac and cheese was amazing and we just had an all around good time.

excerpts: Beers were good, and their "wine on tap" selection was good, too.
beers.author: Susie S.
beers.review:
What a beautiful place! Though it is tiny and you'll most likely end up in a line, this place charms you like none other.

LOVED the flatbread, mac n cheese, and salads. Chicken pot pie had a strange taste, which was the only disappointing part. Beers were good, and their "wine on tap" selection was good, too.

Go early to beat the rush!

excerpts: The list of craft beers, both bottled and on tap, is phenomenal.
Being an avid IPA drinker, I was blown away by the IPA selection here -- ordering three different IPAs and loving each one.
I can't wait to try all of the beers here; challenge accepted.
If you love craft beers, then you really can't go wrong with this place.
Even if you're a craft beer newbie, the knowledgeable and friendly bartenders here will lead you in the right direction.
If you're not a beer lover and you're looking for excellent gastropub fare, you may be disappointed.
beers.author: Roy C.
beers.review:
Fat Angel is a craft beer gastropub that is the perfect blend of artisan fanciness and casual garage grunge. It's difficult to describe, but very pleasant to experience.

The list of craft beers, both bottled and on tap, is phenomenal. Being an avid IPA drinker, I was blown away by the IPA selection here -- ordering three different IPAs and loving each one. I can't wait to try all of the beers here; challenge accepted.

The food is definitely better than your average gastropub, but nothing amazing.

--------------------
FOOD:

Flatbread w/ Mushroom & Truffle Oil: This is a dish that's excellent upon first bite, but gets progressively worse as time cools the cheese. I mean, you can't really go wrong with mushroom and truffle oil on anything, so the taste was definitely there. When the cheese hardens, however, it just tastes stale. Sidenote: I spread some duck liver mousse on it and it was incredible.

Pretzel: It was okay. I wish there was another sauce than mustard.

Cheese Plate w/ Duck Liver Mousse: The duck liver mousse was excellent. When spread upon the bread (or the flatbread), it gave me a faint glimpse of what I loved most about foie gras before the ban. 

--------------------

Fat Angel is an excellent joint for beer enthusiasts. If you love craft beers, then you really can't go wrong with this place. Even if you're a craft beer newbie, the knowledgeable and friendly bartenders here will lead you in the right direction. If you're not a beer lover and you're looking for excellent gastropub fare, you may be disappointed.

excerpts: Definitely the most extensive collection of craft beers I've ever seen: the menu had about 8 pages of beer and wine, one page of food, and then another page of wine.
I wanted to try a beer from the Bruery but wasn't willing to splurge quite yet and opted instead for one from Pretty Things.
beers.author: Jacob S.
beers.review:
Soo good. There's really not much I can add here that hasn't been said. Fat Angel came recommended to me by several different people. My roommate and I were just waiting for the right time to make our visit. We live in the area and were lucky to come in around 10 and get seated immediately at one of the tables in the corner. Contrary to some of the reviews here, I found everyone who worked there to be really laid back and friendly. One of the servers even stopped everyone during dinner to announce that two veterans of the establishment were recently engaged. The place is small enough that it's intimate but without seeming exclusive, which is probably why it manufactures so many regulars.

And of course, the drinks. Definitely the most extensive collection of craft beers I've ever seen: the menu had about 8 pages of beer and wine, one page of food, and then another page of wine. I wanted to try a beer from the Bruery but wasn't willing to splurge quite yet and opted instead for one from Pretty Things. I also tried a cheese plate and the smoked trout salad based on the reviews here and wasn't disappointed. 

Despite the quantity and deliciousness of the food, this is still a bar at heart, so it makes for an interesting inversion of your typical dinner. Simply by the way the menu is set up, you find yourself ordering drinks with a side of food, and butter with a side of bread. Next time I'm trying the chicken pot pie or the flatbread--just need to wait a while so I don't seem too eager.

excerpts: What a great selection of beers!
The food was delicious as well.
Our table of five ordered beers off the beers on tap.
We were very happy with our selections.
My only feedback is, the menu location isn't the most central.
From where we were sitting, it wasn't viewable and it wasn't made known that there was a beer on tap option.
Needles to say we were a little concerned at the price of the bottles since not everyone in our group enjoys the same style of beers to warrant sharing a bottle or two.
I would come back for the ambience, the outdoor seating option, the selection of pretty amazing beers and some delicious food.
beers.author: Rachel G.
beers.review:
Went once and will definitely go back.
What a great selection of beers!  The food was delicious as well.
Our table of five ordered beers off the beers on tap.  We were very happy with our selections.  My only feedback is, the menu location isn't the most central. From where we were sitting, it wasn't viewable and it wasn't made known that there was a beer on tap option.  Needles to say we were a little concerned at the price of the bottles since not everyone in our group enjoys the same style of beers to warrant sharing a bottle or two.

We also ordered the following food to share:
-  Mac n' Cheese with gruyère, cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano, cayenne.  The spice was perfect and the texture was awesome.  
-  Flatbread with roasted red grape, walnut & prosciutto w/ gorgonzola.   Great combination of flavors!
-  Flatbread with tomato, spicy sausage & arugula w/ parmesan.  Again, great flavors, can't go wrong.
-  Chicken pot pie with roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon.  It was decent.  Not the best pot pie I had ever had but certainly satisfying.
-  Sliders with beef, caramelized onions, bacon, irish cheddar, aioli.  They were OK but I'd defiantly try other menu items for some truly delicious food. 

Overall, I really was happy with my experience.  I would come back for the ambience, the outdoor seating option, the selection of pretty amazing beers and some delicious food.

excerpts: Cask wines and beers, in addition to several beers on tap!
Cozy, intimate ambiance, super casual and hip.
beers.author: Meredith M.
beers.review:
WOW- what a gem! Cask wines and beers, in addition to several beers on tap! Cozy, intimate ambiance, super casual and hip. Was a perfect place to grab a beer before dinner at State Bird!

Interesting neighborhood...but I guess lower Fillmore is up incoming so that makes sense.

excerpts: Cozy pub with amazing selection of beers.
Don't let the pub theme scare you away; the food is great!
There is limited indoor seating, some bar stools, and a few sidewalk tables.

Chicken pot pie was good comfort food though I prefer the Liberty Cafe version

Enjoyed an Iduna Cru with the meal and look forward to sampling more of the beers.
beers.author: Brad B.
beers.review:
Cozy pub with amazing selection of beers. Don't let the pub theme scare you away; the food is great! There is limited indoor seating, some bar stools, and a few sidewalk tables. Service was pleasant and efficient.

We had the pesto flatbread. Cracker-thin crust is crisp and chewy - exceptional. Toppings were all excellent.

Chicken pot pie was good comfort food though I prefer the Liberty Cafe version

Enjoyed an Iduna Cru with the meal and look forward to sampling more of the beers.

excerpts:
Nice spot for fun/different beers, I assume the wine selection is good.

Food is pretty reasonably priced (~10 bucks for 3 sliders), some of the beers are crazy expensive.

Three of us had:

several great beers, including:
Ale Industries Rye'd Piper
Ale Industries Dualing Rye 
We sat outside and started on beers and pretzel and were inside before we finished the pretzel.
beers.author: Steve B.
beers.review:
Nice spot for fun/different beers, I assume the wine selection is good.

Food is great, we tried all sorts of things and split them.  Food is pretty reasonably priced (~10 bucks for 3 sliders), some of the beers are crazy expensive.

Three of us had:

several great beers, including:
Ale Industries Rye'd Piper
Ale Industries Dualing Rye I believe it was called, cask aged
Arrogant Bastard Casked

Tried two appetizers:
Pretzel
Polenta fries  :--very good

Tried three "plates":
Sliders  :-- very tasty, light on the meat but very good.
Pesto Flat bread pizze   :--very good
Chicken Pot pie  :---  we were stuffed at this point, but it was excellent.  Probably second to The Townshead across town for chicken pot pies, but very good.  

Highly recommend the place.  it is small and crowded, takes about 30 minutes to get a seat inside.  has heaters on the outside for sitting or waiting.  We sat outside and started on beers and pretzel and were inside before we finished the pretzel.

Great starter for a night at the Fillmore.

excerpts: They even had a large antler taxidermy on the back wall next to their chalkboard, which had a catchy saying from Hemingway and list of 8 beers on draft.
I was really impressed with Fat Angel and have a new happy hour spot!
beers.author: Kaila Y.
beers.review: Wine on draft and a chill atmosphere for happy hour?  I'm all over it!!! After walking by this bar on my way to State Bird Provisions last year, it was bustling and I've been wanting to try it ever since. I came here yesterday after work with my friend Will. The staff is friendly and bar has a cozy bistro feeling. The happy hour specials are $2 off wine and beer, $1 off the flatbreads. We had a half bottle of the draft Zinfandel (juicy and smooth), a half bottle of the draft Sauvignon Blanc (crisp and refreshing) and the wild mushroom and truffle oil flatbread (delish!). The place filled up quickly and was crackin'! They even had a large antler taxidermy on the back wall next to their chalkboard, which had a catchy saying from Hemingway and list of 8 beers on draft. I was really impressed with Fat Angel and have a new happy hour spot! :)

excerpts: They also have wines on draft, and their draft beers rotate too.
It's definitely a little pricey, but the ambiance is great.
Sit and chill on a nice day with your friends while eating their fantastic mac n'cheese or polenta fries (both are amazing; you'll thank me later).
Oh, and they play The Gaslight Anthem, The Decemberists, and Death Cab.
Fantastic music selection.
I do wish it were less pricey, and that there were more than just one unisex restroom.
beers.author: Danny C.
beers.review: This place has outdoor seating and a bit of space indoors. Honestly, the beer selection is ridonk. They're categorized and organized in a way that will appeal to anyone - yeasty, hoppy, bitter, sour, reserves, etc. They also have wines on draft, and their draft beers rotate too. It's definitely a little pricey, but the ambiance is great. Sit and chill on a nice day with your friends while eating their fantastic mac n'cheese or polenta fries (both are amazing; you'll thank me later). Oh, and they play The Gaslight Anthem, The Decemberists, and Death Cab. Fantastic music selection. I do wish it were less pricey, and that there were more than just one unisex restroom.

excerpts: People tend to lounge around due to their awesome selection of wines, beers, cheese & meat platters.
beers.author: Vivian D.
beers.review:
Loved (almost) everything about Fat Angel besides the crazy wait. People tend to lounge around due to their awesome selection of wines, beers, cheese & meat platters. I was tempted to, but the long line piling up at the door made me feel bad. 

Chicken pot pie is a MUST. Their apple bread pudding was pretty great too. Despite the craziness, staff was super accomodating, patient, and knowledgeable.

excerpts:
Drinks:
-- Wines on tap!!!
-- Big selection of beers.
Their selection of beers on tap change frequently.
-- I ordered a Japanese expresso stout on tap!
Who would have thought that Japan would produce stouts?
And that it would be good?
And that a bar here would have it on tap?!
-- LOTS of other stouts available.
beers.author: Jeanne L.
beers.review:
The most quaint little gastropub!!  

Drinks:
-- Wines on tap!!!
-- Big selection of beers. Their selection of beers on tap change frequently.  
-- I ordered a Japanese expresso stout on tap!  Who would have thought that Japan would produce stouts?  And that it would be good?  And that a bar here would have it on tap?!
-- LOTS of other stouts available.  (Hey.... I'm really into stouts...)

Greatly enjoyed the food:
[[ Chicken Pot Pie ]]- a bowl of delicious filling, generous on the shredded chicken; topped with a thick piece of buttery, flakey, crust. The ratio of filling and crust was perfect for me
[[ Flatbread with mushroom & white truffle oil ]] - thin and crispy crust - fresh and light, not greasy
[[ Mac n' Cheese ]] - 3 different types of cheese, nice little crusty bits throughout.  

My only complaint would be that it gets way too crowded here, even early on a weekday.  Anybody want to join me for early mid-afternoon drinking?

excerpts: They have a fantastic selection of sour beers.
Hoping to return for a proper meal someday...
beers.author: Claudine C.
beers.review: They have a fantastic selection of sour beers. Hoping to return for a proper meal someday...

excerpts: Huge selection of wines by the glass and bottled beers.
Supposed to have draft beer as well, but I didn't see it nor was it mentioned.
Food was good,
prices fair, and good portions.
Friendly service as well.
beers.author: Big Baby Jesus C.
beers.review: BBJ like.  Huge selection of wines by the glass and bottled beers.  Supposed to have draft beer as well, but I didn't see it nor was it mentioned.  Food was good, prices fair, and good portions.  Friendly service as well.  The chicken pot pie was uniquely presented.

excerpts: It's a great place to stop in for some cheese, sausage and fine Belgian beers.
beers.author: John H.
beers.review: Really a hidden gem.  If Fat Angel was located in SOMA or the Mission I'm sure there'd be a line out the door, but unusual spot of Fillmore mostly keeps the crowd to those in surrounding neighborhoods.  It's a great place to stop in for some cheese, sausage and fine Belgian beers.

excerpts: Great selection of wine and artisanal beers.
