The food did not disappoint either!
The only downside is that the space is small and gets crowded.
beers.author: Claudia R.
beers.review: Great selection of wine and artisanal beers. The food did not disappoint either! The only downside is that the space is small and gets crowded.

excerpts: An interesting fact is that Fat Angel doesn't carry mainstream beers.
My beer-drinker boyfriend had no idea what to order when there were strange beer brands from that stretched from England to the Netherlands and everywhere in-between.
Finally, the owner recommended us to try an English bitter: Engels Brouwerij De Molen.
The beer had a similar taste to my Alan's favorite beer, Blue Moon.
beers.author: Nobe Z.
beers.review:
Fat Angel is located right next to the busy Fillmore St., and is obverse to a small park. At nighttime, the whole park is lighten up by a blue LED light projected from the top of a marvelous building. The effect turns the park into a visionary scene from the movie Avatar. It's really quite beautiful.

The cute fat angel statue is hanging on the restaurant, smiling and waving to every incoming customer.

An interesting fact is that Fat Angel doesn't carry mainstream beers. My beer-drinker boyfriend had no idea what to order when there were strange beer brands from that stretched from England to the Netherlands and everywhere in-between. Finally, the owner recommended us to try an English bitter: Engels Brouwerij De Molen. The beer had a similar taste to my Alan's favorite beer, Blue Moon. Compared to Blue Moon, the body of Engels is a little bit lighter, but very smooth.

A lot of previous customers of Fat Angel recommended the Chicken PotPie on yelp. I decided to give it a try for this first time visit, which I found to be quite an interesting dish indeed.
For the chicken potpie, the owner recommended me to pair the pie with a white or red wine with a light body. I craved for the red wine on this beautiful night, so I went with the glass of red to soothe my cravings. In the end, I decided to go with what the owner had suggested, a Grenache from Santa Cruz, CA, Birichino 'Vieilles Vignes.'  My, was it wonderful.

Although the look of Fat Angel's chicken potpie was different from a traditional potpie, it still has the ability to fill up a gigantic stomach. My stomach was about to explode after I've barely finished a half of the potpie. All ladies have to be ready to ask their boyfriends to finish what is left from this gigantic dish! The powdery sauce was smooth, thick, pure, fresh and brisk. The Pot Pie and Grenache from Santa Cruz paired quite well with each other, but they where not perfect. I couldn't help but keep my mind stimulated by looking for another pairing to perfect this wine and potpie collaboration and  build a stronger relationship between the taste buds within my mouth.

I will definitely go back to Fat Angel to give a second look at their well-known cheese served w/ organic Firebrand Bread and seasonal accents.

Cheers!

excerpts: We mentioned this was our first time at Fat Angel, and he thoughtfully walked us though the menus (Drink Menu - they have 38 bottles of wine available and some Belgian beers and non-alcoholic; Food Menu - includes various meats, cheeses, butters, a few comfort entrees - i.e. mac-n-cheese, chicken pot pie, and
flatbreads -
we had the asparagus + toasted pine nuts - excellent!).
beers.author: Cathy K.
beers.review:
I've been on a 5-star roll. Thank you Yelpers for guiding me!

I was very impressed with this place. Our server was incredibly patient, knowledgeable and basically went above and beyond. We mentioned this was our first time at Fat Angel, and he thoughtfully walked us though the menus (Drink Menu - they have 38 bottles of wine available and some Belgian beers and non-alcoholic; Food Menu - includes various meats, cheeses, butters, a few comfort entrees - i.e. mac-n-cheese, chicken pot pie, and flatbreads - we had the asparagus + toasted pine nuts - excellent!). Our guy asked us questions on what type of wine we like and made great recommendations on pairing the wine + food. 

This place is cozy, so seating can be tight. Nice candlelit ambiance at night. They have bar seating + table seating. It's a great place to stop in and relax over quality beverage + food + service. Heaven indeed.

excerpts: There are little cheese plates which are super tasty and a variety of wines and beers to choose from.
The sliders are amazing.
The staff is very friendly.
If it's too chilly, there is seating inside as well as the bar, but there are outdoor heaters which work pretty well; great for people watching.
This place is a great date spot!
beers.author: Char M.
beers.review: This place is one of my favorites.  Cute little bar and restaurant with outdoor seating. The menu is smaller, but the food is oh so delicious! There are little cheese plates which are super tasty and a variety of wines and beers to choose from. The sliders are amazing. The staff is very friendly. If it's too chilly, there is seating inside as well as the bar, but there are outdoor heaters which work pretty well; great for people watching. This place is a great date spot!

excerpts: Exotic, rare beers on tap.
beers.author: Scott G.
beers.review:
Who you calling fat?

Exotic, rare beers on tap.

Capers in their take on the Caeser salad MMM.

Usually busy, but tables turn fast. They won't disappoint.

excerpts: This nice and cozy gastropub located just a stone throw away from Japantown offers great wines, beers and eats.
But since this place is clearly known for the beers they serve, I just told the bartender that I liked hefeweizens and just give me whatever they have on tap
that was closest to it.
beers.author: Glen L.
beers.review:
This nice and cozy gastropub located just a stone throw away from Japantown offers great wines, beers and eats.

The eclectic mix of various new and old world wines is certainly more than adequate for a night of drinks and food. It probably wouldn't get noticed by WineSpectator, but the selection should be satisfactory to all but the most snobbish wine drinkers. The beer list is several pages long and quite a few are on tap as well. I'm more of a wine drinker than a beer drinker myself. But since this place is clearly known for the beers they serve, I just told the bartender that I liked hefeweizens and just give me whatever they have on tap that was closest to it. I don't remember the name of the beer I got, but I was happy with it.

From the kitchen I ordered the Basil pesto, black olives, roasted tomatoes & sausage w/ ricotta flat-bread. The bread itself was paper thin and crunchy yet still strong enough to support the tasty toppings. My only complaint is that I think sausage is a bit overpowering flavorwise. It still went well with my beer.

The waitress suggested I try the mac n' cheese which I ordered as well. She warned me that it was very hot. I dismissed her warning thinking she probably has to say that to everyone because she has to deal with a lot of people who are not used to eating spicy food. When the mac n' cheese arrived, I was a bit surprised because it was hot! Not so spicy that it was inedible, but spicy enough that you really wanted that beer to take the burn away.

Only two bartenders were holding down the fort all night and I must say that they did an excellent job of making sure everything was ok and getting all the drinks out.

This place is super popular with the locals. Either get here early or expect to wait.

excerpts: I've only been on "off hours" (weeknight or weekend afternoon), but I'd characterize Fat Angel as a quaint little gastropub with solid food and a nice selection of beers and wine.
This is a good place to go if you want to be able to actually be able to actually talk to your companion.
I've had the cheese plate and flatbreads.
beers.author: Michael B.
beers.review:
This place is consistently very good.  I've only been on "off hours" (weeknight or weekend afternoon), but I'd characterize Fat Angel as a quaint little gastropub with solid food and a nice selection of beers and wine.  This is a good place to go if you want to be able to actually be able to actually talk to your companion.  I've had the cheese plate and flatbreads.  Would recommend both.  

The service has been good and attentive though I've been at the bar both times.  Looks to me like they typically only have a couple of folks working the front of the house, but it's a small place so I think it works.  

It's worth a shot...especially if you live in the neighborhood.  Never have left anything but satisfied.

excerpts:
from two visits....
Great drink options, including wines and lots of unusual beers.
Interesting, tasty bar food options, but small portions for the price.
Friendly and knowledgeable bar staff.
It is tiny and cozy inside, so you may have to wait.
There is outdoor seating, but it can be chilly.
Bring a lap blanket and you are good!
beers.author: Monica S.
beers.review:
from two visits....
Great drink options, including wines and lots of unusual beers.
Interesting, tasty bar food options, but small portions for the price.
Friendly and knowledgeable bar staff.
It is tiny and cozy inside, so you may have to wait.  There is outdoor seating, but it can be chilly.  Bring a lap blanket and you are good!

excerpts: The lemon caper butter and bread was a good compliment for the beers and their wild mushroom truffle flatbread
definitely makes me want to drive back here from the South Bay.
I will be back!
beers.author: R K.
beers.review: Good selection of beer and wine although a tad pricey on the bottle selection.  I was able to try Lost Abbey's tequila barrel aged "Agave Maria" and it was great with their cayenne Mac & Cheese.  The lemon caper butter and bread was a good compliment for the beers and their wild mushroom truffle flatbread definitely makes me want to drive back here from the South Bay.  I will be back!

excerpts: We opted to sit at the bar and have a couple beers rather than sit on the sidewalk patio.
We split the spicy Mac and cheese ( which didn't disappoint).
Great beer list!
Definitely got crowded around 6:30 though so get there early!
beers.author: Kelly L.
beers.review: Came here with my hub on a Friday night around 5pm. Easily beat the rush! We opted to sit at the bar and have a couple beers rather than sit on the sidewalk patio.  We split the spicy Mac and cheese ( which didn't disappoint). Great beer list! Definitely got crowded around 6:30 though so get there early!

excerpts: This place has awesome food and awesome beers, however the short man with pig tails is very unaccommodating and has terrible customer service skills he refused to sit me and my girlfriend at a "table for 3 or more" as the place was emptying out.
Look out for short pig tails man, otherwise this place is 5 stars.
beers.author: Larry B.
beers.review: This place has awesome food and awesome beers, however the short man with pig tails is very unaccommodating and has terrible customer service skills he refused to sit me and my girlfriend at a "table for 3 or more" as the place was emptying out. Look out for short pig tails man, otherwise this place is 5 stars.

excerpts: Excellent beers on tap.
You'll never see the same one twice.
But you'll love every one you order.
beers.author: Marc G.
beers.review: Excellent beers on tap. You'll never see the same one twice. But you'll love every one you order.

excerpts: Not being from the area, we asked both the bar tender and the waitress about the beers and they had no type of description that would be helpful.
beers.author: Morgan K.
beers.review:
This place has horrible food and service. They have a limited menu and can not master the items on it! The staff took forever and were rude (always pointing at the costumers). If you are into the local brews, this place offers an interesting variety. Not being from the area, we asked both the bar tender and the waitress about the beers and they had no type of description that would be helpful. 

Overall, I would not recommend this place to anyone.

excerpts: We had an interesting Mint chocolate stout and two other beers I can't remember.
Their list is impressive (even a bit intimidating!)
so I'd imagine beer/spirits lovers would have a blast!
beers.author: Vivian C.
beers.review:
Dark and cozy gastropub in the Fillmore Jazz District. 

We had an interesting Mint chocolate stout and two other beers I can't remember. Their list is impressive (even a bit intimidating!) so I'd imagine beer/spirits lovers would have a blast! Given that range, there is also a $-$$$, so watch out. 

Fat Angel's pot pie came out piping hot--perfect for the two of us to share (especially since we'd just shared a platter of meats). Not too salty (which is often a boon to pot pies) and not too heavy. :) I'm a fan. 

We weren't shy about grilling the waitress (out of our ignorance) about the meat options for the chatrucerie board of meats. Do you know what this means?

I actually don't remember what they were anymore, but we went with the Duck Mousse, Hot Copa (pork butt), and one of them that was wild boar..because...boar is awesome!  The meats came out in layered rows, served up with Firebrand sourdough baguette slices and whole grain mustard on a wooden board. 

Go, Go, Go!

excerpts: If you have 3 double IPAs and no belgian beers on tap, you're doing it wrong.
They do not appreciate repeat business.
I have met the same bartender probably five times, often going with my friend who lives across the street.
Not once have we gotten a free drink or even just some better service.
That's amateur hour compared to most other places I try to frequent.
beers.author: Louis A.
beers.review:
This place has declined precipitously. I have been going here shortly after it had opened and loved the selection of beer (amazing menu + tap rotation) and food (bougie bar food). 

HOWEVER, of late I have had 3 terrible experiences in a row. Why:

1) The service is atrocious. There are routinely too few waiters and bartenders. They always seem generally annoyed to serve you. 
2) The beer selection is diminished - as a bar this is bad. If you have 3 double IPAs and no belgian beers on tap, you're doing it wrong. 
3) They do not appreciate repeat business. I have met the same bartender probably five times, often going with my friend who lives across the street. Not once have we gotten a free drink or even just some better service. That's amateur hour compared to most other places I try to frequent.

excerpts: Awesome beers here and their food is great too.
Cozy atmosphere, we came at 6 and there were seats
but by 7 it started getting crowded.
beers.author: Dang L.
beers.review: Awesome beers here and their food is great too. Cozy atmosphere, we came at 6 and there were seats but by 7 it started getting crowded.

excerpts: From the dead deer head thingy on the wall, to the corks on the mantle, to the cute little delicate menus to their amazing selection of beers and draft wine, I may have found my new favorite wine bar.
beers.author: Vanessa W.
beers.review:
Tucked away on what seems to be a side street is my new favorite wine bar - Fat Angel. I always have to remember it's angel, not angle. 

This little wine bar is so tiny but packs a lot of charm and character. From the dead deer head thingy on the wall, to the corks on the mantle, to the cute little delicate menus to their amazing selection of beers and draft wine, I may have found my new favorite wine bar.

I had their pinot noir on draft ($10/glass, $20/half bottle) and it was so delicious. Fruity and light just the way I am. Or the way I like it.

Their cheeses are really good and I really wanted to try their famous mac and cheese but that will just give me an excuse to come back and try possibly everything on their menu.

We got there yesterday night at 8:30 and the place was packed. We were lucky to find 2 seats at the bar. Definitely go early and if no seats are available, they have heat lamps outside for you to wait while tables open up.

Definitely one of my new favorite bars in the city. I love you!

excerpts: It's very small and charming but has an amazing selection of beers and wine.
The flatbread pizza was definitely my favorite thing off the menu!
beers.author: Linda T.
beers.review: This place is absolutely adorable! It's very small and charming but has an amazing selection of beers and wine. The flatbread pizza was definitely my favorite thing off the menu!

excerpts: Huge selection of beers.
Great service.
Didnt try the food but it looked delicious.
Will definitely come back!
beers.author: Ellen Cecilia S.
beers.review: Such a nice athmosphere! I love the decor. Huge selection of beers. Great service. Didnt try the food but it looked delicious. Will definitely come back!

excerpts: I've stopped in a few times to grab a few beers and a bite to eat before heading to concerts at the Fillmore.
They feature both beers and wines on tap, and have an incredibly extensive bottled beer list.
The prices can be rather high, but the selection is worth it, as they have many imported and unusual beers to sample.
beers.author: Heidi M.
beers.review:
I've stopped in a few times to grab a few beers and a bite to eat before heading to concerts at the Fillmore.  They feature both beers and wines on tap, and have an incredibly extensive bottled beer list.  The prices can be rather high, but the selection is worth it, as they have many imported and unusual beers to sample.  The bartenders have been great about letting one try a sip of the on-tap beer or wine first, before ordering a full glass, and are happy to make recommendations from either tap or bottled lists.

I've only tried appetizers / share dishes, which were quite good as well.  I've yet to try the flatbread pizzas but they always smell and look delicious when I see them ordered at other tables.  It does seem like it takes a very long time to get warm dishes, such as the pizzas, though.  

My only complaints about this establishment are that they are constantly overwhelmed both in terms of service and space.  Service for food items is very slow, and there never seen to be tables free -- even rarely 2 adjacent seats at the bar.  They wind up with people milling around the bar without a place to sit or stand.  Not good at all for groups, and a bit of a risk on weekend nights, as you may have to wait a very long time to be seated.

excerpts:
So many great wines & beers on tap.
Yes, wine on tap!
We loved this place, small, cozy, clean, price was good, wine was very good, beer was so good, food was good, nice service.
beers.author: Nobu K.
beers.review:
There was an Angel was always drunk.
So he didn't have wings
That was why he was a 2nd class 
His name was Clarence

So Joseph was like, "Hey Fatso! 
You Fatty Angel 2nd class!
You are FXXXin' 293 years old with no wing, Goddamn sonofabitch!

So Clarence was like, "What? Are you talking to me? You talking to me? What did you say, Jackass? FXXX off !"

So Joseph said, " I am just sick and tired of seeing your FXXXin' Fat stomach sticking out and drunk like a fish every day. I can't take it anymore.
So, Go help Gorge Bailey so I can get you wings. OK? Jackass?"

So Clarence was like, " Oh Shit! I blew it. I wanted stay like this until I get 300 but guess not. OK Jo the Jackass, I'll go down there to jump off from the bridge for the idiot."

So Joseph said, " Go Now! Gorge is ready to jump off!"

That should be what was going on in the original story or behind the scene of " It's a wonderful life."


But our real scene was to celebrate that my GF got a new job.
Today was her last "FREE" day Sunday.
So we went to see a movie, Midnight in Paris at Kabuki and we loved it.
After watchin' great movie together, we always get something to drink.
We went to Fat Angel.
The place is just wonderful.
So many great wines & beers on tap.
Yes, wine on tap!
We loved this place, small, cozy, clean, price was good, wine was very good, beer was so good, food was good, nice service.
We'll be back for sure.  

Lower Fillmore is getting better.

Even the Dirty Harry won't say, VFW, very few white disrict anymore.

It's just strange seeing Panda Xpress and Popeye's through the window.

excerpts: The beer selection on tap may be smaller, but they carry some amazing beers on bottle.
beers.author: Vincent K.
beers.review:
There's a trend going on, did you notice it?  What's with all these gastropubs sprouting all across the city, and WHERE were they before?  How come it took so long for some people to realize we love our booze and foodz?

In comes, Fat Angel, tucked away in what seems to be a thriving neighborhood compared to yesteryears.  And with a wide selection of beer, it may be the Western Addition's very own version of dare I say it, Monk's Kettle.  However, Monk's kettle will always have a place in my heart, but Fat Angel will be the neighborhood's finest.  

With a nice intimate spot and dim lighting with a good size bar, Fat Angel offers more than what it looks.  The beer selection on tap may be smaller, but they carry some amazing beers on bottle.  I was able to try some of the IPA from San Diego, but will definitely come for more other ones.  

And sitting outside with the heat lamps has its perks as there was a jazz  dance happening right across the street.  Quite a spectacle.  And the food, the food was great compliments to the beer.  Between my buddies and I, we enjoyed every single bit of it

-Flat Bread with Wild Mushroom and Truffle - amazing.  Almost like a simplified pizza, but the truffle and mushrooms make this.
-Salamate with Truffle - yes I like truffle, but on everything, I'm all game for.  We had the meat plate and this was definitely the best amongst the other ones which were good too.
-Pot Pie - good crisp and flaky crust with an amazing flavorful filling with tender chicken.
-Sliders - probably the only thing I could have skipped on, but it was good.

excerpts: They have an excellent selection of different beers and wines.
Kudos on the nice selection of sours.
I am definitely on a sour beer kick.
The bartender was very helpful as we selected four different beers to split.
Love the sweet and sour beer, but stay away from the wild berries under sours.
It tastes like cough syrup.
beers.author: Aleyna S.
beers.review:
I have to say I love this spot.

I checked it out for the first time a couple weeks ago with a friend. They have an excellent selection of different beers and wines. Kudos on the nice selection of sours. I am definitely on a sour beer kick. The bartender was very helpful as we selected four different beers to split. Love the sweet and sour beer, but stay away from the wild berries under sours. It tastes like cough syrup. Bleh.

Food: Can't complain here either. Food was solid and tasty. The caesar salad is huge! Comes in a giant wooden bowl. Enough for three or four people. We also had the mac n cheese, sliders, and the pretzel. 

Lastly, my favorite part. The ambience. It's a quaint neighborhood spot. Not pretentious. Great place to have a beer and a snack with a date or an old friend.

excerpts: the ever-changing draft beer selection is always interesting (maybe 10 beers total - just tried the Hop Wallop, very nice), the beer and wine bottle list is pretty long, and prices are reasonable across the board.
beers.author: Rosers M.
beers.review:
One word: Awesome.  In a city chock full of divey after work bars, this is my favorite happy hour place in the city.  

Love the vibe - unpretentious, interesting but not distracting decor, and always lively after work but not over-the-top rowdy.  Love the drinks - the ever-changing draft beer selection is always interesting (maybe 10 beers total - just tried the Hop Wallop, very nice), the beer and wine bottle list is pretty long, and prices are reasonable across the board. Love the food - try the flatbreads, fancy mac n cheese, and the olives - all varying levels of bad for you but oh-so-addictive.  

Only a couple gripes with this place - the location is a bit sketchy and the food menu, although pretty tasty, is short and never changes.

excerpts: Maybe I would tell you more if you were to to take me to Fat Angel and ply me with one of the 10 percent micro beers or a couple of glasses of the surprisingly full and well-rounded wines ON TAP!
beers.author: Kingpin X.
beers.review:
Dear Yelpers, I know it's been a while since you heard from me but don't ask where I have been and why I did not write. I guess I just don't want to talk about it. It's not you - it's me. 

Maybe I would tell you more if you were to to take me to Fat Angel and ply me with one of the 10 percent micro beers or a couple of glasses of the surprisingly full and well-rounded wines ON TAP! 

After all it would seem as I write here that Fat Angel is the cupid that has brought us back together. She may be the new baby in my life. 

And if the liquor were to get the better of me and I found myself giving away too much, I could order from the fantastic cheese selection or warm olives or tangy asparagus flat-bread both to douse the liquor and my tales. 

But mostly, I would be telling you what a great "find" the Angel is - though from the excited chatter of the lively clientele, it would seem that others have found her before me. But I won't let that stop me from visiting her again - I am sure we will have a long healthy relationship as my go-to place for meeting friends on the way to the Fillmore and Yoshi's...

excerpts: Their beer prices were pretty high, and for some of the more rare beers, they had an even higher price increase.
beers.author: Brett N.
beers.review: The place was pretty small but cozy. Great beer selection. There had to be like 150 different bottles. A lot of different wines too, but I can't comment on those as I know nothing about wine. Small food menu but it's all pretty good. My only complaint is the pricing. Their beer prices were pretty high, and for some of the more rare beers, they had an even higher price increase.

excerpts: When the barman brought over the book of beers, his eyes lit up.
He ended up getting a craft draft beer which was offered as a 16 or a 22 oz.
The wine menu looked good
but I wasn't in a vino or beer mood.
Upon the waiter's recommendation, I ordered the pimms cup and it was so refreshingly good.
There are cute quotes on the menu
beers.author: Seema M.
beers.review:
Stumbled across this gem on Friday after dinner at Dosa on the Fillmore. 

The name threw me off when looking for a spot on Yelp but once we looked into the bar, we need we would love it. The intimate space has a small bar, dim lighting and seating along the far wall and lined across the front windows. There was outdoor seating as well but being San Francisco, it was too cold to sit out there. We scored a random cozy table in the middle of the restaurant. It ended up being a little traffic-y as waiters and customers would have to walk past us to get in and out.

The menu is simple and conducive to sharing. Selections of cured meats, cheeses and breads are the primary items. I was cursing that we had a lackluster meal at Dosa just 30 minutes prior as I wanted to try some of the great cheese choices they had.

My brit husband was in heaven with their beer selection. When the barman brought over the book of beers, his eyes lit up. He ended up getting a craft draft beer which was offered as a 16 or a 22 oz. The wine menu looked good but I wasn't in a vino or beer mood. Upon the waiter's recommendation, I ordered the pimms cup and it was so refreshingly good. There are cute quotes on the menu and I like that they included 'hetchy hetch' priced as free on the drinks side. 

The crowd was a mix between girlfriends, first dates and married couples. I like communal/family style meals so the idea of ordering a couple of plates and sharing over some bottles of wine is ideal.

Perfect spot for date night, intimate snack/drink with small group of friends.

excerpts: I have however had a few different beers.
beers.author: Abhi M.
beers.review:
I've never had the food here. I have however had a few different beers. 

Very reasonable prices for SF (6 USD)

It can get very crowded, which is annoying at times.

excerpts:
- Mac and Cheese
- Chicken Pot Pie
- Happy boyfriend because there are so many good beers, which means that I get to go here more often and drink wine!
(Seriously, I'm not sure why more places in the city don't cater to couples like us, where one is a beer enthusiast and the other a wine-o)
beers.author: Erin B.
beers.review:
This place has become my favorite spot in the city for wine and hanging out.  We come here a lot before shows at the Fillmore or seeing a movie at Kabuki.  The staff is incredibly nice, and even though the place is always packed they sure do hustle to try and make things quick.  I don't know if I want to tell anyone the trick to getting a table, but just... go early.  Around 6:30, the place fills up and people stay for hours so you probably won't get a table unless you're willing to stand around for a long time.  

My favorites:
- Sauv. Blanc on draft - yummy and comes in at a mere $5.50 during happy hour!
- Mac and Cheese
- Chicken Pot Pie
- Happy boyfriend because there are so many good beers, which means that I get to go here more often and drink wine! (Seriously, I'm not sure why more places in the city don't cater to couples like us, where one is a beer enthusiast and the other a wine-o)

excerpts: Great beers (I'm not a beer drinker, but some of these have almost converted me) and wonderful wines.
The menu isn't terribly vegetarian friendly, but they are happy to accommodate.
beers.author: Katie L.
beers.review: Love this place! Great beers (I'm not a beer drinker, but some of these have almost converted me) and wonderful wines. The menu isn't terribly vegetarian friendly, but they are happy to accommodate. The staff is very good at recommending drinks. There can be quite the wait for a table. But if you just want a drink there is usually a table outside you can camp out at, with great heaters.

excerpts: Love the ambience, friendly & knowledgeable service and the extensive list of beers.
beers.author: Kavitha L.
beers.review: Love the ambience, friendly & knowledgeable service and the extensive list of beers.

excerpts: My friends and the waiter got into a really enthusiastic conversation about one of the beers and the brewery that makes it.
beers.author: Vrushali P.
beers.review:
I found this place on Yelp and took my out of town guests. I'm happy to say this place didn't make me look bad :). 

My friends are really into beer and this place has a great selection. Not only that, it seems like the staff is really passionate about it. My friends and the waiter got into a really enthusiastic conversation about one of the beers and the brewery that makes it. He was definitely very knowledgable. 

The food was also delicious! We ordered the garlic chilli butter to share and my boyfriend couldn't help but eat over half the butter himself. It was really flavorful. We also ordered the mushroom flatbread, the sliders, and the mac and cheese. My friends really like the sliders, especially served with the pickled hot peppers. The Mac and Cheese was probably one of the best I have ever had. The flatbread in comparison was just okay. 

Note that the place is small so you may have a long wait. We waited probably 40 minutes, but we really enjoyed our experience so I guess it was worth it.

excerpts: We got some great beers on draft while we were waiting, some type of double IPA for each of us.
They had a good amount of beers on tap and also an extensive paper menu of bottled beers.
For food, we started off with the cheese plate.
Fat Angel had a list of cheeses we could selected from.
We had the Bella Dry Jack (based on Yelp reviewer advise), Spanish semi-soft cheese, and a Spanish soft cheese.
We enjoyed the food, good beers, and if back in San Francisco we would visit again for sure!
beers.author: Erin G.
beers.review:
I went here on Tuesday night around 8pm after finding it via Yelp.  I was on vacation with my husband and we were looking for a comfortable place to grab some food which had a good beer selection. Fat Angel did not disappoint!

When we arrived there was about a 1/2 hour wait for a table and the bar was completely full with people who were eating.  The bar area itself was very small and a little crowded as there were two other couples waiting for tables who had arrived before us.  Despite it being a little crowded, the bartenders were very attentive to us while we were waiting and constantly made sure our water and beer glasses were full.  

As were were waiting we good in the atmosphere- the chandelier hanging from the ceiling, the beautiful wooden bar back, and the dimly lit room with candles set a nice atmosphere.  We got some great beers on draft while we were waiting, some type of double IPA for each of us. They had a good amount of beers on tap and also an extensive paper menu of bottled beers.  For food, we started off with the cheese plate. Fat Angel had a list of cheeses we could selected from.  We had the Bella Dry Jack (based on Yelp reviewer advise), Spanish semi-soft cheese, and a Spanish soft cheese.  The platter was set up nicely and did not disappoint.

For the the meal I ordered the Mac & Cheese- and it was amazing!!! I am a big mac & cheese fan and regularly order it - and this is one of the best I have had!  I loved the flavor and the consistency of the pasta.  It had just the right amount of cheese to not be too cheesy.  My husband ordered the flat bread with the roasted red grapes, walnuts, and proscuitto.  I tried a piece of his pizza and it was very flavorful.  

Overall the service while we were at Fat Angel was great.  The service was outstanding and we felt comfortable throughout our meal. The waiter checked on us to make sure we had enough beer, water and everything we needed.  We enjoyed the food, good beers, and if back in San Francisco we would visit again for sure!

excerpts: Draft wine, giant salads, north coast brewery beers...can this angel get any fatter?
The place is not slim on personality, either.
Everything seems to be hand selected from consignment shops and flea markets.
It's a labor of love for the owners and it shows.
beers.author: Dan B.
beers.review: Draft wine, giant salads, north coast brewery beers...can this angel get any fatter? The place is not slim on personality, either. Everything seems to be hand selected from consignment shops and flea markets. It's a labor of love for the owners and it shows.

excerpts: The beer menu has beers grouped by type and the wait staff are very helpful with suggestions.
The food is also very good and compliments the beer.
beers.author: Simon M.
beers.review: This is a great place if you are looking for a large selection of craft beer. The beer menu has beers grouped by type and the wait staff are very helpful with suggestions. The food is also very good and compliments the beer. The baby kale salad is excellent despite its simplicity.

excerpts: Their happy hour specials are decent--$1 off draft wines and draft beers and $2 off flatbreads.
beers.author: Marie B.
beers.review:
W(h)ine after work (clever happy hour ploy) is perfect at Fat Angel! Not a huge venue, but its coziness and warmth adds charm to this wine bar in the Western Addition. Their happy hour specials are decent--$1 off draft wines and draft beers and $2 off flatbreads. 

Never having tried wine on draft, my companion and I ordered a draft cabernet and a pinot noir, respectively. We both enjoyed them...enough to order another. In addition, we ordered the mac 'n cheese and the wild mushroom and white truffle oil with pecorino cheese flat bread. The mac 'n cheese, while was delicious, both admitted to having had better, as theirs lacked a richness. The flatbread was just the right amount of crispness, and ingredients were fresh and very present. I'd definitely order that again. 

Staff was friendly and attentive; coming by our table just the right amount of times where we didn't feel neglected nor annoyed. Wine list was extensive (by the glass and bottle), as was the beer list. Prices were moderate; glasses ranging from $8 (whites) - $13. Ambiance is chill and relaxing; perfect for catching up with a friend, a romantic date (lighting is dim), or group outing (though again, the venue isn't huge). 

I'm a fan, and I'll likely go again as I enjoyed the wine and food, ambiance and service. Great addition to the Western Addition!

excerpts: Great selection of beers, although not many of tap.
beers.author: Brian L.
beers.review: This place is great. Went with my girlfriend for a drink and bite to eat. We shared the mac and cheese and kale salad. Mac and cheese was delicious and the kale salad was surprisingly big. Great selection of beers, although not many of tap.

excerpts: Incredible range of Belgian and Swiss (mostly) beers
and I've tipped off the MeetUp beer crew.
beers.author: Michael A.
beers.review:
Excellent food prices (beer not so much) and friendly service

Stumbled across this place before going to Fillmore (Squeeze show) and can't believe I'd never seen it before. V. friendly tattoo-of-the-world server; we got a $10 salad that could have served three.

Incredible range of Belgian and Swiss (mostly) beers and I've tipped off the MeetUp beer crew.

excerpts: Only had beers and truthfully did not remember leaving so that always gets five stars!!!!
The Molotov cocktail IPA at 13% did me in in such a perfect way!
beers.author: Shane A.
beers.review: Only had beers and truthfully did not remember leaving so that always gets five stars!!!! The Molotov cocktail IPA at 13% did me in in such a perfect way!

excerpts: The food is delicious and the beers are unique.
My favorite beer was the double chocolate stout!
Smooth and Chocolatey!
If you don't know what to order just ask the owner.
He is super passionate and always has good recommendations!
beers.author: Jennifer S.
beers.review:
This place is amazing!
The food is delicious and the beers are unique. My favorite beer was the double chocolate stout! Smooth and Chocolatey!
If you don't know what to order just ask the owner. He is super passionate and always has good recommendations!

excerpts: Beers and wines on tap, and nibbles weren't too bad.
The cheese and meat platter held us over.
beers.author: Lisa C.
beers.review:
The intimidate place was quite packed when we dropped in after visiting the Fillmore. The few tables were occupied but we were able to snag spots at the bar. 

Beers and wines on tap, and nibbles weren't too bad.  The cheese and meat platter held us over. I had a bite of the chicken pot pie and I think it's one of these best I've ever had (granted, I don't eat much chicken pot pie).  I'm usually not a big fan of bread pudding but the apple bread pudding here was really good- hot, fresh out of the oven, served with a side of whipped cream.  Only complaint is I wish they served it with a scoop of vanilla ice cream instead of the whipped cream.  

Something like they reuse their wine bottles and they are made with a different material in order to be more 'green'. I'm a fan of the low-pressure atmosphere here so I definitely can see myself coming back.

excerpts: and there are a billion beers.
the flat bread and breads and butter were good too
but i wish the portion for bread and butter was more sizable.
nice servers and patio out front in winter afternoon sun.
beers.author: B S.
beers.review: nice wine and beer spot. not a huge menu but enough if you are open to what they got and not expecting a typical entree portion. we had great wines - on tap- and there are a billion beers. the flat bread and breads and butter were good too but i wish the portion for bread and butter was more sizable. nice servers and patio out front in winter afternoon sun.

excerpts: A nice quiet bar to come and have a few good beers or wine on a Saturday night, and we finally got to try some of the dishes.
We came for dinner Friday evening, and though it was more crowded than we were used to, we were seated immediately and service was friendly and quick.
Jason and Cy are enthusiastic, friendly and quick to clarify the interesting and humorous descriptions listed for the alcohol selection.
A large plate of assorted charcuterie with bread and mustard for 22 dollars makes a great accompaniment to a few beers or wine, as well as a tasty appetizer.
My girlfriend had the pot pie, which I was blown away by its size, and I had the baked macaroni and cheese, made with various cheeses, and sized just perfectly even for a big boy like myself.
Rich but not sickeningly so, cheesy and filling, I'd happily order it again, but not make the same mistake of having pizza for lunch.
And the pot pie
, well I helped her finish it.
Flaky crust, hearty filling, makes me wonder why the heck I ever buy the frozen variety.
beers.author: Eric P.
beers.review:
I love this place.  A nice quiet bar to come and have a few good beers or wine on a Saturday night, and we finally got to try some of the dishes.  We came for dinner Friday evening, and though it was more crowded than we were used to, we were seated immediately and service was friendly and quick.  Jason and Cy are enthusiastic, friendly and quick to clarify the interesting and humorous descriptions listed for the alcohol selection.  Draft beer selection changes from month to month I believe, but you'll always find something you'll thoroughly enjoy.

To the food.  Up until last night we've only ever ordered the meat plate.  A large plate of assorted charcuterie with bread and mustard for 22 dollars makes a great accompaniment to a few beers or wine, as well as a tasty appetizer.  My girlfriend had the pot pie, which I was blown away by its size, and I had the baked macaroni and cheese, made with various cheeses, and sized just perfectly even for a big boy like myself.  Rich but not sickeningly so, cheesy and filling, I'd happily order it again, but not make the same mistake of having pizza for lunch.  And the pot pie, well I helped her finish it.  Flaky crust, hearty filling, makes me wonder why the heck I ever buy the frozen variety.  Prices are reasonable for FIllmore.  

It's nice to find that handful of bars and restaurants you know you can always go to and just enjoy the company of friends, talking and enjoying a few drinks.  Five stars all the way.

excerpts: We sat at the bar and sipped on our beers for an hour or so, enjoying the company, admiring the tree, slowly fading into the end of our night after a long work week.
beers.author: Anne Marie B.
beers.review:
Fat Angel has been on my to-go-to list for quite some time now, and I finally made it for a nightcap after my birthday celebrations.  This is the type of place where you feel comforted just by walking in the door (maybe it was the yellow lighting and christmas tree, but it worked for me). 

We sat at the bar and sipped on our beers for an hour or so, enjoying the company, admiring the tree, slowly fading into the end of our night after a long work week.  

Just thinking about it now with the rain outside makes me want to zip over for some chic comfort food and a glass of something swanky.  I like that their beer and wine selections are atypical, adding to their sophistication I suppose.  

Friendly bartender, calming atmosphere, lovely space.  I'll be back.  Especially when it's cold out or I'm winding down for the night, but not quite ready for bed.

excerpts: Nice selection of foreign wines and beers.
The bread and infused butters are nice.
The PotPie is something I'd order again and again!
beers.author: Heather W.
beers.review: Great little spot hidden in the Filmore. Parking is fairly easy and meters stop after 6 which is becoming rate in this city. Nice selection of foreign wines and beers. The bread and infused butters are nice. The PotPie is something I'd order again and again!

excerpts: Amazing beer selection -- who knew that there were great Belgian-style beers made on the Pacific Coast?!
beers.author: Adam Z.
beers.review:
Amazing beer selection -- who knew that there were great Belgian-style beers made on the Pacific Coast?!  PranQster is a new favorite of mine.

Great indie rock tunes and a friendly and outgoing barkeep.

That's everything you could ask for right there!

excerpts: I would go there for happy hour to check out the spot for their wines, beers and such!
Once again its pricey, they should check that, they may be around for a bit of time or not because of that very thang!
Most are are doing bottomless mimosas for $15 bucks.
Get it real ya'll, its the Filmoe, not specific whites, and keep it real cool!
I may duck in there on a whim
again we'll see what it do?!
beers.author: Miguelito C.
beers.review:
Fat Angel is a cool lil spot in the Filly Milly! For those who aint be knowin, that be the Filmoe! 

Now this spot is cool for a different style breakfast, I guess it is either english or irish style? I wasn't too sure, it is my guess! I dug it though, a bit pricey, especially for the 'Moe'! The portion of food I ordered was actually not bad! Especially for those who are watching they waist line! I would go there for happy hour to check out the spot for their wines, beers and such! Once again its pricey, they should check that, they may be around for a bit of time or not because of that very thang! Most are are doing bottomless mimosas for $15 bucks. Get it real ya'll, its the Filmoe, not specific whites, and keep it real cool! I may duck in there on a whim again we'll see what it do?!

excerpts: Yummy beers, wines, eats and treats too, we were especially tempted by the bread pudding a la mode we saw being brought to a couple next to us..
next time I'm hitting that up for sure!
beers.author: Callie K.
beers.review:
WOWZERS! What an amazing find (yelp comes through again) for pre-Fillmore drinks & eats! And what a serious bargain for city dining! 

Everything was in our favor last Thursday evening.. one of those odd nights where hubster and I must have had karma and/or the gods on our side.. rock star parking on Geary directly in front of the Fillmore? Check. The last available (corner) table for two at FA when we walked in? Check. Being seated, ordering, & eating within about 40 minutes and getting to the show just as the lights came down? Check!

Contrary to reviews, service was FAST. And our waiter was super friendly and sincere. Instead of trying to upsell us, he discouraged us from each ordering a salad as they are GIGANTIC and also said if we weren't super hungry, we could probably share the mac n' cheese vs. each getting our own. We opted to each get our own anyway as we weren't ordering any other apps., but he was totally right, we ended up both leaving with a to-go box of mac (which then became our next day lunches!).  

As far as the food goes, everything was ridiculously tasty. The horseradish dressing on our arugula salad was super yummy, but the fried capers put it over the top! And the mac n' cheese was some serious comfort food- perfectly cheesy with an amazing bread crumb toasty top, baked in its own mini casserole dish.. yum. We had to use some crazy will power to stop ourselves from leaving in a carb coma.

Finally, the beer and wine is I think what people first & foremost come for; as they should. They have a terrific list not to mention some incredible and reasonable stuff on tap. Once again, our waiter actually suggested to me one of the least expensive wines on the menu, the $6 sauvignon blanc on tap (!) and had we had more time, I would have  loved to have shared a bottle. Super juicy and refreshing, easily one of the best wine deals in town. 

As a side note, to be honest, the name Fat Angel was a bit of a turn-off. I thought it sounded a little cheesy, especially after ogling the gold chubby angel that greeted us, hanging prominently above the doorway. BUT, don't be fooled, inside the decor is actually quite nice. I especially dug the gaudy in a good way giant crystal chandeliers and what appeared to be extremely large golden organ pipes behind the bar. The soundtrack was a decent mix of indie rock that was just loud enough to help mask the super loud and slightly rowdy conversations going on around our table. 

All in all, Fat Angel is definitely thee place to hang before a show at the Fillmore and if you happen to live nearby, this is sure to become a new favorite. You could easily split one of their $9 giant salads (which are presented at your table in a large wooden salad bowl) four ways with a group of friends. $2 for a quality salad? You heard right. 
Yummy beers, wines, eats and treats too, we were especially tempted by the bread pudding a la mode we saw being brought to a couple next to us.. next time I'm hitting that up for sure!

excerpts: Don't get me wrong, Pizza Inferno has good beers, but Fat Angel has amazing ones.
beers.author: Paul C.
beers.review:
Finally a place with an awesome beer selection on Fillmore!

Don't get me wrong, Pizza Inferno has good beers, but Fat Angel has amazing ones. Last night I had an Abt 12 and I almost went to heaven.

Their wine selection is also strong and fun, and the overall ambiance of the place is really stellar. The people who work there seem to be nice and the big windows give you a chance to stare out and enjoy...staring at people!

excerpts: We had a great time and the staff really knew their beers.
beers.author: Jay K.
beers.review: The maple bacon and chili garlic butters are killer, but their beer selection is what I enjoyed most about Fat Angel.  It's a small intimate place that has a lively feel to it.  We had a great time and the staff really knew their beers.

excerpts: The first night I went in, I sat and talked to the owners Jason and Cyrick for about 3 hours about their restaurant, and they were not only happy to answer questions about the gastropub like hangout, but more than willing to share about how the bar was built (it contains the inside of an OLD church from Napa) and how they went about selecting a menu, beers, and wines.
beers.author: Dustin M.
beers.review:
I don't write on Yelp. Ever. Well, I've got a few cheeky reviews of me being pissed off about restaurants or bars that suck, but never anything that I'm been particularly fond of. 

This bar brings warmth into the Fillmore, elevating the quality of venue you should have to survive in this neighborhood. I am extremely happy to have a place I can walk a few steps to and have a local beer. 

The first night I went in, I sat and talked to the owners Jason and Cyrick for about 3 hours about their restaurant, and they were not only happy to answer questions about the gastropub like hangout, but more than willing to share about how the bar was built (it contains the inside of an OLD church from Napa) and how they went about selecting a menu, beers, and wines. 

Big win. I just don't look forward to the day it's so packed here that I can't get a beer.

excerpts: It is a very nice intimate place which serves a good collection of wine and even better collection of beers.
beers.author: Abhishek S.
beers.review:
Living in the Fillmore district, Fat Angel is my go-to place when I just want to grab a drink(beer/wine) during the week and just want to relax and chill. It is a very nice intimate place which serves a good collection of wine and even better collection of beers. 

The place is tiny and generally fairly crowded. So, there might be a wait but the ambiance is top-notch and the staff is friendly and nice. It is a fairly expensive place but very good to go for a drink or two. 

P.S. get their fries!!!!

excerpts: Wide and interesting selection of unique beers and wines on tap for decent prices with a selection of snacks like cheeses, salami, mac and cheese, sliders, etc.
Not really a dinner place, more of an after-dinner/late-night spot.
The only thing I really had a problem with... and this is just my preference, at the time I went they had a lack of any quality "lighter" beers.
For their entire list/selection, even after I asked the bartender, there was only 1 lager that was very cheap compared to the others.
I really enjoy Belgian beers, wheat beers, etc, and from a place that aims to have an extensive beer list I wanted more of my favorite beer "genre" to choose from!
Although... checking their menu now I see a Belgian listed called "Beer of the Future"....
I MUST RETURN FOR THAT.
Further scrutiny shows that more such beers have appeared on their list, so I guess I can give them a whole-hearted 5 stars next time!
beers.author: Remi X.
beers.review:
Very cool casual-elegant lounge in the Fillmore. Wide and interesting selection of unique beers and wines on tap for decent prices with a selection of snacks like cheeses, salami, mac and cheese, sliders, etc. Not really a dinner place, more of an after-dinner/late-night spot. The wine list is written in a fun, accessible way.

Perfect for hanging with any amount of friends, whether it's catching up with one pal or filling one of the bigger tables and getting stuff to share. In my experience it's been crowded/full but we never had to wait... it's relatively noisy but that's to be expected where people are drinking, eating, and making merry :) In its way it kind of reminds me of an old fashioned tavern, though the decor is classy.

Servers are efficient and friendly enough, but not overly so.

This is more of a 4.5 review. The only thing I really had a problem with... and this is just my preference, at the time I went they had a lack of any quality "lighter" beers. For their entire list/selection, even after I asked the bartender, there was only 1 lager that was very cheap compared to the others. I really enjoy Belgian beers, wheat beers, etc, and from a place that aims to have an extensive beer list I wanted more of my favorite beer "genre" to choose from! Although... checking their menu now I see a Belgian listed called "Beer of the Future".... I MUST RETURN FOR THAT. Further scrutiny shows that more such beers have appeared on their list, so I guess I can give them a whole-hearted 5 stars next time!

Oh yes, and did I mention they have MAPLE. BACON. BUTTER.??

EDIT: They serve brunch now on Saturday (during the Farmer's Market in the Fillmore area) and have an unusual/different selection, although you could get "normal" items too (eggs, sausage, bacon, etc). I had a really tasty breakfast sandwich. My roomie got a pink mimosa (pricey but good) and the breakfast potatoes, which were seriously good and a pretty big portion for $4! My other friend got the "Ploughman's Lunch" which is a nice little salami/cheese/fruit plate that comes with a small beer (though he traded it out for OJ, ha). Overall it was enjoyable but getting any "adult" beverages hikes up the tab quickly. The food/normal drinks are reasonably priced.

excerpts: Fat Angel has 9 Beers on Tap, which vary from local and east coast breweries to beers from Belgium.
They also have an elaborate bottled selection.
The layout is a bit cozy when sitting at the dining room tables.
I always prefer the bar, but they also have some lower bar seating thats right in front of their front window, which opens nicely to beautiful weather.
Bartendars were Great and knowledgable.
My friend and I decided to order the Wild Mushroom & White Truffle Oil w/pecorino flatbread which was discounted for Happy Hour
and it was
SO Good!
Very thin crust and the mushrooms were incredible!
beers.author: Windy S.
beers.review:
A GREAT BEER selection for Downtown San Francisco standards. My last two trips to San Francisco have really highlighted the lack of beer selection at the bars, pubs, restaurants, etc. Which I find SO hard to believe! This place is surrounded by incredible breweries (Lagunitas, Bear Republic, Moylan's, Russian River, Mendocino, etc). Are they shipping all their beer to us lucky ducks in Portland who already have an incredible beer scene??? Well I guess... Thank you! But I still want to find good beer in San Francisco. 
Thank you Fat Angel for providing me with my first great pint in the city. Fat Angel has 9 Beers on Tap, which vary from local and east coast breweries to beers from Belgium. They also have an elaborate bottled selection. The layout is a bit cozy when sitting at the dining room tables. I always prefer the bar, but they also have some lower bar seating thats right in front of their front window, which opens nicely to beautiful weather. Bartendars were Great and knowledgable. My friend and I decided to order the Wild Mushroom & White Truffle Oil w/pecorino flatbread which was discounted for Happy Hour and it was SO Good! Very thin crust and the mushrooms were incredible! If the rest of the food is as good as the flatbread, I gotta get back and try more of this menu! 

Thank you Fat Angel!

excerpts:
So it was a pleasant surprise to stumble upon this place

Nice choice of wines and beers.
beers.author: John C.
beers.review:
We came here after walking a friend home to the Fillmore Center.  This establishment doesn't fit the norm of the other places in the neighborhood.  The neighborhood are a mixture of Korean restaurants,fast food establishments, Jazz bars & Yoshi's.  So it was a pleasant surprise to stumble upon this place

Nice choice of wines and beers.  Friendly knowledgeable staff.  The prices were right in line with other wine bars.  I can't comment on the food since we didn't order. 

Will come back.

excerpts: Chill vibes...great beers  from Stone Brewery, Mill Valley BrewWorks, and everything in between (on draft).
Typically a ton of selection in bottle as well.
This warm, artisan hole-in-the-wall sits off the edge of the Fillmore District and is a nice escape from the day.
I'm not a huge foodie but check out the selection of cheese and selection of finely sliced meats to go with that Hopageddon Imperial IPA from Napa, CA.
beers.author: H H.
beers.review: Chill vibes...great beers  from Stone Brewery, Mill Valley BrewWorks, and everything in between (on draft).  Typically a ton of selection in bottle as well.  This warm, artisan hole-in-the-wall sits off the edge of the Fillmore District and is a nice escape from the day.  I'm not a huge foodie but check out the selection of cheese and selection of finely sliced meats to go with that Hopageddon Imperial IPA from Napa, CA.

excerpts: The selection of beers is phenomenal, and the meat and cheese plates are amazing.
They have one of the best bread puddings I've ever had as well.
beers.author: Amanda A.
beers.review:
I absolutely love this place! The selection of beers is phenomenal, and the meat and cheese plates are amazing. They have one of the best bread puddings I've ever had as well. It's a terrific place for hanging out with friends, or just for a small, intimate get together.

The only thing is that it's getting more and more busy these days. You're better off going earlier in the evening, rather than after 9 or 10. It gets so crowded inside that you can't even move around. I'm happy that they're doing so well, but it does make it difficult to go there for a quiet drink late at night. Oh well, I still love it here! It's definitely our stand-by drinking establishment!!!

excerpts: Just went here for beers before a show at the Fillmore.
Small space but great selection of beers, servers/bartenders were super attentive and nice, and had a great vibe all around.
Didn't eat here but definitely will come back
so I can.
beers.author: Kim M.
beers.review: Just went here for beers before a show at the Fillmore. Small space but great selection of beers, servers/bartenders were super attentive and nice, and had a great vibe all around. Didn't eat here but definitely will come back so I can.

excerpts: Great selection of worldly beers and yummy apps, however, I was disappointed that they didn't have Blue Moon.
The area in which this bar/restaurant is located is not so great, but it does have cool ambiance.
beers.author: Pina C.
beers.review: Great selection of worldly beers and yummy apps, however, I was disappointed that they didn't have Blue Moon. The area in which this bar/restaurant is located is not so great, but it does have cool ambiance.

excerpts: Great beers, cool staff.
They change out the tap beers frequently which is awesome but sad if you get attached to one.
beers.author: Vanessa P.
beers.review: Great beers, cool staff. They change out the tap beers frequently which is awesome but sad if you get attached to one.

excerpts: We went in and had a few beers.
Love that they had an eclectic beer list and wine list.
It was super late almost closing
so we just decided to drink and have a good conversation.
I'd definitely go back just to try some of the snacks and such...
Intimate small place good for a few friends and/or date.
beers.author: Kim D.
beers.review: My friend and I were roaming around just bar hopping around the area.  I saw that Fat Angel was around and wanted to come here since I found out about it.  We went in and had a few beers.  Love that they had an eclectic beer list and wine list.  It was super late almost closing so we just decided to drink and have a good conversation.  I'd definitely go back just to try some of the snacks and such...Intimate small place good for a few friends and/or date.

excerpts: She recommended some really neat beers and we loved it.
Beers were a bit on the expensive side but they have a great list to choose from.
Food menu was limited, but the food was great.
beers.author: S B.
beers.review: Went here for the first time before catching a movie at Kabuki Sundance Cinemas. Our hostess, Jessica, was awesome! She recommended some really neat beers and we loved it. Beers were a bit on the expensive side but they have a great list to choose from. Food menu was limited, but the food was great. We ordered the sliders and the Mac n Cheese. Both were yummy. We'll definitely be back and if they expand their food menu a bit, we'll be back more often!

excerpts: fantastic beers and awesome friendly service.
i would definitely go back again soon to try more beers in the bottles!!
beers.author: Dot K.
beers.review:
fantastic beers and awesome friendly service. went there with 5 of us on a rainy night, and they were super cool and welcoming.

we had the basil marinara flatbread, meat and cheese plate, bacon butter, and fried capers. they were yummy, but thought the portions for the meat and cheese plate was a bit skimpy, but still good. 

i would definitely go back again soon to try more beers in the bottles!!

love this place.

excerpts:
the place was packed and LUCKILY 2 people were standing up as from the bar as we walked in...

after grabbing the bar stools, we sat down and ordered drinks from their extensive beer list...and i mean UBER extensive...their beer list, although probably not as crazy as the beer "encyclopedia" at monks kettle, was very well organized...especially if you arent familiar with all the different flavor notes of different beers...

as we perused thru the food menu, i was a bit disappointed because there wasnt any "food, food" as i was hoping for, other than some mac and cheese...
beers.author: Kyu L.
beers.review:
"people who like to drink light beer dont like the taste of beer; they just like to pee alot"

this is the first thing written on the chalkboard menu.

stopped by here the other night for a couple drinks and some bar food.

the venue itself is tiny. the place was packed and LUCKILY 2 people were standing up as from the bar as we walked in...

after grabbing the bar stools, we sat down and ordered drinks from their extensive beer list...and i mean UBER extensive...their beer list, although probably not as crazy as the beer "encyclopedia" at monks kettle, was very well organized...especially if you arent familiar with all the different flavor notes of different beers...

as we perused thru the food menu, i was a bit disappointed because there wasnt any "food, food" as i was hoping for, other than some mac and cheese...we opted for a charcuterie plate, a pretzel, and some of their overpriced butter (4.50 for a spoonful of house special butter in an array of flavors)

the pretzel was good. the meats (although nothing really stood out) was good as well.  my favorite part of the food was the dollop of mustard that they thew on every dish...great flavor and it really tied the saltiness of the cured meats with the different breads on the plate...

all in all, service was cool because we were sitting smack dab in the middle of the bar...bartender was nice and helpful...nothing great here but definitely nothing bad...very very chill wine/beer bar indeed.

excerpts: Delicious wines and beers on tap, plus numerous bottles.
beers.author: Jenn G.
beers.review:
A rocking little wine/beer bar near the Fillmore. Tucked off the street, you really do need the sign to find the place. However, it's well worth the hunt. Delicious wines and beers on tap, plus numerous bottles. The bartenders (including the owner) are super friendly. 

I'll definitely be back when I'm in the neighborhood.

excerpts: And I love to try out their exotic beers, pricey as they may be...
it's interesting, and
beers.author: Kitty O.
beers.review:
This place is so pleasant.  :)  I can't think of another word to describe it.  Mind you I get my eatin' done before I go out drinkin' so I haven't tried their food yet... but I love to have drinks here with someone I love.  :)

Their champagne with house bitters is delicious!  And I love to try out their exotic beers, pricey as they may be... it's interesting, and not a lot of bars have "interesting" beer  menus...

It's right down the street and around the corner from my other favorite place, Festa, so that's a star right there too.

Maybe I'm seeing this place through rose-colored glasses because I've only ever been here on dates... but I was dying to try it and when I finally did, I insisted date night includes a stop here... because we always end up at aforementioned Festa anyway.

Just a little side note; those bar stools have this weird lump in the croch area... so just watch out the first few times you sit in them.  Hahaha..!

excerpts: kinda feels like a fancy neighborhood bar/cafe with a ton of beers...
it's fun trying the different beers they have...

bartenders were friendly and offered suggestions, descriptions, etc... they have a small food selection and we had already had dinner so all we got was the pretzel which was pretty good, but I'd like to come here to just eat and drink....
it's pretty small space, but I'd like to come here again.
beers.author: Easter E.
beers.review: I really liked this place... chill vibe...  kinda feels like a fancy neighborhood bar/cafe with a ton of beers... it's fun trying the different beers they have... bartenders were friendly and offered suggestions, descriptions, etc... they have a small food selection and we had already had dinner so all we got was the pretzel which was pretty good, but I'd like to come here to just eat and drink.... it's pretty small space, but I'd like to come here again.

excerpts: Great selection of bottled beers.
beers.author: Mike P.
beers.review: Salads are huge and delicious.  The Charcuterie plate is rediculously small portions for the price.  I mean it looked like 1/2 oz of pate and about the same for the otehr items.  The Muchroom and truffle oil flatbread was dry and did not taste of truffle oil.  I think they might have put the oil in the mushroom past before it was cooked.  Truffle oil should be put on after it is out of the oven.  Great selection of bottled beers.

excerpts: They have an impressive selection of wine and even more impressive selection of craft beers from around the world.
I always ask either Cy or Jen for a recommendation and it's always spot on.
Btw, Cy and Jen are awesome.
Good people and great service.
The food menu is short but you won't be disappointed with any dish you order.
That's guaransheed for all my Rasheed Wallace fans out there.
The atmosphere is beautiful.
The owners purchased architectural components that previously belonged to a church - notice
the organ above the bar, wooden benches along the walls, and golden "fat angel" hanging outside the front.
If you're looking for a venue for a date, or low key dinner before going out, or a drink after work, look no further.
Rumor has it the owners are looking to open a larger restaurant
a half block around the corner on Fillmore.
beers.author: Dave Y.
beers.review:
The only reason why I would give this place anything less than 5 stars is because I selfishly want to keep this place to myself. It's an incredible addition to the city, and particularly the Fillmore. They have an impressive selection of wine and even more impressive selection of craft beers from around the world. I always ask either Cy or Jen for a recommendation and it's always spot on. Btw, Cy and Jen are awesome. Good people and great service. The food menu is short but you won't be disappointed with any dish you order. That's guaransheed for all my Rasheed Wallace fans out there. The atmosphere is beautiful. The owners purchased architectural components that previously belonged to a church - notice the organ above the bar, wooden benches along the walls, and golden "fat angel" hanging outside the front. If you're looking for a venue for a date, or low key dinner before going out, or a drink after work, look no further. Rumor has it the owners are looking to open a larger restaurant a half block around the corner on Fillmore. Hope it comes through, they're turning the Fillmore into one of the most desired neighborhoods to live in SF

My favorites on the food menu:
Chicken pot pie
Chicken caesar salad (comes with fried capers which are delicious and shredded roasted chicken)
Sliders (best you'll ever have, trust me)

excerpts: The theme for happy hour is "whine after work" which we all need from time to time, $1 off draft wines and beers and $2 off flat breads.
What is draft wine you ask?
Its the barrel of wine directly from the vineyard hooked up to a tap system similar to how bars serve beer.
It's a fabulous idea and quite entertaining to check out.
I'd never had draft wine outside of a vineyard before
but I'll definitely come back to try out every kind.
beers.author: Alice S.
beers.review:
This little hidden gem is located smack dab in the middle of the Fillmore Jazz district at O'Farrell and Fillmore, http://www.fatangelsf.com/. Its swanky, stylish and such a find. A couple of friends opened up the place and it retains the unpretentious, intimate look irrespective of the surrounding neighborhood. My only gripe with the Fillmore district is that it's either 4-star expensive or 1-star and cheap and dirty. This place is a perfect balance for the neighborhood as it appeals to a wide range of people, young or old, professional or artsy type. It's perfect for me because I fall in between both those categories (in San Francisco definitions). 

The wine bar is well decorated with reclaimed, recycled and repurposed materials from around San Francisco. So boho chic. The decorating highlights are the stamped tin roof and the "99 bottles of wine wall", aren't they so creative! The prices were average for the city, food was a bit cheaper than expected with the cheese plate being only $5 per cheese whereas you can pay up to $10 for the same sliver of cheese at other bars. The fried capers were delicious and creative. They tasted like the little fried bits of popcorn you find on the bottom of the bowl chocked full of salt and buttery deliciousness. I don't know how they made them, but keep it up. There is a wide selection of house made butters with all sorts of fun flavors like maple bacon and flatbreads to fill the tummy's of those who have a hard time just grazing. The theme for happy hour is "whine after work" which we all need from time to time, $1 off draft wines and beers and $2 off flat breads. What is draft wine you ask? Its the barrel of wine directly from the vineyard hooked up to a tap system similar to how bars serve beer. It's a fabulous idea and quite entertaining to check out. I'd never had draft wine outside of a vineyard before but I'll definitely come back to try out every kind. That's just the kind of dedicated blogger I am. 

Fat Angel is my new favorite local spot! Plus the name is entertaining. It reminds me of the Lyle Lovett song, "Fat Babies Have No Pride" which still puts a smile on my face. Poor fat babies.

excerpts: Great selection of beers and wines--many selections not seen or found anywhere else.
Give it a try.
beers.author: pamela A.
beers.review: We had an ok bite to eat here before a concert at the Fillmore. Beer recommendation was a bomb--asked for a hoppy beer and got a floral girly beer. Nonetheless the olives were awesome and the sliders were to die for. The kale salad was just ok because of the goopy dressing. Would go back to try out the pot pie. all together, it was decent. Great selection of beers and wines--many selections not seen or found anywhere else. Give it a try.

excerpts: Anyway, after putting our names on the "list" we grabbed a drink and stood near the entryway with a couple of beers.
A few minutes later a couple came in and put their name on the list.
Two seats opened up at the seat yourself bar so we sat down.
Food menus were placed in front of us immediately, I told the waiter I would rather wait for an actual table, which he said was fine.
A few minutes later I see the couple that came in after us being seated.
I grabbed the waitress working that night and told her that we had come in first and asked why we weren't being seated.
First the waitress tried to argue with me and insist that I must have just imagined to have stood next to them while they put their name on the list and that they probably came in earlier.

When I insisted that no, we came in first, we were there when they put their names on the list the waitress rolled her eyes and told us that most people were fine sitting at the bar so the waiter handling the list had probably just taken us off.
She then just walked away.
I was shocked.
She was just so rude.
Instead of trying to rectify their mistake she acted like it was so ridiculous to expect the wait / host staff to do their job.
I didn't catch her name, but the waitress working 5/19/2012 was probably the rudest waitstaff I have dealt with.
I couldn't believe she just walked away, so I grabbed another waiter to try and get the situation resolved.
The second waiter (named
beers.author: Kelsey M.
beers.review:
After seeing great reviews on Yelp my boyfriend and I decided to try out Fat Angel last Saturday. We arrived at the restaurant around 7:30 and we're told there was one party in front of us as we put our name on the list. Note, we didn't actually write our name down or watch a host write our name down, we just gave our name to a waiter who was supposed to be responsible for the wait list. I never actually saw our name or any other guests name recorded in any way.
Anyway, after putting our names on the "list" we grabbed a drink and stood near the entryway with a couple of beers. A few minutes later a couple came in and put their name on the list. Two seats opened up at the seat yourself bar so we sat down. Food menus were placed in front of us immediately, I told the waiter I would rather wait for an actual table, which he said was fine. A few minutes later I see the couple that came in after us being seated. I grabbed the waitress working that night and told her that we had come in first and asked why we weren't being seated. First the waitress tried to argue with me and insist that I must have just imagined to have stood next to them while they put their name on the list and that they probably came in earlier. When I insisted that no, we came in first, we were there when they put their names on the list the waitress rolled her eyes and told us that most people were fine sitting at the bar so the waiter handling the list had probably just taken us off. She then just walked away. I was shocked. She was just so rude. Instead of trying to rectify their mistake she acted like it was so ridiculous to expect the wait / host staff to do their job. I didn't catch her name, but the waitress working 5/19/2012 was probably the rudest waitstaff I have dealt with. I couldn't believe she just walked away, so I grabbed another waiter to try and get the situation resolved. The second waiter (named Sai I believe) apologized and offered to buy us a round of drinks out of his own pocket. Now, in retrospect he probably wouldn't have paid for the drinks out of his pocket the restaurant probably would (or at least should) have an allowance of food and / or drinks that can be comped when there is some sort of mistake on the part of the staff, but since he was saying it would be coming out of his pocket and since he was neither the very rude waitress I had just dealt with or the incompetent waiter who "put our names on the list" I refused the free drinks and just asked that we be seated at a table as soon as possible.
A while later we were seated at this little window - bar thing. I thought it  was odd we were being seated there since we refused seating at the bar and this was ostensibly the same or worse than seating at the bar, but at this point I was quite hungry so I just sat down. We ordered cheeses, meat, a salad, the mac & cheese, and a couple glasses of wine. The cheeses, meat, and wine were delivered quickly and were fine. The salad came out after we were finished with the cheeses and meat. The food was fine, not mind-blowing, but not bad. We were about two-thirds of the way through the salad when the check arrived. Both of us were sufficiently satiated so we didn't ask about the mac & cheese, but it was at this point that I decided I had to write a review addressing the subpar service at Fat Angel. The waiter who had offered to buy us a round came with a check that had taken the first round off the bill, which was nice but didn't really make up for all the issues with the meal. To me it seems like most of the waitstaff would fit better at a crappy dive bar, where you don't need to write things down because it really is much easier to remember a few drink orders than the names and order of people on a wait list or several tables food orders and you can be more surly with guests. 
In short although the beer and wine list seems extensive & interesting the service will keep me away.

excerpts: There is also a few beers on tap that are decent.
The decor is amazing; according to their website "Our restaurant was built with reclaimed, repurposed, and recycled materials from around San Francisco".
It's completely not snobbish and low key.
And for God's sake, they have butter on the menu!
There is a parking garage next door but beware....they do not validate.
And yes it might be in the 'hood... but it is my 'hood so its all good with me.
A little diversity never hurt anyone.
beers.author: Jessica P.
beers.review: Love it..... Wine is tasty and you can get it on tap. There is also a few beers on tap that are decent. The decor is amazing; according to their website "Our restaurant was built with reclaimed, repurposed, and recycled materials from around San Francisco". It's completely not snobbish and low key. And for God's sake, they have butter on the menu! There is a parking garage next door but beware....they do not validate.  And yes it might be in the 'hood... but it is my 'hood so its all good with me. A little diversity never hurt anyone.

excerpts:
we sat down at 6:56pm and they let us take advantage of the happy hour (till 7pm, $2 off flatbreads and $1 off beers and wines on tap) - score!
i got a pinot noir on tap - really good
