my friend got an Inception Triple Voodoo - really good Belgian ale.
beers.author: Eleanor C.
beers.review:
my friend suggested to have dinner here after reading the great reviews on yelp and i'm so glad that we chose to come here!
found a parking spot in front of yoshis, a block away - score!
a group just left and we got a small table for 3 right away score! (the place is small and we came on a monday evening around 7pm and it was pretty packed so i would imagine on other nights there would be a wait!)
we sat down at 6:56pm and they let us take advantage of the happy hour (till 7pm, $2 off flatbreads and $1 off beers and wines on tap) - score!
i got a pinot noir on tap - really good
my friend got an Inception Triple Voodoo - really good Belgian ale.
3 of us shared a wild mushroom and white truffle oil flatbread, the sliders, the macncheese and the chicken pot pie. Everything was really solid, although a bit on the heavy side - but hey - it's really good comfort food.
in order, i liked the chicken pot pie the most, then flatbread next, then the macncheese and then the sliders
would definitely go back!

excerpts: Anyway back to Fat Angel, great selection of beers and amazing bites.
You would definitely have to come here a few times to try all the items on the menu.
The menu itself is quite small
but you definitely want to try it ALL.
For appetizers they offer their flavored butters (yum), cheese and meats (yum yum).
beers.author: Arlene C.
beers.review: I have found a new love here in SF. I loved it so much that I returned to dine here 2 nights in a row. You must be patient to come here. The wait can be long, approximately 1 hour each time I came, but definitely worth it. Grab a drink at the bar while you wait and make sure to bring people that will make good conversation or you can always stand at a table giving dirty looks to hurry up and get going. Anyway back to Fat Angel, great selection of beers and amazing bites. You would definitely have to come here a few times to try all the items on the menu. The menu itself is quite small but you definitely want to try it ALL. For appetizers they offer their flavored butters (yum), cheese and meats (yum yum). They offer salads, flat breads, mac n cheese, sliders ( a must try!!! you will die for the sauce), and chicken pot pie. They also offer items for dessert but the 2 times I dined I was way to stuffed to get to that part of the meal. I will definitely have to leave room next time. Great place for a dinner date or small party. Definitely a place I will have to come and visit when in town. Totally in love with you golden chubby lil winged angel. Till we meet again.

excerpts: They have six beer taps, all California beers.
Here's what was on tap last night:

Anchor Brekles Brown Ale
Lost Abbey Red Barn Saison
Lost Coast 8 Ball Imperial Stout
Bear Republic Ryenasty DIPA
Ale Industries

Peche Sour
- can't remember the last tap.
I had the Ryenasty and the Peche Sour.
Both were very good.
They have a bottle of RR Toronado 20th Anniv.
that they're selling for $399.
That may be sitting there a while longer.
Anyway, really nice little beer/wine spot with nice ambiance.
beers.author: William H.
beers.review:
Stopped here for a drink after a show at Great American Music Hall. It's located in Japantown, within walking distance to the Fillmore and just a short drive from GAMH. Sy (sp?), the owner, was closing because it was slow but opened back up for us and let us hang for an hour. Excellent beer and wine selection. The kitchen was closed so we didn't get to try their food. My wife had a Klinker Zinfandel from Lodi.
They have six beer taps, all California beers. Here's what was on tap last night:
Anchor Brekles Brown Ale
Lost Abbey Red Barn Saison
Lost Coast 8 Ball Imperial Stout
Bear Republic Ryenasty DIPA
Ale Industries Peche Sour
- can't remember the last tap. I had the Ryenasty and the Peche Sour. Both were very good.
They have a bottle of RR Toronado 20th Anniv. that they're selling for $399. That may be sitting there a while longer. Anyway, really nice little beer/wine spot with nice ambiance.

excerpts: HUGE selection of artisanal beers from all over the world, great food including soft pretzels, flatbread pizzas, mac and cheese, etc.
beers.author: Lina L.
beers.review: Delicious little gem hidden in Lower Fillmore! HUGE selection of artisanal beers from all over the world, great food including soft pretzels, flatbread pizzas, mac and cheese, etc.

excerpts: Unusual draft beers and solid selection of draft wine.
Friendly, attentive barmen.
Low light AND low music, so you can actually carry on a conversation.
Easy going crowd.
I don't want to see the place get packed, but the guys running the place deserve the five stars.
beers.author: Kenneth L.
beers.review: Unusual draft beers and solid selection of draft wine.Friendly, attentive barmen. Low light AND low music, so you can actually carry on a conversation.  Easy going crowd. I don't want to see the place get packed, but the guys running the place deserve the five stars.

excerpts: Also have arguably the best beers on tap (pranqster, La merle, etc..-
all small batch stuff), and tons of good belgian beers in btl.
beers.author: Nick H.
beers.review:
This is a new favorite spot for some guilty pleasures.

Really good mix of old and new world wines by the glass, about 25 total.  Also have arguably the best beers on tap (pranqster, La merle, etc..- all small batch stuff), and tons of good belgian beers in btl.

I dig the infused butters they make, totally original (the bacon-maple was excellent).  And just a good all around mix of cheeses and salumi.

If you're down to just snack on stuff for dinner and geek out on a few different wines and brews, this place is the jam.

excerpts: Bartender explained the beers on tap..good beer but a bit expensive for me.
beers.author: Jenny K.
beers.review: Friendly staff. Bartender explained the beers on tap..good beer but a bit expensive for me. Strangers were recommending the chicken pot pie, but I'm a vegetarian, so I'm forwarding the recommendation on to you.

excerpts: And the beers are rich and flavoured.
Nice crowed, perfect!
beers.author: Lars J.
beers.review: (Like) a real Belgian bar / bistro! Ok, a bit more clean :). Delicious food, the flatbread is amazing! And the beers are rich and flavoured. Nice crowed, perfect!

excerpts: Even my pregnant best friend wanted to come back for the pot pie-- and she can't even enjoy the great wines and beers!
Most recently, I tried the bread pudding.
How did I not know of this before!?!
It took four of us to finish it
but it was easily the best bread pudding I've ever head.
It's going to have to be a rare treat, though, or I will start to resemble the bar name
beers.author: B M.
beers.review:
I've been to Fat Angel a handful of times and each experience is better than the last!  My first visit was just for wine- which I love having on tap!  The guys behind the bar have great taste and make fantastic suggestions.  Second visit was with a small group and the fun, casual vibe of the bar was perfect.  Third visit was for my birthday and Fat Angel took great care of us.  We were able to snag a few tables and they were attentive, helpful and festive.  Everyone adored the place.  The extensive beer list pleased the dudes and the wine list suited all of our varied tastes.  Bonus, this was the first time I tried the food.  So so good!  Even my pregnant best friend wanted to come back for the pot pie-- and she can't even enjoy the great wines and beers!  Most recently, I tried the bread pudding.  How did I not know of this before!?!  It took four of us to finish it but it was easily the best bread pudding I've ever head.  It's going to have to be a rare treat, though, or I will start to resemble the bar name :)

Fat Angel is perfect for girls night out, small birthdays, dates and... well, any excuse you can come up with!

excerpts: The owners and staff are super friendly and helpful when choosing beers and wine.
Even though every table is filled (even the ones outside...
yea people love it so much girls will eat in 45 degree weather)
you are treated as if you are the only customer at the bar.
It's that great!
I would recommend it for groups of 4 or less.
I also recommend the Tempranillo and Sliders.
Best sliders ever!
beers.author: Tricia K.
beers.review: Hands down my favorite place to relax and eat amazingly delicious food in SF. The owners and staff are super friendly and helpful when choosing beers and wine. Even though every table is filled (even the ones outside... yea people love it so much girls will eat in 45 degree weather)  you are treated as if you are the only customer at the bar. It's that great! I would recommend it for groups of 4 or less. I also recommend the Tempranillo and Sliders. Best sliders ever! :)

excerpts: It was a place to go for food, wine, good beers and you can laugh in there without the whole place noticing even though it is a smaller place.
beers.author: Deseray T.
beers.review: So, I was given the task of finding a place to go for dinner/drinks before going to see MGMT last night at the Fillmore. I searched around on Yelp for places in the area so we could just park one time and walk over to the show afterwards. I found this place on here and saw the good reviews so we decided to try it out. We got here around 6 p.m. and sat up at the bar. The bartender was very attentive and nice! The place became very crowded as the evening went on, probably because of the show at the Fillmore. It was fun, classy and overall a stellar time! It was a place to go for food, wine, good beers and you can laugh in there without the whole place noticing even though it is a smaller place. We ordered the boar salami, truffle oil mushroom flatbread, a bleu cheese, maple bacon butter, lemon caper butter, bacon macaroni and cheese, sliders and chicken pot pie. This was more than enough food for four very hungry people!  All of the food was very good with the only disappointment being the chicken pot pie. The pot pie was only luke warm and very bland. Next time I would opt for a salad because they were huge and looked amazing. It seemed like the kitchen was a bit disorganized if they were busy but I am sure that will be worked out in time, they are fairly new. As for the drinks we ordered the Pinot Nior on tap, Pranqster beer, a specialty bottle beer and a glass of each of the two Pinots. The 2006 Carneros Pinot was out of this world, highly recommend it. The highlights definitely were that Pinot, maple bacon butter, macaroni and cheese and the truffle oil flatbread. I definitely enjoyed the atmosphere and experience and will go back soon, even when I am not going to see a show at the Fillmore.
